column1: i went on a saturday and waited maybe 10 minutes.  i had never been to the ashland and  wellington location, but had avoided supercuts for several years after a bad experience at a different location.  i took a shot at this one and received the best haircut i can remember.  even my fiance commented how nice it was.  piedad (pili) did a wonderful job, took her time and was attentive to the details.  i'm usually not that picky about my haircuts, so i typically just walk in and take the ealier available stylist.  i will be making appointments with piedad (pili) for my haircuts from now on.
lorie is one of the best stylists around. i am surprised that she is not at a top salon. she has absolutely given me the best haircuts always!

the salon is nice and clean, and that's about it. my hair cut was nothing like i explained, nothing like the stylist said she will do, and last but not least nothing like the picture i showed her. i went for a haircut, the lady seemed nice, but... i showed her a picture of how i wanted my haircut to look, tho she made a remark that she didint like long hair on me, i thought it wasn't any of her business. well, she cut away my hair  and to my surprise it was so short!  i only went for a "trim"and shapeup not an entire haircut. the haircut she gave me was the one she wanted not the one i asked for! looks nothing like the picture i showed her. i would not recommend this place, because you should get the haircut you ask for and not the one the person cutting hair wants. too bad i can't give them zero stars.  never going back.
although fairly early till a wait time, for minimal cut bang trim, check-in app not working properly disappointed very much so.

delois is a superstar! i originally went to an aveda salon to get my hair trimmed. i left with choppy, uneven facial layers!? i ran to super cuts around the corner and told delois my story. not only did she sit me down then & there. she fixed the horrible mess that someone else created. i know it's hard to fix a bad cut.. but she did :)very friendly staff. will continue to go here from now on!
i have been going here for about a year . i have used a couple different  people .none bad . pele is the best !!!!! i call in advance to make sure she is available .
i went there last week. i hate it. she doesn't know how to cut hair and i paid $40 bad haircut ever !!!! not recommend!'

i should have known better than to think that a $15 haircut was going to make me look like i got a $75 one.... lesson learned!  i came here on a random sunday and there was no one in the store... that should have been red flag number one considering it sits in the middle of a strip mall.  but i ignored this and talked to the lady at the front counter, she was young and seemed to know what she was talking about.  i asked for a trim because i like the length of my hair and so she started cutting.  i told her my hair was straightened but that i'm naturally curly, she said she needed to cut my hair while it was straight because it would be harder to get the cut i want if she cut it after she shampooed my hair... (flag #2 -- wth was she talking about, 'cut i wanted'  it was a trim!)  yes i have a few layers in my hair but its not that complicated to the ladies at regis, they always cut my hair after shampoo with no trouble at all and it looks great!  so onto the cut, which was a lot of fluffing up my hair and snip, and fluff and snip, and fluff and snip, etc.  at the end of ten minutes she was done... i looked at it and saw that it looked exactly the same as it did when i came in... and not any shorter, i seriously didn't see a difference.  i asked her if she could cut it more, give me more layers and... fluff and snip, fluff and snip... and voila, same sh**.  so basically, i left the store with the same cut i had, not any shorter and i examined my ends... and guess what, i still had split ends!  a good sylist would have told me she needed to cut down x amount of hair to remove the split ends and would have had noticeable layers.  my hair looks dull, long and out of shape.  never again!

went in for a haircut, and when i got home, noticed that it was quite a bit shorter on one side than the other. went back to get it fixed by a different stylist, and she also cut it unevenly. then, when i pointed out that one side was still longer than the other, she agreed, but seemed quite confused that i would want my hair to be the same length on both sides. never going back.

i am only giving it one stars because the place was clean and the girls where nice, but everything else was horrible. this was my second time here once i sat on the chair the l stylist complained about how long and heavy my hair was. i asked her no not cut too much off the length and she didn't. she kept on complaining on how bad it was cut when little did she know she was the last one that cut it. i decided not to tell her anything because it could have just been that my hair grew out weird. after she finished the back she was supposed to cut the from layers and she had a fit saying that i had no layers and who ever cut it last just cut it in two lengths. she chopped at random pieces of my hair and when she noticed it was getting full she was like okay all done have a great day. i don't like so cute my hair for this reason. my hair ! when i put all of my hair in the front of my shoulders the front is longer. i will never come back here again and i am definitely not going to recommend it to no one. i am so upset of how my hair ended
brought my son in for an 11.95 haircut and walked out a happy camper. we were in and out quickly and the lady who did his hair was a sweety pie. no complaints here.

first, i want to preface by saying i understand it's a matter of who, and not where, you get your hair cut, but i just got one of the worst cuts i've had in years at supercuts.  i'm actually really laid back about my hair, but i have a few things i know i like.  i just went in for a trim, and although i explained exactly what i wanted a few times, the woman clearly didn't listen, as i watched her do exactly what i'd asked her not to.  at one point, she actually grabbed one section of hair + held it for a while, scissors hovering, saying "hmm...how am i gonna go at this?" while i looked on in horror.  in the end, i came out with a chop job that looks like 3 different cuts rolled into one....and all i wanted was a trim.i would say that if you do go here, make sure you know who you're getting as a stylist.  i think i'll have to find a new place to go tomorrow to get this mess fixed, now.

i've been to the various discount hair salons in lake view and lincoln park and i feel that this one by far is the best. the location is clean and i feel the staff is courteous efficient and do a very good job. i have 2 regular persons who cut my hair here and they always do an excellent job. i'm not sure why there are so many bad reviews for this location.

people buy from people, not from businesses. that is the reason i go to this super cuts about every three weeks to get a trim. there is a very talented hair guy there named lauro who told me the first time i visited, " ....i make you look sexy, ok?", and he does consistently every time. i had been going to a few salons downtown and just thought one day, "why am i paying $60-$80 for a hair cut when i wear my hair so short." i'm literally in the chair for 10 minutes tops. my hair always looks the same and i never get the free beer or champagne i see all the girls drinking when they are doing a dye job or something.this super cuts is located in a big shopping center, neighbors to pier 1 and jewel. parking is easy and readily available. it's just like another super cuts in the city and you sometimes have to wait for a chair. no use making an appointment as it has never made a difference in my wait time. i'm not a big fan of the super cuts coprorate policy that they should not keep the customer in the chair for too long. where this may maximize profitability for the franchise, the customers end up having the same haircut and does not allow the hair dresser artistic freedom. i once asked an employee at another locating why this was. they told me that much like the pizza hut guy is taught how to make pizza that are consistant every time, the "hair cut school" teaches you one or two ways to cut hair. this way quality can be controlled and maintained corporate wide. the first thing asked as you sit in the chair and they drape the big plastic apron over you is "what number". this means what number would you like your hair cut today. if you are a super cuts customer you will know what i mean.lauro is cool and will take his time, really pay attention to how you request your hair cut, and actually make you look your best. tell lauro i sent you.

this place cracks me up.  why do i keep going there?  i have no idea.  every time my hubby and i go get a hair cut we get someone else who doesn't speak english.  you neame it and they speak it.  my hubby wanted a faux hawk and got a mohawk lol.  then i wanted a graduated bob and now i have a 8 year old girl bob.  the whole time the girl was cutting my hair she kept telling me how hot my husband was (after she asked if he was my son i might add) which i felt very uncomfortable about.  we are only 7 years apart and i am not that old!  i need to find a new place.

i stopped into this supercuts for a quick eyebrow waxing. the place my friend recommended (paris nails...right across the street from me) was closed...and my brows needed help! these places are always risky, but i was willing to give it a try. i stuck out like a sore thumb being the only female waiting for service. well, the risk paid off-the woman did a great job on my brows. she didn't over wax and she was quick. plus it only cost $8. can't beat that!

i could not believe the service i received today.  aprile, my stylist, asked me what i wanted.  i asked for a 3 on the sides and the back, and to have it blended in as i wanted to keep the length on top.  she proceeded to give me a 3 on the sides and the back, but when i excepted her to begin to blend it in, she began cutting a large amount of hair off the top.  i asked her if she could not cut so much off and then she looked at me blankly.  she said it would look weird if the top was longer.  i explained that with my coarse hair, if the top was cut too short, it would stand straight up.  she then continued to work and by the end of it, i just wanted to leave and assess the damage myself.  when i came home and rinsed my hair, i noticed that the top of my hair was clearly uneven.  there was a noticeable slant in my hair.  i am appalled.  this looks terrible.  and the thing is, this is my third attempt with aprile.  the other two occasions, i asked for similar hairstyles with explicit instructions, and she proceeds to give me a 13 year old boy's summer hair cut.  i gave her three chances and she struck out.  i am extremely upset and embarrassed at the result of my visit today.  it is like she's never cut hair before or knows how to follow instructions.  i tried very hard not to give her any attitude, but i was very frustrated and cannot believe that i paid full price plus tip only to sit at home and attempt to fix my hair.

i have gone to "cheap" salons before with no problems most my life. i just created a yelp account just so i may warn people against this place and a women named delouse. i just got the worst f-ing hair cut of my life. first off i am use to more back and fourth before the scissors start clipping. i had to say long layers four times and she never asked how much i want off. i had to stop here after her first cut to show her. at that point its now to late. i asked for a simple layer and a swoop across my bangs. after that she started cutting again going on and on about how i have to keep my hair healthy and saying my hair was thin and dry that's why it was tangling in her comb. my hair is not thin or dry. she was snatching me bald is what she was doing. i was raised by a single father i am not tender headed. now its time for my bangs she sprayed me in the face with water twice like i was a cat on the drapes. she did one big snip and i was done. i have no layers she only cut out the center of my pre-existing bang leaving out the sides of them. i can see the scissor marks in my hair like i had cut it myself. so now not only do i have a poor excuse for a hair cut but i look like i am a kindergarten er that got bored and went at my hair with blue safety scissors. you may ask why i did not stop her or why i didn't ask to have it fixed. i didn't because i don't think any of the women in that place could have done better. my sister and a friend was there with me. they received disappointing hair cuts as well. my sister who is much boss yer then me was correcting the girl who was cutting her hair like it was training. save your self some time and money drive a few more blocks and find another cheap quick place to get your hair cut. once again i have never had a problem with "cheap" salons but this one is god awful and i really do hope it goes out of business.

wow, that's interesting. it certainly never applied to the supercuts at lincoln & peterson, where i first encountered my now-regular hairdresser.  i know that franchise businesses have to maintain a certain "uniformity of product" but i was never asked to name a "number"from a list of standard haircuts. on the contrary, my beautician studied my face and head structure and cut my hair so as to be the most flattering, just like an "upscale" hairdresser.  maybe the pressure to conform to a corporate image drove her (and some other good ones i used to encounter at s.c.) to finally open up her own place.

i got a surprisingly awesome trim here -- on a sunday when no one else was open.  they did an awesome job for $13.  i'll definatly come back.  i'm such a hair snob too, so finally -- something cheap and they did great work.  i wouldn't ask them to style my hair, but for a cheap refresher -- absoultely

i'm actually really surprised at the bad reviews here. i've been to this location for my past two haircuts and had pretty good experiences each time. good haircut, fair price, really friendly customer interaction. i will come back. i did, though, really like the last haircut i got.

this place is only good for a trim. which i've came to this location multiple times but decided  to get a cut. it's not great. the hair dresser was a bit stubborn and preferred to cut the way he thought was best even when i told him what i wanted. now i'll probably go to an actual salon to fix this.

i must be honest and say that i did not start off with a great experience here with damian, but it was quickly turned around within 24 hours!  to start, angela was amazing and promptly fixed my hairstyle. then, vanessa, the owner, reached out to me personally to hear my concerns about my first experience.  she was very friendly about the matter and i feel as though she truly listened to what i had to say. it means a lot when the owner personally reaches out to make sure there is an acceptable solution to an issue. i will definitely be returning and will be sure to see angela for any future hair appointments!

i have no complaints about my haircut with sahara. she taught me how to take care of my hair properly and showed me products to consider buying but was not pushy with sales at all. she was super helpful, gave a great cut and i would definitely return to her for haircuts in the future.
ruined my boyfriend's hair, didn't know how to fade, didn't know how to part, basically parted his hair twice, dont go here, and if you do, dont go to damien !

so, i just got the most amazing haircut ever. i have pretty complicated hair (thanks mom) but i got lucky and i got bianca and she took my curls from limp and boring to va va voom! i don't like getting my hair cut as i've had so many bad cuts in the past, but bianca surpassed my expectations.  now i'm going out to show off this hair!  and i'm going back for a color next week. haaaay. i highly recommend this salon, and bianca does a phenomenal job. thank you guys

nothing amazing but i can usually walk in after work and still be served pretty quickly. they also send out monthly coupons that take a couple bucks off. sometimes you will get a warm towel at the end, but not always.

i'm surprised with the negative reviews, but many were from more than six years ago.  i saw complaints regarding other clients being taken first.  i suppose you weren't told to call when you're on the way and you'll be taken before any walk-ins.   simple.  i saw complaints about no shampoo or having it barely damp.  a shampoo is only a few dollars, but choose what you'd like.  there is no charge for using styling products.a good stylist knows your hair and what they can or cannot achieve.  and will let you know.  and will still try!  we know that!marlene and luz are the best!  luz went to s. mich, in case anyone wonders.  you can't go wrong with either.

it is time someone updates the reviews for this place. what a mistake it was to come here. i came in on a  night that had a bad snow storm and to my surprise it was busy. i sat and waited while the 2 hairstylist finished up cuts and took other before me. they do not wash your hair and barley get it wet. the lady who cut my hair had no idea what she was doing. she said at one point, "i am trying to figure out how to add layers!" umm what?!?!? basic things you should know how to do. i left with a bad trim that will take me months to fix the crappy job she did.  what a waste of money this place was. bad trim and inside is so outdated.

the management at supercuts  is very unprofessional.  they do not schedule appointments.   they do take "reservations" 45 minutes beforehand, but that does not guarantee you any service at a particular time.  explain that one.  a stylist here cut my hair three times in one year.  she did an absolutely  fantastic job.  then one day, she was gone.  (it is obvious now, especially after reading these reviews, that she took her talents to a more deserving salon.) after she left, i naively asked where she went.  they wouldn't say.  i asked her last name.  they also withheld this, claiming they don't share "personal" information for safety purposes.  that is plain bull because if i had the foresight, i would have asked her during my last haircut and she no doubt would have told me.  it was clear that supercuts wanted to keep my business for themselves.the manger assured me the other stylists were great.  i gave one a chance.  utter disaster. so long, supercuts.  you have shot yourself in the foot. to tessa the awesome stylist: if you are reading this, please post some kind of info here, that your loyal clients can bring you their business.

i went to this location for a while for my haircuts.  the price is definitely right.if you are looking for a stylist that is going to wash your hair, give you a scalp, massage, chat about their weekend, and/or tell you how they are going to cut your hair, this is not your place.what you will get is a reasonably priced haircut and they will try to do exactly what you tell them.i stopped going here simply because i like the conversation and the "honey, no...we're not doing that" when i go...i need a little more intimacy, if someone's going to be man-handling my head.  :)

i've been coming to this supercuts location for over 15 years.... but today i had andrea for the first time.  she gave me, hand's down, the best cut i've had there or anywhere.  she's great with color too.

i came in here for a cheap haircut a while ago. i have very fine hair, so i think it'd be easy to cut. there's also not a lot of it. anyway, i got home and looked in the mirror and it was not the same length on either side of my face. also, i got a lecture about having to use really expensive salon products if i want to have long hair. the information was presented to me in a "duh, you're an idiot" tone. sorry, but if i'm at supercuts, i'm obviously not going to drop a hundo on hair product.

i don't know what happened right before i walked into this place but yikes!!  i had just moved to chicago and it was so so hot!!  and i need to get my long hair chopped down.  so i go someplace familiar and figure that it will be an easy enough process.  well when i walked in i could feel a weird vibe in the air.  a girl sits me down, is rough with washing and keeps getting water in my eyes.  and as she hacking at my hair and barely talking whatsoever, she is glaring at two other girls that work there everytime they walk by.  evil, dart-like stares thru the mirror.  so i am uncomfortable and leave and tell her i don't need a hair drying and it was hot out so who cares?!  right?  wrong.  i should have so i didn't have to pay for that haircut.  my "long layers" i asked for as i always do dried and ended up looking like a bad mullet-like hairdo.  i was horrifid and job hunting at the time.  so in the end i went to a nice salon and spent an extra $50 there - which yes, may have been an awful fate b/c i met my new stylist who fixed me up and i saw after that...but wow!  i've never had that awful of a haircut and sometimes just waiting for it to grow out is too long to wait!!  stay away from salons with negative vibes!!  someone just slept with someone else's bf or something...yikes!

i held on to my supercuts card for the longest time, hoping, just hoping that i can get that thirteenth haircut that would be free, but i can't do it. i just can't do it. too many bad haircuts here. while there are one or 2 competent employees here, most of the time, i get butchered.you know it's bad when you're a guy, and your haircut take more than oh, say 20 minutes? i don't have any fancy head of hair. #3 on the sides, 1/2 inch off the top. an experienced barber can do it in under 10 minutes.is that too much to ask? evidently. i need 1 more haircut till my next one is free, but i can't come back here. i just can't. luckily there's a great clips and a haircuttery on the same block. i advise checking out one of them first before going here.

i get my hair cut every three weeks like clock work.  i get it cut so frequently because i'm a little ocd about keeping it neat and short.  so because i'm a little crazy about it i don't have much loyalty to one particular stylist because i like to keep my options open so i can stay on schedule.  so today i went to try super cuts and was pleasantly surprised with thea.  she did exactly what i explained and my cut came out perfect.  i'll definitely be keeping thea's card in my pocket for next time.

so disappointed in this place tonight.  this is not my regular hair salon to go to, but i was in a rush to get a hair cut.  i walked in and  the desk clerk, wrote down my name.  i waited for about 25 minutes and in the mean time another customer walks in and the desk clerk took down his name.  shortly after this the  desk clerk walked to the back and did not appear again for about 15 minutes.  so during that time, one of the hair stylist, looked on the desk where all our names were and took the customer who had just walked in.  how fair is that, i have been waiting for about half an hour and someone else goes before me.  also just to make a note, the other hair stylist working seemed to be disgusted that the front desk clerk kept disappearing and he had to go to the back to find her.  this was horrible customer service.  i ended up walking out and will plan on trying to squeeze in time during my busy day tomorrow to go to my regular hair salon.

i googled a few hair salons near sheridan and belmont but didn't find anything less than $50 other than supercuts. i went in their yesterday and the sweet mexican stylist took me in right away and did everything i asked her to do; also, she gave me ideas on what might look better which was really helpful. i've been growing out my hair for 6 months because my last stylist messed it up, but this lady totally fixed my hair, and whatever she couldn't, she told me what to do. i loveee my new hair and i will definitely be going back! if you're looking for a nice haircut and cheapp ($14) then go to supercuts!

the reviews from this supercuts were from months ago and apparently they made some changes.  my fiance and i went there last weekend and had haircuts.  i had a guy named jason who was able to look at my hair and know how long it's been since my last one and he did a fine job cutting my hair and making me look good.  the lady who did my fiance's hair did a wonderful job.  the price was right too.  excellent haircuts here by total professionals!
stylist kenny is very talented and skillful professional.  one of the best haircuts i have ever had.  call first to add your name to kenny's wait list and availability.

i don't want to give place 1 star. my son needed a haircut so i decided to go here. they looked at us but didn't say anything. the greeter guy didn't feel like greeting at us. he said hi in his lightest voice. that means i barely heard him. he never even told me to sign in on tablet. just rude. i couldn't see myself giving this place my money. please get your act together supercuts not...

love this location! i used to go to foster and pulaski but this one is so much better. the interior is tasteful and modern. we always see dee! i take my boys, ranging in ages from 10 to 19, to her and she always does a great job. two of my boys have bouncy curls and wear their hair long and two get fades. they've never been disappointed.

went in today june 14, 2o18 for a trim and color. my trimming came out good but when i asked for red color the guy shows me a dark violet... so when he finally shows me the actual red color i want from the book, we start to color my hair... wired thing is... i've never been to a place where they only color literally your head and not the rest of your hair?  so in the end my hair didn't turn out the way i wanted and the back of my head is a dark black/brown mix color.... i will be going back to see what this stylist can do to fix my hair but other than that i'm super upset. $80 for some half ass color? wtf is that.update. i went back the next day asking for a refund and the assistant manager was super hesitant telling me i needed to come back around 11am or 12noon because the stylist who did my hair starts his shift @ that time and how she didn't know how to work the small machine to give me my refund back on my card. then she tells me she can't give me any cash because there's no cash in the register... i didn't leave... i stood in my car for 20min. i went back in asking if she could just call the guy then because i want the issue resolved and starts giving me an attitude repeating herself telling me to come back so i bitched her out and told her this is ridiculous! "your an assistant manager, you should know how to give refunds... they train you for that" so finally i get the refund , and typed in my card info manually but it's been 2 days and i haven't received anything yet so not only will i continue to file a complaint to the better bureau, but i will also be returning to them about my money!!!!!

one word, kenny. go to him. he cut my hair exactly as i wanted which is surprisingly hard to do for other places around the area (not sure why).i use to come here pre fire and had pleasant experiences as well but no one tops kenny.

i have been coming to this location for over 15 years.  there are only a few old timers if you will. it doesn't mean they are old on the contrary good stylists. they do a good job and if for whatever reason you are unhappy or notice something wrong call them   i believe you have a week or so to bring it their attention right away.  their prices recently went up which was a bit of a surprise, but if you shop at jewel look on back of your receipt for a $3.00 saving. anyway, overall good experience as usual for the kids and my wallet.
i love this place!  great service and they make you feel at home.  i got my haircut from sarah and love it.  all the stylists are very professional.  i highly recommend this place.

kindly woman but when it comes to the hair ,asian one destroyed my hair and she was acting like she knew what she was doing and at the end i gave her tip and left disappointed. woman hair yes for this salon while men's sucks.

supercuts in general are ok but one employee at this supercuts is a psychopath, i came in with long hair and sat down. within 4 minutes i had the worst haircut of my life. firstly the barber didn't offer to wet or shampoo my hair he just used clippers and yanked my hair out of my head, he didn't even attempt to make it even. it wasn't even close. he didn't blend the top and bottom half of my hair and the moment he finished my haircut he ran out of the store never to be seen again. in total my haircut was less than 5 minutes long and it was completely uneven, fair warning to anyone going to this store avoid the philippino male barber he's a meth-head psychopath. -eli

excellent service. the young lady who answers the phone (i believe her name is grace) is a sweetheart to deal with any time i call in to schedule a call ahead and kenny the dude who cuts my my hair does a fantastic job as well! overall a very well run operation!
great cut for a supercuts!!! thank god it wasn't a lopsided mower job:) thanks supercuts!!

wow, what an amazing experience i had. after going to hair cuttery for many years across the street on peterson (next to potbelly) i decided to come here when hair cuttery had made an appointment with me the same morning and then when i had arrived, refused to take my daughter in as a customer and told us to come back after 4 hrs (even with the appointment). so this supercuts had recently reopened after the fire and i never had tried it out. i came straight here since it was closeby and i asked if they would attend to my daughter since she chopped her hair off that morning. they immediately told me we could come in, and started on my daughter. we had dee as out stylist.i explained to them that my daughter got a hold of scissors and chopped her bangs off completely. my daughter is on the spectrum, so they needed to be extra patient with her and i'm always scared they won't be able to handle her. well they were so warm and nice! dee got her comfortable right away and kept telling her how cute she was which made her smile the entire time! they even gave me many options on what i could do with her hair and how we could hide the scalp that was showing in the front where her bangs used to be. i was a mess, crying going into this place after what hair cuttery put me through that morning, and we walked out of here with smiles and a good feeling inside. we found our permanent place for the kids haircuts. love them!

so blessed to have found this gem so close to home!  my daughter has super curly hair and wanted a trendy haircut to start senior year. we decided to take our chances with this new shop- and so glad we did! the outside is very deceptive- the inside is gorgeous!  urban loft feel, very spacious and clean. we walked in at 4 on a friday with no wait. now here's the best part- kenny!! it can be so hit or miss finding someone knowledgeable about cutting super curly hair, but kenny was amazing!! his technique was something we've never seen before and he gave my daughter the most awesome cut!! she's thrilled and, of course, so am i. i highly recommend kenny- we will be going back!!

i have to say that sarah is the best stylist i have ever had. i started coming to her about 7 years ago. two years ago we moved out of the city to glenview and my husband asked 'isn't there a supercuts closer to here?" i still come back to sarah every time. she's the best! donna f from glenview.
this is a great place. good looking loft environment, good music. sarah was welcoming, attentive and professional. she did a good haircut. will come back!

i got a fantastic haircut from kim. i came in around 5 on a weekday and happened to have no one in line so the wait was short. kim took a bad haircut i was trying to grow out and she made it look great!  she was very friendly and we talked through the whole haircut. definitely recommend her.

don't bring your kids here. i brought my school aged kids to this location since the foster and pulaski location is no more. the stylist nicked my son's ear with the clippers. she didn't even alert me when it happened, it was only until i noticed through blood she apologized. i was distracted from the minor incident that i didn't notice until i got home how awful his cut was. the only reason i gave this two stars is because the other male stylist did a decent cut on my other son. overall, unhappy and dissatisfied.

this started out to be a one star review because when i went in for a haircut on 12/19/2016, i received a terrible haircut from a stylist whose name i believe is amanda. when i got home i realized the cut was uneven on both sides and the hair was actually sticking up on one side! i went back that evening and fortunately the young man (sorry, i didn't get his name) was able to take me and make everything right!  i've been a regular customer for many years and i love gloria and sara so thanks to this young man, i'll be back again. i don't usually complain, but i think the matter of the other stylist needs to be addressed.

for somebody like me, a quick haircut here works just fine. i have thin, lank hair. even dippity do could not tame it. i am middle-aged, and not worried about looking hot or even "cool" to attract a mate. i want quick, easy, and neat. i got exactly that today. a hispanic lady chopped off two inches of hair, all one length. i'm happy with my haircut.but your hair is thick, curly, or you want some fancy cut, this may not be the place for you. if you're like me and you want to be in and out fast, and don't have complex demands, this is a good place.

my husband took my son in today to get a simple haircut. #5 on the sides and scissors on top. not that hard. he came home and after his bath i could see how completely butchered and uneven his hair turned out. this is totally unacceptable. pictures have been posted to the business yelp page.

alba did a great job! love the color. my hair has lots of different colors (reds, blondes, and browns) and she was able to find a highlight color that works well with my skin tone and still have low lights showing. plus she put in this awesome shine spray that makes my hair feel silky and smooth. perfect look for summer. definately will be coming back soon!

i've been here for my 2 most recent hair cuts and i could not be more satisfied.  i usually pop in on a weekday evening on my walk home. these are some of the nicest people who are genuine and full of character. the cuts are fantastic & reasonably priced. i do however think the salon itself could use a makeover

please think twice before working there. the wages are very low and they fire you because a close friend is looking for a receptionist job, this is nepotism and prejudices. selfish patty is close minded and gets angry very easily. that tells you how they run their business when a manager, patty,  is behaves angrily over every little minor details. some customers are not satisfied when they leave their shop.

alexis is lovely and so very sweet. i went in for the first time this afternoon for a root re-touch and also ended having my brows waxed. i've been to the high-end salons and paid double for the same services but i have to say, this experience seemed more enjoyable. yes, the place is a bit bleak with a very chain-like feel (because, duh, it's a chain) but alexis was so personable, chatty (but not in the fake/put-on sense) and did a really good job. plus, you can't get over the price. while i waited for the dye to set, alexis took another haircut appt. -she was so genuine and personable. the client left happy with his cut. seriously, people who write bad reviews about this place are the same people who complain that subway screwed up their sandwich order. they completely overlook that there's a real person who is trying to do exactly what the client asks for.

i went in late saturday morning.  only had to wait about 10-15 minutes.  blanca cut my hair.  she listened to hear exactly what i said i wanted and proceeded to cut my hair to meet my request.  she is polite, profession, fast & efficient.  i will go back.

this is my fault. i just needed a trim, an inch or 2 of my all-one-length long hair. sorry, but i just don't want or need to spend $60-$80 in a real salon for a maintenance trim- plus, i was driving by, and thought i would just try and knock this off the to-do list quick and get on with my day.i should have taken the hint when i saw the older lady in a wheelchair (customer) blow drying her own hair at one station, and another stylist walk past her and snarl behind her back in confusion and disgust. that same stylist then skipped me on the list and took a gentleman who had walked in 15 minutes after me. i had been next in line, and confronted her about this, but she inexplicably decided that i was not next. well- i took this as a sign, grabbed my coat and got the hell out of there. screw. that. add to this- outdated 80's décor, employees who are visibly irritated, and just a general air of.... sadness, and i think i got very lucky to be skipped. never again.

i will start by saying the store in clean and well-lit. as for the quality of the haircut, i don't expect gold coast quality from the supercuts chain but they have certainly managed to lower the bar at this location. the last two haircuts i got there were from different stylists and were easily the worst haircuts i've gotten since i left the army. when a stylist asks 'how does that look?' and needs to be told that individual hairs shouldn't be standing straight up, there's a problem. and when the stylist cycles back and forth from the left side to the right working on my sideburns i just knew my sideburns had risen to new heights. but if you like your sideburns to start somewhere north of the top of your ears then this is the place for you. the next time i need a haircut and find myself near this location i will keep on walking. and the one star is actually a gift because there is no provision for a 1/2 star.

gotten my haircut here multiple times. i already have bangs and just need a trim. shouldn't be too difficult especially if they're already there right? i always get half done jobs aka half my bangs are trimmed other half are not even though i tip 100% and i get pushed out the door with wet hair. not a fan.

i love this place. simple haircut, simple price. but... i'm so mad right now that i got leslie to cut my hair. kinda heavy set dark skinned lady if you don't recognize her name. but i had a haircut with her one time, wasn't very satisfied. she cut off a bit to much than i asked. i came in again, got her, and thought i would give her a second chance. horrible idea. this time it wasn't the haircut more than it was the service. i had to ask her to cut my sideburns as she was taking off the hair cover. she never asked me! aren't those standard?! and at the end, she never cleaned me up. i had hair all over my face, pinched a bunch of hair resting behind my ears, didn't get a blow dry after and left with wet hair. sorry, this is harsh, but i don't ever want leslie to touch me again. i'll come back for someone else.ps - came home, one side was uneven. yeah. damn.

its the most bad salon i have seen ever because i ask her to cut my hair like the pic i show to her but she decided to make a other hair style and ut was so ugly  hair style i got in my life  unfortunately you have bad team  and now there is no body can fix my hair coz now it's too short
good luck getting a solid haircut here. if the people who worked at a place like this we're really skilled at what they do, they wouldn't be working at a place like this and there lies the problem.

as an asian with super straight black hair, it is very hard to find a person of any ethnicity that can cut your hair well. i have been to a few 35 dollar places that can't figure out asian hair. amy at this supercut is the only one that can do it well. she gets the asian hair and all hair. you can tell when they cut with confidence--quickly yet it turns out great. when i use to have the short styled forward and up hair, she did a great job of cutting it for years but it's a simple cut and a lot of people can do it well. now that i have switched to the longer mad men style haircut, it was surprisingly difficult to find a place that can cut it well. i went to gabby's in lakeview (an old school barbershop) but they just gave me a confused look. i guess they're not used to cutting non-white hair. i went to a "professional" place--one of those robert jeffery place and the same thing. "i didn't know asian hair can do that", was what my guy said. alas, i return to amy (it's hard to catch her sometimes. call ahead..) and she knew exactly what to do. she is too good for supercuts but i'm not complaining..

five stars for the haircuts and prices, zero stars for their call-ahead arrangement. supposedly you are supposed to be able to call in up to an hour ahead and put your name on the list. i called and was told to be there in 35 minutes. i walked in 25 minutes later, my name was crossed off the list, and there were five people ahead of me...pretty much makes the call-ahead idea pointless! part of the problem is this particular location is often staffed with just two stylists. but if time isn't an issue and you want a cut for under $15, this is the place to go.

my go to place for a budget haircut. when you have long, straight hair and don't need more than a trim, why pay more than $13? at this price, you've got plenty of money left over to splurge on a pair of $20 shoes at payless and some vitamin b at the vitamin store next door.
slow service and unfriendly stylists. much better in the area. cheap price but you get what you pay for, a lousy haircut and poor service

i've been going here for awhile now and have made some realizations. 1. while blanca is the sweetest little latina, she butchers my hair every time. 2. amy rocks, and 3. thomas (septum piercing guy who is new to this location i believe) also rocks and has quickly caught up to tie amy as my favorite stylist!

i have been going to this location since it opened.  i don't know the precise year, but i'm guessing about 15 years.i went last week and got a new stylist.  she was nice, but she didn't do as i asked in shaping the back of my hair.  so, all week, no matter what i did, pieces of it just stuck out at all angles.this happened once before, ages ago.  i went in and the next stylist fixed it.  i went in today and explained the problem.  they would not fix it unless i paid again.  ok, i'll spring for it.  the stylist completely ignored me and took off more than 1 inch.  i couldn't see the real damage as i am blind without my glasses.  i have a growth behind one ear that usually is concealed and is now totally noticeable.i was furious - and yes, he rang me up.  i asked at least twice, "why didn't you do wha i asked you to do?"  he ignored me and just said that if i wasn't satisfied, i could go to a high end salon and pay $100.after fifteen years of business, that is it.  i'm outta here.
i've been coming here for haircuts for many years. i have very easy hair to cut and i get a great haircut from all the stylists. for me, it's a great value.

i happened to be walking by this location and in need of a haircut. i decided to walk in on a whim and sairz, the manager, greeted me with a great smile and took me right away. she did such a great job with the cut that i came back four weeks later for color and another cut. today, it was very busy but sairz and her staff never missed a beat. they were eternally pleasant and everyone seemed happy with their service. definitely should check it out!

i got a haircut today and it was horrible. i told the lady i want a low taper fade on the sides and keep the top (i used to have long hair), but the lady just shaved my hair into a super short cut. i could tell that lady wasn't professionally trained. (she also said i have slim eyes, because i'm asian)

thursday 6pm, was on my way to dinner with friends. decided that my hair was too flat and needed a blow dry. i frantically searched for salons that were open during that time around the area - loop. all near me were closed/closing, except supercuts... i've never been to one of these places and to be honest was scared to start now. i decided i wanted a quick trim, and i wanted a 'lob' (long bob), but i knew they wouldn't know what that is, so i crossed my fingers and walked in.*$ide-note on pricing: their prices were competitive to salon prices: $50+ for blow dry, $17 for haircut, and $5 to be washed. the only deal i see is if you get the haircut alone, but dry cuts are not what i'm used to. a nearing high end salon, has varying prices for haircut depending on level, but let's say junior stylist is $60 for haircut, that comes with a scalp massage, and blow dry/style, so it's actually more cost effective, just an fyi.i digress. the woman who cut my hair, elder african american lady, was very kind and stuck to the photo i showed her. i loved my hair and will come back if i'm ever stuck in a time crunch again.
worst haircut ever had... the old lady is more like mowing a lawn rather than cutting my hair. attitude and service are also terrible. don't come.
this supercuts has been great for me every time. ask for sairz, my favorite stylist!

called in the morning about making an appointment for the evening and was told they don't take appointments. kinda odd but okay. i asked if i could come in at 5:30 and was told that was too late since they close at 6:00. i asked if i could come at 5:00 and was again told that was too late. i asked when i should come in and the woman told me to come back at 4:30. i arrive at about 4:32 and was told by the person at the desk that it was way too late for a blow out and that there were 4 people in front of me. i only saw two people in the salon and they supposedly don't take appointments. also, i wasn't asking for an updo or anything fancy it shouldn't take more than a half hour to blow my hair out straight. very irritating seeing as now it is too late to make an appointment anywhere else.

i have gone to andrew twice last year to get my haircut and he always does an amazing job! granted i don't get anything crazy, just a trim and a few layers, but he does not disappoint! go with andrew and i guarantee you'll get the same quality haircut than those upscale salons that want to charge $75 for a haircut.

my best friend sent me here and recommended i see venita. i went last saturday for color and a cut. i can now say i have my stylist in chicago!  venita listens. would give her more stars if they were available. i have a television shoot in dallas next week, so i'm going back this saturday for a blow dry & flat iron style. thank you soooooo much venita. you're the best!
great deal for shampoo and blow dry!  very flexible with time availability, the hairstylist are friendly and have always done a great job blow drying and straightening my hair.  great savings!

nice and friendly service. always clean and we'll kept which can be a nice break from some of the other spots in the city. they have six stations available and every time we've been in they have had 2-3 stylists working. never had to wait more than just a few minutes for the hubs to get a haircut. very short walk from the van buren metra station. exit on the michigan avenue side of the street. usually in and out within about 20 minutes. the hubs is relatively new to the city so supercuts is a brand that he is familiar and comfortable with so he prefers to trek up here from hyde park. when we're back in san diego we will typically patronize local spots but also hit up supercuts periodically. like most chains, it's a very consistent experience and a very consistent price.

when i go there next month, i'm looking forward to a barber whose scissors are sharp so that the hair is cut and not yanked, someone who can use the clippers to make the sides match without gouges too close to the scalp, and someone who can square off the sideburns so that they match on each side.  you know, like an experienced barber does.
i work around here so i always go to supercuts. my stylist is this amazing girl. i believe her name is vinita.she is awessommeeeeeeeee.

pros:great location: in the loop, next to office buildings, right on michigan avecons:1. really poor customer service. rude and disrespectful staff2. long wait times. they only have two people staffed at a time so it takes 30-40 mins before it is your turn3. poor system for management of queue. don't seem to respect online appointments. very ad-hoc4. staffers take long breaks before moving to their next appointment.advisable to go to other locations nearby

i can't decide whether or not i'll be returning.pros: i paid $15.95 + a $5 tip. i was helped right away by a really nice girl (my receipt said he name was kate or kat...literally that's what the receipt said).cons: i was in and out in about 20 minutes...which is good, but in past salons i've spent about 45 minutes. i didn't opt for the shampoo, but it still seems like it should have taken slightly longer. and it should have, because i didn't really get the layers that i wanted, but my bangs turned out nicely, and that was my biggest reason for running in for a trim.
we generally show up between 3 and 4 p.m. weekdays so there is never a very long wait to get a haircut.  everyone that works there is professional and provides a decent haircut.  no complaints.

i've been here before, i am a woman with long hair, all one length, and i just needed a trim. a trim. i asked the guy stylist for 2 inches off. he ended up taking more like 4 or 5 inches. i'm kind of pissed. he kept checking in with me, but frankly, i couldn't tell he was lopping that much off at the time. it wasn't until i stood up did i realize how much was gone- and then what was i going to do about it? ugh. ladies- stand your ground and be vigilant.

i didn't get my hair done. here's why: i came in looking for a wash and blow-dry. i was expecting to pay around $30-$50 which is what i've paid in the past at other salons. i actually thought it might be cheaper because, let's be serious, this is supercuts, the walmart of hair. the price they first quoted me was $50, but then the stylist looked over and said: "well, her hair is past her bra so it would actually be $75"seventy five dollars to blow dry my hair? no thanks. i walked around the corner and had it done at a fabulous place (fuga) for $45, and even got an excellent coffee with it.

i went to this establishment for the first time to get a simple bob haircut and came out damn near bald. the "stylists" who cut my hair had terrible customer service, he acted like he didn't want to speak which was a second red flag. the fact that the receptionist's hair wasn't combed was the first, however she did speak. i've been getting haircuts at supercuts for years and have always come out happy, until i went here. i rate this place a c ---for close and b for bad customer service.  if you need a cut, run pass this place. #sucks

my hair is easy: i keep it buzz short (#1 - #2, depending on the season). you don't really "cut" my hair; it's more like a "mow" with the clippers.i've always gotten a good, but nothing-to-write-home-about mow at supercuts. not really a supercut, but a sosocut. i haven't been a regular; i just pop in if i'm in a hurry and i'm not popping in to a mom & pop (or usually, just pop) barber.i hadn't been here in a while, but i needed a quickie today, and vanita was perfect for the job! she cut with precision, and was quick to boot. she has a great attitude, a heart-warming smile, and is sweet (but not sugary) like dark chocolate.i've never requested a stylist (or mower) at supercuts, but i'm putting vanita in my little black book (ok, black samsung gs3) right now.

i love it here! it's so close to everything in the city and very convenient for n my way home from work. my favorite stylist is vani. she's very sweet and always has great conversations with you. makes you feel welcomed and good time spent. getting a haircut in other places i feel can be overpriced and sometimes not good. they now have an app for supercuts which is very easy to make appointments. i use it every time.

very clean and nice and welcoming service. i got my haircut just what i wanted, so i shouldn't complain. men's haircut is decent here. within $15 you might get a good haircut deal including the tip. they use quality products too.$2 off when you are a vet or student, show them your ids. $1 off when you check in from there android/ios app$2 off when you check in on yelp
never ever coming back rude. unskilled and bad service. i will be letting everyone know to stay away from that place.
my dother and me  had haircuts month ago , was very good,clean, friendly, good service .we not go no where else. best value for the money.

this location is always running behind. plan to wait 30-40 minutes from your appointment time before you see a stylist.  this is a reoccurring issue they have.  one of the stylist is very obnoxiously well.

came to get a hair cut, told her the basics simplest haircut, she totally ruined my hair, make me like mushroomed head. totally disappointed and angry! highly not recommend. bad bad bad hair stylest nora. overpriced with rookie hair stylest over all.
great place to get a hair cut. you can ask for the style you want and the people are super nice and very helpful. darsjan

i came here before and it was fine, today i went back and i don't think i will go there again. i asked for an long a line bob with long layers and showed multiple photos, thought i was very clear on this, got the hair cut, it was not what i asked for, asked for an a line bob again, patricia (the stylist) proceed to tell me how she had cut the hair into an a line, i was confused because the hair was not a line, she then tried to cut the hair again but was frustrated and finally said for another stylist to cut the hair because she wanted me to get what i wanted. at this point the hair wasn't savable although patricia tried to tell me it was. the other stylist cut my hair, again too late to save the hair now. i paid my $14 and left. 1 hour and 30 minutes and $14 dollars lost (i think they gave me a $2 discount for ruining my hair). very disappointing and embarrassed to walk around. haircut is not what i wanted at all but noway to put hair back on. both stylist were trying to be nice. patricia seems like a new stylists and wasn't sure what she was doing and consistently asked the other stylist for help.update:gerald, the owner, messaged and called me to try and make things right. i appreciate his excellent customer service however my hair is already to short to be cut anymore. he offered styling and product consulting if i was willing to go by, but unfortunately i will be out of town (hence why i got my hair cut in the first place).

came in not expecting much, figured it was just another chain haircut place. was pleasantly surprised with the service, results, and experience! online check in is super easy and gets you a $1 discount. my stylist ashlee was incredibly kind and went out of her way to make sure i got exactly what i wanted! she engaged me in conversation and made me really feel welcomed. would recommend to anyone in the west side looking for an affordable, quality haircut. will certainly be coming back!

over charged my 89 year old mother, wash blow dry $49.00. that ridiculous. jennifer press you should be ashamed...... then told my mom 'you were not charged the correct price in the past. so how was my mom to know your establishment was charging her the wrong price in the past.if you about customer service you would have just let her know and charged her what she paid in the past, and then going forward she would have the option to make the decision on her own.clearly you are about money, not customer service.

this is an update to my previous review: these guys went out of their way to make things right: they fixed my haircut and i am very happy with the results.i was very impressed that the owner himself contacted me after my first yelp review, taking it upon himself to make sure things were made right.(it appears that this location has recently changed hands and is under new ownership, so older reviews may be outdated.)i'm giving these guys 5 stars for excellent customer service.

went here for a longer mens haircut. the barber messed up and cut a giant chunk out of by bangs, then apologized and kept just trimming it as if i was going to walk around with a giant chunk missing out of my bangs. i ended up with a 1in haircut. do not go here.

i got my haircut today, again thinking the location was convenient and the price was right. let me tell you, i had a terrible experience. my hairdresser spoke very little english. she heard them mention "the c word" on the radio, and proceeded to ask me what that meant. i played dumb and said that i wasn't sure. then she asked me if it was the word cunt, and she wanted to know the word meant. not what i was expected on my thursday morning.oh, and about the haircut. i am at work so i haven't had too much time to gaze in the mirror, but i'm not a fan. the main thing i notice is that she took a very large amount of hair off around my ears exposing far too much scalp.
this place was pretty clean. i would go back cheap and friendly3 stars is all it is getting from megood luck

i usually will try not to give bad review and i always will try to give people benefit of the doubt. i had my hair cut done at this suppercuts location and the experience i here is very bad. the store supposed to be open at 9am and when i went there at 9:15am the door is still lock and i have to wait for someone to come open the door.   when i came for hair cut i show the hairdresser the picture on what i want my hair cut to look like and how short i want it to cut. needless to say my hair got butchered.  i afraid to tell the hairdresser that my hair on my side is uneven and unbalance, because when i told her the 1st time she cut my hair shorter and it still uneven. the end result of the hair cut is nothing like the hair cut in the picture. i understand for 16 dollar hair cut it is cheap so i won't have good quality haircut, but the staff seem unprofessional and unfriendly during the whole process. i won't be coming back to this location to have my hair cut and i will advices try other place.

i wanted this place to work out for me. so close to my place and a very affordable rate. although i was a bit disappointed with the actual haircut.the sign up sheet was actually a post-it note on the counter. there was confusion who actually got their first so it comes down to people being honest, which is fine. to make up a quick excel sheet with name and time arrived would seem to be a simple solution.the stylist who cut my hair seemed that she didn't want to be at her job. my haircut is pretty simple, a 1.5 guard on the side and a 3 on top and fade them together. i ended up with a weird line at the top of my head that didn't look natural. she did ask me where i wanted it trimmed up to, but i have never been asked that before, and thought it was a given to make it look natural.i am going to give them another shot. i would call ahead next time as there were three people ahead of me. all said and done it was about a hour and half by the time i walked out the door.

time to get the hair did. oh who am i kidding, buzzing my furry mop every few months isn't all that difficult, but managing the colics is another issue. i refuse to pay more than $25 for a fade in the city of chicago, so supercuts has its moments of clarity. they generally trim me up nice and neat, and every once in awhile it looks pretty darn good. it is unfortunate that store policy doesn't allow the stylists any creative form or flexibility with their cuts, so the standard trim is about all you should expect.i have never had a problem with the waiting list. just keep in mind that people sign in and come back later, so just because you thought you were their first, does not mean it happened that way. use a little forethought and planning as well. dont show up at peak hours on friday, sat, sun, or after 5pm on most weekdays if you dont expect to wait for 15 minutes. try an off hour like 2:30pm or early morning on a weekend for your best bet with the lines. even on the worst days, ive never sat more than 30 minutes here. i definitely agree with rusty s., come here if youre in the area, have a coupon, and aware of the possible wait. it is very true they do not seem to have a concept on staffing, however, the profit margin may not accommodate it either. ill be back until i find something easier or cheaper.

karen was great, haircut was fast and she did a great job. no excessive talking but not weirdly quiet. in and out fast, took care of everything and was very friendly. price can't be beat. will definitely go back.

i went here because the location was convenient.  i am not someone who is super particular about every detail.  still, this was the worst haircut i have ever had.  absolutely no attention to natural curls and waves.  it is actually more like a man's haircut than a woman's.  and it's a bad man's haircut.  everywhere there is a curl or a wave, there are ends sticking out.  she tried to defeat the big wave in front that i said could not be defeated.  i certainly will not go here again, or even anywhere near a supercuts.
we decided to take john in for a haircut today, overall okay man haircut.

was told that there would be a 30 minute wait, there was 2 people ahead of me. a man who came after me also was told that there was a wait and he decided to wait also. at the moment when my turn came mona the stylist walked over to the computer and told the man after me that she was sorry that she didn't realize that he emailed to schedule his appointment, (that funny why didn't he mention that either?) they guy looked surprised (i take it he did not schedule) she just realized that she would get a bigger tip from him. horrible customer service! will never go here again. mona is money hungry!

well this is hard for me to do due to my own selfishness and greed, but i believe in karma and the power of yelp so here goes:  ana is just great! i recently started visiting this location as ana transferred over from another location.  as it turns out, she is actually closer to me, which says a lot as i dislike commuting but i was willing to travel a bit to have her cut my hair. ana is first and foremost a consummate professional.  she's great at her job, at communicating, at giving suggestions, about remembering her customers and their nuances, and in addition to that she's just a kind and caring person.  i highly recommend this supercuts location and specifically, ana.  extra bonus:  she will even help you learn spanish while cutting ‍ your hair.

i often come here to get a quick haircut during my lunch hour.  was very pleased with my stylist maria,  not only was she very quick, she was quiet and not overly chatty.  lines were perfect and and haircut is still looking good 2 weeks later.  excellent work!

after the original review, jennifer r. the district "leader" contacted me to offer my money back.  i accepted.  it has now been five weeks, and i have not received a check.  i have followed up with her via email, and she has not even bothered to reply.not only can i not trust "super"cuts to do an ok job on a haircut, i can also not trust them on customer service.  you should second guess yourself if you are going to trust them and may want to search for other places that cut hair.  there are more than a few others in downtown chicago.maybe there is a regional "leader" who will still make this right?if i could take away the one remaining star, i would.
calling ahead of booking online means nothing and they never have enough people working.  find some place else

customer service promised that the district leader will reach out to me. it never happened. they made me call and submit a ticket. terrible service, terrible customer care!one week ago ----------------------------------------------------------------their messagehi,thank you for sharing your experience at our supercuts salon in chicago.  i am sorry it wasn't a better one. you mentioned that you were unhappy with your haircut.we take all feedback very seriously and would like the opportunity to make this right. if you are interested in discussing this with a district leader, please feel free to reach out to our guest services team at 1-888-456-2887 or at the following address: departmentcs@regiscorp.c....  to connect with the supervisor of the salon please visit:

probably the worst haircut i've ever gotten. as i looked in the mirror at the end of my haircut i noticed the stylist had cut a chunk of hair off the side of my head in the middle. to make matters worse, chrissy, my stylist, claimed that she didn't do it! i understand mistakes happen, but i can't believe this stylist didn't admit what she did or offer to fix it. luckily the manager, sherri, offered me a full refund. i went to another place where they were able to blend it in. i'll still have to wait for it to grow back for it look normal again. i won't be back to this salon.

upon entering the stylist did not introduce  herself.  she just asked what kind of haircut i wanted.  i showed her several photos of haircuts. which was many layers and face framing layers (i have very long hair).  when she was done, it looked like she just took a bowl and cut around my top layer.  my hair was all one length and now, i have just have two layers; one layer that ends at my ears and the other the goes down my back.  my hair looks horrible and i am in tears.  the towel service they promise was not provided either.  overall, unsatisfactory.  i will never entrust my best feature with a supercut.  it was my fault for thinking i could get a decent haircut for $16.95.  i literally got what i paid for.  #lifelessonsif you wish to look nice and end with a suitable haircut, do not go here.  it is better to go to an asha type salon and get a haircut done correctly.  it is worth paying the money.

i don't know how much there is to say about supercuts in general, but i was happy with this location. the staff were polite, i got a haircut in about 15 minutes with no wait (reserved online in the morning), and they seem pretty busy and clean.apparently this is the first time i've seen them give me a hot towel to wipe off my face from the haircut though, which is a nice plus.really, does anyone ever have a giant story from getting a haircut if a: you're a man who doesn't know much about hairstyle or b: nothing horrific happened? i'd imagine not.

reading some of the reviews i was scared to get my haircut here. but i was desperate and out of time so i walked in after work today and got my hair cut by maria. she was quiet (which i prefer) but did a god job and was quick about it. it's not the best haircut i've ever had, but it's certainly not the worst either, especially for the money.

i was a loyal customer for three years. my stylist, ivonne, is great and deserves a five-star rating on her own.but since this location started trying to high-tech up appointments with their snazzy new app, my last four appointments have been ignored. i call (or now app) ahead, clear that hole in my day and make the trip in, and find myself on the same wait as if i hadn't scheduled at all. three of my last four attempted haircuts resulted in me running out of waiting time and leaving with nothing accomplished.i like ivonne and i wish she could still cut my hair, but time and principle force me to another haircut place that will honor appointments and its customers' time. very disappointing.looking for recommendations for a good, reasonably priced men's haircut option in the loop!
started coming here a few months ago. haven't had a bad cut yet. then again my hair is really short, pretty much a high and tight.love the online sign up process. super convenient.

worst. haircut. ever.   except for the last time i went there 2 years ago.i was clear about what i wanted -- clean up my cut, trim about an inch, longer on top than the sides.  i came in with a side part, and left with a center part.  not my idea.   i don't know what the gal was thinking about, but it wasn't my haircut.  she made it lumpy and lopsided, and i decided to leave rather than see if i could talk here through getting it right.  i don't have enough hair for that.   back to the haircuttery on halsted for me.  they always do a nice job, and it is equally inexpensive.  but like night and day.

i have been going here for about 3 years as it is convenient to go get a haircut on lunch break while working in the loop.  there is a woman here who has cut my hair probably 25 times over the course of my frequenting this establishment, and every time i end up with her, she does a real great job.  i wish i knew her name.  i think it's wendy.  i should find out.granted, my haircut is easy (well, really, what do i know, i don't cut hair).  but you just take a 1 guard around the sides and back, then fade it up to the top of my head and leave about 1" of hair up there.  so it sounds pretty easy to me.  anyways, i have always been happy with the haircuts i walk out of here with. i tried to get an $8 hair cut at some latin american type place near my house and walked out with a way crooked fade and a big chunk of hair missing from the back of my cranium.  i of course can not see the back of my own head, and in retrospect the haircutter there curiously did not give me a mirror to inspect her handywork, so when i got home my girlfriend's roommate politely pointed out that the back of my head looked ridiculous.  this has not happened at supercuts in the thompson center and for that i is grateful.

have you ever been hit on by a guy so sleezy and so below your standards that you felt like you needed to take a shower afterward, just from being spoken to?  yeah, that's what supercuts felt like to me.  if you've read any of my other reviews, you know that i am 100% loyal to my gia at the charles ifergan salon.. the place that brings you lemon waters and treats you like a queen each time you go.  well, during budget craze where for a brief moment i considered haircuts a "non-essential" item, i decided that supercuts may be a decent choice for a simple trim.  i mean, cut and tip for less than twenty? i thought this was the answer to my budget woes.  well, my hair has never recovered from the emotional trauma since, and i will never consider haircuts a non-essential budget item again.honestly, ladies, a hair cut isn't just about the cut.  sure, you need someone with great technique and who can make you look beautiful (neither of which supercuts offers), but more than that, going to a salon is also a spiritual experience.  there is nothing like sitting in the chair having your hair cut by someone who looks just as hip and beautiful as you want to feel.  you want to look around and see other people who care enough about their appearance to put in the time to come to a nice salon.  you want to be pampered and made to feel like a goddess in a place with aesthetic furniture, calming music, and the sound of stiletto heels on the ground.going to supercuts was like walking into a grocery store.  not the hip whole foods type of grocery stores with milfs walking around.  it was like going to a grocery store in the middle of the afternoon where you see people walking around aimlessly like they are just trying to distract themselves from the fact that they don't have a job.  it's like walking into some fashion bug type store off a recommendation from a co-worker only to discover that it's a store where fashion comes to die and you know you have to escape before someone you know spots you.  i feel dirty just writing this review b/c i feel dirty for having ever walked into the store.  there is no amount of frederick fekkai products i can buy to make up for what i did, and just the mere thought of having ever walked into this salon makes my skin crawl.  what the hell was i thinking?and if hating supercuts makes me a snob, then a snob i will be.  but unless you've done it yourself, don't judge.  it was truly that awful.

nothing special. i went in with my friend to get hair cuts and we both exchanged glances as we realized all of the customers were males (not something we're used to at salons.) we both work near by and needed inexpensive haircuts asap. i noticed all the women working also looked the exactly same (must be family owned franchise or something..) after waiting about 30 minutes i got a cut, basically a trim because i was too scared to complicate/confuse the dresser (the cuts they were giving all the men didn't look too good). i left with just a few inches off, i basically look the same. my friend also had the same feeling, they didn't really do much. so for about $20 including tip, it was okay. i wouldn't ask for anything too picky, they don't seem very experienced. though, i don't think i'll go back.
my cut and highlights are perfect at 1/2 price other placescut depends on who you get  but sheri and gina are the best!this place is closed weekends

i'm going to engage in a bit of wacky, so-called reverse stereotyping and say that this is what happens when you get your hair cut by a straight guy. i'll admit that i am 50% at fault for my unsatisfactory haircut, as i tend to forget the description of what i'm looking for, but the guy may well have decided to make his own decision regardless. he didn't cut the top short enough, and he explained that he did so because i would look too bald otherwise. uh, thanks for the editorializing, dude.i knew i should've sat back down and made him cut it down, but i felt like i was in some kind of twilight zone, or tractor beam, or insert your preferred dorky sci-fi simile here, and i also felt like this guy had opinions too strong to be overruled by pitiful "customers," so i just gave up hoping that i could get it fixed at the other loop location, where i'd had much better service. this place is closer to my work, but who cares! if someone's gonna cast aspersions on me, they oughta at least give better results.

how is it possible to have someone else do your hair, yes, for $45 at supercuts - and have it look worse than your own paltry efforts. i don't know how it's possible, but the wierd little chick who washed, blow dried and used the flat iron on my hair managed to do so. for the thompson center, you'd think they'd have a better "quicky" salon than this flea bag shop.  i've never paid more than $30 for a cheapy quicky, but i accounted for its being in the thompson center. huh-uh. location has nothing to do with the quality (not) of service (and subsequent lack thereof)  in this place. frankly, i think the place felt creepy...i couldn't wait to get out of that chair, and i swear - i do a much better job - and i can't see the back of my head!

i really am sorry to see the horrible reviews on here. i have only seen one person here, yolanda. i was tired of paying for pricey haircuts and being miserable after i leave with an ugly haircut. i figured, if i'm going to walk around with ugly haircuts, i might as well be paying $15 for them. i walked in, as they do not take appointments, and was seen quickly by yolanda. i am a woman and wear my hair short, like a pixie cut. yolanda had me skipping out of there in 20 minutes. my haircut was so cute, and it only cost $15! i went back, same thing. again and again. i have been going to her for at least a year now, and short hair needs a trim every few weeks. once or twice it isn't quite right, but i go back in a few weeks and it's great. i've tried growing the side, growing the bangs, angling the cut, and yolanda keeps up. i'm going back today.

i agree with one of the other people that reviewed this supercuts location, i wish there were negative ratings. giving one star is too generous. i was told to see yolanda by a friend. well, yolanda did one hell of a hack job on my hair and then thought she could camouflage by blow drying and then flat ironing my hair.  i tried to live with it for a few days. couldn't, so i went back and teecha (sp?) was the next person that i tried. i say person and not stylist because that would not be an accurate description. she tried to clean up yolanda's mess but failed. i went back to her once more thinking all i needed was to let it grow out a bit so there would be more to work with. uhmm yeah, i was wrong. i went to a professional on saturday and when she combed out my hair and showed me how bad it was i wanted to scream! how do you cut off too much hair and then try and cover it by leaving the next layer longer?! never again!

i've been going to higher end salons for 40 years to get my  hair cut.  i would go to the same person for several years, then they would quit, or move to a salon further away from where i lived, and i would have to find another person.  i finally bit the bullet and decided to go to a "supercuts", which happens to be 5 minutes from my house and which i know was low priced, so i always figured it would be so-so haircuts.  (you know, "you get what you pay for").  well, let me tell you, i was pleasantly surprised by my first visit.  yes, i had to wait, but that is the way it is. so i learned to call in advance for an appointment, and hardly ever wait now. but that's not the best part.  what i was so happy with was the lady who cut my hair.  her name is martha.  she not only is one of the friendliest and pleasant people i've dealt with in the hair cutting world, she also can cut hair!  each time i've gone in, (probably about 6 times now over 1 and half years), she has listened to me and given me a great cut.  today was the best yet!  i showed her several pictures of what i wanted, (knowing that you can't always get the cut you want, if you don't have the same hair as the person in the picture!), and she did a fantastic job.  i would recommend supercuts, not only because it is extremely fair priced, but you get a great hair cut too! thanks martha, you  made my day!

arg, you get what you pay for. i had a stylist (i think her name was donna?) and she did a horrible job. i wanted a layered cut--same cut i have been getting for years--and she told me it wasn't possible. the end result was an ugly, ragged cut that i had to get corrected elsewhere. not coming back again.
just wanted a blow dry. hair is crazy frizzy, and i asked her if she could fix it and she blamed it on my hair. i could have done it better myself. very disappointing.

i used to go here years ago but had bad luck, but i think it changed ownership over a year ago so that's when i decided to give it a try again. my sons and i have been here a few times over the past few months on weekday afternoons and had good experiences. there was not much wait, we got really nice haircuts and the ladies were friendly. plus they'll take the supercuts coupons you have even after the expiration date, making the price quite reasonable.so i don't know why currently there are some negative reviews.  i have no complaints and we'll be back.
