i come to supercuts in the glen because of a fabulously, talented stylist named martha. she is kind, funny and gives me a terrific haircut every time. she is always in a good mood with a great smile. martha is an extraordinary stylist. you cannot beat the haircut for the price. please give her a nice tip because she deserves it! i would follow her anywhere because she's the best!!!

i started my experience by check in online at 10am. the website said '25 minutes" i went in at 10:15 and stated i check in online and the lady said, "wait and i"ll take you shortly".shortly after a young man walks in and signed in and she took him right away.  which upset me since i've been waiting and had checked in online earlier... all meanwhile i have to listen to one of the stylist with a eastern european accent rip on our president, talk about how horrible our country is, and bad mouthing our military.....after waiting an additional 20 minutes, i had to leave since i was supposed to get my haircut 30 minutes earlier.... and had to get to an 11:30am meeting nearby it was very disappointing at the service and attitude these employees have towards their customers and our country....

my family and i have been getting our  haircut with teresa for over 10 years. although she has moved around quite a bit, we've managed to follow and keep up with her because she is really amazing. teresa is especially good at cutting and layering hair for both men and women. we have never had a bad experience and that's why we always come back. i recently colored my hair for the first time with teresa and she did a beautiful job. if you're going to supercuts, make sure to set up your appointment with teresa. she is absolutely phenomenal, you will not regret it!

i really love the work my stylist does and have been going there for years.   there are few changes that i don't care for:  1) they removed the tv years ago, so during cubs/hawks games i went somewhere else as not to miss the games  2) they now don't take appointments unless the stylist is actually there.

quite possibly the worst haircut ever gotten in the last 10 years. i guess you really do get what you pay for. i walked in the door and the two stylist that we're still there were arguing about something. then got a haircut and the lady just absolutely butchered half my head.  i will never go back here. first time kama just moved into the neighborhood, never again.
teresa cut my hair and does an awesome job! she is so professional and makes sure i come out of the salon satisfied and beautiful! she is awesome at what she does. you should ask for teresa!
great haircut for the price. can't beat it. teresa's been my go to for years. recommend her for a quick and quality haircut. remember to call ahead because they fill up quick at times.

i went to just have 1" cut. this was a simple straight cut which is why i went to super cuts. zarina ( name she told me ...by the time i asked for it she knew i was very unhappy with the job she did...) cut 3" off. she kept insisting in order to make it even she needed to cut this much. i asked to see any of the hair she cut that was at the 1" i requested but she said it was on the floor and mixed with other people's hair. there was no hair that was 1". it was an awful experience. if she can't do a simple cut i would be very wary of going to this super cuts.

consistently good haircuts at a very reasonable price! i've been a client of teresa's for more than ten years and have always been happy with my haircut. she's very enthuziastic and provides excellent customer service. i highly recommend supercuts @ patriot bvld. ask for teresa!

show up at 815p, location is scheduled to close at 9p. no other customers in the store, after sitting for a minute, "stylist" comes out from the back and asks if i come back tomorrow. since when do businesses turn paying customers away, 45 minutes prior to closing? my hair cut takes 5 - 10 minutes at most. no, i will not come back and give you my money when it is more convenient for you. i can understand if there were multiple customers in store but there were none and this isn't the first time this has happened. on a positive note, when i have gotten my hair cut here, they've done a fine job. will try out sports clips, great clips, hair cuttery or one of the other options out there...

it all depends on who cuts your hair. martha and an asian lady that have cut my hair do an excellent job. this other person who works on sundays butchered my hair twice. she will not be cutting my hair again!in the future, i will only have martha or the asian lady cut my hair.

checked in online. promised zero wait time. i get there. two people available. and yet i'm made to wait for over 10 minutes. in my view, defeats the purpose of checking in online.  also - one the haircut people always have to get the phones which doubles the time of your haircut. however i'm most miffed about checking in online and then having to wait - especially when there are multiple people available. if they want to take breaks that should be factored into the expected wait time and not made as zero.

i had my hair cut and colored by christina last weekend.  the color turned out okay but the haircut was awful..... the worst i've ever received.  she totally hacked at my hair.   just be advised.... you get what you pay for!update: 12/2013 - worst.haircut.ever!!!  another hack job. this place is a crapshoot.  just because someone has gone to beauty school doesn't mean they can give a good haircut.  i've been coming here for a few years now and i've been lucky to get a string of good stylists (2), but they eventually leave for better jobs.  then, i have to try my luck with a new stylist.  sigh

if i could give negative, i would.  rude, rude, rude is the only word i can think of when it comes to the blonde stylist; cheryl i believe is her name.  not to mention rough.  my 12 year old  told said to me "mom.  she was mean.  she kept yanking my head around really hard." why let people put name on list if they go in only to be told another 30-45 minutes??  will never go back even though it is pretty much across street from my house.  would rather drive 20 minutes out of my way to get my son's haircut.
i've been happy with this place for a cheap hair cut that is decent and covers the basics.  i've been to many of the different hair cutters and they all do a good job.

love this place for the money as long as i never have cheryl !!!!!!!!!!soooo much of her personal phone calls, personal drama, all about cheryl attitude.  she is more interested in getting you in and out of her chair in as little time as possible to rack up the $$$$$.  i suppose supercuts loves that about her but as for the customer.....i come to relax and have my hair done, not hear her drama and see pictures of her latest boyfriend etc etc ad nauseum........she is very unprofessional but cuts fast and alot so management looks the other way - little do they know that word on the street is stay away because of cheryl.  ask for anyone else but cheryl although you will still hear her drama throughout the shop!will management ever wake up to this girl!!!!

thanks glenda. i went to another loaion before and was not happy. i did try again here. i was not greeted at 1st but the glenda quickly noticed i was a client not just coming to sit in the waiting area. she was woman of few word (fine with me) she clean up my original style and i was on my way in 30 mins tops. pros- not crowdeddidn't push me to by productsconshair was on the floorone employee was clearly socializing.not enough change in the cash register eventhough chase is inthe same strip mall (3 doors over).

lady asked me about the hair cut that i need , i told her will need to cut it short and make sure all side are equal and if needed to cut little shorter we can. she told me no if you decided to cut more after what i do i will charge you another $16.50 for another hair cut , because that takes time and she don't have time for that .i was like really ? she was so rude .i'll never go there again thanks for the terrible experience

i went for a haircut in november, right before thanksgiving.  there was a temp working, and she did a terrible job with my hair (e.g., uneven cuts), which i didn't notice until the next day.  (i was in a hurry and didn't have my glasses on.)  the next day, i went back; the manager fixed the cut free of charge.  i went back again today; i received another uneven cut.  in addition, the person cutting my hair kept mumbling under her breath, as if i were doing her a great disservice by asking for a simple cut.  when she was done, she did not ask whether the cut was ok.  she simply walked to the register and began the check-out process.  i've learned my lesson: you get what you pay for.
i dropped in while my boyfriend and i were out walking the dog. galena is lovely, and she did a wonderful job with my hair. i will definitely go back!

do not go here - i have been the victim of 2 of the worst haircuts of my life. tonight my butchers name was stephanie; a cold-hearted, unemotional, ruthless killer of good hair and style. from the moment she sat me down i could see the callus in her eyes and while i sat there hoping for the best; alas, i got her worst. she mercilessly chopped and snipped her way into the #1 spot of my all time worst haircuts. not only did she leave me with a faux widows peak, as shown in the attached image, but when asked as to how this could have happened she merely replied with malice in her heart "it'll grow back". to which i replied, " i will be back here, nevermore".

unbelievably bad haircut from this place.  i've ended up with this uneven and inadvertent anti-mullet that i never asked for.  my usual place was closed and i needed a haircut now im contemplating getting a buzz cut to cover up the damage from supercuts.

i don't get it. every time i go it's a 30+ minute wait. the haircuts are okay. the price are moderate. but i don't have an hour to wait for a hair cut. and when you say there's two people ahead of me, don't bump my spot back. you lost another customer today.

first of all make your appointment online with the app it will get you in sooner. i have received many skilled, thoughtful cuts from daisy. i get the same style every time and i get compliments so for a decent haircut i recommend supercuts.

samantha did a great and fast job. prices are very cheap and she got the job done well. she was very honest by telling me what she could and couldn't do. worked out fine and i'm happy with the results :)

i have been a customer for 17 years (used to be borics back when). samantha has been my stylist for about the last 5 years.  she has such talent she could work in a trendy upscale salon but she said she likes her customers & is happy here-lucky for me & her other regulars! sam gets busy on weekends but is worth the wait (she never rushes which i appreciate as i wouldn't want someone rushing my cut). i have also had good experience with galina & gladys who have worked here for years.
awful awful awful!!walk-ins are not welcome!!they say they don't take appointments, walk in and wait over an hour and a half and still people walking in front of you
if you come to this supercuts, ask for samantha. she'd the only capable person there. otherwise, be warned - check pics to see what the "stylist" did to my 9 year old.

haircut was actually really good. i gave specific instructions and they followed exactly what i wanted. i asked for an upper lip wax which left me with hair on my lip. the technician went over the entire lip in one strip, rather than two or more. so she did not follow the arch of the lip leaving me with lots of hair that i saw later when i got home. i suppose they aren't exactly known for their waxing services though. but it would be nice to have it done properly.

this place was really okay as borics before it was acquired by supercuts. since it became supercuts it has been staffed by employees that don't have any skills whatsoever. after my visit last week i will never come here again. buyer beware.
i have seen galina many times - she is very precise and takes her time,in a good way.;  just saw samantha - she is also excellent; i would recommend both of them!

received a very bad haircut from an incredibly unprofessional haircutter who lacked any integrity or pride in her work.  didn't ask me how i wore my hair.   i asked for short and professional and received a buzz cut that made me look like a tennis ball.  no style at all.  not even close.  after she had "finished" i pointed out several places where she'd missed spots.   the manager then cut my hair for 5 more minutes and apologized.  never offered a refund.  instead offered a coupon for a free haircut next time.  i will not be returning.    my favorite exchange:me:  "you didn't ask me how i wore my hair."cutter: "well, we have a lot of regulars here and we already know how they wear their hair."me:  "do you know how ridiculous that response is?"  i've had many great haircuts at places like supercuts, fantastic sams, great clips, etc.  this place just employs a person who doesn't care at all, is in the wrong profession, and has a manager that doesn't oversee the work being produced by her employees.  bottom line:  the haircut was $11.  you get what you pay for with this place.

save yourself the hassle and do not go here. i made the mistake of running in yesterday for a quick cut and the stylist (hate to even call her that) had no idea what she was doing. when asking how short i wanted, she actually cut it short to show me. um, yea - we're still discussing here. thankfully it was underneath so it doesn't show but who does that? also my hair looks totally unstyled - just a blunt cut because, obviously, she doesn't know how to do any better. my husband could have done a better job! stay away!!! i wish i did.

as a working professional, i feel like i'm supposed to drop $40-60 on every haircut. but i don't because i really love galena and samantha at this location (the other hairdressers seem friendly and popular, too, but i've never had them cut my hair). both women take their time and understand how to deal with my fine, very straight hair that shows every cut. i'm a big fan! the only downside is the wait on weekends, but that's not surprising.
sam is excellent! i think she is also the manager at this location.had to wait 30 mins, but it was worth. will definitely go again.

i normally don't go to supercuts, but i was in desperate need of a haircut and didn't have time to make an appointment elsewhere so i decided to give it a try, i paid about $15, and got one of my favorite haircuts! unfortunately, i don't remember the stylist's name, but i will be coming back.

the power of yelp.  after my regular hair specialist at a competing chain left unannounced, i decided to check yelp for somewhere near the loop.  i found this location in river north, a little further than i wanted but i didn't mind for the right experience.  well, thanks to yelp, i found out about ana.  she is first and foremost a consummate professional.  she's great at her job, at communicating, at giving suggestions, about remembering her customers and their nuances, and in addition to that she's just a kind and caring person.  full disclaimer, ana has transferred to the loop location at the thompson center, but this location is still very nice and in fact one of her own family members is still here.  i highly recommend this location and highly recommend ana.
come here not expecting much but get the best hair cut ever!!! veronica are the best she fast efficient and make me look real cute thankyou!!!

i recently cut all my dreadlocks off. i came here because it was close to where i had an appointment. friendly and courteous staff, i signed in and had to wait only 5 minutes. she trimmed my new short do in minutes & cleaned it up nicely. all for just 11 dollars!

i called my mother on facetime and first thing she yelled "who are you??"  she couldn't recognize me with a newly established beard and fluffy disheveled hair.  so i decided it's time to take care of the aesthetic department of my head. in general, if you're not going to a fancy event, would you feel like spending too much money on cutting hair!. so i looked up supercuts because i had a great experience with them in other states. i read the reviews about this location and they were extremely bipolar. either the best experience or a lady who she said they cut her ear. or another who found this place too shady and cheap for her. this location is across the street from the magnificent mike whole foods on huron st in case you got lost. michigan ave was insanely crowded on the black friday. it was such a nice stroll over here. i talked to ana over the phone, she said walk-in is welcome. when seated, rose took excellent care of my head. she was very smooth and experienced. we had a great chat. we talked about taquitos and mole. she gave me an order to try a taqueria she loves. my head looked great and i was happy after rose did her job. then i had a head wash/massage. omg! it felt crazy good!i definitely recommend the head wash and shampooed head massage here. although i gave a generous tip, but i guess this experience was worth more. i read that ana and veronica are awesome here. but i already hired rose.
i've had one good and one mediocre cut. not a ton of barbers in the area, so this works if you don't want to travel. go in with specific instructions and you'll be just fine.

so i go to a lot of great clips/super cuts, so my review is based on similar comparisons. this place just isn't as good as the others. my hair dresser wasn't very friendly and didn't really do a great job. i'm not all that thrilled with my cut, but it's not awful (i asked for a trim and the front piece to be angled...nothing fancy!) the prices are hard to beat, but i'll definitely walk the extra few minutes next time to try out the great clips.

i am writing to compliment andrew, my regular stylist at this location in chicago. he is always very cordial and professional in providing me with excellent customer service, giving me great haircuts and beard/mustache trims according to my specific requests.andrew is an asset to supercuts in general, this location and to all the customers he serves.matt hauman

shout out to michelle for a great cut. i was in the city on business and needed a quick cut and style. she did a great job of layering my hair and listened & cut carefully to make sure it was just like i wanted. all the customers coming in and out seemed like regulars, and the staff greeted them by name. happy place with a friendly staff.

i love this place.  i have been a customer of armando for more years than i care to admit.  he never misses a beat & the shop runs flawlessly.  always upbeat & professional -yet fun staff.  definitely recommend this supercuts location.

i was looking for a new salon so i stopped into supercuts to see what they had to offer.  i was greeted with smiles and people willing to help me, including the owner armando.  i wasn't planning on getting a hair cut that night, but when they said they could get me in right away, i decided to try it.  i believe my hair was cut my nora (but i might be mistaken by her name!).  i was so thrilled with the cut and i've received so many compliments on it already.  it's a few blocks away from my apartment, which is extremely convenient and the price is just right.  living so close to michigan ave and the gold coast, it's nice to be able to get a haircut without having to spend an arm and a leg.  i will be going back!

great place to get the style you want in an affordable way, the staff are up to date with the latest and greats trends. i normally have trouble someone who can work with curly hair, i was very happy with my cut and style when i left. highly recommend!

terrible, really bad experince, i won't come back even if they will offer me free hair cut for life.i made a mistake that i step into this place, i got hair cut by lilly medina. she is not hair stylist and not even close to. bad bad don't go.

consistently terrible - these people are garbage at cutting hair and even worse at customer service (and also super shady!). 1st time i was here, the woman cut my ear which was exquisitely painful. the manager came by and declared that i was not bleeding (lie) and then at the end, gave me a bandaid (why would you do that unless i was bleeding???). i thought it was a freak occurrence and came back again for convenience. hair cut ended above the chin (not what i asked for) and they deny doing anything wrong. they never admit to the mistakes they make and will charge you if you ask them to fix it. my hair looks like a mess. i asked for thinning and i ended up with an asymmetrical cut with lots of frays - it looks like a nightmare. avoid at all costs. this is a lesson in giving 2nd chances.

you might ask , why the hell is this guy giving 5 stars to a hair cut place?well i will tell you why.i have gone here on and off for a few years. sometimes i go to someone name veronica who is very efficient and fast. but what i do is i call and tell them i will be there in half and hour. then when i go in, i get my hair cut done within 5 minutes of me being there.in the maybe 10-15 times i have been here i cant say that i have been here for over 25 minutes. that is very efficient and they care about your time.its not by appointment only but it does not hurt to call before

the worst haircut ever. avoid at all costs. have used this place because it is close to mhome. the last cut the worst. they do not speak fluent english. so they cut as they want. never again will i fall for the close and cheap.no one in the area goes here leaves a good review, they depend on tourists, or anyone only needing a nimber 2 shave.

it has been hard finding a reliable place downtown that gives a good haircut at a reasonable price. i tried this supercuts which is a couple blocks from where i live. it turns out that one of my old stylists, lilliam, is working there and she always gave me a great haircut. i went to her for several months but due to some scheduling conflicts of my own, she was not there one night and i got my hair cut by sandra. she gave me an amazing haircut and probably the best shampoo i have ever had. i mostly see sandra now (because she is there in the evenings) and could not be happier. both sandra and lilliam are terrific stylists and i would recommend either one. thank you sandra and lilliam for the best cuts in chicago!

usually i pay 50-60 for a haircut and for a trim, not necessary. i walked in after work about 430, got right in. they trimmed my hair dry, which i've never had done before and was a little nervous about especially because i have curly hair. in and out in 10 minutes and staff were very nice. will be coming back for sure.

i go to this location as this is closest to me and i only need trim for my hair and not any special style/cut. i usually see hair stylist anna - she is very nice, does the job well and is courteous to clients. the receptionists though whoever is at front desk except the hair stylist herself are all very rude. the older looking stylists who try to act as the manager not sure if the is actually the manager is utter mannerless always carry that attitude on her god knows for what. may be cz i dont see her and always wait for someone else? if you only care for your stylists and getting your job done this is a place but if you are looking for anything like customer service its a big no no. those stars only for stylist and lost starts for management for being consistently terrible at being courteous to clients

i went to see chrissy after a disastrous color by another salon nearly ruined my hair.  i initially saw her for a haircut and her cut and blow-dry were so fabulous i went back to her the next day for a color re-do and have been going to her ever since. she highlights my very long hair and doesn't seem bothered that i have a lot of it. her color always turns out so natural and my hair is in the best condition it's ever been in. her blow-dry and style is incredible. the best i've ever had.

i started here after my italian barber left the country without informing me. supercuts was almost across the street so i decided to try it. my first appointment was with ana and i lucked out. she does a great job and has been cutting my hair ever since. the price is about half of what i'd been paying before for the same quality. i use the app for appointments and occasionally have to wait because ana is so popular, but it's never long and worth it.

updated review: the front desk girl just called me back and yolanda now has an appointment and is able to fit me in. i'm a returning customer after all!yes yolanda is amazing but too bad the girls who schedule can't seem to remember when she works! i called yesterday at 10:30 to schedule an appointment and the girl told me to call back at 11:00. when i did the next girl said she wasn't working that day. she told me to call back the next day at 11:00. when i did that the girl said that she had come in at 10:00 and was now completely booked with no availability.i cannot wait any longer to cut my hair and will be going to another salon from now on.

terri did a fantastic job on my sons hair. he has course, heavy, thick hair and curly to boot! she did exactly what i wanted, no hassle. we were going to the boardroom and weren't quite happy. word of mouth brought me here.

be sure to get a name if you call ahead and make an appointment bc chances are someone will screw up and even though you made a reservation 30 mins prior ( as instructed) you will come and be put at the back of the line.   not even sure getting a name will really help though?!?  maybe it's a bad place for a girls haircut?  seems like everyone can do men but maybe only some can do women and that's why they just put another guy in front of me? $54 for shampoo ($9) cut ($19) blow ($25). hmmm

horrible experience here! i decided to come here because it was very affordable ($16.95 for a haircut), and i just needed a trim. boy was that a mistake...i did the check in on the website to get a spot in line before you arrive. it worked great, and i only had to wait about 5 minutes once i arrived. the lady cutting my hair was quite rude from the beginning. she told me i need to wear leave in conditioner all the time and was annoyed i didn't have it in my hair. i said i didn't need a hair wash which she seemed bothered by as well. she took a total of 5 minutes to cut my hair. 5 minutes!!! she said the left side was already shorter than the right side so it didn't need to be cut. the whole point of getting my haircut was to get rid of the split ends everywhere, so i didn't understand her point. also my last haircut was at an upscale salon in nashville so i know for a fact both sides are equal. i left very unsatisfied with the haircut and will have to go elsewhere to have it fixed.
terrible haircut. the person cutting my hair had no idea what she was doing and went to get help from another employee only after she butchered my hair.

great service! always do a quick job and do it very well. i've never been able to make appointments so i don't understand the bad reviews concerning a non existent appointment system. sounds like over privileged complaining to me.

this has been bugging me for a long time but today was the last straw. supercuts doesn't honor appointments! today i called ahead and put my name on the list for a set time that they agreed to, then i showed up and they said that i'd be behind all 8 people in the waiting room. i clarified that she was viewing me as a scheduled haircut at this certain time, and she confirmed, so i walked out. she was not understanding but frankly she's probably confused about her store's policy to accept scheduled appointments and then put these people behind walk-ins. it's gotten to be so frustrating, just please tell me that this time won't work if you can't get me in within 10 minutes of my scheduled time, i'd rather choose a later time then show up and wait!!!

yolanda does an incredible job. i'm here temporarily and received a hair cut from her about a month ago, when i came in conversation picked up like it never dropped off. she remembered who i was and what i was doing in dallas. it's customer service like that, that is unique. not to mention she does an incredible job

i have had 3 hair cuts here so far. i'm leaving 2 stars for the first 2 hair cuts. (looking back after writting this, my hair cut just now was god awful, i can't bring myself to leave 2 stars)i just got the absolutely worst experience i've ever had getting my hair cut. i was in and out in like 15 minutes she took a #2 or #3 to the sides and back after i asked for a #4. it's way to short and instead of blending it looks like she took a bowl and a razor to the back of my head! no gradual blend nothing just a strait line then your into hair, i could have done the back of my own head better with a piece of glass and a mirror! this was terrible and no one would look me in the eye on my way out. she didn't ask how i wanted the back and just jumped in with the "#4" and cut a strait fucking line. and it was too late  she knew she screwed up and i wouldn't dare let that but her try to fix it. she didn't even get the top back where i had specifically asked for it! i didn't want that butcher touching me anymore after she screwed up the back and sides that bad then says "done!" yup i'm done! if i had her do what i had wanted i bet i would have ended up with a shaved line through my head and her looking dumber then usual while trying to explain how that was on purpose. my hair has been thinner since my cancer treatments and it really shows when its butchered like this. inconsistent, terrible job, i through down my money and kept more change then i ever have from a hair cut and ran out of there! i have never left a hair cut feeling this low. if you get your hair cut here ask for the german lady, she is kind and polite and cuts hair like she cares what you look like. she deserves 5 stars. she did my last cut here and i loved it. my hair looked good and thicker after! so i came back but they gave me to a cutter today instead of a hair dresser and now i'm writing a review considering wearing a hat in 100degree texas summer...

i understand this is a drop in kind of place and if you do that, it probably gets the job done. but i've been getting my color done there done there for about 6 months because it's the only place open on sunday's. it is always a comedy of errors. you have to call ahead and every time it takes a minimum of 5-8 minutes while everyone that works there shouts back and forth about it. for some reason they have to ask every stylist of they "have time to do a color today".   i know because they have no idea how to use the hold function. on the few times they do use hold, the person always picks up like a new call. it takes about 1 hour tops as i only get my roots done but they can't do it within 3 hours of closing?  i always overtip and am very friendly thinking maybe they will remember me and not go through the whole ordeal again next time but nothing works. i hate dealing with them- and look forward to finding another place that fits my schedule. only go there if you have no other options. price is okay but for mediocre color.
get yolanda to cut your hair. she's terrific. you will have to call ahead and have them put your name on a list. (she's that popular.)

the haircut i received was average. i have really long hair and the stylist spent like five minutes on it. that said, it was okay. the real problem was the dreadful service. the stylists took at least two other people before me who had clearly come in after me and didn't have appointments. completely ridiculous! since i was the only person in the waiting room who wasn't a white male, i have a feeling it had something to do with my race and/or sex. avoid this salon and their prejudices!

took my daughter there for a haircut - it was ok, but she asked for layers and the girl cut it straight across and she asked to have it blow dried which costs $40!!!  she didn't know to ask  how much it would cost first, but $40 for a blow dry - they should have warned us!  not going back here!

this review is based on my only time at supercuts...i usually spend a lot more than what they here charge at a higher end salon.  i wanted to chop my hair off as a spur of the moment decision, and thanks to their online check-in i was able to see how long the expected wait would be so i didn't have to waste time waiting there.  i got to the location a few minutes prior to my estimated check in time but was greeted and helped immediately.  i had a picture of what i was going for and even though the cut wasn't exactly like the picture, i like it better than the picture i showed her.  when she finished she asked if i would like anything changed, and she touched up part of it perfectly (it's like she read my mind).  i'm not going to lie, i was scared to go as short as the cut is (and was probably in shock at first) but she did an amazing job and i can't believe how inexpensive it was.  one thing that is probably common knowledge to others but i didn't know is that everything is a la carte - the price is for the haircut only, and if you want it washed or blow-dried afterwards, it is extra.  one of my favorite haircuts to date.

walked in and was taken immediately!! quick cheap awesome cut! i noticed a really nice of hair products line up in an eye catching display with prices very reasonable! i think the woman who cut my hair is tam. very sweet, smiley and funny. she was gracious and skilled. thank you!

i stopped in this place last night....at 15 minutes til close....i was met with great hospitality by the manager.  usually when i go to these "franchise cuts" places i am met with apprehension because of the texture of my hair and the definition in my cut.well, the manager was super nice and accomodating.  she made me feel like an old friend.  first, she knew it would be more than 15 minutes, no frustration.  second, she went ober everything in detail before cutting.  she made sure she had a understanding.  ran it back to me like she was taking my order (i.e. ok, let me make sure i have this right, you want......).  third, she understood my misinterpretation and mis-understainding of "hair talk".  we worked by talking, pointing out.  she got it, all of it!  fourth, she made small suggestions of inexpensive tools to get hair magic! like how to get color out without damaging my hair for $5 total.  wowzers....lastly, she didnt do a full cut so she was able to give me a discounted rate!!!  to top off an already good experience.there was another lady ckeaning the entire time so the shop was well kept.  product displayed nicely, sinks clean.i was leery because of past experiences with these kind of places, but she definitely deserves a gold star.  i left her a nice tip!  not to mention, she was pregnant, so i can imagine she is evem nicer when her harmones aint going crazy!!  i think her name was yesenia.  not 100 percent certain, but she is the manager.
my boyfriend's haircut came out look more uneven than when he went in....hair around the neck area was left untouched and not trimmed...not coming back.

came here today because it was closer to me than my usual marsh and forest spot (love those ladies!) the store was empty but the two ladies made me wait twenty minutes until they were done curling eachothers hair. worst customer service .

i got my hair cut here three times. it wasn't horrible as i am pretty specific with what i want and most of it is just guard work. the staff is always really nice though. it's usually pretty empty here not too much of a wait but they don't seem to be able to keep employees here not sure why.cheap. quick. decent hair cuts. what more can you ask for from a super cuts. i will probably be back.

yeah you don't get the luxury of a high end salon but if you want a quick cut, in and out sort of deal, this is it.  no product up sells, no frills, just a plain old haircut.  the girl i end up going to is super friendly and easy to talk to.  she gives down to earth suggestions on hair care instead of pushing products on me, and she cuts my hair so well.  i know it's just a trim but i'm no stranger to crooked hair cuts.  plus it's so cheap i just can't resist.  i know these establishments are just considered a "chop house", but if you're not into paying $80 for a cut, this is a steal.

as far as hair cuts go this place rocks!now i am not particular at all about my hair, (like seriously not at all)so when i go in i tell them "just clean it up", or "a little off the top"; i know sometimes i am going to leave with a "high & tight" and sometimes a nice cleaned up look. that being said , after coming here for ten years! i love this shop, they are fast and they listen and they always make sure i look professional when i am on the way out! great staff and and super cuts!keep it up, see yal next time

to the little young lady who runs the register. please chew your food before you come out from the back to speak to me. that was so gross. also i could not understand one word that the asian lady said who cut my hair.
did exactly what i wanted in a timely manner! great job lindsay! thank you so much i'll be back!

can get a pretty good haircut here for not too much money.  you get in and out pretty quick and good thing is not lot of picky women in here with lot of hair and lot of demands from the stylists. mostly guys go here and just want a good quick haircut without a lot of fussing.... the prices reflect that.

the wait was non-existence and my stylist was nice and professional.  it did not take her long to cut my hair so i was pretty much in and out.  she did miss a few spots though thus explains the 4 out of 5 stars.  i will return as they are close by and i rather not pay 20 + just to shave my head...
just when you find someone you like they quit. never a line though and the receptionist is nice.

that transformation though!! lol finally got my unruly long hair chopped off and i couldn't be happier with the result! trista is amazing at what she does and the place was super nice and clean! i usually hate going to salons because i get very socially anxious, but i didn't feel that way at all here! everyone was so professional and i knew i'd be in good hands with trista, so i felt very comfortable. 10 out of 10 would recommend!
showed up during open hours, door locked. stylist inside on phone, with a person on their chair. didn't open door or even acknowledge i was there. no explanation.

i love this place. the customer service is amazing, the quality of cuts is the top, and the convenience of the mobile check in is super!i can't gush enough about the stylists either! they are so warm and friendly and i left with a beautiful cut and style! i will definitely be back!
love the stylists here. all very friendly. needed help with hair products and showed me exactly what i needed!

this is the first time i have ever come into an empty store for a haircut with my son and asked to come back in 2 hours. mind you the store was empty.  i said i was unable to and he asked me why not.  strangest experience!  the haircut itself was good and efficient.  we left and the store was still empty.  guess that should have been a clue that they have poor customer service and nobody wants to get a haircut here.

the haircut itself was completely fine, but there was only one worker when we came on a monday around 5 pm. she was cutting one persons hair, another was waiting for color to set, and she seemed frazzled that my husband and i came in since someone else had an appointment for 10-15 minutes from  then. she seemed nice, but we did feel slightly uncomfortable, almost like we were adding to her stress. about 10 minutes later a second worker appeared, and we were both done with the simple haircuts after 40-50 minutes, but it was just a slightly odd experience,

shea is a godsend. i can't say enough good things about him! i've had my hair cut at numerous upscale salons, and have never been as pleased with the outcome as i am when he does my hair. some how he manages feminine but edgy cuts on me everytime, and it's always something different. i won't go anywhere else. thanks shea!

i have just been to super cuts for blow outs recently and love them. they make me look great for a lower price than any dry bar. i have had my hair done by a few different people and they have all done a great job. i don't know what they do but my blowouts last for days when they do it. very much worth the money. i love the products they use- nothing too smelly or heavy. heads up- they have a lunch hour rush so plan accordingly. you can call ahead and get on the list.

they have barbers/stylists for 'ethnic' hair too.  all i wanted was a basic boot camp cut.  the young lady had me in and out in five minutes.  for some reason, even as a child, i have always disliked the barbershop experience, whereas i know others love it.  so this was perfect for me.  however, if you want to sit up and bs for hours, this probably isn't what you're looking for.
i moved to plano from florida and i am so happy that i found  a great salon. i love my stylist as he is patient and really listens every time as to how i want my hair done. great place.

i came in to see wayne for a blowout, and i had a wonderful experience! not only did he give me an awesome head massage at the bowl, but a voluminous blowout to go with :) he is very professional and personable! i highly recommend coming here and seeing him! ask for wayne!

this store used to be really great but has gone significantly downhill in the last year. i recently went in to get my eyebrows waxed. while the staff was generally friendly, the woman who did my eyebrows made them uneven and left many areas unwaxed/cleaned. i'm not sure if she realized it, but the wax she was using was not even heated, which is why it wasn't working very well. she claimed my eyebrows were like they came out to begin with but i've been getting them done for 12 years and have never once had this sort of problem. instead of not charging me because i calmly expressed that i was unhappy with the product, i was only given a 50 percent discount.

i had my hair cut here last week.  when i washed it i found one side was longer than the other.  i called and found out the schedule of the man that cut my hair.  i went back today and he said, "it's the same on both sides."  i asked the second employee who said, "maybe it's a little longer."  i left and on impulse went into a second supercuts on beltline and marsh.  kathryn heard my story, agreed one side was definitely longer and said, "sit down, i'll fix it."  she did a great job.  i will return to this salon in the future.  the attitude at preston and park was unfriendly - there was only one other male customer.  last time i go there.

it's really difficult to find hair salons that are affordable, with stylists who know what they're doing and actually listen to you. usually, i find you can expect to pay a ton of money for a really great cut, so this place was a pleasant surprise.i've been to several supercuts in the area and this location is by far the best. there was no wait at all. elizabeth cut my hair today and she was awesome. she listened to me when i told her the type of cut i wanted and she took her time to do the right job. she made sure she blew my hair out and didn't leave me with a bunch of wet hair all over my clothes. most places are so quick to get you in an out they don't bother with the extras. i'm extremely pleased with the cut i received here and will definitely go back again to maintain the style. a+++ all around!

i don't get my haircut nearly as regularly as a gal should, maybe. but recently, my hair decided it wanted to grow out just as terribly as possible.   i went ahead and downloaded the app in order to check in online ahead of time. i'm glad i did because it does seem to assist the staff versus calling ahead or walking in. the reason behind this is it sounds as though they are a bit short staffed right now. every time someone called in to inquire on wait times or to put their name down on the list, there was no receptionist to handle those calls. the stylists had to pause in the middle of their respective cuts multiple times due to high call volumes. i'm by no means upset, but just recommending for their sanity (and yours), i do think it's preferred to check in online. i did so maybe 30 minutes ahead of time and only had to wait about ten minutes or so. now - as for the actual 'do - i've gotta say, bless molly. the first (nice) lady who was going to cut my hair took one look and said molly would be better suited to handle my locks. ha! i didn't take offense as i knew it was a wreck, and i wanted someone who felt confident in getting it back into shape. molly took her time (but not excessively) in making sure everything got back to even and healthy and fabulous. she was a great conversationalist but didn't chat my ear off either. all in all, she was professional, kind, and knew exactly what she was doing. she may be my new girl going forward! i will be back.

new to the dallas area and didn't know it would be so hard to find a salon open on a monday! after making quite a few calls and no one picking up or most of them being by appointment only i found this place, decided to give it a try and sooo glad i did! aurora did an amazing job! i came in for a cut and style and she did awesome! she even recommended some awesome products to keep my blonde hair looking healthy! she took her time and really listened to what i wanted!! thank you again!

i'm here on business from pa. i desperately needed something done with my hair. i took the chance on going to this salon. gabby was my stylist and she was fantastic! she offered me a stack of magazines to occupy my time while she completely highlighted my hair. she was very professional, and when she was unsure if i needed toned or not she made sure to ask advice from another stylist. i greatly appreciate that! my hair turned out great! she even taught me a trick to curl my hair with my straightener! i would definitely return to her if i ever end up back in this area!
maria does a fantastic job.  i highly recommend this place, as the employees are friendly and professional!  a+++

never again! wanted to give 1 star but 2 stars for the history i have had with this place.i have been regular here since 2009 when i came to dallas.most of the girls are good but they keep changing.but my fav since i found out this place was mayra! she is the best! probably one of the best i have ever come across!  apparently she has become the store manager now!last couple of my visits has not gone well! her attitude has changed completely. not sure if its trump magic! lol.i am not white. south east asian (indian).1) last to last time i went with on call reservation, waited 20-30 min for my turn with her. when she got free she called someone else and left me out. when i asked her she said " oh i thought its the other sam, i need to go for lunch after this so come back after 1 hour! i thought..might be mistake. went to next available person and got my hair done.2) last time did a online appointment so that i select her name and there is no confusion. went there and checked, other girl confirmed i am next for mayra. waited 20 min. some guy walked in and checked in. 5 min later she got free, and called that guy ahead of me. i was stunned!..did not know how to react. thankfully the other girl realized what has happened and told her i have been waiting for her. the other guy was not even seated yet..he was just getting ready.her response: "well ..the system did not tell her i was waiting on her..if you can wait"i was like..#######!not sure if indian are not good at tips ..but i used to as i liked her work.anyways...i said thank-you and walked out! :-)will cut my hair myself with trimmer but ..never again here! :-)

i have a crazy anxiety about finding a new salon stylist for my haircuts. i trusted the smiling face (gabby) that greeted me when i nervously walked in. gabby gave the best haircut i've had literally in many years. took her time and made sure she was doing what i had asked. top notch stylist. i even asked when i left if she ever planning on leaving there because i'd finally found someone i'm comfortable with. she said she had no plans to leave. very happy i went to supercuts!

gabby can grab my curly hair and make it right! it's always nice knowing that you don't have to cringe around a pair of scissors about to attack the out of control hair on your head.  i'm always confident that she's going to tame my hair and make it look great!
cecilia and gabby were awesome the customer service was beyond satisfactory they girls were as nice as could be and i got exactly what i wanted done to my hair they've made a repeat customer outta me
cecilia and nancy are both awesome, i had my haircut with nancy today she is nice and did a great job. nice clean and friendly environment. would recommend this place to give it a try .

i've been going here for 7 or 8 years, and generally got a decent haircut. sometimes it has been good and a few times it was barely good but acceptable. one person did a good job always and i started going to her every time and was very happy. she left and i made a reservation with "next available". a couple times i came in for a cut and even with the appointment, the wait was longer than i could handle, and that was understood and ok. i came back another day. last time i had an appointment and walked in a few minutes before it. the stylist was telling a lady that there was one person ahead of her as i walked in, and she asked if i called ahead and i said i did and gave her my name. the other lady had taken a seat to wait. the stylist then walked over to her and said she was ready for her, to which the lady was surprised as she had just been told of a short wait. then she told me it would be about 20 minutes. so i didn't have 20 minutes to wait to get started and i left and won't be back. i'm polite, friendly, and i tip well (usually $5 on a $17 cut), but i'm done with this place.
i told her to give me the ronaldo #5starservice thanks cici! she took her time and did it right, all smiles at supercuts!

just got a cut here . larissa cut my hair, and she nailed it!!! she is easy to talk to, listened to what i wanted, and delivered on a great hair cut, which everyone wants...the staff there is friendly, great, and welcoming. i haven't had a bad hair cut yet. finally found a place that is worth going to over and over again!

not even 1 star. i waited for more than 45 mins even after checking in online. they do not even bother to check appointments in system and give preference to their existing customers. same happened with another lady who was sitting there for 1 hour and she left without haircut. they may be good if you are existing customer but not for new customers. it was my first and last time.
top hairstylist is mayra. totally recommend her. if she is not available you can ask for miriam or vanessa.

what i like about this place is that the location is great and the staff is too. its a very busy location, so their will be a wait. which is okay if you have the time, cause there is a starbucks close by so you can grab yourself a nice cold ice macchiato to ease the wait pain. there is one stylist that i have learn to love, larissia. she does an amazing job every time, i have yet to be dissatisfied. with her clippers at hand and a fierce attitude, shes always cuts my hair with a twinkle in her eye and makes sure my hair is exactly what i asked for. ill be coming back, thanks!!
maribel was great. she has been cutting hair for 12+ yrs and did awesome with clippers and scissors. i will be coming back to have her cut my hair again.

first time at supercuts and it was great.  i had no wait time and the stylist was great for being very new. i advised stacey to please take her time and not to feel rushed in anyway.  she showed great confidence in her cutting and will improve with tenure.  i advised her that i will be back as she did well.  great hire supercuts!!
nancy was awesome and gave wonderful hair cut along with a very relaxing head massage. highly recommended!! go for her !!

i checked in & waited 30 minutes & i noticed         people just walking in & being taken in ahead of me pretty lousy place to be ati am not coming to this place ever & will talk to several of my friends & family about my experience

marlon did an outstanding job on my hair, which is a big compliment taking into consideration my hair is awful! marlon is a very pleasant and talented  young man! finally found my favorite hair technician.  thanks marlon!!!ted

simply awesome.   very clean salon, friendly and helpful staff, on time appointments and abdel is just outstanding.  i met him at the smu location and have been following him since!! kudos supercuts !!

i had a great experience getting my haircut here.. i asked for long layers & face framing layers as well as about 4 inches off my very long hair.. karina did a fantastic job & i'm being pleased with outcome! she listened to exactly what i wanted & also gave me great advice when i asked her about the hairstyle i wanted.. she was very friendly & made me feel at ease.. also i came in during the last hour they were open & never did i feel rushed or my haircut feel rushed..i highly recommend this location..
finally found a great place to get my hair done!! thank you beverly, you made my day!

this is my second supercuts experience and first at this location. wow! this location is nicely decorated inside (modern feel) and natalie was awesome. at 11am on a weekday there were a few people already waiting for a cut so i am very thankful for the online check-in.  i see why this place is so popular and plan on returning!

tl;dr version;great place. def worth more than the $16 spent. long version;although supercuts has a reputation for being a cheap place, this location is great. the stylists are super friendly & talented. i hadn't had a haircut i liked in years until i came here. 100% more than worth it.

i've been going to this location for several years now. the staff is always friendly and the space is always clean and well maintained. several stylists have cut my hair, and each time i've been pleased with the results. abdel has cut my hair the last 6 or 7 times. he has many years of experience in the business and it shows. no worries when i use him -   just sit back, relax, and let him do his magic.
i travel extensively hard to find people who can keep my young guy haircut intact on this old guy. glad i stopped in here .. erin was very cool.. perfect in fact!! definite recommend..

great experience.. i always concern about the waiting time when i go get a hair cut.. i recently moved to dallas area and googled saloons around me.. beside that the store was clean and shiny, smells good, nice music,have magazines and sport channel on... the receptionist told me that estimated waiting time will be around 20 mins and i literally waited for 20 mins then abdel took care of me.. i enjoyed the conversation with him and was the best hair cut i ever had for 16 dollars only!!! second time i went there.. i requested abdel again and had the same experience... thank you super cuts for having such service for that price.. i would absolutely recommend any one looking for a good service with affordable price to try them out..

great place for a great price. natalie gave me a great haircut and was very nice. my hair is curly and not easy to handle but i love what she did. i showed her a picture and she did her magic. i will definitely be going back.

this place is phenomenal! home away from home 100%! my husband and i absolutely refuse to take our hair business anywhere else! the stylist are extremely upbeat with warm and welcoming professionalism. all though they do perfect with making sure you end up with exactly the hair style you envisioned, if not better, it is definitely the staff that make this location so top notch. abdel particularly has been taking care of us for the past year now and we keep forgetting just that...only 1 year...i swear it feels like he has been a close friend of ours for decades! that's how comfortable he makes you feel as soon as you walk through the door! i never have to tell him how i want my cut and he never has to ask me. i love it! he cuts our hair exactly the way we want it and provides top notch hospitality at the same time! he creates a close relationship with from what i have noticed all of his clientele in turn treating us all like family instead of just paying customers! i have no idea how we would make it if it were not for abdel and his expert skills of hair styling and customer service. thank you so much abdel and the rest of the staff at this location for making us feel like nothing less than vip with every visit! thank you abdel!

tl;dr - go to abdel and everything will be fine!this supercuts is great. the manager, abdel adawi, has been cutting my hair for over 10 years now. he has a dedicated following of customers, some of whom have been going to see him longer than me. i've seen him with plenty of loyal female customers, but he has even more male customers who have followed him religiously from his previous supercuts location on hillcrest by smu, and who will wait patiently for an hour for him even though other stylists are open & available. i'm sure the other stylists are great, they are always friendly, the store is always clean & comfortable, but at the end of the day i'm there for abdel - all around great guy, very professional, and always gets my hair right every time!pro tip: call ahead, because abdel almost always has a waiting list!

hit or miss. prepared to be lied to your face about the wait time. i called in thinking someone would be available upon arrival. so i get there and there is a 10 minute wait time.  so i say ok that's not too bad. i wait for 30 minutes while the employees are getting coffee and taking their sweet time. they than ask me are you waiting for someone? how can you not be pissed at that.

this supercuts location is a great place to get your haircut with professional services with lower prices. (i love a good deal.) i request abdel to cut my hair because he takes his time, puts effort into styling it and always asks to make sure i am completely satisfied with my cut and style. he is very professional, friendly, and most of all, does a great job cutting hair. even when abdel isn't available, the other stylists do a great job styling my hair. they are always friendly, honest, and thorough in cutting and styling hair. i have yet to walk away from the place with any kind of regrets. i highly recommend this place. hope this helps!

it's not often one finds excellent work along with excellent service but the staff at supercuts (preston and beltline) managed to do it. i couldn't not be happier with the way they cut my hair and the staff is always friendly, always providing service with a smile on their face. thank you supercuts.joe munoz

i've been going to see yessica at this location for over a year. her work is fantastic. all of the people i've interacted with at this store have been incredibly professional and helpful. i think everyone there is genuinely happy, which makes all the difference. they work well as a team and the store is clean and tidy. because they are so well run and the stylists are good, the traffic here is pretty high, so don't be disappointed if you have to wait 15 or 30 minutes.
jordan was amazing! fast and friendly. clean facility. would totally go back to her and this location!

great place! friendly people, i liked the men treatment very much the girl took her time and massage my head for at least 15 min i will defiantly come again oh and i only paid $20 included tipi feel i am lucky i found this place
i luv yessica my little stylist xoxo

i'm not sure why this place is rated this low. other than maybe rival businesses playing games. i've always been treated quite well and have been more than satisfied with my haircut. everytime. especially for the price you pay! would give ten stars
ash is great! fun personality and i love my haircut! the shop is clean and everyone is friendly. fast wait times, i happened to come in during a busy time and still didn't wait long.

would definitely give this place 0 stars if i could. sure, i don't have a go to salon and usually just go the place that's convenient but never in my 26 years of living have i ever gotten a cut so bad. decided to try this place out because it close by and my father recommended it.i usually do a comb-over with faded sides. i go in telling the hair stylist what i tell everyone. a 1 on the sides faded / trim the top, i do a comb-over. guy says "okay gotcha!"i trustfully take off my glasses and go blind for the next 15 minutes.- he starts fading the sides without clipping the top up. that's fine, maybe a different technique. but then i start feeling him going at it near the top of my head, left side (i don't feel the same thing happening on my right side). note, during this time he is very talkative and jolly.- proceeds to start cutting the top of my hair. at this point i see an outline of my bangs and it is definitely missing a chunk on my left side.- he then goes quiet as he starts working frantically on my left side. almost as if he did something wrong.- puts on glasses and what do i see? he cut off at least 5 inches of the 6 inches i had. i have about 1 inch of hair. i have one hair style and that is spiky. i can't comb over. there's no part. the fade line is slanted. oh and there's hair missing on my left side. everything is lopsided. all in all. 0/5 would not go back.

i had the worst hair cut i've ever gotten at this facility. i wasn't going to write a review because these things happen and it's just part of life. but just a moment ago my wife looks at the back of my head and says "your hair line on your neck is crooked" looked in the mirror and sure enough was, that was the last straw. the lady cutting my hair seemed like she a super basic knowledge and didn't care one bit. wish i could get my money back, not worth the frustration.

i love this place. the customer service is amazing, the quality of cuts is the top, and the convenience of the mobile check in is super!i can't gush enough about the stylists either! they are so warm and friendly and sooooo sweet! i left with a beautiful cut! i will definitely be back! thanks for taking care of my curls!
i love this location! everyone greated me as soon as i came in and i got exactly what i asked for.

went there to get shampoo and blow dry plus trim. an indian lady asked me how i would like my hair blow dryed? im confused....how many ways are there to blow dry hair. there was an asian lady standing next to her who was no help. had to leave and try to find another place.
ashley gave me and my daughter great hair cuts.  will be going back.

extremely unprofessional staff. they never greet the client. staff has often been rude in the past. not sure why. staff fight for clients, in front of the clients. i am a professional as well, and would never do that to my clients. extremely disappointed. won't visit again.

went in for a trim.  told sima multiple times just a trim do not want short!  she does not listen and cuts it short.   by the tim she has taken the first snip it is to late for us to fix we have to go with the short.  if you go there do not use sima.  we will never go there again.

a head-turning haircut with on-line check-in? is this affiliated with the tony cvs health brand.why this supercuts is a winner:nothing can make a meh day into i have arrived day faster than a great haircut at a fair and reasonable price. remember to tip generously!the stylist are intuitive and do not require a lot of coaching. you will look twenty years younger in minutes.sparkling clean surfaces and floors with no antiseptic smells.it does not rely on cheap gimmicks to get customers in the door. dallas and collin county citizens have high standards and they are delivered on here. flying someone soon? get a haircut here and the flight crew will bump you into first class because you look dallas.ethic hair invites what we all know - more options for a saucy and sexy new look.all age groups including those memory challenged are welcomed and treated with respect and honor here. not to mention a flattering or updated haircut.comfortable waiting areas with new magazines!great air conditioning and abundant parking!saturday and sunday hours respect your busy work week.the general vibe is comfort meets style meets skilled staff!

cut my hair way shorter then what i asked for. guys beware. i repeatedly said about 5 times to leave it long on top, but in the end everything was short and way out of style. that's why i cut my own hair for 5+ years. i never trusted anyone to do it right but i gave in this time and i sorely regret it. also, i was sat in a previous client's chair without any sort of cleaning of the chair or floor around it. yuck! besides that, the actual haircut was what i disliked. $20 for a bad haircut is a little too pricey.
first time going to supercuts. on-line check-in was easy. got an excellent haircut from rodney.
second time i called for appt second time i was told 20 minutes, second time i waited over an hour and still no haircut. awful
came into town for a business trip and i needed a trim to be presentable the next day.  rodney was incredibly professional and sharp with his scissors.  thank you for the great haircut.
lisa & rodney are by far the best two people there!
excellent hair cut!  great conversation!! reasonable prices!!!

if your wanting great service, ask for rodney!  always offers a smile and great conversation.  and once he starts with your cut, you're done in no time.  he has cut my hair for two yrs now.  my wife went to try him out and he now cuts her hair regularly.  incredible guy.  ask for him, you won't regret it!

took guy and jason's advice and went to see rodney for a haircut.  they were right, rodney is great!!!  my hair hasn't looked this good in a very long time.   he listened to what i wanted and cut it perfectly.  thanks rodney!!!

i went in with long hair to get a short cut. i took photos and told them how 2 years ago i'd paid $75 for the awfulest haircut i've ever had. i left super cuts with the second "awfulest". i took photos that should have made it easy to imitate the cut i wanted.  jenny told me she could do that cut.  i am blind without my glasses, as in i see a blob in the mirror that might be me or might be a tree.  when  i expressed trepidation about the cut after she'd finished and i put on my glasses, jenny told me, "that style too young (pointing to my phone with  the photo of the haircut i wanted) - you need more ....mature". i paid and left.  i was too upset to speak. i was afraid i'd cry if i spoke.  stupid me was so stunned i even left a tip. do not ever ever use a stylist who with thinks they know better and cuts what they want without telling you first. jenny was that butcher. my hair today, the next morning, has chunks in it that look as if she cut it with a dull sheep shears. i will not go back to get it fixed because its already shorter than i asked for. any shorter and it will be a mans' cut. so i'm back to crappy hair until this mess grows out enough to try again to find a decent stylist.  i'm sick of bad hair and sick of egotistical professionals.

based on the actual hair cuts we received i would rate this place a 5 star.   i can't give it that rating because of how dirty the store was.  they actually sat my son in a chair that still had hair from their previous client all over the it and the floor.  considering that this is a major violation and extremely unsanitary, i will never go back!

when my roommate said he needed a haircut, i didn't think twice about recommending this place.  when he looked it up online, he expressed concerns about going here, as the reviews for this establishment were very poor.  i was very surprised to hear this, so i decided to write my own review.i've been frequenting this establishment for over a year now and have had nothing but good experiences here.  mayra is my favorite hairdresser, but all of the ladies i've seen here are very competent.  every time i've been here, i've been greeted when i entered the store, all of the ladies are very polite and have a professional demeanor.  i normally go on sundays, first thing in the morning, so the wait time has been minimal.  my normal routine is to get my hair washed, conditioned, cut, blow dried, and flat ironed.  this runs about $25.  i find this a reasonable price to pay to walk out of there with great looking hair.the store is clean, friendly atmosphere.  if you are looking for a place to offer you wine and rub your feet while you wait, this is not the place for you.  if you want a great haircut for a reasonable price, ask for mayra.  you can thank me later.

busy place with only 1 barber. web check in is a good idea. staff always look frustrated and in rush to serve everyone. will get a good haircut if the barber is in good mood. not my preferred place if i need to be get ready for some important appointment or anniversary
love this salon! the stylists are so upbeat and always know how to take good care of my hair! they are definitely hair doctors that know their products! best hair cut and will always return!
had a good experience. my hair was tended by jasmine and she cut my hair exactly the way i wanted it to be cut.

terrible experience.  unprofessional personnel, old dirty appearance, unsanitary people and equipment.  i'm a guy w the easiest haircut in world. somehow this girl screwed it up. haven't had a haircut this bad in 10 years. she was eating when i came in and screamed from the back of the empty store she was coming. took about 10 minutes to get to me. didn't see her wash her hands. she used clippers that actually pulled my hair when she started using them. after my reaction she changed the head saying the earlier customer complained but she thought it was just him. she trimmed high over my ears. looks terrible.

well, i was contacted by someone from supercuts after my previous review. i was asked for my home address so that i could be refunded for my haircut. it has been well over a month (my hair finally grew back) and i have not received any refund. i'm not surprised at all. if you need a inexpensive haircut close by, go to nidia at great clips in irving. she made me presentable after i was butchered at supercuts.
wow. i went in for a haircut. there was 1 other man waiting for his. the lady said i needed an appointment because there was a 4 hour wait! there was 1 person in the whole place!  0 stars!

had haircut before and it was okay so i tried again and they do unfinished hair cut, right and left side cut looks different, new hair artist most times i guess that's how corporate hair salon works. wouldn't recommend.

you can't beat a good haircut at their price.i've been going here for years, and with the exception of one lady, all of the stylists are fantastic.be sure to put their number in your cell phone so you can call ahead and get on the list in the event there's a wait!
just stopped in for hair gel waited 20 minutes. employees have no idea what they are talking about or doing. go to floyds!

i've been to this location before and the haircut it's been ok but this last time i left in complete disbelieve! how can a hairstylist that basically just came out of school (july 2015) cannot cut straight lines. hairstylist contreras may seem shy and soft spoken but seriously the job you did on my trim on the back is awful. the sides instead of going down straight are v-shaped with an abnormally high squared back. please avoid this location or getting your haircut by ms. contreras! totally disappointed

i started a new job recently and i am in a part of town that i am not yet familiar with.  and to be honest, there's not much around here to choose from.  i've been so busy, and in desperate need of a wig-splitin', that i figured i would knock out a haircut on my lunch break.  the partial disclaimer is that i am used to a mid-higher end barber shop/hair styling facility...but i don't think my standards are too high for some supercuts.  i walk in at 1:30 pm and i am the only customer.  the person who would be soon cutting my hair, turns around from a chair in the very back of the shop, cell phone in hand, and says "umm hello? you getting a haircut?" there was no wait of course.  i was escorted to a chair where even in the awkward semi-silence, i had to ask how they were doing, hows your day going etc.  c'mon customer service 101.  i tell the "stylist" how i would like my hair cut and the response was a "gross face" followed by "wow, okay do you always do it like that?!"  yes.  the paying customer currently in your chair is saying yes.  they start the process and begin complaining about how dead the shop has been.  how they have been the only one working today and i was the 2nd haircut they have done.  fast-forwarding.  the work was halfway done, zero desire to give me the style i was looking for, and when i began asking for adjustments, the attitude was back.  long story short, its not a terrible haircut, but it's not 100% what i asked for, and i wasn't pleased.  the persons attitude was my main issue, like i was putting them out to do their job...that they spent the majority of the time complaining about.  if you are in an absolute pinch, and don't mind not getting exactly what you want (if you don't care - hair is hair) then rock on.  i just won't be coming back.  the haircut will cost you $12 but the attitude from the staff is free.

took my son here today.  there were 3 ladies working and they all had a scowl on their face and were very unhappy and unfriendly.  when we walked in, we were not even greeted -- one stylist just sighed and asked if we had an appointment.  i told her we didn't, and asked how long of a wait.  she said 15-20 minutes.  well, the appointments started coming in, and we were pushed back over and over.  i get it, they had appointments - i even asked if i should leave and come back - over an hour later, we finally had my son in the stylist's chair.  she did not cut his hair the way i explained and even showed her.  there is no way i'll ever go back.

although some of the staff were friendly it was a saturday afternoon and they were under staffed. the manager was obviously feeling the stress due to her attitude. absolutely no skill by the stylists when all we wanted was a simple wash and blow dry. doesn't even deserve a 1 star, bad tools and techniques, wasted money
the worst haircut ever. very uneven. not even sure how these people got hired!! never go!
average prices ($13 for a basic "supercut"), but mine was done just the way i like it. staff was fairly friendly as well, plus i walked in and there wasn't much of a wait.

without a doubt the worst haircut i have ever gotten. i went in for a simple "buzz" cut. five on top, and a one on the sides.... how on earth can you mess up a haircut like that? one side of my head was longer than the top, and the other side was almost bald. she tried to tell me that gel would fix it. wtf? and if the haircut wasn't bad enough, this lady kept asking me to take her 300 lbs friend on a date, the whole ordeal was extremely uncomfortable. do not go to this place.

what a dump!!! never seen a supercuts in such a nice neighborhood this filthy and run down?!?! staff was lazier and dumber than the toothless wonders who clean horse shit out of barnyards. 2 stars for cutting swiftly on my infant baby's first haircut. minus 2 stars for butchering his bangs worse than an 80's bowl cut.

nightmare! the black girl doesn't know how to cut hair! if she were working at a black shop she would get booted out immediately. she cant cut! took a big chunk of my hair like she were practicing on raggedy ann!! supercuts you want to hire "experienced" stylists!!!!!!!!!!! not anyone from the street. you wont be getting my business ever again!
misty did a great job cutting my hair. she took a few minutes extra to make sure it was perfect. thanks, misty, i'll be back.

place is a joke when it comes to management and customer service.  will never come back here and would highly discourage others with so many other options in the area.apparently the manager left the floor with three customers waiting to discuss some training with another employee. will never come back here and would highly discourage others with so many other options in the area.

i feel like i should make two reviews. one has a 2 star because i went in wanting no more than 2 inches off my hair and left with my hair completely uneven and cut about 4 inches off. i got home and thought to myself, well it's just hair and maybe i can go back and have someone fix it... i would give amanda 5 stars!!! i'm so glad i went back! thank you amanda for fixing my hair! i truly appreciate that you took the time to fix my hair and make sure that it was done properly. i really appreciate it.  if you go in to get a trim, be sure to only go to amanda! she is so sweet and really knows how to take her time. thank you again amanda!
they are all very friendly and the service is great. cookie does a great job of cutting my hair every time.
came and saw josie spencer to cut my sons hair and she did an amazing job! super friendly, funny and kept us laughing!

unfortunately, i did not have a good experience in the way of my hair cut, for starter's i asked her to cut 1 inch only and she cut like 4 inches off my hair if not more.  the cut was not what i expected for a layered look and she did not want to do anything further of the services i asked stating to save myself the money that it would be too expensive for me. and this was on week day where it's not that busy at all with nobody waiting for her. so, as for my hair i am totally dissatisfied with it but my husband did have a good experience with her and his cut look's great! but this review is based on my experience but i still wanted to balance it out a bit stating his experience. i would say for a man's cut she's great but possibly not for a women's hair cut "again" based on my experience. maybe other people have had good experiences but i sure didn't. now, there is a lady that work's there that goes by the name of cookie that does a great job on my husband and has on me in the past. i was just determining my decision to go with this other lady by my husband's hair cut, which was great and her availability at the time i walked in. i would say if you're a man definitely go with this lady and if you're not go with cookie or go somewhere else. i was very dissatisfied with my experience this go around. i will never cut my hair with anyone but cookie there.
