firstly i worked for supercuts for 25 years as a manager and educator , my daughter lives in westwood and needed her haircut , since i live in another city with  no equipment with me , i called ahead for a wash, cut and blow dry , it was clear the stylist did not want to do any blow drying today since she quoted me 35 additional dollars for a total of 61 dollars for my daughters shoulder length layers . 21 for the cut , 5 for the shampoo , and 35 for a simple blow dry ?, right...pure laziness . all those years i served my clients fairly with a smile and without complaint and to get this, truly infuriated me . so we walk out with wet hair when all we wanted was a simple blow dry not a extravagant updo , because there's no way i'm going to have someone with a bad work ethic rip me off .

i will not return to this location nor have gina a short mexican woman touch my head again. she did not listen to the instructions given to her, had to be told to cut around the ears, but did not trim the eye brows, plus did not comb my hair. charged me $21.00 then had the nerve to ask for a tip. i believe this woman belittled me with her colleagues  behind my back after i left the location. i recommend not to attend this location unless you have a established hair coiffure.

worst experience i have ever had at a supercuts with staff and professionalism and cut!!! i will never take my boys there again. both stylist were complaining about my boys hair to me . although one did a decent job cutting my son's hair gina was complaining about me in front of me in spanish to the other stylist not knowing that i understood every word! she didn't want to cut my son's hair and tried her best to mess it up! and at the end when i tipped both stylist although i was not happy with my experience and hair cut the lady who rang me up complaint about the 15% tip i left each!

waited for 2 hours even though they said the wait was only 15 mins. shame on you! when it finally came time for the haircut, it was shockingly mediocre, yet not at all cheap. terrible place. would not recommend at all.

first, get more than 3 dang parking spaces. second, lovely customer service from 3 younger short ladies. smiles and said hello when i walked in. it's all downhill from there folks, some lady who honestly was probably drunk, came straight to me for a haircut, skipping the little 16 year old who had been there before i (i came to find out). then she cut my hair trying to be as fast as lightning. i'm guessing she was off at 4:30 or something. she then scraped the back of my neck with the same buzzer she cut my hair with. i'm pretty sure you have trimmer you could've used. as my neck sits here and burns from the crappy cut i received. also, the line up is crooked anyway. rrrrghh, why did i leave a tip..

i loved this place. i didn't make an appointment, i just walked in, and i didn't wait very long (i got lucky). blanca trimmed my hair. i was so desperate for a cut. she fixed my hair right up! i love how much volume it has now. thank you so much! i will definitely return for my next cut! highly recommend this location!

good luck to anyone trying to get good service here! worst customer service i have experienced in a long time... and to top it off it's happened a few times (should've written this review a while ago, but have tried to give them the benefit of the doubt). good luck trying to call ahead and get an accurate account of how long it will take. sadly a few of the stylist do a great job of cutting mens hair but the device in trying to get to a chair is horrible!! tonight i tried to walk in and was happy to see at least two stylist i am familiar with... was told i could write my name down and it would be 45 min. so i go run errands and come back to have to wait again. *also one time a lady was either so incompetent or rude that she tried to give me a mo-hawk and when i tried to get her to fix it, she handed the machine and scissors to another stylist. they couldn't even really look me in the eye as i asked how long it would take. hate to be impatient but this has happened before when i need to catch a flight out of town and this was the last straw... my kids hadn't eaten dinner and although i really needed a haircut, i can't stand when people can't be curtiss enough to keep an "appointment".

i called to make an appointment for my son. i was informed that they do not take appointments, just walk-ins. so i just took my son in after school... there's an hour wait. then she asks, "do you want me to put you down for that time?"what?? "i thought you don't take appointments," i said. "well, we take call aheads," she said. "and why didn't they tell me that when i called to try scheduling an appointment?" i asked. "i don't know."ugh.

horrible service celia is a horrible rude stylist if you can call her that , she has no manner she is rude to her customers especially if young , my son went in to get a cut he asked for a 2 then decided for a one she right away said w an attitude an intimidating tone " you asked for a 2 " sideburns?????long or short ? he was like huh , she said these long or short w an intimidating tone  as well , i complained to clerk and she said yeah she is rude ..... i say management get her out if you don't want health dept there as well due to unsanitary issues that were noted $18 dollars down the trash and a 13 yr old who said yes she was rude but what could i do ... she's an adult? because mind you i have taught my child to respect his elders but this lady should be let go please contact me for more info management ilozano1616@icloud.com

i moved out to downtown la a few years now and it's hard finding a great hair stylist. i decided to give supercuts in downey a try because of the rave reviews. i went in yesterday morning and i'm glad i did! i happen to get my hair cut by the stylist blanca (whom i read the great reviews about prior before). not only is she great.. she's fast, very friendly, and i absolutely love the style of cut she gave me!!! :dnot only am i excited for my new cut.. i appreciate the friendly staff, the reasonable price and how well organize they are with their valued customers..thank you blanca!!! you're awesome! definitely will be seeing me again for a next cut :)continue.. i came by tuesday, but blanca wasn't there! i took a risk in having joanna cut my hair.. and i'm glad a did! love my cute asymmetrical short bob! not only did you bring bounce to my hair, but i no longer feel self conscious in leaving my hair down. thank you joanna.. you're awesome!!!!

parking is a major issue with this location, and not making appointments.  you can call 45 minutes before to be put on the list.  i always like the cut.  usually we have the same stylist. they take mastercard and visa, but not american express.

i will never go back to this place!!! i have never been humiliated in my life like i did !!!! i went yesterday because my 6 year old daughter needed a trim and i took my baby with me because i had called ahead of time and they told me they would have a stylist available as soon as i came in. while my daughter was getting her hair cut, my little one was walking around and i was supervising and making sure she didn't touch or get anything. the stylist joanna so rude told me to make sure the baby didn't touch the product, and really got upset because i was already watching her and shes just a baby. i felt shamed-mom, she yelled it out in front of everyone that was there. then another stylist opens the door knowing that i had my 1 year old and i asked her if we can close the door because didn't want her to run outside and get hit by a car. she told me she didn't care and that i should hold her. basically told me to tie her down like a animal. never again come back again!!!! i will be also contacting corporate office. what i don't understand why i was treat so poorly and still want my money !!!!  honestly i would want a refund!!

stylist are always a hit and miss and to top it off you always get someone new, for some reason they can hang on to employees here. the wait and the customer service are the worse!even if you call in ahead you are bound to wait at least 40min after your estimated wait time. i always try to give places a second,third chance and this specific time lace has always been bad! so i would suggest you try some where else to  have a better experience.

update: called back the next morning and the manager blanca offered to fix my hair. i hurried over before leaving town and she repaired the mess that was done to my hair. because of the other lady, it was straight on the right side, slanted in the back and two different lengths on the left. she mentioned the lady that cut my hair said i wanted a slanted cut. well, her employee *lied* to her cause i specifically told her i wanted a simple straight bob. even if i did want a slanted cut, in what world does that mean straight and slanted in 4 different lengths?! anyway, the manager was friendly and gave me the perfect cut even though she had to trim it shorter than i initially wanted it, but it was necessary to fix it. couldn't be mad at her, not her fault another employee rushed through my hair and didn't care enough to make sure it was even. while i'm glad she fixed it, i still won't be returning. which is a shame cause i used to get my hair done here all the time years ago when i worked nearby.added one star since the manager made things right. had some issues reserving my appointment time on the website. kept getting an error so i just walked in. they said my time did go through and i was next. i wanted my bob trimmed & re-shaved in the back. i believe it was the supervisor on duty that cut my hair. she asked if i wanted shampoo and condition, i said yes so the shaved bits would be shampooed away from my hair. she sprayed down my hair then cut it at the right length i wanted. she showed me the back to make sure it was short enough. during the shampoo she asked if i would like a blowdry & style, i said yes but she said she didn't have time cause she wanted to take another customer to do a hair cut on him. what?! why? i was there first. asked me to wait 20 min so she could cut his hair then finish mine! i didn't want to sit around w/ wet hair so i declined. came home to dry it myself and noticed the cut is so uneven! one part is almost an inch longer than the rest. see the photo. worst hair salon experience ever!incomplete hair cut and unprofessional attitude! i only came here cause my usual stylist was busy the next few weeks. never again! now i'm going to have to try and even out the cut myself, and it's already short eno

very disappointed i do not recommend this place. i came here looking to get a blunt over the shoulder haircut and i ended up with a mushroom bob. not only is it not what i asked for but it's also very uneven. now i have to wait until my hair grows out to recut it. i believe the lady that cut it was named ana but i have to double check. my hair is curly and i didn't notice how uneven it was until i got home to straighten it. now i'm stuck with a mushroom head. i rated 2 stars because she was friendly and minimal wait time but the cut she gave me is really bad. if you must go to this location i would suggest a different stylist for this type of cut. i am adding pics for reference.

i love this spot! i keep my hair super short with a tight fade and let me just say blanca can get that done in a quarter of the time it use to take my barber to do it. i always check in on-line cause it's easier to reserve your spot. with the reservation i may wait no more than 5 minuets once i arrive. keep in mind, this place is always busy, which speaks volumes at how good these girls are. in addition to the good service, it's always a good time chatting with these girls. they are all super cool and funny but most importantly efficient. i've now turned several friends (male & female) on to this spot. so far we've all been good. thanks again ladies and see you in a week!

i have been a customer for this location for years. they have great staff, clean salon, great customer service. i started using the online reservation which saves me time because they are a very busy store. defiantly try their tea tree experience. highly recommended. a++
this is a great place to get your hair cut.  the service and people are very nice.  blanca is awesome!
i love their service, i came in and blanca huke me up.. i came out looking very pretty. thank you so much. she's the best. come to super cuts you wont regret it. money worth spend! thank u

extremely rude, uneducated so called stylist. joanna rodriguez has the worst attitude. she acts like she is doing you a favor by cutting you hair. someone should really pay more attention on how customers get treated at this super cuts location. i did not even get the haircut i wanted because of how uncomfortable she made me feel. i just wanted her to get her hands off my hair already. i strongly suggest you to go to the one on lakewood.

these girls are amazing! each & everyone of them. they are dedicated to their customers and service. super helpful. they listen to the customers needs. i have to admit my first initial visit was rough but for some reason these girls are awesome and aren't the same. totally personable. yes the wait is long, but that's expected. why rush especially on a hair cut? please don't rush on me. i will be back :)

i used to go here a little, but that's until the last woman who cut my hair about 8mos ago, left a huge long piece of hair without cutting it. i didn't even notice til i got out the shower and combed my hair out. how the heck can you possibly miss that? never going back. plus, they take forever, and that's probably because they are too busy talking and not cutting hair. no thanks.

let me preface this by saying that i have been getting my hair professionally highlighted and colored since i was a preteen and am now 29.  also, please note the pictures i have included. i wish i could include the sinking feeling i have walking in public but my lengthy review will have to do. i am naturally blonde but have enjoyed keeping my hair super light with some slightly darker (medium brown) undertones... or as i was informed by one of the stylists are "low lights." well, i showed them 4 pictures of extremely blonde hair as the reference for how light i wanted my hair and one photo with the blonde & slightly contrasted shades alongside the blonde. long story short, my hair turned out way darker than when i walked in. it is currently a light brown from the light blonde that i was. i was charged $220+tip for a bunch of stuff i didn't agree to (deep treatments and 2 other things that were never explained to me). i was so upset that i couldn't formulate my questions right and every single girl who worked there made me feel worse by saying that it was my fault for getting low lights, that that is the reason my hair is now brown. no one had a consultation with me. no one showed me a sample of what colors they would be using. no one told me prices and when i asked, the response was "we'll have to see..." they made me feel so bad for coming in at 3:45p on a saturday, too.   (i left at about 7:15) i felt unbelievably uncomfortable because they made t known that they were so busy and that their manager who scheduled my appointment messed up by saying okay to me. two girls worked on my hair but neither of them told me what they were going to do. then every single girl was rude, defensive, and accusatory towards me about how dark my hair turned out. i feel so gross about how my hair looks (even though they kept saying "it's beautiful! it's beautiful")... i can't come back to have it "fixed" because i will be undergoing a surgery and out of commission for 3 weeks (which is after the amount of time that they will fix it)... and they won't refund me for the insane amount of "extras" that they added to my bill without my knowledge. i wouldn't have agreed to paying it in the beginning if i wasn't told that the manager could probably refund a portion of the bill and if it wasn't past closing when i left (i was so disappointed and shooken up that i couldn't even argue the price with them.). just be extreeeemely careful if you have naturally light hair and want highlights.  i can't get over how poorly these people treated me. from beginning to end i felt uncomfortable then disappointed and now like someone stole from me. i usually spend my money on high end salons like luigi bruni in michigan and charles ifergan salon in chicago but this is my mistake for trusting a low grade hair place like supercuts.  and when i mentioned what my cousin (miriah from charles ifergan salon) said about this places process, the rude manager, blanca, shut me down and said that everyone does hair differently so her opinion doesn't matter. well, hers does considering she's a upstanding colorist that makes supercuts look like the lowest grade hair establishment. don't go here.if they make a mistake you will have to pay... quite literally... and you will pay the price of an actual upscale salon that makes you feel good about yourself... now embarrassed.
got my hair cut and colored and blanca did an awesome job and color came out perfect!!  the store is clean and all the staff is very friendly totally recommend!
every time i walk out of this store my hair is healthy and beautiful. blanca's been doing my hair the last couples times and she's a great. amazing colorist! very nice and professional :)

i didn't have time to go to my person for a haircut so i went to supercuts by my work.  ana cut my hair and she did a great job!  the only downside is that they are very busy and only two stylist were there and they have to stop what they are doing to either answer a call or speak to a walk-in.  supercuts, you need an receptionist for your stylist but overall, ana is the person to go to for a great haircut.  gina jackson

i walked in yesterday 15 minutes before closing and i was told that i was going to be serviced. the 2 stylist finished with their customers at the same time. neither one wanted to approach me or acknowledge me. i stood up and walked towards them. i said i'll just come back tomorrow since you're closing. neither one said sorry or thank you. i've been there before business hours and let's just say that they've opened late before. if you're gonna open your business late, do you think it's a good idea not wanting to provide services to late walk ins. the only bad outcome for me leaving this location is that i won't be helped by ana. ana gives the best haircuts. shame!

just got the worst hair cut off my life. they forgot to fade half the side of my head, so it looks like i'm wearing a hat. had to pay $50 so someone can come to my house at 9pm to fix this, because i can't got into the office like this. likely going to appeal on credit card, this is ridiculous.

1st time having my twins get their hair cut @ a super cuts because it's difficult apparently to just trim ends when their hair is down to their waist ... but not for ana ... she did an amazing job and didn't rush . she was very pleasant and my twinkies loved her as well . we will definitely be back because of her great customer service and professionalism .  thanks for the great experience ana !
yea it's nice with the app and all, but if i'm going to pay almost $30 for a haircut i'd expect them to at least have a 7"

went in today with my boyfriend, he got his haircut by philip. when asked to cut the top a little shorter, he immediately corrected my boyfriend. he was very rude, normally the staff is very welcoming and super nice. avoid philip at all costs.

the young lady with short hair who cut my hair was very nice and outgoing but the she did a terrible job cutting my hair. 7 people now have made fun of my haircut, heck even my 10 year old son made fun of my crappy haircut. the cut is so bad that i considered buzzing my hair. i will never cut my hair at supercuts and i'm disappointed that a place this "reputable" has such crappy "hair stylists"

ok so i've had some bad experiences at this location (ridiculous wait times due to under staffing) but today was literally the last draw. called at 10:30 and made an appointment for 11:30 and i arrive 5 minutes before the appointment time. at 11:50 they call my name but i'm wrapping up a work call so i tell them i need 1-2 minutes but i'll be right in and i'm told sorry they have to move onto the next person (a walk in who had been waiting less than 10 minutes). so apparently it's ok to keep a customer waiting for 20 minutes but the stylists waiting 1-2 minutes is too much of an inconvenience. i will never come back to this location....

five stars for phillip who not only gave me one of the best haircuts i've had in a long time but also gave me some great tips for making my thin limp hair appear fuller. i even bought a product at his recommendation (a root lifter) which i never do and so far i love it!

don't understand the concept of appointments... i called m made an appointment in advance and was given one for 3:20pm, get there at 3:10. my stylist was still finishing up with someone so i waited. he then calls the person who walked in after me. so i asked them if it was gonna be a while, i was told i had to check-in once i got to the salon, so i checked in and was told i'll be next. but a guy who just walked in with no appointment was attended to at 4:15 , while i have been waiting for almost an hour. trust me as a small business owner i'm the last person to leave a feedback like this, but i don't appreciate a business who don't value their customers time. i won't be coming back here again nor would i recommend anyone to go there....

elle (or el) probably is the worst stylist i've ever met. she seemed like she just had drugs or something, very frustrated by the hair on the ground, she kept complaining and using a blowdryer to blow the hair away. she's impatient, unfriendly, and of course my hairstyle is ruined with an uneven edge. i'll never visit this store again.

5 stars to alfredo - 3 stars this locationnot to knock the other stylists but alfredo has been the only one who consistently give me a cut as i expected.  i may be bias but i feel my request is closer to the simple spectrum, i've had other stylists shave off my sideburns leaving an awkward gap between my head and beard.  he pays attention to detail and something he does that i never expect out of anyone is he remembers who you are and details about you and your life.the store i give a lower score to because not only do they charge a higher rate the my older supercuts but they also tack on a $2 "request" fee.  honestly no one would be requesting if everyone delivered.to be fair the 3 people that had given me a bad cut haven't been at this location for quiet some time but i'm in no hurry to replace alfredo.

had to get my whole head shaved at the end of the cut because some woman who works there doesn't understand a crop goes down, not up like a pseudo-mohawk a 7th grader would have. it was just completely unacceptable, and the woman was beyond rude, rolled her eyes countless times and was completely careless. i will literally never go to another supercuts again. just shell out the extra $20 to go to floyd's or better yet support your local shop, your hair is worth it. i could have done a better job on my own using a lawnmower.

five stars just for yoko alone! i wasn't blown away by my first cut here months ago, but tonight i had the luck to get yoko for the first time. she was absolutely meticulous and very skilled on my long unruly hair.at supercuts, the basic haircut (priced here at $21.95; locations vary) usually do not come with a wash unless you pay for it (the wash-plus-cut package here is $25.95), so they usually only wet your hair with a spray bottle before cutting. yoko saw my mane condition, and instead of just spraying my hair down, she took me to the back sink area to fully wet my hair as well as apply conditioner and later detangler so that she could get a better cut.be warned that this supercuts location is very busy, and their online "check-in" (which holds your spot in line remotely) wasn't working tonight, so i called in and was told it was a 40 minute wait. it ended up being more like a 60 minute wait, but i stopped in and then came back again. the good thing is that the clientele here is almost all male so their cuts go pretty quick with the two stylists yoko and monica here, even when there are three people in front of you.special requests for a stylist cost an extra $2, but may be worth it for yoko. monica is also pretty good, but yoko goes the extra mile!tip: right now there is a $2 coupon online for one-time use when you sign up for the supercuts emails for this location.

they made us wait for an hour and a 1/2 but told us 45 minutes wait. didn't apologize. my son had long hair and wanted to cut his pony tail. he went from long hair to short hair but hairdresser wouldn't allow us to photograph it even though i promised hair dresser wouldn't be in frame. such bad attitude. then she butchered his hair and it had uneven lines. i should have known she was terrible from the cheap dye that covered her middle age grays ,epic fail trying to look like a millennial.

don't go here, you'll be ripped off. bad customer service and even worst hair cut service. overpriced and unhappy workers. the front desk lady needs an attitude check. going back to the barber shop because this place is garbage.

thanks to sarah for my shampoo, haircut & blow dry. another thanks to ceci for recommending me. they both made me feel comfortable, inviting & very relaxed. i was unsure if i wanted to show up due to losing a lot of hair after my 2nd pregnancy but they reassured me that i had nothing to worry about. nor did i need to feel embarrassed. as one of their first time clients they couldn't have treated me any better. thank you girls! until next time.

i have to write a review after phillip literally made a whole in my son forehead . my son ask for a faded haircut . his hairline is back about 1 inch . my 10 years old was so upset . can't be fixed so at least i got my money back . will never go to a supercut salon

the wait was short considering i walked in around 5:30 pm and elle was fantastic. i haven't gotten a haircut in about two years so naturally i was nervous but she did a wonderful job. i would definitely return.

this location is always understaffed, leading to long wait times. stylists are qualified but whomever sets the schedules is obviously oblivious to the fact that customers are not being served ina reasonable amount of time. one should not have to wait an hour to get a haircut at a supercuts.

honestly, i usually always go to the bigger salons. but it was a sunday and i needed a "trim"(like 5 inches kinda cut). they were fast, professional and good. i'll come again for my trim. happy they're around.

three attempts here before i'm moving on. stylists, on the whole, seem outwardly pleasant and helpful, but the atmosphere is not managed. by the nature of the business, walk-in clientele are on parity with those taking the opportunity to"check-in" prior to arrival, meaning if you have a time given you when calling or online, treat it as a nice gesture. thee is no such obligation to honor it here. want an appointment so as to work around your life, go elsewhere. fair enough. want to attempt to manage time here, forget it. there is no real incentive for checking in when others can come in off the street ahead of you based upon a complex algorithm only the reception staff know. i want to like this place. however, if waiting 45 minutes on average is a problem for you, then move to a place with an appointment system and develop a relationship with a stylist that is harmonious with your needs.

jose, the manager, is amazing! i wanted my hair shaved, but still feminine looking. i had a photo with me, and he completely "nailed" it! this is a cut i was just about to pay $85 for at my regular salon, but i took a chance while waiting for my husband to get his haircut.i couldn't be happier with the results. in addition, jose and i had such a good time while he "nailed" each section. the most impressive part is that he walked me through what he would do before approaching each sectioni'll be back!!!!!
they open at 8:00am and are conveniently located downtown. very few places are open this early. this is a great way to get a cut before work.
thanks to kim for the wonderful layers for my thick wavy curls. days later i'm in love with my haircut.   appreciate your expertise. applause!

my new dtla spot for haircuts. priced well, service is awesome, jose is rad and always take the time to listen and understand what im looking for. quick, clean and relaxed atmosphere. im always a walk-in but they seem to find room for me in a timely fashion.
kim does a great job every time i come here. two thumbs up for service and two thumbs way up for listening.

great atmosphere etc but what you really care about is the cut.  jose is great, listens to what you want and walks you through his plan to get there.  does a great job.  i'm very happy this place is around the corner from me but if it wasn't i would take a drive downtown to still come here.

i am a student and needed to keep my costs down so when i arrived i asked how much it would be for a haircut and they told me $26. the stylist took me to my seat and asked if i would like my hair blowdried telling me i would be charged $30 and if i wanted my hair shampoo'd to she would charge me $6. i expected the total to come to $36 but received a bill for $62. i was surprised and asked how it jumped so high and they became defensive, telling me i was told of the prices. i do not feel they were very clear.  i would never in a million years expect to pay more for a blow-dry than the haircut.  they should have been clear and when i asked about it, i didn't appreciate their defensiveness. i called corporate and the owner was supposed to call me but never bothered. i would have been a returning customer if this hadn't happened but not now.

so my barber of 3 years up and quit without telling me so i was left without a stylist. searched yelp for locations in downtown, surprisingly supercuts had the best reviews by far. took a chance and had allison cut my hair, wow i was impressed! she did an amazing job! definitely returning, the cut, the fade and the blending she did on my simple 1940s combover is impeccable!
price is a little higher then where i'm from but understandable for being dtla. jose did my hair and did an amazing job, great to talk with. very fast service with online check in
i came in for a small haircut and a trim on my bangs. erika wtf is this. seriously dude she just went ham on my bangs for $26. prices went up by the way, it's no longer $23

alison is absolutely awesome! my friend who did my hair for me moved away and i've been bouncing salons and stylists since then. i mostly do my own hair (mediocrily) so my trips are few and far between. i first went to alison a couple months ago and she was the first to actually give me a cut i left happy with. since i had a good experience the last time i came back to her today and she remembered me and bits of our conversation from months ago. her personal approach and great conversation keeps me coming back. (plus the fact that she knows how to cut the way i like it). highly recommend!

called in about 2p saturday to make an appointment for a shampoo, cut and style for my long, course curly hair. i'm pretty bold when it comes to my hair. i've shaved it, bleached it on my own, colored it own my own, had pretty much ever color in the rainbow on my hair. for the last four or so years, i've kept it natural from dyes and only trim. aside from using protective styles (braids) i really haven't done anything drastic to my hair...that is until 3 weeks ago. bored at home, i decided to cut my own bangs. what a failure that was! my hair is curly when i cut them and when i straighten it it looked horrible. when i made my appointment, i was assigned to allison who was totally understanding of my hair experiment. she was talkative, energetic and incredibly friendly during my visit. jose was also there being the vibrance of the salon. at the end of my cut and style, allison made my hair look absolutely incredible!! received lots of compliments on her work that evening. wow!!! so ecstatic with the result!!! she really has the magic touch. 10/10 would recommend. thanks allison!!
two thumbs up for jose. efficient, clean, careful, and precise with his cuts. he always follow instructions perfectly to the way i want my hair cut

i've been coming to supercuts for about 2-3 years now. hopped around a few times to other salons and barbershops, but none were as consistent, friendly, and fast as supercuts. i didn't mind who cut my hair in this location because all cuts ended up surpassing my expectations. recently walked in just to get my sides and back cut to a 1. jose spent extra time and care, and at one point, i swear he was about to strain his eyes focusing on my fade! i felt as if he used 7 different tools to cut my hair. love my cut and obviously will be back.
they did bad haircut on my son! they don't ask for details about hair cut. i am very disappointed from their service and never going back to any supercuts again!!

came here on a monday afternoon and it was very busy but the workers move quickly and i found myself with a cool cut pretty quickly. they really took their time to help me look good. the app to check-in is helpful as it can minimize wait time if you check in before you show up. it is a bit pricier than a great clips or fantastic sams but i feel you get what you pay for. i was happy with the cut and will be returning

keep in mind that i can only speak to the eyebrow waxing service, but the whole experience has always been positive for the past 2+ years for me. diana is forever and always my favorite--she is so sweet and fast yet everything looks exactly as i like it. i have huge naturally arched eyebrows and prefer to just get them cleaned up a little bit than to get the spider eyebrows that i was always envious of and wanted back when they were in style in 2002. that being said, this location only really does "clean ups" and not so much styling/definition. for me, as this is all i want done, the end result has always been comparable to whenever i've gone to some fancy spa for $30+ per wax. the timing is fine, i've gone all different times of the day/afternoon and am always in and out in 30 minutes total.

couldn't find another place on short notice to get my hair done. the place is nice not really busy. the girl that cut my hair did a good job i think her name was wona. i think their pricing for color is stupid. my hair barely goes to my shoulders and they charged me the most expensive price for "long hair" the prices are no better than other salons in downtown so all in all if you are in a rush and can't get an appointment for another place it works.

nice place. my reservation is always honor. mara my stylist, was born on my birthday also. she does a good haircut, as requested. always look forward to the hot towel finish. there is a super cuts app, you can download. i always use it. good place.

absolute worst customer service ever!  i decided to give it another try as the last nightmare stylist was no longer there.   so i go in for a simple quick hair shampoo again and the woman who washes my hair tells me not come back again because she is "not allowed " to scrub my head harder and give 3 shampoos because it is a waste of her time and energy!!!!!!  r e a l l y?????  no class or professionalism at supercuts fort lee.  never again!!!! boycotted for good!!!! doesn't even deserve one star but had to write this review

i usually get cuts color and hair treatments here for past 4 years and all the girls are friendly and they all are professionally experienced. they know what they're doing and what customers want. great easy location too

claudiana rocks! my husband and 2 year old son go to her and she does a great job every time. i'm not crazy about their way of taking appointments but that's not her fault. she always has people waiting for her and she does a great job organizing her clients while giving great customer service. i hope she stays forever!

trashy example of customer service. ive been taking my kids to supercuts in hackensack but their stylist was not there, so i went to fort lee's location and checked in online and it said no wait. i get there and i get a rude introduction. apparently, if youre russian, youll receive preferential treatment. once the stylist finished the previous customer, she takes a crazy amount of time to get the guy on his way. at 40 minutes, i stood up and told my son to lets go. here she comes..... im coming, hold on! and shes shouting as were walking out! needless to say, my 2 year old was not amused with this crackpots attitude. im disappointed in supercuts as a brand and for hiring that waste of oxygen.
terrible service. staff is terrible. they are rude and insulting. the only person i enjoyed moved to hackensack and i tried going after, but they are just so rude. i will never go back again.
cheap. rather dirty. ever hairdressers themselves. don't have haircuts. $14 bucks for a haircut. had to wait for 45 min.go elsewhere if you anything more than low price.

i walked in 30 minutes before closing to get a haircut and was taken care of by alyssa, who said she's been working here for seven years. even though i have a short and simple hairstyle, she did a great job and only took fifteen minutes! i was so impressed that i made a yelp account to write this review. will go here again.

i took my son in for a haircut and it came out totally wrong not how i pictured it or in the magazine photo which i've shown to the stylist. back of the head groomed and trimmed nicely but what happened to the front or side profile? we were pressed for time for another appointment therefore couldn't fix the problem. alyssa cut my son hair very quickly that day. i don't think i'll be returning to super cut any time soon.

get your story straight. elizabeth made me have two people cut front of me who didn't have appointments with yin that day because i refused to get a haircut with her last min on the walk in. she straight up lied and said that guy called in advance and yin confirmed that guy didn't call or did he even ask for her. she made me wait because i denied her that day after i said yes to her at first and then declined because i remembered the previous garbage haircut i got from her about a month ago. the fade was so bad, i could seriously do it better with two mirrors. you want pictures? cause i have it. after i got the hair cut, i walked to my car and realized it was so messed up, i walked back in so that she could fix it . to make it even more entertaining, i went home took a shower and it was still fked up. i took a picture for humor.  false review ? again the 2nd visit: i made the appointment on the app after i declined and made it with yin. i was the next person to get a haircut and magically two walk ins that came after me got a haircut with directly with yin. ( yin had no appointments besides me) the reason was that the guy " called " which was a lie by elizabeth cause the guy who actually called for a walk in (not request for yin) came in about 40'mins after that walk in guy got the hair cut with yin. there was like 4 people cutting hair and 2 of those girls just standing around. why did elizabeth straight up lie and put the 2 walk in that didn't request yin with yin and the best part the walk in that came after me didn't even call( wrong person), while i was clearly waiting for her for and only her ? and while 2 other girls just talking and doing nothing ? what is your name? let's escalate this. you either have to be elizabeth or just ignorant and you don't have a clue what the heck is going on.

worst haircut i've ever had in my life.i question this person's credentials about cutting hair...she just pulled out the trimmer, played around with my head, then used a scissor (3 slices). down... took 5 minutes or less.i didn't even want to pay for this, i actually had to go to another barbershop, to get precise cuts after. she failed every category within cutting hair. do not come here.

i like that they have the same stylists working there for years. my favorite ones are donna and patricia. my only complaint is that this location is so popular the lines are sometimes long (call beforehand to put your name down). also, the last two times my haircuts turned out to be asymmetrical, which luckily gained me lots of compliments. i tried edgewater location for a change, but it was a disaster, so i'm coming back to fort lee. also, fort lee location is corporate so employees get health benefits, which is important for me from social compliance point of view.supercuts are great for wash and haircut only. anything more, and it gets more expensive and rushed than regular salons.

will never go to this supercuts again. asked for a 1 inch trim on my hair and received about 3 inches off which is fine. then the lady proceeded to try and give my front layers without my permission. the end result was an extremely uneven haircut. i'm not sure what she was trying to do because i do not have layers or a face frame at all. it looks like she just decided to chop an inch off without angling it at all. other pieces at the back are also unevenly cut.
i check in on line, jen hooked me up, took the time and put the workmanship i expect when i get cut up.  thanks, i will be back next time i am in the area.

had a 6:30 appt and waited for a half hour. i walked out without getting my haircut.  i wasn't waiting for anyone in particular so there were two women free. one just stared at me from the back of the store after she was done cutting a young man's hair. then once the other women freed up she spent about 20 minutes ringing up a customer because the reception girl was not competent enough to ring up a customer. instead she just kept yapping away with a person who wasn't even a customer. this place is awful, they are lazy and rude. i could understand if i was waiting for someone to finish up but they had no customers for a half hour while i waited way past my appt time.

i was going to the supercuts in fort lee because jen was there and she was their best stylist in my opinion. well, she no longer works there. i was told by "management" that she quit. she's the only stylist who i'll allow to cut my hair. if anyone knows what happened, please post it here and if jen is working somewhere else please post that info here too. i would like to know and so would her loyal customers. thanks.

with supercuts, you never know how good the skills of the person cutting your hair is going to be. this doesn't concern me too much as my needs are simple and the rare bad haircut grows out pretty quickly. what irks me about this supercuts is that on two separate occasions the person checking me in neglected to tell me that there was an hour's worth of customers ahead of me who had called in. (there were only a couple of people waiting in the store.) after a 40 minute wait today i mentioned it to the employee and she then told me i still had a wait. when i suggested the wait time could have been communicated when i first came in she rolled her eyes. at that point i left. there are lots of other places to get a cheap haircut without having to encounter a long wait and an attitude.

this place is great for my needs.  i think when people come here they can't expect a lot.  if you really cared about how your hair really looked then you wouldn't be coming here.  let's face it if you are coming here, you are coming here to save money and that's it.  my haircut is easy to cut and for 14 bucks it's perfect.tips, call about an hour in advance and have them put your name down.  this will make the wait a lot shorter.

this is a nice supercuts but this review is for their stylist, melissa.  i've been coming to her since november. she is a very good listener, understands how i want my hair cut, and is a joy to be around.  she cut my husband's hair as well and he was also very pleased.  i finally found someone i can trust at an affordable price!  i have a very short haircut and it's a struggle to make it look feminine and she nails it every time.  love her :-)
having written this nice review below, i got butchered by my regular barber here. god, i look like hell. :-(

amazing experience. mimi, the woman who cut my hair was very friendly and made me feel at home. my hair came out better than i could have imagined. i liked the product she used in my hair and she even gave me a discount.
always take good care of me & family.  nothing pretentious.occasionally i get coupons & hair products on sale a lot.no complaints!!!

so i went here on a whim a few days ago while shopping bc i really needed my hair cut but with christmas around the corner i really didn't wanna spend that much on just a trim so i saw this place and one of the girls was available, megan. she was so nice! so sweet & so good! i got a blunt cut & honestly was a little worried i'd notice some unevenness days later (bc blunt cuts are actually harder bc u can't hide it in layers) but i didn't it's amazing! i will be goin back that's for sure love this place! not to mention super clean too!! awesome thanks again!
great experience. place was clean and had a good vibe. most importantly got a perfect hair cut. happy that i found a place so close to where i work. definitely will be coming back

i had a great experience at this salon! megen was accommodating, professional, and creative! i had no wait time and walked out with the perfect hair style. i highly recommend megen and this salon location! you won't be disappointed!

great place! everyone is so nice & friendly! i called ahead and didn't have to wait ( i loved that) megan cut my hair perfect! she is so sweet and very friendly and easy to talk to. i will definitely be back!!

i am taking back my good review for supercuts in upper montclair. it was very upsetting to hear they pushed my hairdresser out. mark is a great hairdresser. he was excited to get an opportunity for advancement last time i got my hair done. he was then overlooked for his promotion.very upsetting.the managers in this place always have unhappy faces and act like they are doing you a favor. mark always has positive vibe. he acts like you are the most important person when you get your hair done. i asked him why he was rejected for his promotion. the manager of the nj area told him he was not fast enough. that is a complete lie. he does my face frame in a very short time. it's always perfect. the other hairdressers take over a half hour and never get it perfect. another friend of mine told me he gets his hair done in 5 minutes.  i recently found out he goes here too. he was also very upset when i told him.when i came in to get my haircut, mark was working with a girl who could not do the face frame correctly. he came over and fixed it for her. he was very professional and worked with her as a team player. he did not make her feel any less qualified in the way he went about it. those were great management skills. ever since i have been so happy. every time i get my hair cut i get compliments from everyone after my haircut. even strangers at the supermarket.i came to find out that many other people i know have discovered mark. he has a big following.i have been going to this location for years. every time i get a good hairdresser they leave. i had started with danielle who left. david was my previous hairdresser. he also left and moved to a high end salon which i can not afford. i found out he comes to get his haircut with mark too!!so mark wanted to stay and make this job a career. it helped local people to have a great hairdresser for an affordable price in this bad economy. life is hard enough. now i have to deal with this!

i called early on a saturday morning, seeing if i could get an appointment, and i was able to come right in for the first appointment that same day for a dye and trim.  this was huge for me because i have a pretty busy schedule and can't always make appointments so far in advance.  the staff was courteous and professional, the place was very clean and they did a great job on my hair.  i will definitely go back.  highly recommend!

i know it's a $15 haircut, but does it really have to be that difficult? have been going to his location for over a year and they used to be really good. however lately something has changed. this upper montclair supercuts location now has everything: bad service and incompetence. horrible attitudes by staff. like mcdonalds but with haircuts. there are so many competitors and other supercuts locations with hair stylists that take pride in their work unlike this location. unless you prefer crappy service and bad haircuts i don't recommend this upper montclair location.
great salon, clean, and efficient. i used to come here all the time until my schedule changed.vera did a great job with my haircut!
i loved the way alex cut my hard to manage hair. now she has moved elsewhere. would be great if anyone can forward her my email so that i can find her.

we walked in there at 6:40 pm and were told that they were closing at 7 and couldn't take anymore haircuts. i explained that there was still 20minutes left and the cut was for my son who is 5 and takes about 10 minutes to cut his hair. they then told me that there was another person waiting but when that person said he wasn't actually getting a haircut (was waiting with someone else) the woman reluctantly said she would take my son. while my son was getting his haircut another hairdresser berated me for showing up so close to closing time and that their policy was not to take customers 1/2 before closing. he explained that there is a lengthy process to cleaning up and shutting down (aka we are lazy, hate that we actually cut hair at supercuts and want to be out of here at 7 pm sharp). it was clear that he was being nasty after getting a lousy tip from a previous client which he loudly complained about just moments earlier. i told him that there was no clear explanation about this alleged policy on the website and he told me i needed  to be more prepared. thanks for the life lesson mr supercuts and i am sorry that this will be the only job as a hairstylist you'll ever get. on a side note, my son's haircut sucked and the woman barely cut anything off. stay far away from this supercuts.. agree with other reviews aboit incompetence and horrible attitudes. they have major chips on their shoulders and take it out on customers.
very friendly atmosphere. unlike it used to be. its a convienet spot based on where i live. with the new staff came a new upbeat atmosphere. great place. great cut!
i've been here four times and i've had excellent haircuts every time. a special shout out to vera, lily and cara. shop is clean and the staff is friendly.
my worst haircut ever!! the young lady who cut my hair spent almost an hour and obviously she has no idea how to do the job right, i need a wig for at least two months.never this place again!!!

great for what it is.  this is not a high end salon, no do they claim to be.  plenty of stylists are always working, i lucked out and got one that i like, however i'm pretty sure you can request someone specific if you like.  it is very clean and everyone is very nice. can't beat the price for the results. they do not take appointments but if you call ahead they will put your name on the list.

wow. i feel like i should have paid them more for the haircut and color they gave me. it was one of the best i have ever had. jordyn (sp?) was my stylist and she was amazing. she listened to me. she talked me through everything she was doing. she created a custom color for me that was the best i have had. people can't stop raving about my amazing a-line bob. i adore this girl and will totally be back!

worst place. i don't ask for much when i get my hair cut, just a basic trim with layers. this time around, i was told that she "won't cut my hair like that" and cut it the way she thought was best. i explained i've had the same cut for years, and she said that she refused to cut it that way and if i wanted a cut, it would be a basic trim. i could not believe how rude and unprofessional my experience was, and given that my hair now resembles a wet dog, i definitely won't be coming back.

dont' let a girl named sasha get within a mile's radius of your hair. not sure it she still works there, but she could make a lawn cry after mowing it. to add insult to injury, she has a hard time listening and following the customer's requests. somebody please form a coalition and stop her!

they ruined my hair.  i will never be going back here.  they dyed my hair with black permanent hair dye (jet black) when i asked for a semi permanent dark brown.  they messed up and tried to add more brown tones, but they dried out my hair, it turned red.  service is terrible, they gossip about their customers (they spoke about me when they were doing my hair, two stylists were whispering nasty things about my hair).  just rude.  and expensive!  don't let that one dollar sign on this yelp page confuse you.  i have long hair, but to wash, color, trim and blow out my hair costed me $200.  go to bangz, they're (surprisingly) cheaper, cleaner, friendlier and they know what they're doing!

this is near my work so i like to come in for a trim on occasion (that being twice now). i've had good experiences both times. when i went there was no wait, but there was only one hairdresser working, so if you come at a time like that you can get stuck waiting for a while.granted it took longer than i expected, but my hairdresser was very thorough. my hairdresser (lindsey according to recepit) was friendly and took the time to cut my layers and make it look really nice. it wasn't much of a change length wise but it got rid of the heaviness of my hair without drastically changing it. and the price is definitely good. i can't speak to more complicated style proficiency, but it's good for what i need and it's next to some shopping and some eateries so it's easy to squeeze it in while running errands.

oh my god are they slow. if you've got an hour or two, probably a good place to get your hair cut. check in online, if not people that come in will keep getting called in front of you. not a problem normally, but since they cut hair in slow motion...it's a must.

i walked in without an appointment so i didn't mind the wait. while i waited i went on yelp to peek at the reviews. was a little skeptical seeing the more recent reviews since they were negative. ashley cut my hair and she did a great job. she was friendly to talk to and did exactly what i asked for. the other girls there seemed nice but i can only speak for the one who cut my hair. i'd happily return, can't beat the price!

i came in for the blow dry and while people were super nice they had no idea how to do simple blow dryi left with flat hair that looks like i have asked my baby sister to do it and they put tons of oil on it so will have to wash it as soon as i get home...
stephanie, was a very sociable kind worker that took time on me and my boyfriend hair. very friendly and great personality.
i get a very simple haircut. 3 on the sides, 4 on top, straight across at the ears. my haircut was exactly like i wanted. the store was clean and well lit. the stylist was polite and quick.

whoaaa dhaval...!! thats exactly opposite of who marquita is. one of the best hair stylist i have ever seen. she is very friendly, takes her time and very professional. she suggested some products for my hair and turns out they suite best for me. i have been going here from past one year and always had best experience with marquita. highly recommend her people who are going for the first time!

needed a nice haircut for an upcoming holiday party. walked in and got a stylist named marquita. best cut ever! the girl's got skills. she was way cool and very professional. i had to write a review because i don't know what dhaval d is talking about. people might read that and go in with the wrong attitude. marquita took her time and was extremely friendly and thorough. you can tell that she loves what she does and takes it seriously. she also played great music the whole time. long story short, i look like a f&@king stud. totally going back to her.

rude and unprofessional.  the employees would rather converse/gossip with one another than do their job.  i've been there 3 times (only because the haircuts are relatively inexpensive) and something went wrong with each visit.  i won't be going back.  don't waste your time or money going to this establishment.

worst choice ever!!! got one star because they need it in order to write the review.   brought my 12 yr old son to get a trim and patricia starts cutting his hair with obviously no clue on what she was doing.  the 2nd hairdresser takes her scissors away from her and starts cutting his hair.  i felt better as it was obvious the first one didn't know what she was doing. but then people came in and the 2nd one left him to take a new client.  patricia tells me he's done, he puts on his hoodie, i pay, tip patricia and when i get home this is atrocity he was left with.    a 3 yr old child with scissors on his hand for the first time would've done a better job.  the head looks like if it's split in half with double the amount of hair on one side.    it's obvious, that if this so called hairdresser thinks thats even, she either needs to get glasses or go to beauty school for the first time.  i was forced to come back and get someone else to work on his hair and try to fix the damage.    i donot recommend this place.    first and last time.

not your average supercuts! like most guys, i wouldn't go here if it was the last place to go, but i needed a haircut in a rush so i had no choice. ashley cut my hair the first time i came here, since then she's been the only one to cut my hair. very professional, and very good haircut, wouldn't go anywhere else.

i came in for a haircut since the last one was uneven and i was greeted by cassandra.  she was a very nice and listened to my concerns.  i felt and looked great. i love her attention to detail.  definitely coming back.

won't be back. checked in for two people at 2 pm for 6:30 appointments. did both check ins at the same time. got my haircut and they tried to skip the other person and even argued with us about it. if it wasn't for the nice gentleman letting the other person go ahead of him, like the system should have done anyway, we would have walked out. don't bother wasting your time here. so slow as well.

beware of the stylist marquita!! extremely rude, arrogant and also messed up my hair. i am not the one to write bad reviews . . i usually let it go as ppl can have good and bad days. but this time i was royally pissed off . . i have been going to this place since past 3 years and most of them have been pretty good. but this lady was something. . she went on sooo fast like she was trying to break a record for fastest haircut. she screwed up my sideburns. you don't mess with people's hair!! my usual stylist was felicia but was told she no longer works there so i thought might as well go along with someone else... what a mistake!!

when i go to a supercuts location, i heavily rely on yelp reviews to pick the right hair dresser/stylist for me.  so when we moved nearby, i relied on none other than yelp reviews to figure out who i wanted to cut my hair.i got my hair cut with lindsey and she gave me the most perfect adorable haircut when i was going from long to short hair which was a drastic change.  she is awesome at her job and knows her stuff. she also consistently asks you for your feedback on if her hair cutting is looking the way you want.  my hair is super curly and because i alternate between curly and straight hair, the cut has to be at a certain length for both styles to work.  lindsey always gets it right! she is the only one i go to at this supercuts and i have always left happy.

supercuts is my go-to place for my hairstyling needs and i was excited when a location opened in secaucus. lindsay was the first to cut my hair over a year ago and i'm happy to see that she is still there.jillian was my stylist for my recent coloring needs and she did an excellent job with my highlights and understood my love of red. she helped make the time pass with great conversation and made me feel like a vip.the ladies are friendly and take the time to listen to your hair wants. i have no problem letting them make recommendations and getting a little creative.give them a try, you won't regret it!
lisa has been cutting my hair for a couple years, and she is the best one they have.  there is always a line for her to cut someone's hair, thank you lisa.

i've been going there for a while always had excellent service. the place used to be open 9-9, but a sign on the door now says due to staffing shortages they're open 11-7. michael cut my hair he had no idea what he was doing! after i left i got an email from them asking me about my experience. i totally blasted them & gave very specific examples of why i was unhappy. never heard back from them. they just lost a loyal customer.
they don't know what they are doing. they cut hair unevenly and now i have to go fix it some place. never again!they offered to not take a fee for the haircut .. which does not fix anything.

warning! this review comes from someone who has visited this salon quite a few times and has constantly had only bad experience. unprofessional and inexperienced people cut and style hair here. they somehow make your hair look way worse than it was before! long waiting time and extremely poor management adds to the fury! beware of one mr.michael who ruins the complete look of your hair. he has a bad sense of hair styling and gives a very uneven hair cut.think twice before you lend your hair to him! both me and my husband have been returning customers as it is the closest to our home. but we have realized that it is time to look out for a better salon that makes the whole experience and money spent worthwhile.

i was looking for a place to get a haircut and i had never been to a supercuts before, so i decided to try things out. it was during the afternoon so there were several other people already waiting. they have spots to sit up at the front and back of the store to wait.  i ended up waiting about 20-25 minutes to be called. once i was called, the haircut was done relatively quickly and it went very smoothly. typically i get buzz cuts or beard trims so the kinds of haircuts i get are relatively easier to manage then most. my hairstylist was wonderful and was very accommodating. if i'm in the area again, i might visit. the facility isn't as clean or flashy as other places but it gets the job done.

disclaimer: i didn't get a haircut.checking in online is literally the same as walking in off the street. you should ask them what the difference is if you want to be amused.i "checked in" at the time i had chosen online and still had to wait. and wait. and wait. and then i had to leave because this is new york city and ain't nobody got time for that. i'd rather pay more at a salon that is organized to get a better cut because my time is money. and all i wanted to do was donate 9" to pantene beautiful lengths! byeee

wait time is wildly inaccurate. sat waiting for a half hour past my check in time when there "zero wait time" listed. had i stayed it likely would have been another half hour!!! whats the point of having the checkin?? beyond that, employees were extremely rude and dismissive. dont bother giving your business to this place.

horrible experience! horrible!the black woman working there is a racist.  she had such a attitude to me since i came in. i am not expecting a good survey, but at least you can give some smile. she treated me like some homeless people begging for her to get a haircut. and i gave her my phonr number, she had that disgusting look on her face and said where is that at. itold her philadelphia, then she shaked her head. i was like wtf is that supposed to mean. afterwards, i sit on the chair and she asked what do i want for hairstyle. she still talked in an attitude which made me so confused and uncomfortable. i have never been there before but i swear i will never go there any time. she kept shaking head and her facial expression was so disgusting when i show the picture of the hairstyle i want. then she kept asking me what do i want her to do. i had a scar that i want to cover, but for some reason she said she cannot do that. so i walked out. i am so sick of her attitude. there are plenty of barbers around here.i will never recommend anyone to go there. also, i regret even step into the barbershop because of the horrible experience.honestly. i do not want to give 1 star. it should be negative.

as others have mentioned, there is no point to checking in ahead.  for the 4th time in a row, i've show up for check-in at least 10 minutes ahead of the check-in time and at that exact time, they take someone who has been waiting, but did not check in.  10 minutes after, they called me. haircut is always fine, but not worth the frustration.

i needed a refresh to my good haircut and couldn't wait for my usual stylist appointment, so i stopped by supercuts at university place.  waited 3 minutes and was seen by shana.  i explained that i wanted a trim and shape up, she was ready to start cutting. i told her i'd like a wash first.  the shampooing was fine.  we made a little small talk, she said she's been cutting hair for 10 years.  great, i thought.she began cutting and seemed alright. i told her i'd like a bit of fringe in the front, just some wispy bits, nothing heavy.  she sectioned off the front, and showed me, i had her reduce the section, reminding her i just want some fringe, not bangs.  i showed her the length, to the middle of my nose, nothing short, just some bits.  she began to cut.the next thing i knew, she stepped to the side, pulled out the hair dryer, fluffed with her hands, no brush, for 3-5 seconds and said we were done!  the first thing i saw in the mirror was me with short bangs above my brows!  omg and wtf i told her this is not what i wanted, or asked for!she said, "i cut to the middle of your nose like you said.i told her to blowout the rest.""oh you want a blowout?  i thought you just wanted a cut. that's more money!"she excused herself and scurried away to rinse another customer, leaving me in the chair.  the rest of the cut is fair, not good.  the new bangs she gave me do not even blend with the sides.  moreover, the cut looks like something from the 1970's.  i decided to get up and settle the bill and go.how does a hairstylist make a living not listening to the client/customer/guest?!?stay away from shana at supercuts in the village

maxine was the best. she not only gave me a great quality haircut, but she was incredibly entertaining. for $23 i felt like i got a haircut and a show. i will definitely be returning to this salon in the future. can't express how friendly the service was

worst haircut. simple men's trim and tyrone sent me out with wet matted down hair.   only after returning to work and my hair drying  did i learn that he had done such a poor job that my co workers had to share with me the bad news.   he clipped the sides with a #2 bit forgot on the left side to blend it in to the top.   this left an embarrassing and ugly haircut.  i hope that this was merely a case of tyrone being incompetent or not caring about his work.    he would not speak to me but instead gossiped continuously with his co-worker.

i came in as a walk in and was told it would be a 15 minute wait but i can back before then and the barber, tyrone was waiting for me.he gave me a wonderful haircut and was really pleasant to talk to. haircut came put exactly to the picture of what i wanted.  highly recommend.in a city filled with barbers it's hard to find a good one, respect!!!

everyone here is great. they are all dedicated workers and will try their very best to meet with customers expectation. you describe what you want, and they will help you along the way. my favorite, juana, is a very kind and very happy person. she's very good with children so for those parents who want someone who's going to do well with your child's haircut, i definitely recommend her! irene is also a very lovely worker here in this establishment!

went in for a blowdry and the guy there did a good job on my hair. it was a pretty high price, though ($37).the reason i'm giving 3 stars instead of 4 is because when i tipped $3 (which is the usual amount where i'm from) the guy who styles me said "no offense but in the 10-20 years i've been doing hair i've never been tipped $3". i guess the usual tip amount in the us is higher (he said its usually 5-10)? it made me feel really bad, but i had already paid and didn't have cash on me. slighty rude of the guy, though, but it was a good quality style.

tyrone @ supercuts, university place is the very best cutter, stylist i ever had!!i found him in westchester ny and now traveldown to greenwich village for a haircutas he is the mgr in university place store!

black people should never stop here even if you are desperate. not a good experience. the woman that just cut my hair was awful. she didn't take time. didn't try to blend and left bald spots. she also kept poking me in the head with clippers. i knew better but decided to just end my day with a terrible haircut.

i called ahead for my appointment - i waited about 10 minutes on arrival and was placed with a stylist. she listened to my request (a simple, unlayered, blunt bob) and followed through perfectly. i paid $27 and couldn't be more pleased... especially as this trip was to correct the work of an overzealous and inattentive stylist at a trendy salon in bushwick. i'll be coming to this supercuts from now on - nothing is more valuable than someone who is willing to cut you hair the way you ask!

i originally had an appointment with another salon but the man working there wouldn't cut my hair because he thought i was a woman. after that experience i decided to try my luck at supercuts and was not disappointed. i was seated after about five minutes of walking in and got exactly what i wanted! the stylist i had was very nice and had my hair all done in no time. i would highly recommend coming here and with their prices it really can't be beat!

i had a long wait time, but this wasn't their fault. it was very busy and i didn't have an appointment.tatyana did a fantastic job on my cut! i love it. as others have mentioned, the place isn't super clean but i don't think it's unreasonable for what you pay for either. the stylists tools are cleaned after ever guest and that's all that matters to me!i will return. for people who are no fuss with their hair, you can't beat the ease and price!

i usually go to another location which does my hair perfectly every time but i  had an appointment a few blocks away so i had to settle for this one. went in on a monday at 1pm and was the only customer. the two stylists there were annoyed and weren't doing anything. explained what i wanted and showed the stylist a picture and she swatted the picture away saying "yeah i know" without looking at it and rolling her eyes and sucking her teeth. all i wanted was a wash, trim, and blow out of my long layered bob and bangs. she cut it too short so now its all one length and blew it out and curled the ends under. i left upset and looking like a mushroom. phone kept ringing and she and the other stylist kept complaining about this phone meeting they were going to have at 4pm and refused to answer the phone the entire time i was there probably to avoid customers. the place is also dark, drab and dirty. was asked to set my purse down on the floor by my feet while sitting in the chair when i spotted what looked like thick dried coffee or chocolate splattered on the walls under the table and floors that no one bothered to clean. i then picked up my purse and held it on my lap the whole time. they also don't dust, sweep or mop the floors. filthiest salon i've ever been to.

i was so happy with my haircut here recently.  i went at lunch time and there was no wait.  i was taken right away, and i usually get simple-type cuts.  but even then, many places don't do it right.  how hard is it to layer?  well, the girl i got knew how to layer and framed my face so nicely.  she did a great job.  i have had the best haircuts in my life at supercuts and great clips and the worst at high-priced salons.  i never have coloring done, so i can't speak to that.  i also don't have contemporary/trendy/experimental cuts, so i can't speak to that.  i know it depends on the stylist you get, because i've had some blah experiences at these places too, but this was a great cut.
had the sweetest lady trim my hair today. she gave me a clean, even cut in no time. thanks supercuts!

i go to this place because my cut is simple: #1 on my entire head. if you go after 7pm on weekdays you get half off.  i have been here twice and have had something negative both times.#1 i got my standard buzz cut and was looking great. the barber was finishing up the back of my neck when she decided to _really_ dig in. my nexk was nearly scraped raw. it burned when i touched so when i got home i had my wife look at it and there were visible parallel scratch marks that broke the skin, traveling from the base of my neck to my hairline. i was sore for a few days.#2 i arrived at 7pm and there were 4 busy barbers, 3 waiting customers. i was set to see a movie at 8 and my cut takes about 5 minutes, so i figured i had plenty of time. i was wrong. if the barbers were a bit more efficient i would have made it, but each one took a 10 minute break between customers. at 7:45 i was next and a barber had finished her customer. then decided to take a break and didn't return. she was still in the building, just not cutting any hair. i had to wait until 8:05pm for the next barber to finish her customer, and finish her break before getting my cut.i know i could call ahead to minimize the wait, but i don't really mind it. i do mind the laziness of these barbers though. i bet that they get paid by the hour instead of by the client, so there is little incentive to speed things along. even with the half-off pricing post-7pm, i am still going to look elsewhere for a place to take my simple cut.

if you just need a basic haircut, i've been to supercuts a few times and it's been a great option. most recently, i went right when it opened and was taken right away. i have straight hair and asked for two inches trimmed off and got exactly that (i've been to fancier places where somehow 2 inches turned to them cutting off 5). the hair dresser did a great job, it took 15 minutes, and, even with a 20% tip, the total cost was less than $30. i feel embarrassed thinking i used to get the exact same cut for over $70! i'm confused when i see people putting 1 star review for supercuts when they need their hair dyed/wanted something fancy because i would never go here for something like that, but for a basic cut, it's been perfect!

this place is awful. i was last here years ago and got a really bad haircut but supercuts is so close to my apartment and so convenient. this time around, i just needed a few inches cut off my hair but while i was waiting i saw the manager be super rude to ppl. one customer was explaining what she wanted and the manager was so rude. the manager made a snide remark about results and the customer being picky. then an elderly guy asked the manager a question about the charge to his credit card while he was being rung up and she was so rude, i cringed. and then i left. get your haircut somewhere else. customer service is last in this place.

the worst horrible haircut in my  life, the cut was great but the idiot sprayed my hair with a thinning solution that all but destroyed my hair, if it gets any thinner i will be bald and then i  will sue super cuts.

great haircut gladys did an awesome job and she also have me tips that were very helpful. as the saying goes you get what you pay for so keep that in mind. i've been getting my hair cut at supercuts for as long as i can remember and i've never had an issue. but i'm just one little ole person what do i know.

went in for a fade and trim on top and walked out with choppy hair. it was near closing on a friday and i had to ask the stylist twice to blend the sides in better. she was pleasant but should not be cutting hair. i had to go to another barber the next day to get it fixed.

surprised at all the negative reviews below.  this is a cheap no-frills place... and it was totally fine as such!  walked in and asked for a roots touch-up.  yvonne was available, she immediately quoted me the cost ($40) and took me in.  she was nice but not super-chatty which was just as well.  the whole thing (coloring, washing, brushing and styling) took about an hour, and she was gentle combing my super-curly easily tangled hair.  she did a nice job with the color, too.i have a feeling people with negative reviews are expecting something along the lines of fancier salons... while this one is market with one dollar sign for a reason.  my expectations were perfectly met.i'll gladly be back.

whatever you do, do not let maria cut your hair. she gave me attitude the entire time, even though my cut was nothing fancy - i only came in to trim the ends and touch up the layers. she acted like i was asking for the most elaborate and complicated style she had ever seen and argued with me when i explained that i did not have an angle, i simply was growing out bangs so it appeared to be an angle. the worst part, however, was when she flat out told me, "well i don't like it, but if you do, then whatever." maybe stylists here should be advised to keep unsolicited advice to themselves, especially when it's rude. if you're going to offer criticism, at least a. wait until i ask for your opinion or b. offer a suggestion for what you think, as a stylist, would look better, instead of just telling me that you don't like my cut... especially considering you just cut it. also considering i only got a trim, she was essentially insulting my hair in general. other than that, be prepared for a long wait, filled with watching the stylists chat about what they're doing that night, while no one's hair is being cut. and beware if you have a cartilage piercing! mine was not so gently ripped out with a comb. take it out beforehand (shouldn't hair stylists know how to handle those?) unless you want an additional hole in your ear.

i thought i was getting a good deal for getting to the tips of my hair dyed deep red. the stylist seemed to be working on more of my hair than i had asked for, so i confirmed what i wanted and showed her a picture, and she said she knew what she was doing. i left with 3/4 of my hair dyed a terrible orange red, and she charged me $20 that what i had originally wanted for some "extra process." i went home and dyed it back to my natural brown. tl;dr you could dye your hair better in your own sink.
went in for a straight trim across the bottom - no layers or angles. came out with two completely different haircuts on each side of my head. not sure i can rock this look.
