does this look even to you?? clearly the hack that provided this cut thought it was perfectly even. by far the worst haircut i've ever received.

one of the worst things about moving somewhere new is finding a decent hairdresser that won't charge you a small fortune. so i thought i would give supercuts a go because i'm generally not fussy with my hair, it's just around the corner and i'm on a budget. i should have known better. i don't even know what the stylists name was - she was blonde, surly and didn't even say hello or ask how i was. that's bare bones politeness in my opinion. i prefer not making small talk when getting a haircut, but general pleasantness should be expected. anyway - i would forgive all that if it weren't for the monstrosity of a haircut this woman bestowed upon me. it's completely uneven, hacked into on one side so much that it looks like a four year old took to one side of my head with some kitchen scissors. the ends have been chopped so bluntly, it's hideous. for the style i asked for, she should have done that zig-zag type technique on the ends. absolutely no texturing to thin out my thick hair and give it some shape through the bulkier bits....nothing. and the way my hair sits, it literally just looks like she forgot to cut the back bit. i look like i'm growing out an awful bob-mullet hybrid. the only saving grace is that i can still fit my hair back into a pony tail to hide how awful it looks when it's out. i shouldn't have walked out like that, but i didn't realise how bad it was until i got home and examined it closely. it's truly the worst haircut i've ever had. and for someone who really isn't fussy about their hair...that's saying something. i even cried because it was so damn ugly. i've tried a multitude of ways to style it, but it doesn't matter what i do...it just looks terrible. i'm going to have to get it fixed by someone else now, so instead of just originally paying someone a decent amount to cut my hair properly, i have now wasted almost $30 to have some stink eye hack ruin my hair. i'm also going to have to cut it much shorter than i originally wanted to fix what she's done. thanks a lot supercuts. never ever ever again. i would probably only recommend this place to someone i hate.

i'm one of those girls that does not care about my hair. it's long, very fine, i don't have a lot of it, and pricy haircuts in the past have not made a huge difference in terms of the look/feel. as long as i get an even haircut with subtle layers, i'm happy. with that said, i really like this place. there are no extra frills unless you want (and pay) for them. every stylist that has cut my hair here has been pretty good, and none have had an attitude (i've been coming here for two years). keep in mind that they are not going to be as experienced/skilled as stylists in more expensive salons, nor should they be since you're only paying $21 for your haircut. this is the place to stop in for a trim or simple cut on your way home, not the place to go from waist length hair to a-line bob right before an event. if you keep it simple and don't have unrealistic expectations, you will walk out with a great haircut (and damp hair unless you want to pay extra for a blowout).

so many places in the city overcharge people for a simple haircut. not this place.  i got a wash, cut, and dry for a flat fee of 47 dollars.  there was no one there so i was immediately taken and the woman was so nice and she cut my hair to my liking.  a bit hesiate to go in the beginning because of the reviews but glad i went anyway
she ruined my hair!!!! i said i wanted to keep length and she cut all of it off! livid!

there are so many bad reviews that i feel like it's important to share my experience. i went for a wash and cut. gladys cut my hair, and was very professional and friendly. she also did not rush through the cut and did a nice job. i have no complaints.

incompetent. went in for a trim and the person wouldn't do it. all they did was cut the bottom, not the layers. she never event touched the top. i asked her to and she said she can't do it. i ask he why can she simply said she can't do it, then stopped and and literally walked away. she said she wouldn't charge me, and she didn't, not even when i tried to tip her for her time (which i'm glad for now) but she left me with a butchered head. all i wanted was a trim. i said, "trim everything an inch." how is that so difficult?"
popped in on friday around 4pm. was seen immediately. great hair wash (good massaging) and the cut was good. very simple trim - about 1/2" off the ends. will return for sure!

i really like this place ! i always do there highlight ,  haircut once even when i did highlight come over with my baby and they were ok with it i recommend this place.i would like to add that i very much like the price so i go there :)
horrible customer service, over priced, and no idea how to run a business. don't use the app to check in because it means nothing and you will still wait 2 hours!!!!

marisol is absolutely the best. i've been going to her for the past year and just absolutely love her. she gives a beautiful haircut , understands what you want, and makes you feel completely comfortable. i highly recommend her. she's as amazing as a hairdresser as she is a beautiful person inside.
ask angelica if you're getting a blow dry. definitely coming here instead of going to a blow dry bar. worth the money!

gets the job done, i will definitely go back next time i need a haircut but this location is not as good as other supercuts i've been to.  rachel cut and washed my hair. i have a very basic style (straight across​) so i never like to spend more than $30 on a haircut.  she was a little rough on the shampooing, and during the cut she kept talking to other stylists which made me a little worried that she wasn't paying attention.  overall, i walked in on a saturday and didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes.  i don't know if i would recommend this place for intricate cuts or coloring.  but if you have a basic style, i'd recommend giving it a shot!

been to many hair salons and can honestly say i was taken for my money. shareif is a life saver and life changer! he fixed the many many years of horrific hair damage i had done to myself. he also educated me to prevent future damage. his professionalism is over the top. no matter how busy he is he always carries a smile. any place would be extremely lucky to have him with such talent!

i slip into supercuts every now and then if i need a trim or haircut/blowout and don't feel like paying my expensive regular salon prices. i went recently to jess and she did a great job. from the shampoo, to cut to blowout (which made my hair so soft and lasted for 3 days) i walked out very happy. on that particular day there was no wait which was a bonus as well. for the price and quality of the cut i received, i will return again.
it's second time i'm coming within opening hours and they tell me they're closed. if they only accept by appointment they should mention it. don't trust them...

don't know the name of the woman that cut my husband hair yesterday, but from the way she cut my husband hair you would think it's her first time holding a  scissor/clippers. to top it off all the women working there look angry. we will never go there again. i recommend they hire more experienced hair dressers.

i've gone here five times now because it's around the corner from where i live and cheap hoping it will finally be passable, and each time it was a disaster... uneven, like these people are holding scissors for the first time - i'm a guy with straight short hair, it's almost impossible to get wrong. also the staff are a tad unfriendly and snarky - one gets the sense they don't care one way or another.

i must say this is the worst haircut experience i've ever had. the barber clearly had no idea what she was doing. the attitude was okay but the technique was awful. usually when i got a haircut and if there's something not perfect, i'll go back home trim a little to fix it. but this time it was so terrible that i can't even makes it right. i don't often leave a review on here especially if it's negative, but today i felt that i have the responsibility to tell the truth and remind others don't repeat my mistakes and end up like me.

awful cut! i should have know better. unfortunately rachel doesn't know how to cut hair. each side was different lengths, lopsided etc. it was a mess. i had to go to someone else to make it look descent.

worst service ever! they just made me wait 20 minutes only to tell me "oh i'm sorry i don't feel comfortable washing and drying your hair"... because of my brain surgery scar! total waste of time and i felt very humiliated in front of all the other people waiting -they really need to learn how to deal with customers in a more polite manner ..that was horrible being ridiculed in front of other people

i was going to hoboken hair every other month because it was pretty cheap and close. i started to dislike the haircut i was receiving, even though it was kind of cheap. i decided i would give super cuts a try and boy am i glad i did. first of all sadé is my favorite. she gives a great cut and always has great recommendations for myself. great service and great prices.

i called ahead to ask if i could come in for highlights and a cut. i was told i could make the appointment and was told the price for the service. while i was on my way to the appointment, they called me and asked if i could get there earlier because apparently they needed more time to do my hair, which was why i called to ask in the first place. when i told them i was almost there (which was even before my original appointment), they told me i couldn't come and that the price they originally gave me was not correct. this experience tells me that they are extremely disorganized. i would have liked to have been told that i couldn't come in the first place so that i was not rushing to the appointment. when i had previously been there for a cut, i had to wait, even when i had made an appointment and the stylists acted annoyed that i was even there. i will not be going back.
was exactly what i was looking for! 21$ including tip hair cut (no wash) and blow dry! shaday (spelling may be totally off) was sweet fast and professional!
i had two great experiences at this salon. sade, was my stylist and she rocks. she gave me my best cut in the past five years.the online check-in service was helpful too.

i have been going to this location for about 7 years and i had a very bad experience this morning. i had to mention this so others wont have this issue ever again. hopefully management will notice. it's been a couple weeks since i returned to get my normal haircut, with cindy and when i arrived at 8:05 this morning to get my haircut, i was told "she doesn't work here anymore" with an attitude. i thought nothing of it until they actually shut the door on me, when the hours state 8:00 am until 8:00 pm. i stood outside for a couple of minutes to wait and noticed they were drinking coffee in the back while i waited outside and it was 8:05 am. are you serious? that is so rude. why ? very bad hospitality. i would stay away from this location and go to the one on route 3. never again will i return.

if i could give this place 0 stars and still leave a review i would. avoid at all costsi usually get my hair cut at super cuts, i just moved to the area and went here a few days before an interview to get my cut cleaned up and i walked out fuming.the girl cutting my hair left it choppy (in a bad way) and very visibly uneven. she cut my hair wet, dried it, showed it to me and i told her it wasn't what i wanted could she please fix it--she says ok and starts dry cutting my hair!! i have straight hair, it should not be dry cut, ever!i walked out very upset. i went to another local place -- avanti beauty -- and when the woman there saw my hair she said "oh my god what did she do to you!"avoid. at. all. costs.
$18 for a haircut is pretty steep.   the cut was fine, no complaints, but i can get the same cheaper elsewhere.i can say though that i had a short wait for a walk-in.  that's always a plus.
a very nice stylist named nailah cut my hair. she did a great job and was very pleasant. will definitely be going back again

absolutely awful!!  if i could give it no stars i would. i set up an online appointment and when i walked in there were two women working and i was treated as though i was bothering them. and although there was no line, a man who had walked in a couple minutes before me with no appointment was taken before me and then i had to wait for the woman to sweep the floors and finish her conversation with her co-worker before she would take me. she also informed me that my appointment should have been cancelled since they only accept appointments made one hour in advance. there was no mention of this on the website and at the time, there was only myself and one guy in there. and again i felt unwelcome like i was bothering them! then, i asked for a simple trim straight across, nothing difficult. she cut my hair quickly and instead of thoroughly inspecting how straight my hair was cut (which is difficult since i have long dark hair that blends into the black cloak you have on), i assumed she cut it correctly and even gave her an $8 tip on an $18 trim. unfortunately, i came home washed and dried my hair and saw that it was completely chopped! a five year old could have done a better job!  i now need to go get it cut again in order to fix the mess she made of my hair!!  if i could reverse the charge, i would. i should not have to pay to be treated rudely and have my hair hacked!i will never go here again. i assumed anyone working at a hair place would understand what a straight line is and how to trim hair!! obviously not here....absolutely awful!!!!

dear long hairs: it is not worth it if you want to save money and/or time. trust me, you do not want to risk it.it is better if you wait one/two more days or simply spend the double or triple at a professional hair salon. sincerely,exlonghair girl.

i still prefer going to my usual barbershop, but my schedule lately meant that last saturday was the only good day to get a haircut...and my boys are closed on saturday.so, with a 5k coming up this weekend, i need that aerodynamic boost that only my usual buzz cut can provide. do you even laws of physics, bro?anyway, supercuts was sufficient for a quick buzz. i guess they are used to more intricate work, and the ladies working there got a laugh when i said  "just gimme a 2 on top, 1 on the sides, square in the back" - i was probably one of the fastest cuts and easiest customers they've had to work on.it was a little pricier than my usual place (18 vs 15), but yeah, it was fine for me. ready to race!

pros: i got in fast but it was also the middle of the day. the hair stylist i had did a good job on my hair. cons: the hairstylist i had wasn't too friendly. i also had a hard time understanding her because of her thick russian accent. when she was cutting my hair she kept pulling on it. it hurt so bad that my eyes watered.  for the love of god don't come here. save your money(also your beautiful locks) and don't come here. i do not recommend this place at all.

this is probably the worse place to get your hair cut. when i walked into this store the smell was so bad. they didn't do a good job on the haircut i had. one side hair was longer than the other. i've had better haircuts paying the same prices at other salons. i do not recommend.

after my long-time hair dresser sadly quit and abandon me of eleven (11) years i had to find another hair salon, but with a budget i am unable to seek a high-end salon.  without an appointment, i waited five short minutes to be seated.  the hair dresser washed my hair with shampoo and conditioner and then cut it to my desired length as requested.  after the cut was completed she did not blow dried my hair leaving it wet as i roam in the streets of new york for the rest of the day.iman, my assigned hair dresser is not computer savvy as she does not know how to work a cash register to duplicate the hair cut transaction two times overcharging me.  i voiced her overcharge transaction loudly making her nearby colleague aware of her gross error which was evidently rectified.  the wash and cut came out to be $21.00 (with sales tax), but with this unpleasant register transaction plus no blow dry i gave iman a $4.00 tip.

this place is horrible went for a haircut showed the lady a picture of the haircut i wanted she asked if i wanted my hair trimmed she showed me a length to trim and told her yes and what happens she cuts it way past that and ends up cutting half the hair off of my head

why can't fh have a decent place to get a haircut. after having a terrible experience at a barbershop in the same area i can here, and boy was that a mistake. immediately after being seated and my cut began, an angry customer came i. and took photos of the licenses of my stylist because he was outraged at the cut and customer service he received.it was too late for me to get up and leave so i had to sit through. she completely disregarded my instructions, kept asking "how's this?", didn't seem to understand how to blend as i had to remind her.  complexity missed my neckline, looked like some kind of weird rat tail / mullet situation.steer clear.

today was my 2nd visit at super cuts of forest hills ny. susan did again a wonderful work on my pixie cut and color. i returned because as a busy mother, with tight schedule between soccer and over activities, i found that the cut and color susan mastered about three months ago, grew into a beautiful long pixie while the highlights she applied last time still last till this day, when she only needed to do my roots. as it grew i kept getting compliments on my long pixie and highlights and asked if i visited the salon recently. that's a bonus, yes cost and time effective, but most importantly, i didn't feel that pressure of, "i am in a dire need to do my hair and soon!" i appreciate that the salon and staff seem to have their regulars' loyalty, from children to teenagers, to middle aged and so on. the atmosphere there is a nice combo between an 80's and 90's, plus some contemporary, playing in the background while the hair masters chat nicely and ask their next costumer what they would like to change or keep about their hair ....i like being there reading my book while my color is settling in, or chat with susan while she flawlessly is back and forth between me and another costumer. thank you susan and team, i will be back! gigi
susanne cut and colored my hair and she's fabulous. i got nothing but compliments from everyone!

i wish i could give this place negative 5 stars.  i usually go to michicche salon down the block, but i had to get my kids' hair cut last minute for school pictures and decided to just take them to supercuts this one time since they didn't require an appointment. i figured, how bad can it be? they only need a trim. when we walked in, the place was empty.  that should have given me a clue that i should walk us right back out. there were 2 "hairdressers" that were just sitting in the chairs and talking. so one of them takes my son first. i explained to her that she only needed to give him a trim, nothing special. she gets the buzzer out and as soon as she starts to buzz the back of his hair i already know it's not going to go well. she looked like she'd never given a haircut in her life. what he ended up with was something that looked like someone placed a bowl on top of his head and cut around it. my son is very particular about his hair and when he saw what she did to it he looked miserable. i put on my happy face and told him it looked good, but i was fuming. i wanna drop kick the woman at this point. not only did he have the dreaded bowl cut, but it was choppy and uneven. i could have created the monstrosity myself at home, probably would have done better. my daughter is taken next and i'm praying to god that hers turns out different. not! this woman was way worse than the one that cut my son. my daughter's hair was down to the middle of her back and she wanted to have it cut to her shoulders. i asked the woman if she could give her some layers because she has so much hair that it looks really bulky in the back. she proceeds to look at me like i have ten heads, or am speaking a different language. her confusion worries me so i think better of it and tell her to forget the layers. she gets ready to start cutting and looks all sorts of awkward and inexperienced holding the scissors. she didn't even wet her hair. i'm no expert, but i've never had a "dry" haircut. i realize there is no hope for this haircut to turn out any different than my son's.  they must have an adverse reaction to evenly cut hair because, like my son, my daughter ended up with her hair being longer on one side. i was fully aware that my kids wouldn't be getting a state of the art haircut at this place because, well, you get what you pay for and all that, but i figured these people would atleast have some basic cutting skills and be able to pull off a damn trim. needless to say, if i ever find myself in a jam again, i will be cutting my kids' hair myself. there is not a chance in hell i could do a worse job than these so called hairdressers. epic fail supercuts. epic fail!

shea moved to another salon and the woman who cut my hair this time wasn't as good by a long shot. i didn't wash my hair before going, usually they wash it for me. the woman asks me if i want a wash as well and i tell her yes, i just don't want any shampoo or conditioner used- just water. she doesn't want to do this. instead she tells me to just sit in the chair and she'll spray my hair with some water. my hair isn't clean and this doesn't really work. i ask for layers and a trim. it's simple, but she doesn't spend a lot of time on me before she says she's done. i had asked for "as many layers as she could fit into my head" and i barely see any. i show her where to shorten it up and add more, and she does, but she also tells me my hair is too greasy to see the layers. um...no. my hair is greasy, because you refused to wash it for me, but i can still see the haircut. so she finishes and i tell her next time we'll wash it- and i stress with water only- because i'm allergic to many products. she replies, "that's ok, we have products for sensitive people". jesus, no, that's not what i said. shea never had a problem just water washing my hair and i don't understand the insistence here, or the implied refusal to wash my hair without products. it's cool, i'm not going to argue with you about it, i'm just going to go somewhere else.after i got home, washed and blowed out my hair i notice a distinct lack of layers. there's one layer in the front, and a longer one in the back. two layers isn't really what i was after and i don't know what else i could have said to get...well, layers. anyway, i hope shea is happy where she is, maybe i'll find her in my search for a new salon.

i was there for a haircut today. dalia took me right away and asked what i desired. i gave her the exact description of what i wanted. she started the cut, and asked questions along the way to make sure that i got what i wanted. she also offered some advice as far as how i could change my cut. it showed that she cared. my only concern was that she didnt do the hot towel at the end which helps clean up the loose hair. overall: good haircut, decent price, dalia is better than the other stylist that i had previously seen there.

you pay for what you get.  i was in a complete pinch for a trim so i stopped in. i should have known from the wash - if you can call it that. i was at the sink for maybe 90 seconds. she barely washed my hair, and i swear there was no conditioner.  i had to brush my own hair because she needed to check her facebook.  she asked how much to take off, i showed her. instead of the half inch i showed her, she took off two full inches.  two. full. inches. then she stuck me under the drier so she could cut someone else's hair. for 20 minutes. when i finally got back to the chair, she attempted the worst blowout i've ever had.  i walked out with curly, frizzy pieces of hair in the back, and the front looked plastered to my forehead. when i expressed my disappointment, she dismissed me. i went home to wash and redry my hair. never. again.
i noticed after i posted this that she cut my hair unevenly. my right side is a good 1/2-1" longer than my left side. really lame, supercuts.
they completely botched my eyebrows, half of it is missing! i specifically said not to make them thinner! do not come here!

had a great experience! i walked in at seven pm and got a perfect cut and color in under an hour. this place provides great service and extremely reasonable prices unlike other salons in forest hills. the stylist was very friendly and listened to what i wanted, she picked out a great highlighting color for my jet black hair. the blowout was also fast and painless being i have ethnic curly hair which many salons don't know out to properly cut. this place is a must for great affordable service!
the barber was friendly, fast and skilled. the location had no lines and the hair cut was exactly what i wanted. only concern is that the price is a little high.

sue cuts my hair, i don't have to worry about a thing and always get compliments, even from strangers. and the hair snobs cannot believe i go to supercuts. i guess when you find the right haircutter it doesn't matter where they work :)

do they have the most skilled stylists? probably not. so if you're a woman who absolutely must have have the perfect haircut, then this place isn't for you. but if you're a guy who just needs a clean cut look every month or so, then this place is perfect. waits are usually not long and prices are reasonable.

do not go here. i took my 7year old niece for a simple/no frills haircut and it was so uneven that i took her to spectrum to have it fixed right after. i shouldn't have paid or given a tip, but i am not evil. there was an older woman also getting her hair done at the same time and she kept saying her hair was uneven as well. i should have known better. $15 isn't worth it.  walk two stores down and get a quality haircut!

i went here to get a quick haircut because my normal stylist was on vacation and i needed to go somewhere nearby.i made an appointment online for a wash & cut. i came in and waited 30 minutes for a pre-made appointment. once i was put in the chair the stylist didn't offer to wash my hair, sloppily put the bib on me and started cutting. now asking me my cut, what i wanted or how short. the woman wouldnt give me her name, presumably because i was visibly annoyed. she cut my hair uneven, 3 inches shorter than i wanted and then asked why i wasn't tipping her.her name is susan. the only reason i know that is because a friend of mine walked in, asked her and walked out.don't waste even $20 there.
ana did exactly what i wanted with my hair. she recommended me the right products. awesome service. thank you ana for my lovely haircut
i went in for a trim, and i had to let the hairdresser know that she cut my hair completely uneven. but, then again...i shouldn't complain much since it was a $20 haircut.

i got my haircut by stephanie. i was taken right away, and she discussed with me exactly how i wanted my hair cut. she then proceeded to give me a great detailed haircut. after that, she gave me the hot towel, followed by a shampoo, and styling my hair.she was a good conversationalist, and didn't rush.i encourage all men to get their haircut by stephanie. i certainly will come back to her.

my wife went here friday evening. she originally called for a blow dry and was quoted $35.she arrives to a rude woman who tells her it will be $48. she asked why the extra charge? to which she came up with nonsense.... since it was friday evening, it was too late to go to anyone else so she stayed. they tortured her hair and did a horrible job. they even had a audacity to ask for a tip!stay away from this crap whole, the other reviewers are correct as well these people are unprofessional, crooks, and completely incompetent!!!!!

hi, i gave them another try & found out why i shouldn't have! this is the second time in 2 yrs that they royally messed up the simplest haircut ever. i asked for a classic cut , no layers, angled towards the face with my hair being slightly longer in front than the back. both rose & now anna, couldn't seem to get it right & did the haircut in reverse, with it being shorter in front. she ended up needing to cut a full inch more than what i wanted to 'fix' it. a horror. i'm not sure what to say other than they both admitted to their mistake & looked embarrassed. messing up a woman's hair is a sin. honestly, i'm never going back. be careful how you describe anything to them & ask them to repeat it back before they cut.

i have only had 1 supercuts experience and it was literally - ok. i had a an appointment for 930am to be in and out - which i was. i was the first and only person in their aside from my stylist, anna. she was bright eyed and ready to go. she was chatty but not annoying. i asked for a very simple cut. i asked for my ends to be trimmed, which they were but not enough was taken off. i dont think i will go back. cheap price but you get what you pay for. 3 stars because i was in and out, price is cheap, and anna was nice.

consistently awful. i came her reluctantly because because we needed to get a cut. i vowed never to go again but came again because my regular hair cutter went mia. several years ago my son got a bad cut by an inexperienced hair cutter who drew blood by clipping my son's ear. so bad. you can just tell the inexperience by the service and lack of confidence by the hair cutters. my son asked for a trim with a bit longer on top and got buzzed on the side and top and the two were poorly blended so that a hard line still shows. my son is so upset he's been in his room sulking all day and vowed not to go to school tomorrow because of the embarrassment. avoid at all costs.

just wanted to give kudos to rosa at the bell blvd supercuts. i have long wavy hair and rosa took the time to listen to what i wanted and executed the haircut to perfection.  she told me she was going to give me a $100 haircut and she did (of course it really only cost less than $20.00).  she is talented, caring and a true asset to supercuts

today christy saved my life. or at least my look. i had gone to a borderline hipster salon in flushing earlier and asked for an edgy asymmetrical pixie cut. i showed them pictures of what i wanted and was careful to use words like "choppy" and "punk". after two hours of meticulous snipping and very little of letting me see what the heck he was doing, i ended up looking like a sound of music-obsessed soccer mom. that was not what i was going for. i lasted one afternoon before i just couldn't live with this haircut anymore and ran to the nearest hair salon: supercuts. there, i saw christy with her colored locks and covered tattoos and instantly felt hope. she had all the right questions, understood my woes completely and regaled me with entertaining stories of misunderstandings between customers and stylists. in a matter of minutes, she transformed my hair misfortune into a hair miracle. thank you to christy and supercuts on bell!

came in to get my haircut was approached by anna literally got the worst haircut of my life it looks like a 3 year old gave me a cut dont go here better off going across the street to hair studio 41 for a real barber experience

the place needs to completely replace their staff.  consistently terrible customer service.  hire employees with character and work ethic.  just because you are not the owner or manager does not mean that you can get away with treating paying customers like crap.  fire all of them and replace them.

the service here is consistently awful. i was worried on my first visit when a customer was arguing with the staff, i should have known to not buy a haircut package then. and even when the staff struggled to use the system that required me to pay $0.53 sales tax on the card it should have been clear to me. today was the last straw when i was quoted a wait of 20 mins, only to be left staring at them when 30 mins passed. and then when it was 45 mins in someone else who came in after me complained and was told they would be next i knew that it was over. i asked when i could expect someone and they all just stared at me. i walked out after an hour. i left my supercuts card. i won't need it ever again, anywhere. why can't i give zero stars?

after coming here for the past 10 years (since i was 13) i've decided to take my business elsewhere. call in for an appointment and they still tell you to wait 45 minutes. as for quality of haircut, you just have to get lucky. i can't stay loyal to this place i once loved any longer.

inez is the worst stylist ever!!!!!!!!!  she ruined my 15 month old sons hair. it was his first haircut and she destroyed his beautiful locks. she never even consulted me how to cut his hair, she just started cutting!!!!! not only is it waaaaayyyyy too short, it's completely uneven!!!!!! thank god he's too little to undergo ridicule from his peers but i feel terrible that i allowed this to happen to him. please take the scissors away from this awful woman!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

i did a walk in today at supercuts, and was taken right away. the first lady at the counter was a bit abrupt, but i brushed it off and it was taken over by my stylist. i was the only customer at the time. the girl that did my hair, arianna, was nice and tried to make small talk, but i'm always awkward at talking during my haircut. she was very knowledgeable and gave me her input on what would look better, but still leaving it up to me. i have had many stylists tell me how it should go and that was the only way. i also wanted to get my eyebrows waxed, which arianna also took me back to do. she  seemed to have trouble - tried twice to get under my eyebrow and ripped out the wrong way (she went with the growth, not against). she then went to get another girl (the girl who greeted me originally) who took care of me and did a good job.i usually get my hair done at supercuts - what can i say? i've never had a bad experience and it's good for the price. this supercuts wasn't great, but not bad. they did decent work.

i preface this by saying i am a black guy...this matters?so a funny thing happened when i went to super cuts on an evening after work, i went in because i was looking for a basic 'take all the hair off'' buzz. there were two women and one asian guy there. as soon as i walked in, the two women walked into the back and when this poor asian guy went to get the person whose turn it was, she actually refused to cut my hair. the asian guy wound up cutting it, he did a reasonable facsimile of a haircut and then proceeded to apologetically  tell me how it was against super cuts policy to use rubbing alcohol on a freshly cut head, they recommended some perfume which would have made me break-out due to my sensitive skin. then there was a full-on summit to decide the price. good news is they didn't over-charge me but that was my first and last time in any super cuts...ever.

my son's long hair was shaved when dad asked to please only trim.  he loved his hair and feels embarrassed and ashamed.  shame on you natasha for doing this to a 6 years old.  beware who cuts your hair!!!!!!!!

had my hair cut there about 2 months ago with arianna. she was very nice and did a great cut and color on my hair.  but i called today and she is no longer with the salon.  anyone have any idea where she went to?

i've been to other supercuts, this one is by far the worst i've ever been to. i came here one day after work with a friend because my usual hair stylist at a salon was on vacation and i needed my hair done for a night out.i can't even explain how disappointed i was. i showed the girl a picture of the haircut i wanted, explained it in full detail, and i guess she decided she didn't want to do it, so she did something completely different. my bangs were butchered so i had to keep them up in a clip until my girl came back from vacation and could fix them. all she did was complain about how dry my hair was and then insisted i get the deep conditioning, needless to say she didn't sell me on it. and last but not least - what really annoyed me - i asked for my hair to be blow dried and straightened. she dried my hair with a brush and dryer, and then literally took a few pieces of my hair, ran over it real quick with the most out-dated inefficient flat iron i've ever seen (didn't even do my whole head or in layers) and said "ok!", complimented herself on such a nice job, and then slapped a nice little fee onto the bill for "straightening" my hair. i could've done a better job myself with my iron at home. my friend wanted to get her hair done as well, she had to wait until i was done, and by the time i was, she was so turned off by the way they did my hair that she told them nevermind. some of the staff is very nice, the others have such horrible attitudes. they charge for every little thing, and they overprice for the work that they do.i will never return here again, and believe me i have not recommended this place since my visit, nor will i in the future. i'd trust my 10 year old niece to do my hair before i come here again.

a $15.99 haircut is now $18.00 - everyone who worked there left - they won't honor coupons from corporate - you make an appointment and show up and they don't have your appointment.  it's a major disappointment - it will just be a matter of time before they have to shut down because no one will want to go there any longer.

i have a great experience every time i come with my kids people are super nice and friendly! but we love rosalva she's super sweet and always makes sure we're happy with our haircuts, totally recommend her!

hiwhat an experience at this locationi went here with my sonwe say hello and nobody reply back wow i am looking i went to counter this guy pointed at flat screen okfirst they try to make me give info and i refused it was first last phone and email to much info i respectfully decline and one of the lady's with glasses looked at me with the greatest discuss i have ever seen my son got his hair cut to short my hare dresser was asking me every second can i cut this can i cut that and the lady with glasses swept my feet and doesn't say sorry i was not comfortable or delighted customer service is dead herei will not return sorry

i had been visiting another supercuts location, when my go to dresser retired. so i had to start over again...well carleen is fantastic! i visited on a saturday 6/17 and the place was moving despite the rain. she's definitely a doll, listened and got it right. i have medium length hair and needed to clean up my split ends in layers with a face frame trim and she nailed it! can't be happier..thank you carleen! i will definitely be back again.
i go to this location even though it's not the closest one to me.  rosalva has been amazing....very nice, professional and gives really good haircuts.

this place should be ashamed to call itself a business. my mother in law who is in her 80's went in for a trim and they took off 5 inches and had the balls to charge her.  what happened to listening to your customers.  stay away go some place else.  do not waste your money

this places surpassed all of my expectations .  i called in first and explained that i needed a very bad haircut fixed . i wasn't specific enough that i needed a wash, cut , blow dry but was accomodated anyway. carleen was the fastest, most efficient hairdresser i have ever met. she took me from wash to cut/dry in under 40 minutes. most importantly , she completly fixed my bad haircut.  this was a huge undertaking, as i had uneven layers all over my head . the only way to fix everything was to cut the hair until it was one even length . voila ! it was done quickly and for 35.00. i cannot thank this salon enough for giving me my hair back .

i usually go there every two weeks. i tend to get a different stylist everytime. however, that is going to change. when i came in i was warmly greeted by rosalva. i was then seated, and she began to cut my hair. she understood exactly what i wanted. before i knew it i was all finished. rosalva is now the only person to cut my hair in supercuts. great quality , and care is the soul reason why i will be coming back! thank you rosalva.

very disappointed with my experience at supercuts today.  i was met by two individuals who didn't seem that knowledgable about hair - and really didn't seem to care either.  one was openly eating her lunch in front of customers and was not very professional at check-in.  they advised me on the total price of my various styling choices with calculator in hand like i couldn't afford them and were just making sure i could pony up the cash at the end of the visit.  i don't think i was ever treated like that before and it was very unprofessional to say the least.  i ended up leaving with a sub-par style.  i used to go here a lot - decided to visit again today - but it most certainly is my last visit.

amazing haircut !! short wait.   normally i go to a very expensive salon. i ran in here on whim in desperate need of a cut because i couldn't get into my salon and saw rich.  i haven't been back to my salon since !!!

had my hair cut by rosy gomez today. i told her i wanted a two in trim and to clean up my long layers. she ended up cutting a very thick choppy layer that was as short as my chin!i usually get haircuts in nyc that are about $100+, but decided a trim in between actual hair appointment couldn't go wrong....wrong! two other women had to come over to help when she realized she messed up. beware, this is where good hair goes to die.

terrible haircut by rosalva. she asked me if i prefer clippers or scissors. i could have done it with clippers at home if i'm paying of course i want scissors. so she started cutting my hair. i wasn't happy with the length. she was nice to shorten it, but when the number of customers waiting are increased at 5 pm on sunday with two stylist (or just haircutter) she panicked a little bit. when she was done it was totally unsymmetrical. i told her and she said you are right and did couple of more scissor cuts and still same. people were waiting i said forget about it and left. i shouldn't give her any dime but left a good tip.so i came home i did my hair clippers symmetrical! when i was young i had accidents using the clippers and was running to the barbershop to fix it. now i go to supercuts, pay for the haircut and running to home to fix it! ridiculous. i want my money back!

i used to come to this place ever month for about a year, not anymore. last time i was here i decided never to go back. price is very good but the way they cut my hair just wasn't doing it. i asked her to use only scissors and she agreed to it, but ad the end she ended up cutting my hair with a machine. i would rather pay more and get a better hair cut.

i feel like this place should be way more popular! i usually have terrible experiences going to other chains, but this supercuts has great stylists at awesome prices. today they were swamped but the girl taking care of me took her time and didn't half ass her job. she went out of her way to great clients as they walked in and would excuse herself when the phone rang -- she did a hell of a job being by herself. great place -- definitely worth it and the place to get a trim.

i've been coming here for about a year. carleen is the best ever, very attentive, friendly and professional.  i won't let anyone else touch my roots.  so happy to have found her, keep up the great work.
i love this place !!!!! best haircut.   see rich!!!.  you will not be disappointed.   expensive haircut for cheap !!!

i have been coming to supercuts in edgewater for over a year to get 2 weekly blowouts. i've seen this salon decline in every way in the last 2 months. i have decided not to come back and these are my reasons. there is only 1 person there from opening until 11 am during the week so getting my blowout in the morning became a problem. i would watch 3-5 people walk in and walk out because of the wait times or no one available. this salon is losing a lot of customers for being understaffed and not with qualified people. how rude is it that you arrive for your appointment and as you are getting ready to sit to be washed someone else walks in and your told sorry i must take walk in haircuts before an appt for a blow out?? i'm left sitting there an extra 15-20 minutes until they are done plus the time it takes to get my hair done. that's unheard of for any salon to treat their clients with such disregard. another time i called about 6 times between 9 am - 10 am to get no answer. that was strange since the salon opens at 9:00 am. when i get there almost 10:30 am rich the manager was there by himself. i said why didn't anyone answer the phone. i was trying to call to come in. he said with an attitude it's only me here and i'm too busy to answer the phone. i had to come back at 12:00 pm if i wanted my blowout done. if your unprofessional with an attitude people will simply go elsewhere near by. i was also told by the manager last week he is raising prices on many of the services. i said why would anyone come to supercuts if your now charging more than a full service salon? he said it's nothing personal whether i liked it or not. if big changes for the better do not happen this salon is and is already losing a major amount of business by having these manager and scheduling problems. i never had any issues prior to these changes and enjoyed coming to my weekly appointments with carlina and rosey. they do the best blowouts and that's why i chose to keep coming here over a year now. i had my last straw with this place and had to find another salon to do my hair every week. my review is don't even waste your time coming there. for those prices go to a full service salon by appointment.

looking for rude, unprofessional staff, wait times of over an hour and a staff turnaround that makes even fox news look stable? look no further than the supercuts in edgewater, nj. as an added bonus, the staff (like rosalva) will skip you over their "favorite customers" regardless of how long you've been waiting there. don't waste your time here. plenty of better options in the area like the sportsclips down the road for a comparable price.
nice environment. i like the computer check-in process. the service was great and very friendly staff. he gave me a good haircut!

went for a blowout before a last minute night out. they suggested a quick haircut and it was much needed. ..dead ends gone and blowout looked great!!  also lasted several days! will definitely be going back

they asked $43 for my 7 yrs old daughter hair, just for shampoo and flat iron!!!!!be aware!!! they have no idea what they are talking about.i left the store, went to ulta they did shampoo + hair cut + blow dry with much more experienced service and paid only $22.

check in online before going to the salon for a much reduced wait time. i got a layered haircut for $20, added a $4 off coupon i got for signing up for the supercuts mailing list online (be sure to do this well in advance, the coupon takes more than an hour to be emailed).  it's very clean inside with friendly staff. the salon is actually up the set of stairs of building 108, it's on the second floor to the right. the haircut was just what i needed, really unless you're getting an insanely complicated haircut it doesn't make sense to pay the price of a normal salon. supercuts is much more reasonable in price and is very good quality!

i have had good experiences here in the past, but the last time i was here it felt and looked like the hairstylist was a child cutting their doll's hair. she did not listen to what i wanted and then went ahead and gave me god-awful short layers. i never asked for layers and when i saw her chopping away, i asked if that was what she was doing, creating layers. i then decide, and told she, fine, layers, but only if they are short.my stylist was stubborn and when i drew attention to her not even parting my hair the way i normally wear it, she ignored it. she only did so at the end when cutting my bangs. again, it's the luck of the draw when you come here. i should have asked to see one of the women whom i had before who was good. unfortunately the one i found to be fantastic has probably, and rightfully so, moved on to a better salon. as for now, i'm going to pay the same amount i paid here for a haircut just to get a bang trim. eve that was too difficult for her. i can't entirely fix this haircut because the layers are ridiculously short, forcing me to wait a few months.i'd also like to add that my stylist was way more interested in gossip about the salon than her task.

i made a huge mistake going to supercuts. this person was inexperienced and very unsure of herself. she keep asking me for directions including what scissors to use. she used very dull layering shears that kept crimping my hair. the worst part,  she started layering an inch away from my scalp result in the ridiculousness pictured here. i was clear i did not want bangs, and she lobbed off a huge chunk of hair on the right side of my face. appalling.

i wish i could give this place zero stars. i made an online suggested appointment for 745. i walked in around 735 and was barely acknowledged. one of the hairdressers who i assume was the owner had finished cutting her persons hair a little before 8, she then proceeded to take 20 minutes to ring them up to pay. afterward she chatted with them and made phone calls instead of helping me. i waited until 830 before i finally walked out. i am absolutely disgusted by their professionalism. i was not acknowledged even once while i was sitting their for over 45minutes. thy should learn how to treat customers. absolutely disgusted by them! will absolutely never go back.

i started going to the montague st. supercuts because of the very long wait time at  university place.  i am so very happy i changed location.   i love donna.  i have seen her 3 times and she has given me a fabulous cut each time.    i will definitely be going back.     thank you donna.

had a great experience with donna. she gave me a wash and blow dry. my hair came out much more gorgeous than i expected. she is super talented and sweet. will come back again! 5 stars!i came back, emma a manager , seems to be having a very bad day. she had a harsh attitude in her tone towards me and another customer. 3 stars.

gemma was extremely rude to my sister when she walked in to get a haircut. she sat down and immediately gemma started criticizing my sisters hair and implying that she did not want to cut my sisters hair. my sister finally got uncomfortable and left, gemma seemed pleased by this. don't go here, they lost two customers in the span of 3 minutes.

5 stars !!! a hidden gem ! had an outstanding haircut with nina today!!! i have very fine medium length hair which is hard to grow long without lots of special care and treatment. pair that with my [prior] dislike for actually getting a haircut and you have some seriously split ends! i finally caved in and decided to get it trimmed after work today. it had been about 1.5 years since my last cut and it was noticeably crispy at the bottom (yea, not a word you'd want to use to describe hair) !this was the best haircut i've had! the actual haircut/trim (not including the consultation), took about 5 mins and i could tell and even more so, feel the difference immediately. nina really respected my wishes for the appointment and is very trustworthy if you're worried about too much hair going missing lol.  i'm a wash and go type, so this was absolutely perfect for my personality -my ideal haircut is no more than 10 mins and pretty much in and out. my hair is also easy to cut because of the texture/light weight. i'm sure if you wanted a more styled cut, and lots of time taken, that nina would also be good for you. i just want to emphasize that my haircut wasn't rushed at all- it was exactly what i wanted. the ability to understand the client well and respect their needs is a true gift that nina has in spades. i've been to several high end salons & spas, aveda salons, and four different supercuts locations besides this one, but i've never felt as comfortable or been as happy ! there was no wait time, the salon is easy to find and very clean. also seems child friendly. i will absolutely be back, i've already recommend nina to two of my friends, and having such a positive experience really changed the way i see getting a haircut :)

horrible! i went there thinking that nothing could go wrong since i only wanted a simple layered bob. i was so wrong!! i am irritated and shocked that this woman has a license to cut hair. she butchered my hair,it looked like a 5 year old did it. before i left the salon,i knew it wasn't great but it wasn't bad either. but when i left and really took a good look,everything was un even!! i took some of the photos of my poor hair. i didn't make a scene at the salon because i am not the type of person who does that,i really thought i could grow it out and wait for another haircut. it was horrendous that i had to fix it at the same day at another salon. i don't know who did my hair because she didn't introduce herself. she had curly hair and that's all i know. do yourself a favor and do not go to this salon!! they will ruin your hair!

i came in for a haircut and specified that i would not  like my shoulder-length hair to be cut short: i wanted only a trim and a haircut that mostly shaped my existing haircut.  i was asked to remove my glasses which meant i could not see what was going on.  when kamla was done, i had a super- short cut and even though it was not bad as haircuts go,  i was shocked and quite unhappy.  i will return to gemma next time.

be prepared to wait, even if you have an appointment. the app the company uses needs to be improved.gemma is wonderful at what she does. she has been in the business for countless years. hair stylists are good at what they do, and listen. super cuts is for an affordable hair cut.if you are a man, great. they will take you before anyone else - even if you have an appointment.
i got an outstanding cut and color by jeff today after work! i had great conversations and walked away reinvention! highly recommend!!

i've been back a couple of times now, including getting a trim by nina as well as a trim a few months ago by another woman.  i have no idea what happened to tony but so far there have been no mishaps with my trims.  i've never gotten my hair washed or blown out at supercuts, just trimmed which is fine for $18.76 + tip.

i went here once. i got a trim. she cut my hair uneven. next haircut i got they had to fix it. never will use supercuts again. you get what you pay for when it comes to haircuts usually. i learned that the hard way.

just got a wash and cut from rosie, she is such a nice and sweet person and an awsome hairdresser. i am soo hooked with her. loved the cut and she gave me tips to soft my hair. i am gonna be a regular here from now on... ask for rosie she is best.

excellent service at a reasonable price. i typically pay 70 dollars to get my hair cut, but i need to start budgeting now and can unfortunately no longer afford to go to my favorite salon. i was very satisfied not only with the service, but with the quality hair cut that i received from this salon. i will definitely be returning!
was one of the finest experiences i had. got my hair done in $20 and the service which was provided to me was really great. would surely recommend this to a friend of mine.
donna gave me the best blowout and was quick, friendly and professional.  intend to go back for cut and color.
alainya was great! i have very long hair and getting a hair cut stresses me out. i explained what i wanted, she repeated to me and explained in detail, and did a great job. i will definitely be back!

i was really skeptical about going here since i hadn't been since i was a child, haha, but being on a budget you have limited options in nyc. i have long curly hair and not everyone knows how to cut it properly without making me look ridiculous. however nina did the greatest job! i am in love with how it looks now!! definitely will be going back to her from now on. everything from booking the appointment to the price everything was such a great experience.

i had pretty much given up on getting my hair colored in salons since no one seemed to be able do it right. tony suggested a red violet brown and my hair looks beautiful! in addition to being a true professional, he is also a great friendly guy to spend a couple of hours with.
sad that at 20 minutes before closing they lock the door. wanted to buy some product but sweeping girl flat out ignored me.  lost a customer in me - plenty of other places to go

just went in today as a walk in and was very well taken care of.  i was just looking for a place where i could go on my lunch break but i was also tired of the high prices of other places.  i am happy i was able find both.  chelsea was my stylist and did a great job.  she took time to listen to what i want to have done.  all the great reviews of her here on yelp are well deserved.  i'm glad i'm not the only one.  definitely an asset for the salon.  great prices and great service.  looking forward to going back next month.

i don't think i'll be taking my son back here. i could have done a better job myself. my son was there last week for a cut and i said to keep it long without layers. the girl was very nice that cut his hair but the more i look at it the more it pisses me off. it's hair and will grow back but the girl needs additional training. it's unacceptable!

chelsea was my stylist and she was great!  i was a bit apprehensive because i hadn't had my hair cut in sometime and it was a bit straggly looking.  she cut about 2" and gave me a nice blow out.  she also answered my questions about how to cover my grays.  service was immediate and prompt.  i will be back to see chelsea so she can cover my grays and give me a conditioning treatment.  price is right.  this location may be hard to find.  its directly behind the strip mall that houses shoe carnival, gap outlet, five below, etc.  supercuts faces the acme.

chelsea did a wonderful wash and blow dry on me. she's very meticulous and cheerful which leads me to always come back to her. her attention to detail is amazing. conversation is always great and she makes me feel comfortable and at ease while sitting in her chair. i'm not a fan of chain salons but i'll always make sure i get my cut and blow dry with chelsea!

i stopped in yesterday, 7/19/15,  to get a haircut. everyone was extremely friendly and accommodating. did not have to wait at all. christina gave me an awesome cut that i really love! i definitely recommend her, she gave me exactly the cut and style i was looking to achieve:)

this is a beautiful shop.  the girls are all very nice.  chrystal gave me a great haircut and the prices are so reasonable.  i go to supercuts every time i need my hair done, but this is my first visit to this location. very nice.
hit or miss place. the newer stylists haven't been fully trained. i leave with chunks of long hair. at times i end up getting good cuts.

the prices are standard...i got what i asked for and was pleased with the result. when i came in there was only one worker there so i gave a four star review because of the wait. the worker did a good job but they need people at the reception to take calls and checkout those that at finished.

greeted nicely by all stylists when i arrived. checked in and was taken quickly (only a few people were waiting). ashley gave me a wash, cut, and blow dry and did an excellent job. i have long thick curly hair and i wear it straight. she spent all the time needed in blow drying it straight with an awesome curl/wave at the ends. this was my first time to supercuts and i would return to ashley again.  the atmosphere was quiet but welcoming and friendly. the only reason i wouldn't give it a 5-star has more to do with the actual aesthetics of the salon. the carpet is worn as are the seats in the waiting room. i have been to a couple other similar salons in the area (master cuts, great cuts, hair cuttery, etc) and they are all a lot "nicer" to be in while waiting. that being said - i would rather sit in a shabbier spot and get a great haircut than wait in a brand new shiny place and leave unhappy!!!

due to a poor vacation over sight  a simple knot in the back of my hair became a complete crown of a matted mess. i bought every detangling product on the planet worsening the situation. i allowed this problem to fester for three weeks! as my hair is about almost two feet long as i am growing it out to get married in two months. all of it stood like a cone on top of my head. i was doomed. my mother, a dog groomer, said i had no choice but to cut it out. i was terrified my groom and i would have the same hairstyle for the wedding. i called to make an appointment with complete embarrassment and was met with encouragement they would try to salvage as much hair as possible. upon arrival i was greeted with a warm welcome from a women named jess w. who explained in detail every avenue she would take to help. customers in the salon we're in shock at my hair. i was heartbroken by the customers face because i knew they would cut off my hair. jess laid her hand on my shoulder and said let's get started we're going to be here awhile because we're not cutting anything. we spent the next 2.5 hours together. she reinforced there was nothing to be embarrassed about. held conversations as if we were best friends all while hiding any symptom of fatigue in her hand or back. she did it to make me feel comfortable. that gesture alone awed me. well truth be told she never took her scissors out!  she made a miracle happen. after the last knot was brushed she did not say were done. she leaned over and said i'm going to give you the best shampoo you have ever had. in deed it was. she even offered to throw my hair in braids so it would not knot over night. i plan to make this my only destination for hair beauty. if you can request your consult. request jess w you will not be disappointed. she's a miracle worker

i had an appointment on a sunday afternoon with tina for a cut & color. i was taken back a few mins after i arrived. the staff greeted me warmly as i entered. tina took the time to talk to me about what i wanted done and discussed my color with me. i walked out extremely satisfied and pleased with my cut and color.  i will definitely be returning. tina is an amazing stylist and extremely professional.

so i checked in online and it said no wait. i get to the salon and there are two ladies being serviced. i get no acknowledgement from any employees and am ignored for now going on 35 minutes. i'm about to walk out. this is absolutely the worst supercuts i've ever been to and management needs to be replaced as i've seen i'm not the only one who has these feelings.  in addition, the app serves no purpose as i had to check in again when i arrived.

so i am here now and have been waiting to get my haircut for about 25 mins. i checked in at the kiosk but the staff has not given me even 1 update about when i will get called up.  in addition people have been coming in based on earlier reservations made.  so...do people who walk in keep getting bumped back like those trying to fly standby?  the staff doesn't seem very friendly or approachable either. will update this after i finally get a haircut.

i've gone to this particular supercuts for the last year. the stylists are all pleasant and personable and i always have a good cut. they definitely know what they're doing.that said, the management of this particular establishment is pretty dismal. on a few occasions there haven't been enough workers to cope with the clientele load and there are frequent walk outs which cuts my wait time but you'd think they'd be able to maximize service by having at least 3 working at any given time.the computer check in system should be able to tell the timing and walk out rate and they could tailor schedules to the metrics. but i guess that's just me.

consistently customer focused with great quality.  i have been coming here since 2006 (nearly 9 years). i am really happy with the prices and how they do my cut and color.  they are pleasant, friendly, and customer focused.  a tip:  they are not very organized at filing the color cards.  my last name is often misspelled and hard to find, takes a little extra time.  a couple times, my card was never found during the last year.  you would think this would be a problem for me, but it isn't.  the staff is so good at what they do that they can talk to me, look at me, and then....i get a color i like better than the last one.  so if they lose your card, don't worry!

went there and got my sons hair cut. it came out really nice, she did it exactly how i wanted it!  also i got my eyebrows waxed...  the lady did a very nice job as well! she is the second lady that i would now trust to do them!   i would go back there again

my son had a bit of a haircut emergency at 8:20 on a tuesday night. i called 3 hair cuttery's and all of which answered the phone as if i bothered them and were closed or closing even though it said 9:00 online. i called super cuts. they answered the phone pleasantly and assured me they do not close until closing time. they take their "last customer" at 9:00. they sounded as if they would appreciate my business and now i'm happy to give it to them.the stylist was evelyn. thanks evelyn!

i wanted to give a shout-out to tara at this location. yesterday i had gotten my hair colored and cut with my stylist in king of prussia (who i'd been going to for well over a year without incident). for some reason that stylist went rogue on me and f'ed up my color and cut. i am leaving the country in several days and didn't want to be seen looking the way i did. first thing this a.m. i went to this villanova location as a hail mary to see if something could be done last-minute before i left town. tara assessed the damage and offered up solutions. my hair was so brassy and over-highlighted that the toner wasn't quite doing the trick to tone it down. tara stuck with it and my highlights look so good and blend with my base color so much better!! i appreciated her attention to detail and care in making sure she did all she could. next, she corrected the weird haircut i had received - my stylist likes to use the razor blade to create layers vs. cutting them in with scissors. for my hair type it just looks too choppy and isn't blended well at all. tara got to work fixing that hot mess.so, at the end of my supercut visit, tara greatly improved my hair color so that i'm no longer embarrassed walking down the street and my kids can no longer make fun of me - plus i no longer look like chunks of gum were cut out of my hair!! phew. such a relief to walk out the door feeling confident about how my hair looks! thank you, thank you, tara!

i'm not going to give this more than a single star. i live not far from this location. so other than convenient - that's it. the staff is very rude. they discourage people from waiting and exaggerate the wait times. i've witnessed it nearly every time. also - the place is filthy.!!!! every time i've gone i noticed a rash on my arms and neck  from the chairs. they don't sanitize their instruments or wipe down the chairs and there are piles of brushes around the damp sink. it's really gross. i'm not sure they even wash the robes. it's really unpleasant. never ever  again.

this is the place to go!from the get go, as i entered in everyone greeted me with a smile and just the overall vibe of the store was inviting. i was checked-in and had very little wait time and was immediately seen by my 'stylist' of choice (trish). fyi - there are multiple ways to get check-in as they have the mobile app, or direct call-ins that you can do to schedule an appointment as well as they take direct walk-ins. everyone has a horror story or two about getting their hair cut and having someone try to do what they would like when getting their haircut. i have quite a few and as i have been trying to find a stylist who not only knows what she's doing but has great customer service for the past 4-5 years... and i finally did! trish is a gem i found! even though hair grows back and mess-ups can be fixed this way, trish is someone that always has made me not worry about my look or cut, but also someone who i trust. now, i get my money's worth and not always having an issue month to month with my dew.i recommend this supercuts location. i also recommend seeking trish if you're looking for great customer service and a great finished haircut everytime. after my recent visit, i noticed that all the other customers were satisfied with their stylist as well - so you can't go wrong here.from what i discovered, this is a new supercuts location that popped up in the villanova area. not only is everything just clean, new and updated compared to other locations - it has a nice inviting set up to really just give that local barbershop/hair salon feel. it's all topped off with great workers/stylists that just make the place inviting... go check it out!!

my two little kids got great haircuts here from gracie. they are both a little nervous and not very excited about haircuts. they came in with long faces clinging to my leg but ran out skipping and laughing, just like that scene in naked gun when the couple comes out of the movie theater after watching platoon. overall the haircut was great and gracie was extremely nice and accommodating! we will be back!

since opening, this is where i get my hair cut because it is the closest to my home. i am not that particular when it comes to my hair, and will always allow whichever stylist is available to perform my generic male haircut. the last two haircuts i received were awful. bad to the point of going to a competitor for a "fix". needless to say i think i have given up on this supercuts.
another great experience at super cuts. friendly accommodating staff who are happy to be working there.

i've been going to supercuts for well over a decade and to the drexel location for perhaps 3yrs. i have never been disappointed in the service and the prices remain more than reasonable. today, however, the staff were especially accommodating and were friendly as could be. they really brightened what was shaping up to be a rather unpleasant and frustrating day...and i got a great cut to boot (per usual). my regret is that i am unable to recall my stylist's name so as to thank her personally. i will continue to patronise supercuts at drexel for as long as i'm in this area and will be sure to recommend it to any and all. thanks, guys!

been here three (maybe four) times for quick trims since they opened, but my most recent visit will be my last. i realize that i am a much more "mature" client than this location typically sees, and i have had very short hair for 35 years now so there are not a lot of styling options. when i went in, i explained that i just wanted a trim and, if possible, some shaping to take out some of the "bulk" of my thick, wavy hair. i showed the stylist two pictures of haircuts i liked. we talked about how the stylist felt both my style and my color were aging me. i agreed and said i hoped a little shaping would help and i trusted her, because after all - hair grows back. (it was a joke!!)i was asked if i minded if she used clippers in the back. i said no, i didn't mind because most past stylists used them on the edges in back and on my neck - i have a low hairline. then i felt the clippers going straight up the back of head....over and over again. and i felt the scissors going across the back of my head....higher and higher. at this point i said something lame like "that feels awfully short" and the response was "it'll grow back." i was asked if i wanted the length on my bangs cut. i said no - i just wanted them textured to be wispier. she agreed... and then cut them to be about 1/2 inch long. needless to say: i am horrified to report that i look like i was attacked by a weedwacker. yes it will grow back eventually....but with a few tears and lots of embarrassment in the meantime.

i got a really bad haircut from here. the layering was uneven and i got short layers even though i specifically asked for long layers. the layers in the back are 3+ in shorter. also, the cut is very blunt. they gave me a refund because they know they messed up. i have to go get it fixed now but i will definitely never go back here.

three stars? are you serious? this place is a definite 5 star establishment. the staff was fun, friendly, and helpful. my stylist, jasmyn, not only gave me the best fade and trim i've had in years, but also great conversation about cosplay, her new line of all natural hair products, and just life lol. don't pay attention to all the negative reviews and book your next appointment here!

i had been wanting to find a new place in philly and usually i try to find high end places but i decided to try it out and i was very pleased. i didnt get my hair cut but i got a partial with a red and purple color done. jessie was amazing and they didnt have the first colors for me first time around but i went a second time and she redid the color on the house and i was super appreciative of it! i'll definitely be seeing her for future hair appointments:)

this was my first time at a supercuts in philly, as i usually go to south philly salon, but, i was in the neighborhood and not available on my usual day, so, i decided to try it. as soon as i arrived, they instructed me to sign in (online) . i had one person ahead of me, so, wait time was less than 5 minutes. the stylist, was friendly, professional and cut my hair precisely how i asked. i asked after cut, if i used correct terminology, and she replied "yes".. i will come back if i am crunched for time and cannot make it to my south philly salon. the haircut didn't take long and it looks good. thanks.

i have very curly hair and i've been trying to find a good, cheap haircutting spot for the longest- i finally found it. vernessa really listened to everything i asked for and even gave some curly tips for me to use, she knows how to cut curls! for all the curly headed girls that don't wanna spend 250$+, for 25$ this is honestly a deal, i'll def be coming back again !

don't go here, this is the worst haircut i have ever had.  this place is enticing because it is so reasonably priced but they will make you look stupid.  i had bangs and i wanted them to be a little more full, the staff just chopped a thick piece of my hair without consideration.  she looked aghast when she looked at me, she knew she effed up my bangs.  honestly, if it came down to supercuts or shears in the bathroom... i would take my chances with the shears, and i have no experience at all.  booo!

honestly one of the worst haircuts i've ever gotten. i got the girl in the front seat to the left on a slow saturday afternoon. she rushed through my haircut and didn't bother cleaning up the back (usually a decent barber would ask a man if they want the back..rounded or square) when i asked her to clean up my neckline, she gave a condescending attitude as if i asked her to glue my hair on and start again.

the staff here is all very friendly. that being said, no one cares if you have a nice hairdresser when you have a rough hair cut.  it wasn't even that he cut it too short (which he did) it just seemed like such a scraggle-y technique. i know during other haircuts they have a way they cut it so it doesn't have a blunt looking cut, but this was like that in a very chunky, unnatural looking way.for $20 plus tip, next time i'll  be going somewhere better with a groupon promo or something, little better quality.

venssa is the best, she is a professional and so friendly. i came with an orange hair after bleaching she fixed it. so glad with the result.i just gave 4 stars for the entire stuff but venessa deserves more than 5

after hearing and reading so many positive reviews about this place, i just had to give it a try. the staffs are nice people and i felt like i can come here for all my future hair cuts, but it turns out to be the top worst place that i've ever gone to. i had long hair and asked for a new look, specifically the type of hair i mentioned, and in the end the barber only spent about 10 minutes cutting and trimming my hair. the results  shocked me and left me feeling embarrassed walking outside back to my room. i could get a way better haircut in connecticut, and for cheaper, if i was back home. before, i have heard of the guy, by the name of kevin, from most reviews, and that he is best barber to go to, but unfortunately i went with someone else. i am now stuck with this awful haircut that could not be fixed. because of my first bad experience here, i will never plan on coming back here again and recommend that everyone should find a better supercuts or a new place to go.

okay okay excuse my "elite yelper b#%^ syndrome" from the last review.  this time i went back again, sarah was amazing!!!! she took her time with trimming my hair and did a great job. kevin and sarah were so friendly and attentive with the guests who were waiting. honestly when you have one bad experience with a staff doesn't mean that the whole team is not satisfying. ladies. please request sarah when you go in!!! !!

i have been here twice in the past 6 weeks. supercuts is comically known to my friends as the "fast food" of haircuts as they are usually inexpensive and quick. i don't mind this business model and find it useful when you are in a rush. i have read the reviews about this location and agree with the former customers. the employees here do not seem to cut hair that well. they got me in and out quicker than most other supercuts franchises i have been to and pretty much did a superpar job. i dont understand why they don't wash your hair like other franchises as well. i hope next time i go i dont feel like i am being rushed out in such a short time, especially when no one is waiting for a haircut

its not about the prices , its about the process. right now it is sat morning more then 14 people waiting and 1 barber!! this is upsetting and very unpromising when advertised quick and qualitative. im sure the manager will reply oh i am sorry about the experience from what i see its a lack of leadership and team effort. she even forgot to sign me in and still intended to call people before me !!! this is a joke ...... and last time i have posted this on fb until this process changes i will withdraw my comment
kevin the manager is here! i loved him in wynnewood, i am so happy to know that i can still get my hair blown out by the best!
great experience and an amazing cut. finally supercuts is on campus. thanks melissa! you're awesome.
