ok, here is the thing, my hair is hard and thick, but it can't be the reason for you to stretch my scalp with your sharp clip! and also, the details are super terrible! i wouldn't hate you for the awful haircut, but please! practice more!
kevin did a great job on my hair, blow dried it, and made it look fabulous! deforest will be using them for mine and my husband's hair cuts. quality haircuts for a great value. thanks kevin!

never written a yelp review before, but this is the worst haircut i've ever received. asked for half my current length and the stylist took that to mean an eighth as long, and, in order to make it look less wrong, trimmed the sides shorter. unfortunately, this wasn't even and so now i have hair wings on my sides like a mediocre pegasus. matching this pegasus look, she left several "horse tails" on the back of my head (at the original length), which i had to pull out. bad.
stopped in without an appointment to get my face cleaned up. they were able to accommodate me, and i left out with a nice even beard trim.

i just moved to philly and i was trying to find an inexpensive barber to just get a simple cut and supercuts was the only barber that was under $20 (it is $18 for just a cut). i went and the people were friendly and got me setup. within a minute or two i was in the chair and a stylist was asking me what i wanted. i don't recall the stylists name but she was young and probably very new because she didn't seem to understand how rough she was being with the razor. about halfway through my cut she poked me with the scissors which was more annoying than painful but is part of the reason i can't give 5 stars. overall the price was okay if a bit on the expensive side compared to what i am used to and the atmosphere and attitude of the stylists was great but the actual cut was rough even though it ended up looking good in the end.

this review is regarding my hair cut and what i would consider an unethical practice...i have been to this location several times, however i will not be returning to this location. while waiting to be seated the stylist helping me was finishing up with another client. at the end of the cut i saw her grab an instagram/ facebook picture frame. she held this up so the clients face was in the frame, and quickly grabbed her phone to take a picture. i could see the client in the chair was confused about what was happening. he had no clue what she was holding up because she did not turn it to make it visible, nor did she tell him or ask him if she could or wanted to take a picture. at the end of my hair cut she tried to do the same thing, however i quickly stopped her as she grabbed her phone. again she did not ask permission or indicate her intentions. on top of this i asked for finger length on the top however the stylist should have told me that she has very small fingers because it turned out to more look like i had a full out buzz cut. i just left from a supercuts near my work. i told the stylist about my last experience, how she cut my hair extremely short and about the instagram/facebook photo frame situation. the stylist was in shock when i told her about the pictures because she explained that this was for a contest. the store that could rack up the most pictures of their clients with the frame would win a prize, and a day they could wear jeans into work. she also told me that all of the photos taken were published on facebook. to top it off this location won the contest.your location won the contest taking photos of your customers without their consent or knowledge that the pictures would be published to facebook.

i had to wait for my daughter to come out of a concert on south, and i tried this salon while i was waiting.  they had a special running for hair dye, and i figured, why not?  i have nothing but time!  cut and color for 35.00, can't beat it. trish is the girl that i was put with, she was so nice!  i've never had my hair colored (and i'm 45), i usually do it myself...but for the price, i couldn't turn it down.  trish was fast and thorough!  i was nervous because there were a bunch of men that kept coming in for cuts, and i wondered if they were any good on women's cuts.  she cut my hair and even razored the ends!  love it!  she was fast and did an excellent job on my locks....i didn't wash my hair for three days because i loved how she styled it. i wish i lived closer to this salon because i'd go every 6 weeks !  thank you trish!
terrible haircut. uneven all over and styled similar to lloyd's in dumb & dumber. avoid.

i've gone twice to this supercuts. the staff aren't particularly friendly. the first time was fine, i just got a trim and it was more or less what i wanted. the second time i went back it seemed like the stylist didn't know what she was doing. i told her i just wanted to trim off the dead ends. she cut more than enough off and though i asked her for layers, i got all one length and it looks terrible. i will definitely not being going back here.

terrible!  i went for a blow out and style which i asked them to curl it- it was awful- i had to go home and redo it myself. i thought something so basic would be easy but i was wrong. on top of it, they were super unfriendly!!  it's s shame because i try to give these chains the benefit of the doubt, but i will not be going back...just goes to show if you need even a basic service to go to a real salon. stay away!

i usually give these guys the benefit of the doubt and it's pretty cheap but the last few times i've gone there, they've really messed up my hair, and i wear a very simple style (and takes about 15 mins). it seem more lack of care and willingness to provide extra effort with some of their new hires. will be looking for other options in the area

before i moved out of queen village, i would stop by this supercuts on occasion for affordable waxing and impromptu trims if i were too impatient to wait for someone at work to do it.  they earn back one star for the stylists i ended up seeing there, whom i would recommend and go back to if the opportunity presented itself.  i have gotten waxing done by trish a few times--she is thorough, gentle, and friendly.  as i was checking out after an appointment with her, i made conversation with another stylist, tim, whose style i really liked, so i figured i would ask for him on my next visit.  that i did, and he was fun to chat with and did an awesome job on my hair! i also saw him for waxing once and he is great with that as well.  on that note, should you visit this location, make sure you request trish or tim!

i just read a negative review on this site about brandi & i was floored. i'm guessing there was another reason for this negative review especially when you make it personal about the way a person looks and there genes and not about the job. brandi is remarkable and adorable. she cuts my son & my husband's hair and does an amazing job.

i called to make an appointment (they don't take appointments i learned) with someone who has expertise in cutting curly hair. both the receptionist and the manager were really unhelpful and rude when i kept asking if there were specific people in the salon who cut curly hair and have had the most experience cutting curly hair. they just kept saying everyone has had the same training. as a person with curly hair who has gotten some pretty awful cuts over the years, "the same training" is not in any way reassuring. i've had plenty of people with "training" mess up my hair cut. it is not true that just anyone can cut curly hair, or rather they can cut it, but not well. their lack of help was very disappointing, as was their attitude. i was looking forward to trying them as they are in my neighborhood and affordable but sadly i will not.

i give this place two stars. i had two different cutters and three visits. try try again. each time i had to adjust shaping and short hair adjusted around ears and needed a trim again really in two weeks. the two haircuttery also did similar cuts.. the supercuts cut!! it is certainly worth the $20 then for this non haircut...

i've been getting my hair cut by brandi at supercuts for about two years and she does a great job. i have incredibly curly hair and she seems to know just how to cut it. if you have curly hair ask for her.

i was just astounded by a review i just read on yelp about brandi.. i was completely in a bind and i needed my hair colored totally last minute. i arrived at supercuts at 8:45 on june 21st. i was taken by brandi for a full ombré color . i felt totally horrible about the situation & brandi pleasantly did my hair even though i didn't leave the salon until 11:15 (which i presume was much past their closing ) i am a complete believer in yelp reviews & i can't believe yelp kept such a unreliable review about brandi! there seems to be an underlying problem that chris j has with brandi & i hope my faith yelp will investigate this review

i have been going to this location for about 5 years now and everyone in there is extremely friendly and welcoming. the manager, mary, always greets me with a warm hello every time i walk through the door. i've received many great cuts there but ever since brandi showed up i get my haircut from her when she's around because it's exactly what i want every time! i couldn't ask for a more consistent, friendly, professional stylist! as a retail manager myself, i can say she is the type of person every business would want on their team. keep up the great work, brandi!

i've been getting weekly blow outs her by tina, she is awesome!  it would be great if the frequent buyer program could apply to blow outs, they are more costly than a haircut. i'll keep coming back and will refer tina.

usually when people talk to me about my hair and what products i've tried it's one of my more enthusiastic conversations. i can talk about 4 odd things really intensely: candy, dogs, working out, and curly hair products. you probably usually touch on these subjects as small talk and if you're talking to me all of a sudden you'll find themselves taking notes while i'm showing you random websites on your phone. the curly hair products obsession is because of the mixed-race thing. i think there will be more and more of us in the future and so i want to be ready to advise those future 1/4 germans 1/4 jamaicans 1/4 croatians 1/4 japanese what to use. so when people ask me: where do you get your hair cut????? i'm always mumbling "supercuts".... like realllly mumble. ask me three times and you still can barely hear me. and i admit, it's because i'm a little embarrassed that the hair product combination i use is way more expensive than the place i get my hair cut. i get it. it's not fancy. i think a 19 year old cut my hair the other day. but i don't care! it's a curly hair thing. if all i need is a trim, then supercuts is just great. i'm easier than a dude because my hair springs back and you can't tell if it's uneven or not. so why pay $50 at a salon for a regular trimming? no thank you ma'am. sure if i'm getting something fun and new done i've gone other places. otherwise i'll take a $20 trim and shampoo from these cats any time. and they're not pretentious at all about it. they're happy to see me and easy going. thumbs-up.

omg - a big 5 stars for melissa (not missy!) who has now been cutting my 6 year old's hair since september.  she is great (the place - probably 3 stars - but she gets 5).  so patient and great with my little one.and for $12 - what a deal!!thanks again to danny bonaduce (love him!  and he married amy - a yelper - so go danny!) for sending us to supercuts.they make my kiddo supercute.

got my hair cut here last night.  needed a quick walk-in haircut due to a last-minute trip to visit family in canada.my haircut certainly was quick (earning this joint one star), but i can honestly say that i am currently sporting the worst haircut for which i have ever paid $17, and possibly one of the worst haircuts i have ever seen.to describe the cut itself: high and tight on the left side (scalp visible about two inches above the left ear), not nearly as high and not nearly as tight on the right side. some jennifer aniston-style layering (unrequested) on the one side, uneven sideburns, and a patch of loose hair on the neck.the hair dresser's name was alex (possibly), but it's hard to tell because everything happened so fast.  the only time she spoke was to offer me a monotone list of upsells: "any waxing?  any coloring?  any hair products?  want your eyebrows done?"  she finished my awful haircut in about three minutes then ran to the register without offering me a chance to even look at the back.  i was so put off by her repulsive attitude that i just handed her a twenty and scooted out the door.  i guess i figured, "i paid money for this haircut.  how bad could it possibly be?"i found out this morning at work, when at least five of my coworkers asked me if i had cut my hair myself. needless to say, i shant be returning to the ol' supercuts in this lifetime.  i write this review in an attempt to caution any and all potential supercuts victims.

the female stylists are great listeners (especially brandi) and gave me the type of cut i wanted each time. the male stylist, however, seemed to go his own way both times i let him cut my hair. i have short, thick, curly hair. the first time, i figured i'd just let it grow and i'd get over it, as the curls will cover any unevenness. the second time, however, he completely butchered my natural part and the way my hair lies on its own. this was over 6 months ago and my hair is -still- an uneven mess. i am trying to let it grow out before i go see one of the more high-end stylists in the city to fix the mess on my head. very displeased. if you're particular about your style, it's worth it to pay for better service elsewhere.

great place to get your haircut at, super reasonably priced as well. i highly recommend mike, whom has been cutting my hair for about 2 years. he has cut it when it's short and long, and i'm always pleased.  the other stylists are great as well.  always super friendly and efficient. be sure to try the app for more convenience and a shorter wait time!

horrible customer service.  do not use this location.  my wife walk in with my son. and they basically lied and said there was a 3.5 hour wait when there was only two people there and three stylists there.  and not that many people checked in.  they just didn't want to cut a kids hair.  if you have a kid done go here. they are not kid friendly and down right rude.  this is the second time something like this happened.

don't bother checking in online. still had to wait an hour after i showed up to get my haircut. they had 3 people stocking shelves, 2 at the register, and only 3 cutting hair. mike was a chill dude though
i checked in online an hour ago, somehow i still have to wait another half hour. slowest mediocre haircut that $20 can buy.

fool me once, shame on you. fool me twice, shame on me. i can't believe i make the mistake of returning to this place again and again. it's quite frustrating. the name of this place should be re-labeled to hit or miss. i figured, hey it's sue. she did a pretty good job on my hair last time. nope. she spent way less attention to detail to my back like the last two times i got a cut from her. maybe it was because it was an hour before closing time, i'm not sure. i told her, like i tell everyone who cuts my hair to leave the top long (at least a fingerlength) which she readily acknowledged at the start of the haircut. however, she just kept snipping quickly and by the time i realized, it was too late. if i pull with the tips of my fingers, maybe i can get a cm of hair from my scalp. seriously. additionally, it takes a while for me to grow my hair back. there's a certain trust you give to a person to let them cut your hair. when they royally screw up time and again, they should lose that privilege. the last thing i want to do after a long day of work when i'm tired is scrutinize my barber's work in real time and stop them every other minute to make sure they're doing what they're supposed to be. if anything, it is the barber who should stop and ask "is this too long, should i cut some more?" this never happens at supercuts. people only go to this place because it's convenient, quick and easy. but at $18 it's clearly not worth it. i would rather spend much more and get a decent haircut so i'm taking my money elsewhere from now on . i will be searching for a new place on yelp and elsewhere. if you have any suggestions, feel free to let me know. i urge you to take your money elsewhere.
you get what you pay for. crappy hair cut. will be going to another salon to get it fixed. worst hair cut of my life.

worst bangs trim ever!!! avoid this place. i left with my bangs still soaking wet, and had to go home and recut it because she missed a huge chunk and it was crooked. my 3yo would have done a better job!

hit or miss. the revolving door of employees clearly states the type of environment here.  5 people waiting, only two stylists working.  it's often like this when i come. understaffed and always a wait.  the staff is friendly for the most part but this company needs to get their act together. you pay for what you get. cheap haircut, cheap service.
have been coming to this supercuts for many years. marie is the only person to cut and color my hair. she is patient, courteous and always honest about what will work/not work for my hair.
i went there for a walk in, they didn't tell me i had to check in on their computer screen. people then came in and checked in ahead of me. the employees then mocked me, don't go here.

what is the point of signing-in online? we're still waiting for 45 minutes after the appointment time for the haircut! supercuts, please fix your online scheduling system!  you do not give your stylists enough time for appointments. on saturday mornings, why would you schedule only two stylists? once in the chair, all was good. friendly professional stylists but the wait is dreadful.

today, i went into supercuts for a trim.  the only available stylist was katie...she was blonde and had tattoos, and was not friendly.  i told her i only wanted "the minimum amount of hair" off.  she took about 6 inches off.  i am absolutely horrified.  also, it did not seem like she knew what she was doing which made me nervous the whole time.i will never go back to this supercuts in my life.  usually i try to go to generic hair salons to save money on trims and high end salons for highlights.  from now on i'm sticking to high end salons for both trims and highlights.
great place! mike has a great personality and he us very creative. i love how he makes my hair look.

edited to only include my disgust with the warts!!! i'm disgusted after my last visit to supercuts. during the shampoo service, or massage service rather, my stylist katie put her forearms all over my face as she washed my hair. we finish up at the washing station only for me to spot the giant uncovered wart that she had on her forearm. now she was just rubbing that arm all over my face. disgusting!!! if you're going to put your arms all over someone's face make sure you cover up your warts!!!!
sue did a great job on my long hair cut just enough! had a great experience and the prices weren't bad at all. will definitely be back :)

marie recently cut my hair and she was amazing!!!!!i hate getting my hair cut because i feel like stylists always try to pressure me into being more high maintenance than i naturally am, but marie listened to what i wanted while offering helpful suggestions.

after moving to this area from the suburbs i tried many different barbers & hair salons. i finally struck gold at supercuts in roxborough. take my advice schedule appointment with katie let her do the tea treatment on your hair then get your haircut. you will be hooked for life. the tea treatment hair washing is so relaxing sometimes i come in just to get that done, whether i need a haircut or not.

terrible customer service.  checked in online for a haircut at 11:30.  i show up at 11:25, all stylists are with customers and there are 2 other people waiting so i take a seat.  no big deal, i'm early and they are busy.  at 11:40 a man and his son walk in while all the stylists are still busy and the man announces "i signed in online for 11:30".  ok no big deal, obviously i was here first but no need for me to interrupt all the busy workers.  so then a seat up opens up for a haircut and this walks his son over there and the starts getting a haircut.  well, at least i'll be the next person to get a haircut.  then while another stylist was finishing the man announces, "i also had an 11:30 checkin so i'm next".  not wanting to get in argument with this guy i assume the employees will check the computer, ask if i was there first, or do something to double check if he was next.  nope.   he gets his haircut next.i finally get my haircut at 12:15.  i mention at the end to the stylist while paying, "hey just to let you know i also checked in at 11:30 like those two, and i was here 15 min before them".  all i wanted was an apology.  even a stereotypical customer service apology like "i'm sorry for the inconvenience sir."  but no.  nothing.  so i said "i just didn't want to be rude and interrupt you guys when i walked in, and i figured my online sign in would put me in the computer".  to which she responded, "well that's the way you have to do it."  oh really?  so every customer should come in and announce when they signed in and that they are next?  and still no apology.long story short, apparently moving to the back of the line was my fault for checking in online, showing up early, and then being polite when i showed up.
nice people clean shop! great fast service ! good price and nice selection of products!

always great service from all the ladies and guy that run this shop. they're always relaxed and in a pretty chill mood. i am usually in and out of there fairly quickly...and they are very reasonable (17.00 for a guy + tip). they also do "cool" cuts if your looking for the new styles. the check-in app makes getting in and out even easier. good thing going up there.

this supercuts is great! don't expect a five star haircut at a two star cost, but you will get prompt service and at least a decent cut for a very competitive price. checking-in with the mobile app makes things really easy.

just had one of the worst haircut experiences ever.  left loose hairs everywhere. i asked for a line. i left covered in hair. no hot towel or even a wipe down.had to correct her on using a 2. never even shown the back of my head before i was told it was done.
i really only have experience with allie; she is fun, thorough, and gives a great men's cut!  she also seems to really be interested in coloring, trying a lot of mixes on herself.

it was like a slow moving train wreck.  the receptionist said somebody would be with me shortly.  then a few min later she came back and surprise.  she's going to cut my hair.  i asked for a fairly standard men's cut - clippers on the side, take an inch off the top and blend.  she started off with the clippers but rather than blending toward the top she was moving my hair in all random directions and taking the clippers higher and higher looking for some magic line to stop at.  when she got to the top she put some kind of product in my hair and started cutting.  she kept making my hair it mohawk shapes as she cut.  so i'm pretty worried at this point as a big cowlick in the back is standing straight up and no part of the top is even.  then she moves on to the sideburns where she does one pass with the normal clippers leaving the hair half cut half way up.  finally she asks if its done.  is it done?!?  should she do something else?  at this point i'm in such horror i just want to run out and find a barber.  is she going to fix it?  no.   i get home and my wife looks at me in horror before she starts laughing.  hands down the worst hair cut in 25 years.  it's pretty short so not sure how i can fix this for at least a week or two.  i would say that this stuff depends on the individual stylist but if you employ somebody with this level of skill you have to wonder about all of the folks there.  so best to steer clear of this location

i went in friday morning and the first indication i should have left was the fact all these haircut dummies were out on display and several employees working on it. i asked for a simple hair cut; short on the sides; long on top. 1 or 2 on the sides. the hairstylist clearly didn't hear me because she used the electric clipper right on top of my head. i stayed silent and in absolute shock as she cut a ton of hair from the top of my head. i was mortified. she left me buzzed cut. i wanted to leave and even gave her a tip. the cut was horrible i still had long strands of hair on the sides and it was uneven. i will never step foot in that establishment ever again. please train your employees.
vince gave me an amazing shampoo/haircut experience today, really appreciated how efficiently he worked & cut my ends perfectly!

got turned away from supercuts because i got there 30 mins before they closed and they were "too backed up". i don't get this place, the employees mess with the system so u can't check in online properly and then turn you away. seems like very bad management. i guess i will be going to to great clips next time!! thanks for wasting my time.
i still drive up from nc to see my stylist, alaina, at the wynnewood supercuts. she's the best.

francine there is really truly talented at color, by the first time i went to her her highlights were fine and subtle and look so natural and she was genuinely happy and excited for the outcome of my hair. the second time they came out bleach blonde and she refused to tone them and i am unhappy with how streaky and stark they look.my appointment was later in the day and left my iphone charger there, by the time i had gotten home and realized they were close, and called the very next day to pick it up and it was nowhere to be found. shady. edit: found and returned! good on them :)
dara was excellent and professional . hope to return again and book with dara. the app makes it easier. it's best paying $50 for a haircut....

no.... seriously ...... take your time.   take a break between doing haircuts and go text and drink coffee and talk to the other employees when you have an entire waiting room of people.  this was typed in a sarcastic tone, by the way. no smiles, no "welcome", no making you feel as if anyone cares.  besides getting an awful haircut, i have never felt more like i was bothering the employees by being there.

sumbal is the absolute worst!!!  she flat out lied, which i don't understand.  said she could cut a bob and then it became obvious she had no idea what a bob was.  so why lie???  worst haircut i've had in years and will take months to grow it out.  and one side is longer than the other.  barbara was the best but she left in the winter & there's been noone even close to replace her.  would give zero stars if i could.  the new manager is nasty also.  will never go there again

from check in to haircut to paying one of the worst customer service experiences i have had ever.  i have been going here for at least 10 years, almost all new staff.  i myself have a career in customer service and had anyone along the way would have listened and cared about my experience things would have been great.  we can never lose site why we are here in the service world whatever the price may be.  not too mention quality wise it was the worst haircut i have ever had, glad its just hair and will grow, although i will be wearing hars for a while.you have a great customer base in the community, without good service that will go away.after further thought i will not return to a supercuts again.  ten days later my haircut actually got worse as it grew in, uneven and just not good.  spoke with someone in customer service who mentioned a free haircut of which was never received or followed up on, not that i am interested in using it.  overall the company seems to be more interested in volune than quality and service as it used to be.

i went there for a hair color of simple black and my roots came out blonde the stylist was truly inexperienced. i usually go to a high end salon in center city but thought i could save some time by staying in the burbs big mistake. i refused to pay for the terrible hair color i would never suggest going there for anything, terrible experience. don't waste your money on inexperienced operators

it's supercuts.  some of the stylists are better than others.  i took my kids here for years and only had one disappointing cut.i give this supercut props because more than once i saw stylists serving customers with a range of special needs and they were so gracious and easygoing with the customers, very professional.

i've been meaning to write this because i found this woman on here and i'm so glad i did!  anyway, i'm not really a "spend money on pampering myself" kind of person, so when browsing around to find a spot to get a reasonably priced hair cut, i read some yelp reviews.  one such review mentioned a woman named flo as being superb....sooo, lucky for me, when i went to check in on the website, flo was working that day, so i booked with her.  now, let me tellll you...i felt like i was at the spa, i've never been to the spa, but flo sure made my experience "spa-like." i wish she could wash my hair everyday, all day...it was like that.  then she spent a decent amount of time cutting and straightening my hair to perfection which lasted like an entire week.  the whole time i was in the chair, i was thinking that the haircut was going to cost me an arm and a leg because some of the reviews i had read had warned about hidden charges, but flo charged me as advertised on the board.  my only regret is that i didn't tip her more; she still said it was a pleasure cutting my hair as i was leaving, but i assured her the pleasure was all mine.  i would absolutely go visit flo again!

alaina is hands down the best stylist. she always saves my hair from myself. i love my cuts so much i also bring my two year old son and my husband to her! alaina is very talented and you won't regret booking your next appointment with her.

went in to get my haircut and had a hooded sweatshirt, which i've worn several times without an issue. the haircutter, and older lady name started with a d, refused to cut my hair with it on. i then left, went around the corner and got an amazing cut at the barber shop with no issue. won't be returning.

daughter treated me to a mothers' day haircut and we were happy to find that this place was open on a sunday!there was a good amount of people here but we waited less than 10 minutes. lucky me got kevin as my stylist - he was professional - fun to converse with - very knowledgable - and i will be going back because i felt confident that he can handle my hair. daughter was very happy with her cut and her stylist was also pleasant.the prices are very reasonable and next time i will get color done as well. left here feeling great, which is exactly how you should feel when you leave a salon.

i got my hair cut and blown out by a lovely lady named flo. she was wonderful. she gave me the best haircut i have had in a long time. she gave me an eyebrows wax and i looked 10 years younger when i left. i didn't even know they did waxing there. she is going to be my regular stylist from now on. thank you thank you flo

thank you, michelle - not only did you fix the worst haircut of my life that i had gotten from elsewhere in drexel hill over the weekend, i absolutely love my new cut.  would recommend anyone looking for a professional stylist that understands the art of cutting hair to see michelle.

michelle is amazing. somehow while multitasking her managerial duties at this busy supercuts, she also was able to focus on me as a client, which was not easy given my impulsive decision to chop off my elbow length hair and go with a super short cut. she is so talented and knowledgeable. i am sincerely grateful for her and hands down recommend her, especially if you're deciding to completely change your look. if you can't get michelle trust that the other stylists working keep open communication between each other. this is so important! every salon i have gone to has stylists working at different levels and when no one talks to each other, it is always a bad sign. i observed the stylists offering help to each other, asking questions, requesting feedback, and openly communicating in order to achieve the best results for the client.

after going to the same hairdresser for 17 years i took a chance and came here and i'm so glad i did! all i have to say is - go to michelle!!!! she gave me the prefect highlights and cut- everything i had asked for! very professional and a great head/neck massage during the wash!

go to michelle! she goes above and beyond to meet your expectations while being professional and honest. whether it be a color, style or just a simple blow out- she's the best. also, if she washes your hair- be prepared to drift into a little piece of heaven. it's amazing. she truly cares about her customers needs/wants. not to mention she is super friendly and funny. it's nice to see someone so passionate about their job!! i always look forward to leaving the salon looking and feeling amazing! thanks michelle you rock!!!
michelle performed a miracle tonight.  she changed my pick hair to silver:)  i love it!  and it feels fabulous.  she used something new, marula oil by paul mitchell.

best haircut in over 10 years! i have tried so many salons in the area, but michelle at this supercuts location is the best by far! she examined my hair prior to washing, really listened to what i wanted, and she relaxed me so much with her shampoo/scalp massage technique. then, she taught me tips to style my new do! i haven't felt this good about my hair in a very long time!

michelle just gave me the best hair cut and color i have had in the past ten years!! she has a wonderful personality and took a lot of time and care with me.  she took the time to explain the the color choices and also the type of shampoo she would be using so my color would be soft.  such a soothing scalp massage -- i could have taken a nap.  my hair is wavy and the cut she gave was just perfect.  i will be recommending michelle to all my friends and family.  she is the best!

great place to get a haircut. michelle is awesome! knows her stuff. i usually bring my kids with me and michelle always makes sure they get a braid, pigtails, or other surprise style after their haircuts. always leaves a smile on their faces. highly recommend!

i love this supercuts location!  checking in online saves me time and i just earned a free cut through their new rewards system.  the entire staff is talented and professional.  i go to michelle who does the best blow dry i have ever had!  i would highly recommend.

i have two young children (1&3) and we use this supercuts for their haircuts. they get really busy so please remember to check in online before heading over to the store. they do a great job with both boys. especially the younger one who hates haircuts and squirms everywhere. prices are fair and you can get a frequent visitor card to get your 12th haircut free.
been here two or three times and the employees are less than interested in waiting on you. the haircuts are unimmpressive as well!

i have been looking for a new stylist for awhile. since my horror of a haircut in march 2013, i have been very reluctant to even step foot inside a salon. yesterday was my breaking point and i just knew i had to do something. we all know that feeling, your hair is just done and you are over it. so i made the decision to get my haircut and i starting my research. i called a few places and asked questions but none of them really gave me a good feeling. then i called supercuts and spoke with julie. she immediately put me at ease and answered all my questions with no hesitation at all. this was just what i needed. i went to the location, and luckily it wasn't too far from my house. i walked in and took a look around. the place was clean and looked good. i was the only one there, which was fine with me since i am not a fan of waiting. i spoke to julie again and went over the cut i wanted and explained my past experience. (check out my review of hair-cut one hundred) again, she put me at east and totally understood what i wanted. i sat in the chair and off we went. she was awesome and showed me everything that she was doing. she put up with all my questions and indecisiveness. she was truly a professional.  i will definitely go back to see julie again. thank you julie for being just what i needed to get over my hair cut phobia lol

called and spoke with julie, she seemed knowledgeable and friendly. i went in with a very specific look and brought pictures. i was greeted with professional staff and welcoming smiles. julie and i spoke about what i wanted and as she cut we talked about the hair cut. i left very happy and couldn't wait to tell my husband so we could all start coming here. cut looked even better after i washed and blew it dry, she did exactly what i wanted.

i got home with highlights that i didn't like, so i quickly went over to supercuts and alexis did a fantastic job! she used a sample book to discuss what i wanted, then mixed a nice shade of toner and applied it twice so my highlights were much tamer. next time i'm just going to alexis to begin with!also, my husband has been very happy with julie here.

i am thrilled to have supercuts a walk away from my home in fairmount.  read reviews of people complaining about wait time-but i keep my wait expectations in check as calling ahead or signing up online is still not the same as scheduling an appointment.  sometimes it's slow and i walk right back, sometimes i wait...not a big deal.my favorite stylist is sophie - always pleasant and gregarious.  but her real talent is with color.  i go every five weeks to have my roots touched up and enjoy the salon environment as this is a multi-step process.  everyone is pleasant and seemingly enjoying their craft.  i look forward to returning in five weeks time.

bad, bad bad system!!!so, i call. "only one person ahead.  come over now"  i arrive, one person sitting.  i register, and the nice woman says, "you'll be next with her".  great. !" 2 new people come in, sit down.  they registered online.  my"turn" arrives, and my cutter takes another person.confused i ask:  "can you explain your system here??  i called, was told to come in, one person ahead, and that i'd be next with you!"  "i'm so sorry, they made a reservation online"  "well, that's great.  i've been here 2o minutes expecting that what your colleague said was true :that i was next with you!"  "well, we're short staffed..." not about being short-staffed.  it's about being clear and communicating correctly.  you should have told me when i registered that several people had reserved online and that i could be bumped and bumped. cause now i'm pissed off, i'm going to walk out, never come back and write a bad review on yelp'  "i'm sorry. have a nice day"  "you just wasted 30 minutes of it"

this is my second time at the location and i have never been more impressed. the first time i thought maybe i just got lucky with who cut my hair but somehow this place is packed with highly-skilled, consummate professionals who are also good people. after most haircuts, i only look forward to the coming weeks when my hair grows out, but both times here i was actually happy to have someone mention that i got my hair cut. the only other place in the world i've gotten quality cuts is top notch barbershop back home and that costs 35 bucks. this is half the price and was probably even better.

courtney cut my hair today. she was so nice and personable and did a great job on my haircut. i  will definitely be going back to this salon and to courtney. i   checked in online and was seen right away. great experience!

after my last visit i was extremely hesitant to come back, but finding out that the horrible 'stylist' was no longer there, i scheduled an appointment.i was just expecting to get my haircut and eyebrow waxing, but after showing beth a picture of the cut i wanted, she suggested that we add some color to accentuate my new cut and i was totally down.beth was so personable and professional that i immediately felt comfortable. she gave me a gorgeous haircut and stunning color. i've never been so pleased with my hair color either!i'm super happy with my hair and will definitely come back :)

i was walking down the street when i saw the supercuts on hamilton street. i was in desperate need of a haircut so i figured i would go in. at first i was a little hesitant because i have heard good and bad stories about supercuts. well, i'm glad i stopped in. the young lady who cut my hair, i can't remember her name but she was all tatted up, did a fabulous job. she was super friendly, outgoing and knew exactly what i wanted.i will definitely return for my next haircut and when i do i will get the young lady's name.

i'm not one of those people who prefer to go to salons to get a haircut. i'm pretty basic and usually need a trim, maybe a bang trim, maybe some layers. because of i don't want to pay an arm and a leg for a haircut. some might say i'm taking a big chance but 99% i have been fine. this location opened last year in spring garden among some restaurants, nail salons, convenience stores, etc. it's clean and minimal, just how i like it.  i also like that you can check in online before you arrive. today was my second haircut here and it was $23 which included the shampoo and conditioning. originally i wanted a blow out but the girl who did my hair took a little long. but she was meticulous and attentive.would i go here for color services? no. but for the basics, this place is perfect.

called for an appointment asked if they could do 1:15 they took the appointment and there's 5 other people waiting for their cut when i show up. why not just say it's going to be 30 minute wait no matter when you show up? they don't respect your time at this establishment.

i have been here several times and got a decent haircut for a good price.  i walked in today to get a haircut and sat there for over an hour waiting to get called up.  when i first came in there were only two guys ahead of me and then one after another "online check-in" walks in and goes in front of me.  i understand you have check-ins online, but you can't have a customer sit there over an hour, i will not be going there again.

moved to philly five years ago and tried multiple places for haircuts.  i was thrilled to find sophie at supercuts.  i usually make sure it's a quiet time of day and just leave and return if it's too busy.  i used to bounce from place to place, but i love knowing supercuts is around the corner and open every day.

i asked to get my hair dyed burgandy and the woman bleached my brownish blonde hair so it could come out more vibrant. but then when she first applies the dye, it came out practically black. she said it was "a little dark" and i was like "a little?!?" so she put in bleached shampoo to try to lighten it but the finished product was still a very dark reddish brown. i asked if she could lighten it and she said "it will fade after a few washes." but i've dyed my hair vibrant colors before and when you wash it, the vibrancy goes away too. so after a few washes i imagine it will turn dark brown. but even still, it's not the color i wanted now. and that's what she was saying to get me out of a refund i guess. i also paid for a waxing and i'm pretty sure she didn't know how to do that as well. you're supposed to go against the grain and do it in peices. but she put was one my whole stache and tried ripping it all off in one go, downwards with the grain. i didn't notice how bad the job was until the next day when the redness went away. there were still a few hairs leftover in very waxable places that i could have plucked myself. also i have short hair. maybe medium depending on who you ask. but it doesn't touch my shoulders. and one of the assistants told the hair dresser to charge me for long hair. i'm over here like "excuse me?? does this look long to you??"so in the end i wasted $110 to damage and dry out my hair (because of the two bleaching process) dye my hair dark brown (which is more towards my natural color anyway) and get a less than decent waxing job that hurt like crazy. thanks.

goodness this place sucks !!!! it's now 7:15pm... if i asked at 6:30pm "how long is the wait" and you say 10mins, what clock are you using??? fyi only one person was waiting besides me..and yes, he left a while ago... if i wasn't in a pinch i would've left!!

i have been to this location twice and had fantastic service from zoey! cut, color, and style have been superb. i like the paul mitchell products so much i bought some to take home and my hair hasn't looked for felt this good in a long time. --you can call and schedule and appointment on the day you want to come in or download the app and check in before you get there so the wait time is not as long. --prices are reasonable and they have specials every day of the week too
courtney is a true skilled profesional. best haircut i've had in a long time.

husband took my son for a haircut since this place was close by and convenient on a sunday afternoon. thought he'd be in good hands as we've taken him to a different supercuts with great results.gave the woman specific instructions on how to cut his hair. even showed her pictures of how it's been cut in the past. the cut was choppy and uneven. even his sideburns were cut at two very different lengths. called the store to see if i could bring him back the next day but in the end decided to go to the location where he regularly goes.

so i was in desperate need of a haircut. i called as soon as they opened & this angel beth m answered immediately. she said "come on in. i will fit you in and i will fix your hair." i went in looking & feeling down. but beth m fixed my hair & beard into a new style that i never tried before and it turned out amazing! i walk around with this new style looking great with my head held high now. thanks to beth m, i am alittle more happy and confident about my appearance. thanks so much beth m at supercuts.

i've been here 3 times. twice as a walk-in, waited 50 minutes b fore giving up and leaving. finally made an appointment the third time and still waited 45 minutes. this place is just totally understaffed. advertises as a place with quick service, but doesn't deliver

such an awesome location with a bunch of talented and very friendly stylists! i love how convenient it is, especially since they do color and waxing in addition to haircuts. just what the neighborhood needed!!
really great service here. friendly and talented staff.  you may have a wait...but after all they are  a walk in salon. these ladies work extremely hard to get the job done !!

recently increased their prices to 20 dollars, and they try to rush you out of there without a proper cut. didn't get what i asked for either, and the lady said that she had cut hair for 15 years. mentioned that i wanted a part and said that she couldn't because i had too much hair in the way. no longer a cheap haircut so i'd pay the extra 10-15 and go to an actual barber shop or salon.
kaylee did a great job love the new hair cut! this is my second hair cut at this location they do a great job!
ivana was wonderful and got everything exactly how i want it. great job. would highly recommend!

had a great appointment today with tori. my son had a very specific idea of how he wanted his hair done and she was the best at working with his needs. for sure coming back to this location in the future!
great experience!  tori was super friendly!  i would recommend coming in.  make sure to check in on line.
tori was super friendly and kind! she was very helpful with information on how to keep my hair healthy with the products recommended.

the stylist shall remain nameless since she never bothered to tell me her name even after i asked if her name was "____" she said no,  and never said what it was.  i felt like we were uninvited guests to the employee's party

first let me say that the only reason i gave this place 2 stars was because a former stylist named joey was fabulous.  he cut my hair twice and was superb. i've been back 2 more times since joey left.  2nd visit....waited 45 minutes.  this was after my online check in time. i saw jackie.  meh.  a flat tire has more personality.  i give the cut an 8. she didn't smile, didn't ask me anything.  jackie shouldn't be in the retail business if she's not a people person.3rd time- i checked in online for an 11:20 appt with michelle, the manager.  got there at 11:10.  it'll be 20 minutes.  fine. no problem.she's talking about herself to the customer.talking to another stylist about hiring another stylist.asking if this other stylist tick tock tick tock tick tock            tick tock tick tock.one hour latershe's sweeping the floortaking tape out of the registertakes something out of her purse and goes into the bathroom.10 minutes more! i'm not sure what the reason is for checking in on-line if we're just going to sit there for an hour anyway.  i sat there for an hour on purpose, waiting to see if at least one person said anything to me as i was the only one there.nobody said anything.i left.not a phone call (you have to check in with a phone number)  i'm going back to my "real" salon where they care about their customers.

the stylist was nice and haircut is fine but unfortunately i left with a bad taste in my mouth. apparently the owners do not allow coupons that aren't printed. which is so silly. i register my email address today, downloaded the app so that i could check in and save time. i received an email with a $2 off coupon. i checked in on the app, arrived. waited 30 minutes.... got my haircut and then tried to use my coupon only to be told it had to be printed to be accepted. i think that is rediculous. we are in a digital world. it should say on the coupon that it must be printed to be honored. it's too bad that the owners make up a bogus policy and require the stylist enforce it. this makes the final minutes of the transaction unpleasant which could effect the amount of a tip (i still tipped appropriately). it did definitely confirm the fact that i won't be returning to this location.

absolutely amazing service!!got my eyebrows done by joey and my hair cut by casey. they both did an amazing job i'm so pleased! the salon is very clean and the staff is friendly. i will be a regular from now on.thanks guys!!

garbage place, went in for a haircut on sunday and was trying to get a faux hawk. they ended up buzzing the top side of my head than continued to just straight buzz cut it as i couldn't change it from there. my girlfriend and i were very specific on what we wanted done and they spent maybe 3mins on my girlfriend and i. did a terrible job and no manager has bothered to look into this and the owner doesn't take responsibility for their employees. on top of that they cut my girlfriends hair in different lengths and now has to get it cut shorter and she didn't want to do so cause of her 21st birthday.  $40 spent on top of $30 for a hat to cover up the buzz cut. already spoke with a lawyer about this horrible situation and mental stress they have caused my girlfriend and i along with ruining her hair plans for her 21st birthday. don't ever go here as the owner or managers make no attempt in providing good customer service. i will be going forward in suing this location for their actions.

bad! i have been using this salon since they opened. its close to where i live so its convenient. over the last 6 months i have been going when they open@8 on saturdays as it works best for me and each time i feel like i am an inconvenience its the same stylist "jackie" this last time was the end all for me with the salon not only did she open the salon late (as usual) she didnt say one word to me other than "how do u want it cut" no good morning nothing  she then did one quick swoop around my hair pulled off my cape and said ok ur done never even asked if it was ok if i needed anything else etc. although i was disappointed i still left my normal 5.00 tip but won't be back. i will drive out of my way for better customer service.

went in for an overdue cut today. it's nice to have a location closer to home.the wait was pleasant and i was taken care of very quickly. what i also really like about this salon is that they are a full service salon, they provide waxing services and at very reasonable prices. the stylist was engaging, fun to chat with and she listened carefully to my needs and wishes and did an outstanding job. i will stick with this location from now on.

i made an appointment with michael today base on several good reviews and i am very happy i did.  he did a great job of highlighting, lowlighting and cutting my hair.  i am extremely pleased and he was also very pleasant.  i highly recommend him!  i plan to be a regular customer.

this is the only place (including high dollar salons) that can cut my long thick hair. most places attempt to cut it in two different chunks but then they can never get it blended. i always end up back at supercuts if an attempt at another salon is ventured.

i had a color, cut and style.  i was overjoyed with the out come.  the staff was amazing the salon was clean and i have nothing but positive thoughts and comments to say about the salon. thank you michael for great hairdo.!!!!!

i went in for a hair cut and shampoo. michael did a very good job on my haircut. along with my eye brow waxing. this supercuts location is very clean and embraces a positive work environment. keep up the hard work!

not so super of an experience. will never go back. my husband and son needed haircuts so we decided to try this place out instead of where we normally go as i thought it would be ok. we waited almost an hour (not a surprise because there was a lot of people waiting but we thought we will see how it goes) only to become #1 and 2 on the list (yay we are next!) and they call the people who are #4, 5, and 6! we had been waiting longer then the people they called, we saw them check in so it wasn't an online check in and it clearly showed they were after us on the list! we were so angry we left and will never go back. the people who work there didn't even notice that after sitting almost an hour we were getting up and leaving. this was about an hour ago. we will go next week to our normal place (sport clips) where it may cost more but we aren't invisible. we didn't throw a fit (wanted to!) because i didn't want to make the people they called feel bad as it wasn't their fault. so no, i do not recommend this place. would give zero stars if it were possible.

britney is an incredibly talented and confident stylist. i've been coming here for couple of months. from shampooing, the haircut itsel all the way to product recommendations, she has steered me in the right direction each and every time. there are other supercuts that are closer to my home in gilbert, but i am so happy to drive a few extra miles for the privilege of working with her.

super disappointed with my sons hair cut from yesterday (3/31/16). my husband took our son in for a hair cut and he came home with something that looked like i did it in our kitchen. his hairline in the back was so bad i can't even begin to describe it. his sideburns are very uneven and so is his front hair line. i have to take him to another place today to have it fixed. i would never recommend going to this location. i would give them zero stars if i could.

every time i try to go to this location they have an excuse as to why they can't take me. the whole idea of supercuts is the convenience of no appointment necessary. however even after i check in on line they turn me away. i think the people who work there just don't want to do color. if it was just one time i would say no big deal but this is the 4th time in the last year that they have turned me away for a simple root touch up of brown hair. i will never go back to this location again. tgey have horrible customer service and they obviously do not want my business.
best experience ever toni took care of me cut my hair really good i would say come here had me in and out 10 minutes

i don't usually go to supercuts, but, i work next door. toni is awesome!  i needed a new do and she talked with me and gave me just what we had decided. then i went back yesterday and wanted something new again.  she gave me another great cut! thanx girl.

outstanding haircut by rocky! she talks you through what she is going to do and makes you feel comfortable in the chair. i was impressed by her skill and her accuracy of the haircut. i will definitely be returning to this young, hip gal.

first time coming to super cuts. wih that said let me add i'm big on not ever going anywhere to get my hair cut. one bad time did it for me. however i was having issues with my scam and an excellent recomendation to get the lavender tea tree shampoo and conditioner helped. as i'm getting a scalp massag and wash hot towels were a plus for the face. made my over all experience pleasurable. on to the hair cut. sarah f cut my hair and did and excellent job as i told her what i liked and didnt like. she put hope back in my heart for being able to get my hair cut again!!! keep it up!! i might be a regular.

very friendly and fun conversations to be had over here. the store manager toni is very knowledgeable and passionate about what she does. it's good to be able to go someplace where i know i can get a quality service done fast and for a great price. just passing through the area and needed a quick touchup before i went back to san diego and got just what i was looking for. love people with great customer service skills and always want them to feel recognized and appreciated. thanks again.
i'm on vacation visiting friends and needed a trim. the stylist, toni was upbeat, welcoming and professional. i was very happy with my haircut and the service!

i took my granddaughter for a trim.  saw a lady leaving with a super cute short cut. i needed a cut and asked who cut her hair.  she said toni so i had my hair cut after my granddaughter's trim.  toni did the best cut i have had in a year. i hope she never leaves chandler.  she is awesome.
toni is amazing with color! she did an all over low light and highlight color on me and it was spot on! she's got an amazing eye for what you ask for! she's also fun and friendly!

i come in evey couple of months. on my last visit i was very happy with the service. almost never a long wait. the manager of the salon heidi, did an absolutely amazing job. i had a haircut and brow wax. one of the best brow jobs i have ever had. the cut was great too. she took the time to explain what cut would work best for my face. all of the stylists are super friendly. would deffinatly  recommend this location.

i was extremely satisfied with my hair cut.  heidi was genuinely concerned with making sure i got exactly what i wanted.  she took exceptional time and care with me. i was in town visiting from new york and making this quick stop was a risk.  i am so happy i found heidi.

toni is a great stylist. she is very professional and is excellent at both cut and color. i have trusted her with my hair many, many times. she's also done wonders with my eyebrows, so get a wax while you're there! i would recommend toni to anyone.

extremely pleased with my cut and color-- toni listened to me describe my "hair concerns" and she magically fixed it all.   i am from out of town, so was not sure where to go.   i recommend supercuts...good clean salon, reasonable prices and talented stylists.  don't hesitate to try.....they are great!

toni is amazing!! she's worked wonders on my hair! :) she always makes sure i leave absolutely satisfied! she listens to what you want and pays attention to detail! and her skills with color are phenominal!! i would recommend her to anyone! :)

i love going to this location for my haircuts. veronica knows exactly what she is doing and always makes sure i am 100% happy with my hair. i don't know a lot about hairstyles so i let her do what she thinks will look good. she always gives me a slightly new look and i'm always satisfied with it. the stylists always genuinely greet me right when i walk in the door. there a plenty of supercuts closer to my home but i'd rather make the trip and know i'll be happy with the results.

i've been a client at this supercuts for eight years. no longer.  i've received two haircuts in that entire time i wasn't happy with (both this past year).  recently, a cut left my hair butchered. i told my brother's gf i look like a homeless rag doll.  i asked the gal that cut it if she could fix it and she said i had to get back in the store within the same week.  an appliance emergency at home and my work schedule, made it impossible to get in within that time period (it had to match her work schedule she said) leaving me with this awful haircut. i expressed my sadness on fb because i cried every morning that week when i looked in the mirror at my hair.  the stylist text me saying she'd never touch my hair again and to basically f off. i don't deserve nasty text messages.  that's not ok. very disrespectful.

stylist was young and fairly inexperienced. she also took way too long and i had to point out on multiple occasions when she was "done" that hair length was uneven in certain areas.this place is hit or miss when it comes to quality.

the wife scheduled our 2 young kids for haircuts via their website.  she shows up on time and is told website scheduling isn't working and that she'll need to wait 30-45 minutes.  wife asks for a discount and is told they'll need to call a district mgr to approve that and that will cause them to have to stop cutting peoples' hair ... which then caused customers to turn on my wife and start saying nasty things to her in front of our kids.  terrible, terrible, terrible.  we had been frequent customers at that location ... but no more!

lame... got here at 6:30 and was told they stop taking haircuts at 6:30 but close at 7... what ever... the older lady there looked like she hates her job... i guess that's what you get at one of these cheap places... crappy customer service...

it's great. it's a normal supercuts experience and i got a quick solid haircut. i don't know why everyone else is complaining about this store - it's not any different than other supercuts. i'd go back (i've been about 5 times).

yeah, idk what's going on with the stylists at this location. there was one girl that worked there that was really good and i haven't seen her in months. i guess she quit and went to a sports clips. any time supercuts gets a good employee they wind up quitting and going somewhere else. it's so sad. anyway, the last 2 haircuts i got here were pure crap...i mean, they were uneven and weren't even what i asked for. granted, my hair is a little difficult since it grown in like 50 different directions...it doesn't seem like the stylists care or really analyze someone's hair before they start chopping at it. it seems like supercuts must be a terrible company to work for since employees keep quitting and the ones that do work there seem like they don't care. i'm sure there's real talent currently employed there but doesn't seem like the company is tapping into that talent. i'm definitely going to try a different place. ya know, for just a few $$ more you can go to a full service salon.

despite the bad reviews, i went here for a bang trim. i figured you cant ruin a bang trim, right? wrong. i got in my car and straightened out my bangs and there were long pieces everywhere. i thought to myself, is 7 dollars worth it to let this lady hack my hair some more? nope. so i went home and fixed them myself... listen to the bad reviews and take your money elsewhere

i went in today to get a haircut and was told, supercuts was not going to give courteous neck trims, that it would cost the same price as a haircut???? really? how do you compare a 25 minute haircut to a 3 minute neck trim??? at the same price??? either they go back to courteous free neck trims or lose many male customers, me included. on a positive note, shantie and lana are always great at giving haircuts, i have been going there for 6 plus years now.

i went to this location with my dad on 27th sep, 2015 and it turned out to be an ugly experience!! i'm definitely not going back ever again and will make it a point to spread the word to people i know who live in the area. there were two girls working at that time and one of them that was going to give me a haircut was super rude and downright racist! her behavior seemed to stem from the fact that 1) i walked in late (although i had told her in the beginning that i could come back next day if it was too late) and 2) that i'm an indian (and she did not want to deal with even a bit of accent or non american names). it was such a display of unprofessionalism and disrespect for the customer!! i got up and told her that i did not want a haircut from her! the other girl (with a distinct tattoo on her arm) was very embarrassed by her colleague's behavior and in fact asked her to leave right away. unfortunately all of this unfolded in front of my dad who is visiting from india for few days and i'm sad that he'll leave with the wrong impression of an otherwise superb city.

unless you get mallory, don't other. so i called at 9ish and made an appointment for 11. i got there around 10 to and when i walked in heather was cutting someone else's hair and didn't even look over just said, "did you call before you came in?" and i said yes, i have an 11 o'clock appointment. she said nothing more. that should have been my first hint. at 11 she calls me back. i showed her a pic of what i wanted and told her i wanted about an inch off so it comes to the bottom of my neck and she took me back and washed my hair and sat me down. when she began to cut she segmented the front off and brushed the back down and boom cut straight across and took off 2-3 inches  (well above the bottom of my neck) i wanted the front angled and i even stopped her at one point because she just grabbed a chunk and went to snip n i said wait wait wait that's a lot and she says oh i'm gonna go down. (no idea what that meant) anyways so 10 minutes later my hair is done and i look in the mirror and i'm immediately like no no no this is way too short n she says well i told you you wouldn't be able to pull it back  don't know what the hell that was supposed to mean. then she says you're done. i ask her for a mirror to look at the back (thank god) and it wasn't even even and there were chunks of stray hair and i told her about it and she said "well that's because it's rolled under"  what the fu** does that even mean?! i said yea well when it's straight it's gonna look even more fu**ed up! she kept arguing with me to get back in the chair so she can fix it and i'm like you will not touch my hair! my dogs could have cut my hair better than this person. thankfully mallory, the manager, was standing right there and shooed her away and did the best she could to fix it... too bad it's basically irreparable. mallory was wonderful and did what she could but heather messed up my hair so bad you would swear she's never cut hair before. i personally think she botched my hair intentionally for some reason seeing as she seemed to be in a bitter mood as soon as i walked in the door. probably feigning for a cigarette, as soon as mallory told her to go that's right where she went, sorry to impose on you heather!  and thanks for fu**ing up my hair.

hit or miss here, depends on who you "get." but, there's one stylist there who doers a meticulous, thorough job, so i keep coming back. it's about 5 minutes away from my house as well, so that's a huge bonus. always a good idea to call ahead... who likes waiting for a half-hour plus-some for a trim? i don't. place is clean and pleasant, i usually have a coupon too for the $10.99 hair cut. what a deal.
i love bringing my 5 year old here. getting his haircut is always torture but the girls here are always amazing with him!! great staff and clean all around!!

went in yesterday for a trim... specifically told the person cutting my hair i wanted a trim and showed her exactly how much i wanted taken off. i even joked they do not need to be paid for quantity, but quality. i walked out a few inches taken off my hair and instead of a trim got a full blown boy hair cut. i specifically told her several times not too short and even discussed a new shampoo i had that seemed to be making my hair grow really fast. upon finishing, i replied how short it was.... i guess my definition of a tiny, tiny bit off of the bangs and hers were two different things. then she replied guess it lucky you got the shampoo that makes your hair grow faster.  why is it there are no stylists that can cut a woman's short hair without practically shaving their head and making them look like a dude.... oh and the gouges and uneven parts are the icing on the cake....  also, she cut my hair so fast she kept slapping me in the face with her comb.....

this is the worst hair cutting shit hole i've ever been to! the stylist and front desk lady were rude and seemed rushed because they didn't want to help out a customer or cut someone's hair. my hair cut was uneven and way shorter than what i asked for not to mention they can never line up my side burns evenly like how hard is it?! i could probably cut my own hair better than any of these rude nasty stylist in definitely never going here again! i'd rather pay more money for better service and quality work!
first time i had lisa cut and  my hairi brought in a picture of what i wantedi also asked her opinion.my cut was perfect !very happy with the end results will definately be back.thanks lisa

thought i'd impulsively get a haircut. the place was quiet, and i decided not to be off-put by the stylist who checked me in being rude.so while he was clipping a customer ahead of me, 3 stylists finished their cuts and then got very very very very very very involved with getting their equipment absolutely spotless. when i looked inquiringly in their direction, they glared & turned away. all i'd done was sit quietly with a magazine!once it became clear that my only option would be the stylist who'd already decided he couldn't understand my speech, i thanked the shop politely and left.if i looked like crap, it's because i needed a haircut! i guess i should figure i dodged a bullet, as who knows what this rude shop would have decided it was okay to do to my hair.

went in for a haircut tonight and the service was horrible. i got there and was never acknowledged. i waited for about an hour and watched 3 customers get waited on before i did. this service was ridiculous and i will not be coming back to this location. i have never had a problem with any other supercuts location.

i have to say that i love coming to this place whenever i need to freshen up. big thank you to andy nguyen, friendly, professional, and genuine. you will be able to learn about andys life or day as he is cutting your hair. he cares about his clients and will ask you how your doing and how life is going for you lately. he will always bring a smile to your face and the place is also located next to amazing breakfast and lunch options. all around appreciate andy and super cuts at this location, there is no need for me to go anywhere else! -sammy the luxury expert @ chapman bmw camelback

i went in just to get my sides faded. the gentleman cutting my hair was being pretty rough (i should have said something) but i also know that i can be tender headed so i tried to ignore it. when i left, i paid and tipped him; i didn't get a receipt but didn't think too much about asking for one. by the time i got home, my head was burning in multiple spots. i looked into the mirror to find multiple areas of irritation and that he had cut me along almost the entire length of my neckline. since i don't have a receipt there's not much i can do. but i will not be back, it really sucks when a service that is supposed to help you feel good ends up doing the exact opposite!

first time i had andy cut and color my hairi brought in a picture of what i wantedi also asked his opinion as to colormy cut and color was perfect !very happy with the end results will definately be back
lisa cut my hair. i asked as short as you can and she delivered. very happy with my even and clean hair cut. great location.

this is not your average supercuts. it's a very nice, upscale location and everyone here is so nice. i've been going for the past 5 years or so, to see andy. he is insanely good and has an amazing following (book ahead). if andy is on vacation i'll see lisa, as she has also been here for many years and her customers rave about her as well. use their app or call in to book ahead so that you don't have a long wait. it's worth it, and you too will come to love this little gem. thanks andy for many years of friendship and making my mess of hair look great!

i was looking for an affordable, clean location for a haircut-i chose this supercuts mostly because it's near where i live. i was pleasantly surprised by the expert service i received from lisa, a stylist here. my only surprise came from the fact that their prices are on par with the fancier salons in the area. a good experience overall. lisa is great at her craft.

i'm new to the area and read some reviews of this location before i went. some good and some bad but enough good ones for me to give it a try. i walked in right behind another customer so there was two of us in line. the gentleman who came over to the counter to check us in took the customer in front of me telling him "you have two people in front of you it will be 20mins." i walked up next and he said to me "you will wait 1 hour, there's 3-4 people ahead of you". i have no problem waiting i'm a patient person. but when you come off rude towards me when i watched you be polite to the person in front of me, that's when i get irritated. and you add a range # of people ahead of me when you tell the person in front of me something different. i understand the feeling of being busy and overwhelmed but don't take it out on a customer that walked in for a service (what your at super cuts to do). i walked out, not worth the wait if he was rude to me the second i walked in, can't imagine how the rest of the service would have gone.

thank you libby, for giving me the haircut of my dreams. i wish i could put something on my head to keep my hair from growing so i would always look this good! i like this salon overall, but the talent has varied somewhat, which is why i can't give it five stars. but i'll keep coming back because i like the friendly service, reasonable prices, and accessible location.

went to supercuts this week for a haircut and shampoo. libby id a fabulous job with the cut! it looks wonderful! and she is one of the few hair stylists that did not cut off more than i asked her to. i don't know about the other stylists here, but libby is the best!-norma
andy has been cutting my hair at this location for 5+ years. he's consistently great and my go to hair stylist. super cuts is lucky to have andy

libby was great was honest about my color she could of easily said yes do the whole thing! but she didn't. i will fer sure have her do my color again!! very sweet person. as for the bad reviews have you ever heard you get what you put out!! maybe you get bad service because your an a**.  we all can be one i know when i'm a jerk to someone they will be a jerk back! it's human nature. try being  nice to each other you will be amazed what you get in return.

i don't expect to be wow'd by a haircut from supercuts, but i at least expect the cut to be symmetrical! i asked for a trim and then some light layers with long bangs (chin-length). the trim alone took nearly 30 minutes as it seemed she was counting each individual strand on my head. you'd expect with such attention to detail that both sides of my head would at least be symmetical but she cut more "bangs" on one side of my head than the other in a completely botched attempt at layers. definitely not interested in ever returning.
libby is excellent! she repaired a botched hair color done at a nearby pricey salon! she's awesome!

i like coming to get my haircut here. not sure what happened with the rest of these reviews, but i am always pleased with the service and price point of this supercuts! will continue to give them my business!

i have cut my hair twice here and before everything was perfect the girls were very nice very polite and patient but on this occasion vicky the stylist got really upset because i used my phone had a emergency call so she didn't finish the job appropriately, she rushed through it, she didn't even clean up with a warm towel like they always do. when i brought it up she argued with me saying that i was rude and that customers are not always right. i never got on her way of cutting my hair i just didn't talk to her while she was working on my hair cut and is my thought she took  it personal.

this location for supercuts is not the best experience i had.  the stylist that shaved my head was not knowledge and was too afraid to use the hair clippers to shave down to stubbles.  he was not that great but friendly and nice guy.  i would hope they can shape things up to have better stylists and knowledgeable.

when one kid wanted a short and spiky haircut and the other wants to keep it longer like justin bieber, i realized that going to my regular barber might not be the best move, so we checked out supercuts. even walking in without an appointment they were able to get both boys in the chairs within 10 minutes and we were out of there in half an hour. both of the boys came out looking great and they were both very happy with the haircuts they received. i would definitely recommend this location, especially if you have kids who need haircuts.

i've been here several times and am mostly happy with my experience here.  wait times are generally very reasonable and the ability to check in ahead of time is a massive convenience added in the past few years.
we visited for a back to school haircut. it was just awful, my daughter had strands that weren't cut. went back to have it fixed, still not good. don't waste your time.

ask for landree and you'll get a 4-star haircut i guarantee. he is the most knowledgeable person there and can even give you tips and tricks on how to maintain, style and keep your hair looking good always.make sure to tell him how you want your haircut and he'll make sure you get what you want.

nice job... my bad.. didn't get her name. she has done hair now for a little over a year. young and dark brown hair. anyway i gave her specific instructions and she followed them to a t! will definitely come back here next time in town.
