great cut, great price - i have a huge amount of hair and jasmine did a fantastic job, from washing to finishing. she talked me through what she recommended, then cut it just like we agreed. add in a superb scalp massage and i'm sold. my husband and our sons also get their hair cut here and they are really happy with both jasmine and gracie. jasmine was working by herself and she did a really good job on my hair while also greeting new customers and checking them in. i didn't feel rushed at all even though she had a client waiting for their turn. great experience and i'll be back!

awful. just awful, i explained the simple cut and even showed her pics. i felt bad for the lady cause i shortly learned she had no clue what she was doing, by the time i stopped her, it was too late and my daughter paid the price right before a birthday party. this place is on my "never again" list. sadly my husband has gone there for over a year. do not go to this lady!

graciela gave me a great haircut!  she listened intently to what i wanted and though it took her extra time, wow, it is perfect!  thank you graciela!  i'll definitely be back cause on top of that, the price was great!  i am so pleased, yes, so very, very pleased.

my husband goes here and doesn't have trouble. i went in and there was one stylist working on someone's hair. she didn't even acknowledge me when i walked in. there was a family that came in as i did and they were acknowledged. i was sitting there and up came another stylist and took one of the family members before me. i just needed a trim and style. i will not be coming back. i can see what others mean by unprofessional.
this location is dated and the staff are unprofessional.  i've seen the hair stylists take personal calls during haircuts.  super long waits even when there is nobody there...
only one hairdresser on staff and she is not friendly at all. to me it seems like she hates life and hates what she is doing
literally my hair looks like i tried to cut it myself, with a viking sword, without a mirror, with only my left hand. it is truly unbelievable how bad they messed my hair up.

checking in online with their new app is  a complete waste of time. checked in 45 minutes early so once i arrived i could walk in and be serviced. to my surprise both ladies working that evening took multiple clients after me showing up and checking in. at that time i was told that i would be taken care of they did not inform me i would have to wait an additional 20 minutes and  three customer later i was next. then as i left the premises a large gentlemen came out after i had left assuming to make sure no trouble was to be started.... since when were workers spouses/ boyfriends allowed to start sitting in chairs behind the counter where stylists work and act like a hired body guard to super cuts employees ? i won't be returning to super cuts and the bad thing is i have been a customer since i was a young child.

the young lady that had done my hair  twice is perfect. i cant remember her name ( it starts with an  r ) but she has been perfect , i am an unconventional woman (( not the usual just a trim person and wear my hair in a flattop ) and she listens and does exactly what i wanted even doing a couple of design lines in the back . could not ask for better !!!

went with my husband. first stylist said she didn't know how to cut a flat top. we said we'd wait because three other stylists were there. after waiting 25 minutes one stylist took someone who came in after we did (he'd called for an appt so that's fine) but the other two went to lunch without saying a word. just disappeared. so we left. amazingly poor service. won't be back.
they did better than the barber shop on lackland afb but not the best haircut my husband has gotten.
1st time coming here, i needed 2 haircuts for my children came in without an appt.  and they took them super fast. definitely coming back again, great  and friendly customer service.

since when does it take two ladies to go talk about high lights costs and different colors. to make it worse both ladies left their stations to talk. errrrrrr. oh well, hair cut ended up ok but i do think they need more stylist.

i've been here a few times for myself and son. all times we were taken care of right away and our haircuts have always been on-point. the ladies are very sweet and after sitting there for a few hours having color done, i noticed a lot of regulars come through which was very nice to see.

i came in and was told there were 2 people in front of me.  there were two people waiting, so ok.  i understand that people check in online, but 4 people later i was still sitting there.  i get it, people have their regulars, but at least have the courtesy to acknowledge the customer still waiting as people after them are checking in and seen before them.

went and got highlights and it took about 2 hours. all the girls there were very professional and my hair came out great. i noticed that the store is very clean, cleaner than i have seen anywhere else. i noticed all the stylist were pretty fast, most of them told me hello while i was "cooking" as they called it. so basically it was a fun to group of girls who managed to interact with everyone. later on in the day i took my 4 year old son to get a zero fade and it came out excellent. defiantly a family environment. i will most defiantly be back. tuesday they have $10 haircuts.
the only person i go to is rosalina. she does a good job, so far my experience is the people are quite friendly.
one person ahead of me. waited over an hour to get service. the ladies on the weekend are super slow. never had bad service here before. however note dont come on sunday.

i will never go to another super cuts again. the people that worked there were rude to another customer, did not know how to cut hair. i know i was in trouble when i told them to cut my son hair medium fade 0 on the side and a 2 on top. and the lady said do i want to keep the sideburns.  lol did not know how to do a fade and another women had to finish it. my bad experience.

they did a decent job on my daughters hair, shaped it to frame her face, facility was clean and close to my house for a quick trim it works but i didn't like is that i waited 30 minutes after my appointment time.

sitting here waiting for 45 minutes, 2 hairstylists cutting hair, and many more keep popping from the back, just look out and go back to their little room in the back. wait is ridiculous, only reason i stopped here, again, is to give them a second chance from previous times months ago, again, same service. slow, and girls here seem to hate their job. for sure not giving them a 3rd chance.

i'm usually skeptical to go to places like this for a haircut because i'm super picky and sometimes i don't want to splurge for a simple haircut/ trim.  my friend recommended me to stop by here and ask for mary and omg every time i go i am  always satisfied!!! i can show mary a picture of what i'm aiming for and she always gives her honest opinion before she cuts my hair and that's what a good stylist should do! please please try it out and ask for mary she's the best you won't regret it!
best hair cut i've had in many years. come by and see mary i promise you won't be disappointed.

the skills of the stylists is average yet no one seems like they actually enjoy working here. it's frustrating to be told you're next on the list and then 5 people get called before you. their explanation was that other people had checked in online or called ahead but shouldn't that have been mentioned when we initially checked in? i'm fine with waiting as long as i have a good idea of how long i'll actually be waiting for.

supercuts does a fine job of cutting my hair. then again i have a very simple hairstyle. if you're looking for inexpensive salon treatment for your coiffure then i would give supercuts a minute. my biggest complaint is that they always leave too many cut hairs on my head and down the back of my neck and shirt. this happens not only at this location but every supercuts i have been to. immediately after getting a haircut i always go to the bathroom and wet my hands and run them through my head to remove all the little hairs. i don't know if this is due to improper training or desire to sell you a shampoo and rinse but this is not acceptable.

i visited this location when i was out of my state for a wedding. the place is nice clean and efficient. they're realistic on wait time and everyone greats you. it was my 1st time going there and i need a updo for a wedding. sarah jane ( i believe that was her name) who actually did my hair was nice and friendly. she kept making sure she wasn't being to rough with my head. i didn't know exactly how i wanted my hair i suggested somethings to her and showed her the dress i was going to wear. she did a fantastic job.

apparently the solution for a cowlick here is to cut it super short... despite the hair around it being about 2-3 inches long. i am not too picky about my hair. first, because i still have a decent head of hair and that makes me happy. second, it grows back. but when a stylist is as lazy or incompetent as to simply cut the cowlick extra short in hopes that addresses the issue i get a little upset. what makes the matter worse is when i noticed the hair on the back of my head was longer than other parts i asked her "why is not even with the front?" and she told me "because i don't want the cowlick to stand up." i did not notice the botched job she did until i got home and was extra mad because not only did she cut the cowlick extra short, she used the cowlick as an excuse for keeping the hair uneven on top my head! avoid this place! there are plenty of others within the couple miles.

haircuts are quick and usually decent, though quality can vary by stylist. my kids get great cuts here. i don't like to have my own done here, though, as nobody seems to be able to cut decent layers. i did get my bangs trimmed today while my son got a haircut, and while i was happy with my bangs, i was pretty disappointed with the experience. my stylist asked if i wanted a haircut too and i declined. she talked me into a half-inch trim, which she completed in under 5 minutes on my completely dry hair--didn't spritz it with water, let alone wash it--then charged me for a full haircut. i thought it was odd she didn't even wet it down, but then thought maybe she was being nice and still considering it a bang trim--nope. won't make that mistake again--or go back to this location.

for starters, i love this supercuts! i've been coming here for several years and have never left unhappy!! i recently got my hair dyed and my hair definitely took to the the color and it came out way too dark. i was so unhappy with the color. not anyone's fault, just wrong selection of color done by us. ‍ well i came in today and emma was so helpful and patient when trying to fix my color. she worked so diligently to make sure i left happy but also to keep my hair healthy. it was trial and error, but i'm so happy with how my hair turned out! i had to hug her at the end! definitely recommend this supercuts and emma!

i'm not one to write reviews, i actually created an account specifically to write how horrible this location is.hands down worst haircut i have had done. the girl had no idea what she was doing. she attempted to tell me she was done, i had to point out the obvious patches of hair she left. i would've asked her to fix it but i was worried she would leave me nothing to fix if she made it worse. i asked for gel and instead of her styling my hair i had to do it myself because let me quote her, "my fingers are stubby". if you can't apply gel to someone's hair you probably shouldn't be cutting it to begin with.there was another employee kissing her partner which was very unprofessional.i've gone to supercuts for awhile and this is by far the worst location and experience i've had. if i could give it zero stars i would.avoid if you like your hair!

i usually like going here, but the last time i went the lady who cut my hair seemed to be in a huge rush even though there was no one else waiting.just chopped at my hair with scissors with almost no attempt at making look like i didn't just grab scissors and do it myself

i checked in online, drove over there only to find they were closed at 5:45 pm on a monday night to film a commercial. perhaps you shouldn't take reservations if you're closed. perhaps you should change your website to reflect your random closings. thanks for wasting my time. if you can't do the simple things right, you can't be trusted with anything.
the best bang for your buck !!!!!great hair style and friendly atmosphere.

dee is my favorite.the ladies in here are always having a good time and atmosphere here is alway lively i've had 3 - 4 great hair cuts hereask them to go hard on you during the hair rinse,      you'll thank me later.

i have been coming to this location for well over 7 years! lenzy is by far the best! you may walk in as just a client but you leave knowing your part of the supercuts family! all the others ladies are friendly! love this place!!!!!

wow! i have been coming here for over two years now and this place has always exceeded my expectations. the ladies are friendly, welcoming, and professional. you can tell they love their job. i have been going to lyndsey the longest. she is amazing as well as dee! the prices cannot be beat and the wait time is not long. i've never had any complaints. i highly recommend. i will be back soon!
they did a sloppy haircut on me and my dad. the people were rude and i do not recommend this place.

the girl with pink hair named kayla cut my brothers hair who is very specific with the way he wants his hair and she was told to just trim the sides of his head and she ended up cutting off his hair on the top of his head and left him with a very sad and ugly hair due which left my brother crying after leaving the salon. supercuts is not the place you want to go to get you're hair cut (the way you want it.) this all explains on why the place was empty and only $15.

i came in and saw lyndsey yesterday and she did a phenomenal job on my short haircut. i tried cutting my hair myself to be short enough for work and it didn't turn out too hot. but anyway, she was incredibly professional and very kind to me. i would highly recommend and will definitely come back if i'm still staying here in town.
sarah did awesome job! she cut and style my hair perfectly. she listened my wishes and  gave me few suggestions and i end up walking out with big smile. i will def go back.
this is an update. lindsey and angie are still there and continue to do a great job. they also have dee and another young lady there who do great work as well.
great haircut for a reasonable price.  karen is the bomb, especially if you get a shampoo, and lindsay is good, too, with her spicy personality hahaha...
great and friendly staff! lenzy is a great stylist! dee is wonderful! you can't go wrong with either stylist!!
dee was absolutely awesome. i had an appointment at another place a little further down the road. but, they stood me up so i went here instead. i'm really glad that i did. i will be back. thank you!!

i had my hair cut today by dee, she was friendly, professional and did a great job on my hair. this was the first time i visited a supercuts and am very please that i did. i will definitely return. thanks dee!

very good and friendly! walked in without an appointment but didn't have to wait very long to be serviced. there were two ladies working and both were very nice and welcoming. the parking is ample and the service is great. it didn't take very long for her to clean up my hair and bangs, and she also gave me recommendations for good food places! decent pricing as well. i would come back if i was back in san antonio again. thank you for the great service! keep up the great work!

i had a good experience here: all the ladies were nice, and payed close attention to what i had to say. i hadn't gotten a haircut for a while, but each place i went to didn't listen to what i wanted. so in other words i am very protective with my hair and who cuts it. i'm a college student, i needed somewhere cheap but does good quality cuts. i'm very happy i found this place and i will be going back more and more.

lived in sa for 6 months and went here off and on. best supercuts i've ever been too. never got a bad hair cut here and could trust all the girls there. took one star off cause i would prefer to wait an extra two minutes than to walk through and sit in a strangers hair...

i wanted a cut that was shorter, long enough to pull up off my neck when needed, easy maintenance and still cute after a wash and go. chloe did exactly that!  love it!  i recommend chloe if you need a cut.

not pleased. i have been here since 430 for 2 haircuts. (its now 540)boy hair cuts no less.  we were given an appt time of 445. i understand taking your time with a client. but there was an hour spent on a kid (about 14)who had been left here and mom gave no direction on what needed to happen. almost done  with his hair and here comes big brother. mom wants it short. so now we have to call mom and get direction that should have been given before hand. to say i am not pleased is an understatement. i only came here bc their regular barber was closed. i am in dire straits. it won't happen again. and this girl had better be as meticulous with my son's hair as she was with the kid before him.well, she didn't. she offered me $5 off. as i was trying not to allow my anger get the best of me,her manager stepped in and comped the haircut.thoroughly disappointed in how the stylist handled or was going to handle the situation. she was a bit confrontational with me and i not been weak with hunger at this point she would have seen a side of me i save for very few.

i've gotten haircuts here before and they're usually nice, but every time i come in it's an issue!  i don't understand how a haircut place like supercuts offers walk-ins yet you can never get a haircut when you walk in.  they always make you come back an hour later or way later in the afternoon.  remember they don't make appointments, right?! i try to call instead.  i called at 1:10 to try to put my name down for 2:30 and the girl tells me that they can't schedule me that far out because they don't do appointments.  she tried to schedule me for 2:10.  so i call back at 1:30 (note: 15-20 min difference) to try to get 2:30 and another girl tells me that they can't see my at 2:30 and tried to schedule me for 3:00!!!  what?!!  that's an hour and a half later.  mind you...the other person told me they couldn't schedule that far out!!  i don't get why it's so difficult to get a haircut at this place and i'm sorry, but ana has helped me before and she's always been so nice, but today on the phone she really had bad customer service.  sounded as though it bothered that she had to answer the phone and help me.  i'm disappointed with this place.  i've been here at all hours of the day and they're excuse is that it's always a busy hour.  i will now be going elsewhere.maybe they should have a person dedicated to walk-ins only!  don't advertise that you take walk-ins when in reality it never happens!!

this supercuts is one of the highest rated in san diego. i was fortunate enough to be in the area and the app wait time stated zero minutes waiting.  i came at the right time apparently, as soon i was getting my hair cut the place got swamped with a 2 hour wait time. seems like alicia is the store rockstar ( and apparently the store manger to boot). there are many reviews calling her out by name as their preferred stylist. i can totally agree with the praise. she was fast and precise and this may have been the best ever supercut that i've ever had. a striking difference from my last visit to the mission valley sc where that was a terrible cut. there was also something else about all of the stylists here. they looked like stylists from a fancy salon, not from supercuts or sports clips. you don't have to worry about having someone that looks like your mom giving you a haircut here...- wednesday, thursday, early, but never come here on a saturday. - ask for alicia....

asked for a fade using clippers on the back and sides, but the hair stylist stated she was not comfortable blending with clippers (!), and instead used scissors and spent about 20 minutes doing it by hand. the end result was this weird choppy look that i definitely did not ask for.

i hate to give this awesome review simply because i don't want my stylist to get too busy and make it difficult for me to schedule with her. however, she deserves a great review. i always get a 1 or 1.5 cut on the sides and back and most stylists don't take the time to run the clippers long enough to make sure every hair is cut evenly. alicia (manager) does take that extra step and makes sure every thing is to my liking. i've been to many barbershops and i can never get the cut i want at an affordable price. alicia is the best!the facilities and clean and the rest of the staff is also nice. it certainly makes it easier to schedule with the supercuts app now that it works properly.

i came here originally to get a botched haircut fixed (my own doing) and alexis came to the rescue. everyone at this location was and continues to be helpful, accommodating and kind. i now go to alexis for my bang trims, haircuts, blowouts and i now buy my shampoo and conditioner here. this place is the real deal. great service. great prices.

so bummed out! my daughter came here for a color fix and explained exactly what we were looking for. long story short and 2 1/2 hours later, she walked out with the front of her hair being white with violet in the front that i ended up having to go to the grocery store to buy hair color to put foils in my own to fix her before pictures. i was very clear to her and the other she asked to his sister, that i was unhappy and that she needed to fix it. she even had the guts to charge me $85 for the mess. i was just sick. beware when people sound like they know what they're talking about. if you need a color job .go somewhere else

i love this place. i've been going here exclusively since they opened and have had nothing but excellent service and even better haircuts. roxy is my go to stylist and has been for quite some time now. she's always happy and does an amazing job. she's friendly and really cares for her clients. her tea tree treatments are extremely relaxing and totally worth the extra price. i wouldn't think that getting a haircut would be something i'd ever say i look forward to but i love going to the supercuts in poway!if you don't want to wait, make an appointment over the phone or use the app! it's easy and super helpful.

moved back to the area last year and usually stop by here on a whim once every month or two to get my hair shaved down to a number 1 length mainly for ease of waking up at 0400 everyday and considering i usually wear a hat. stopped by here today and was able to call ahead on my way home which was very convenient, but also had a great experience. alicia was very inventive with my bi-monthly head shaving when it came to fading my beard and shaping the back of my head. who knew you could have both squared and rounded at the same time! **mind...blown...** additionally, i got a legit beard massage which i would never have thought to be a thing until today. the beard oil she used was also on point! glad to have moved close-by to a legit supercuts! will definitely keep this as my regular place!

i've been coming to this location for approximately 2 years because anna gives me a fantastic cut every time. lately though, i feel like it might be time to look elsewhere. there is no receptionist at the salon and the stylists have to stop what they are doing to answer the phone, greet customers and check them in. anna even had to stop cutting my hair to assist the at&t tech who was there working on the salon's internet (while i sat in the chair for 10 minutes waiting with a quickly drying head of hair) the result? a crappy, poorly shaped cut. as i said, i've been going there for 2 years and this is not a new situation, there has never been a receptionist and the stylists have always had to stop their work to attend to others, but it's always annoyed me and just felt like it is beyond time to say so. anna is not to blame, she's always professional, apologetic, and does great work so i hope the powers that be actually read these reviews and consider properly staffing their salon. it's not fair to paying customers and it's not fair to the hard-working gals that work there. quit being cheap supercuts!

very rude staff. i made an appointment and when i showed up they told me two people were still in front of me. i asked why did i make an appointment if i can't be seen at that time. they told me they were running behind. i responded with asking how long it would take to wait and they couldn't give me a direct wait time and laughed at me while i asked questions. i made an appointment so i wouldn't have to wait for 30+ minutes. as someone who is in this industry myself it would behoove your company to not treat your clients this way. if you're running late do your client the decency to call and let them know. i drove all the way out to this salon for nothing. i will not go to a supercuts again if this is how they run their business.

$19 for basic trim$4 for shampoo45 min-1 hr wait for 1 person @ 3:30pm on a friday???? (only one stylist on the floor). there were two people waiting ahead on me and i watched as 4 people walked in and then left, after they heard that the wait was 45 minutes. one of the most ridiculous parts about the wait is that there was another stylist there, but instead of cutting hair she was putting price stickers on merchandise. huh???!the only 2 reasons why i wound up staying here was bc 1) it was the closest place to my house (the next closest place is wendy's hair and design & they charge an insane $55 for a basic trim...wait, huh??? does it come with anal bleaching or something??). 2) i got very little sleep last night so i didn't feel like driving further.
been here about 8 times now and never had a bad haircut.  roxy is great but also used a couple of the other girls.  there is a good vibe in there, no awkwardness or insincere conversation.
my first time here. i'm super happy with my haircut. roxy did a great job! make sure to make an appointment since there's always long waiting list.

alicia is amazing!! i'm so happy i stumbled in here and got her!! she took her time and cut my hair to perfection!! i will for sure go back to her every time! i love my hair and i'm sooo happy i met her! thank you alicia!!

first let me start by saying that i am really happy with my hair cut done by savana, however, the color experience was awful! i have completely white hair as i am prematurely grey. i decided to have it colored platinum so it didn't look so stark. savana colored it. on the first attempt it came out rusty white with a pink hue. the second attempt turned my hair a light aluminum shade. she said that the color wouldnt take because my hair lacked pigment. i just stated that i wanted some warmth added to my already white hair...so .....on the third attempt she put "gold " in it and it came out burnt orange. ....then i just gave up!...my co-workers said it looked like a golden lemur or a golden retriever. so to make a long story short don't ever have your hair colored there. i suspect that the stylist there lack experience with color.

i always get nervous trying to find a new place to get my haircut since having just moved back to san diego. i work close by this supercuts and thought i'd give it a try and alicia did a great job. turns out she's the general manager for this location as well as a few other locations, murphy canyon and i think escondido. naturally she did a great job being the gm, i suppose one would expect nothing less but there are those managers out there... anyway, we had a great conversation while she was working on my hair and she did not thankfully, forget that she was cutting my hair because of the conversation.i also noticed that she did a great job overseeing the shop in general, the other stylists (but not micromanaging) and tending to the customers who walked in.i was impressed because on two occasions she specifically remembered details about other customer's cuts and preferences. one guy who walked in, she passed him on to another stylist because she was busy with me and she told the stylist exactly how the gentleman liked his haircut and believe me, it was not just a generic instruction. props to alicia, i hope to have the same experience each time i go in to your shop, especially when you are not there. you seemed to run your businesses very well and have a great rapport with your stylists and customers, so i imagine it to be the case. then will come the 5th star

alicia did an amazing job on my haircut. i went from a boring just below the shoulders haircut to a perfectly layered and cute cut above the shoulders. it's couldn't have turned out better. i'll be back for sure!

roxy! yes that is the only word you need to know. .aka roxanne makes me really look forward to a haircut. i have been seeing roxy for about a year now and every time i can count on a good cut. she is fun and friendly, precise and efficient. i love the way the online appointment works, it's very convenient and alleviates any wait time.
lil sarah washed, cut, and styled my hair.  i was so impressed with her professionalism and positive attitude.  i enjoy going in to see her and always love the way she does my hair.  she is the best!

truly enjoyed having my son's hair cut here. new stylist named kimberly works here now and does a great job. i appreciated there is finally a stylist who cuts hair like a professional. i will be coming back and having his hair cut by her. thank you kimberly!
marie did a good job , i think she is one of the best men's hair stylist i ever tried she is very detailed and will not rush you out.

i usually go to supercuts for basic upkeep haircuts (trims, thinning out). went to this location for a shampoo, trim, thinning. i was the only customer in the store during my entire visit. my hairdresser was stephanie. after shampooing she combed through my hair and while i do have fairly long thick hair, i've never had as painful/complicated of an experience brushing it as i did here. i figured it was just a bad hair day for me and dealt with it. the haircut seemed to go fine, fairly quickly, and felt nice and light when i was done. looked ok in the mirror, while still wet. after my visit i threw my hair into a bun, headed to class, and didn't really do anything with it until the next day. when i dried and straightened it my boyfriend (who doesn't usually notice haircuts) said , oh my gosh what happened to your hair?   why you ask?!this was due to the fact that not only was there much more visibly gone than the inch i had discussed, but there were chunks of my hair cut at completely different lengths. my bangs (previously swooped to the side) were chopped bluntly but a chunk was missed. the two sides did not match up length wise. there are chunks within my hair (i.e, behind my ear, bottom layer) that should be the longest layer , that are now only about three inches long (my hair goes past my shoulders!!).  when i put my hair in a ponytail now, random pieces won't stay up. i can't wear my hair half up because of the super short areas in the middle layers. and wearing my hair all down and straight poses the same issue.  after working so hard to grow my hair out, i am not sure whether to laugh or cry, at this time i've done  both.  i considered returning to see if a manager could help fix my hair, but i decided i don't want anyone there to touch it again. i could have done a more even cut backwards in my mirror. so disappointed in this experience, not sure how that lady is allowed to touch peoples hair.  :( **in the photos please excuse my un made up face .  i also included 2 before photos-- this was supposed to be a one inch trim
i got a really awesome hair cut from rose at this supercuts the other day. she understood exactly what i wanted and was able to do it flawlessly. i will definitely go back to her.
i will continue to go see janet she is very nice and do a good job, love the location as well if i you wanna go out after you're hair is done across the street is the utc mall.

kelly was awesome! she gave me exactly what i was looking for and also advised me on what would look really great on me. i took her advise and i absolutely love my new hair cut!! definitely recommend her!

i'm super impressed by this supercuts! i came in and was greeted promptly and kindly. kelly, the hair artist, was incredible at listening to what i wanted done, combining the different elements (keep it long, add layers,make it v shaped in the back), and keeping good conversation =)i would def recommend this supercuts! even if your hesitant like i was at first, you won't be sorry ^_^

want to get a decent haircut without the salon prices ?head on over to supercuts ! it can be a gamble, but if you like taking risks, this will do !i've been to a few other supercuts locations and surprisingly have been happy with the results. no major traumatic experiences. knock on wood. figured i'd give this place a shot since i was getting my car serviced nearby and needed to kill time. yes..why not get a haircut ? summer is here ! time for a change ! located at a small outdoor shopping center with nearby restaurants/nail salon/small businesses.as i walked in on a friday afternoon, i was immediately greeted. there was one other customer ahead of me, so the wait was short. they gathered my information to input in their system and asked for the type of service i wanted: shampoo, cut, and blow dry - the basicsmy hairstylist, shari asked for what type of cut i wanted. she made sure i was specific with what i wanted which i appreciated. i hate when hairstylists assume and jack up your haircut and don't do anything to fix the problem. anyway, shari was quite the opposite. she was fast, efficient, and very conversational. i felt very comfortable with her. she took 3 inches off and added some layers. it's medium-length which i prefer for my frame. she did exactly what i wanted.in addition, she wanted to know the types of products i used for my hair and to get a history of my haircare routine. she was open to hearing me out and gave me great recommendations.i purchased a couple products that she used on my hair: paul mitchell awapuhi shampoo and conditioner  - love the scent ! no pressure to sell either. overall, i'm very satisfied with the whole experience ! i wouldn't mind coming back if i was in the area.supercuts is really stepping it up and hiring well-qualified hairstylists ! thanks for not burning a hole in my wallet !

super frustrated! this weekend i took my son to get his haircut first and last time here! the poor girl was confused about who the next client was even when the other person told her several times my son was next. the name rc seriously confused them. he got a ok haircut she was nice and tired. i was told it was $15, i tipped $2 no problem or so i thought! i check my account and no i was charged $32! i call to ask how much a haircut is the girl says $23 i tell her i was told $15 she says well on tuesday's it's $14. i informed her i was told it was $15. she says oh yes maybe. i tell her i was charged $32 she says that i (me the customer!) made a mistake. i ask what do you mean i made a mistake it was $15 i tipped $2 she says oh yes you must've made a mistake when you tipped. i was pissed now! i told her i'm not stupid! i paid $15 for the haircut i tipped $2 that makes $17 not $32! she insists that it was my error and that i should not be upset. i told her really i shouldn't be upset you guys charged me more than what i approved and i shouldn't be upset?! she tells me to come with my receipt and they'll fix it. i tell her i don't have a receipt she says just come with my card and hung up. fuming i get there telling them i'm there for my refund. she tells me i don't need my card the girl left the money in a envelope then says because i tipped the machine thought i wanted to tip $17 but the girl left my over payment for me. i was too pissed for words but i couldn't just leave i told her very loud to make sure all of them heard in the future you don't tell the customer their wrong and don't have attitude because that's what pissed me off! if you go there you better pay cash if not watch you credit/atm cards they are i'm sure scamming people!

i came in because my normal barber couldn't take me and needed a haircut today. i asked the lady for a shadow fade and she had no idea what i was talking about. i asked for a light trim than and to clean up around my neck and ears. she couldn't not even give me a straight line in the back. it is even noticeable from a distance how uneven the back of my hair is. i gave up and told her i was done just so i can go home and fix it myself. go somewhere else. you were warned
called before coming in, an hour before closing, and got turned away when we got there 10 minutes after calling. plenty of people inside the salon but they locked their doors on us when we got there.
polly is my hairstylist she is damm good at work. she understand what i exactly looking for and gave me a new styling look. thanks to "polly" again.

this review is about chelsea. first of all, i understand the risk of going to a place such as supercuts, however i do not understand how someone so incompetent can work there. i got a haircut there yesterday and asked specifically for a shorter haircut with not too many layers, a very simple and easily completed style-or so i thought. what i walked out with was nothing short of horrifying. the top layer is so short and thick its like a bowl cut around my head. i cannot believe that not only did she not listen to me at all, she also did not well execute the haircut she thought i should have. since i'm out of hair, there is no way to fix it and instead i am using my own money to buy extensions, and heavily relying on a half up do. i would like to see supercuts make some sort of effort to remedy the situation (free product, etc), since now i am basically sol.

my boyfriend joe told me that sarah cut his hair one time months ago and that he liked the way she did it... hope i can get to meet her to see what can she do with my hair because is very thin... maybe i would drop by soon

i took my son here to trim his hair for school. i specifically told the girl, leave his hair long. and explained in detail how he is very attached to his hair. having only cut it by a barber one other time. i usually cut it.she completely hacked his hair. only leaving the front longer because i asked her to stop cutting. he left in tears because of her inability to understand what the customer asked for.will never return here.

i love the supercuts at genesee. everyone is extremely accommodating and talented. i'm always greeted with a smile and my overall experience is great. i would like to give a shout out to kelly, who is my go to hair stylist. she is a magician. she knows exactly how i want my hair to be done and always delivers the perfect haircut. thank you kelly for everything you do. i really appreciate it! because of kelly, i keep coming to supercuts at genesee again and again, and will continue to do so!!

i spent a few days looking at reviews in the clairemont mesa/kearny mesa for a hair salon that did good work, but was also affordable as i only get my hair trimmed and did not wish to pay $50+ to have my split ends cut and a few layers added. i came across sarah from supercuts on yelp and saw she had really great reviews and took a chance and called up supercuts and asked for sarah. i called an hour before to see when they could take me in and was told to come on over. i was greeted, remembered from my call, and immediately taken to a chair. all i knew was that i wanted long, face-framing layers and to take 2-3" of dead ends. as i was sitting in the chair, sarah took my vague requests and channeled them into specific, direct actions and really explained to me how certain layers would look in comparison to what i desired and divulged knowledge and expertise to help me achieve the results i wanted. she even offered a certain type of layer that i had never heard of and i could just tell she was trying to help me get the trim and layering i desired. sarah executed trimming my hair and adding layers exactly how i requested. i trusted sarah according to her reviews and her performance did not disappoint. i will continue to see sarah because i know she will use her knowledge and expertise to help me achieve my goals of healthy hair.
i love coming here! i have an autistic son named mason. his stylist kelly is so great. she talks with him, and  is very patient and sweet! 5 stars all the way! thank you kelly

poor costumer service. when i walked in there was only one costumer and two employees. for some reason both of the employees were attending the same person. i waited for 5 minutes until one of the two ladies decided to attend me.

last week i took my daughter in for a haircut and it had definitely been a long time (my daughter wanted to try the long hair thing). she's ten and was very sure of what she wanted! kathleen was who did her cut and not only was she nice and friendly she made my daughter feel so happy! even a week later she's still talking about her haircut experience and beautiful new do! we will definitely return and hope to see kathleen again!

went to get a haircut and she did not know how to give a fade... i asked for a high fade and she kept asking "are you sure that's what you want?"  i kept saying yes..  she did not blend the sides, so it looks like i have fluffed feathers now. you're supposed to blend the sides so it looks natural.. didnt even bother, she just rushed me.  i went there cause i didnt want to drive 20 minutes to my regular barber "who is 12 dollars cheaper" and cuts hair much better without questioning me.  not to mention pointing at my hair and laughing with another barber.  i will never go to a supercuts again.  do these barbers have any knowledge on cutting hair?  i didnt think a fade would be that difficult .

we tried to give opportunities to solve my 3 yr old son's first haircut debacle but it was just a mess. bad haircut, no communication or fun for him.   he's such a sweet little guy and the girl took no opportunities to engage, at all.   i would avoid for kids if you expect any personality combined with quality hair cutting.  on a relaxing sunday midday, minimal customers, we specifically asked for someone with experience and good at first hair cuts.  we got the "oh well all do that" and it seemed like it was probably just a coin flip and whoever lost got the job. the girl maybe said 5 words to our son.  our son was super chill and did exactly what he was told.  but she never asked his name or anything at all about him, it was just "look down".... and " is that good.?" and it wasn't.  then the clippers came out and buzz fast and uneven...  very disappointing.  we called back and got apology from manager, took him back when manager was there and she fixed the haircut but didn't really care to satisfy the unhappiness that we wasted our first experience with his hair on them.  they didn't offer to refund us or offer a free next hair cut as we have "two boys under 8"... a lot of future hair to cut.  you'd think future business would be something they would value but they seemed happy with fixing the mess and having me sign away liability by abmitting my minimal satisfaction.   had the girl been hospitable and done a bad job, or had an amazing haircut and been boring.... maybe it would he something to let go, but both awful and the manager cured the haircut but it was clear our business was not cared for.  unfortunate but there seems to be some good spots for kids, so we will seek some referrals instead.
fantastic servicei stopped in for a hair cut last week and got brianna bishop and she was fantastic!!!! friendly and bubbly personality she made the time go by fast and made me smile

i love this place so much and my favorite hairstylist to go to is estella she's the best. she always does wonders to my hair. as long as she's still there i will always come back. she's a sweet girl. thanks estella

i've been to so many supercuts, and found the best hairstylist for me....cecily! she understood exactly what i wanted, and it looks great....therefore i'm happy!! i've bought so many hair products as well. she recommended d:struct and i'm lovin that. cecily is also super nice too! thanks!

worst haircut ever!! do not see stella... she has absolutely no clue on how to cut hair.. and when hearing how upset i was - the rest of the staff gave a looks as though that was the norm... not surprised at my frustration...asked for the closest barber and they gladly gave me it.. manager griselda just stood there like nothing going on... worst place ever

i got my hair colored and cut from manager griselda! she is soooo wonderful! she had me looking fabulous! she always does a great job that's why i go back to her every time! and she's so nice and makes it a really enjoyable experience! i got so many people i work with saying ur hair looks fabulous and makes u look younger! how great is that!

super cuts is the best place to get your hair cut. the hair stylist are friendly and do a great job on cutting your hair the way you want it. i've been back three times and have been satisfied each time. i recommend supercuts to anyone who needs a haircut.
got a haircut.  it's bad.  looked fine day of but it's growing in horribly.  bad place for haircuts based on my haircut.

i made an appointment and i had a $3.00 off coupon , they wouldn't take it because it was for a different super cuts. i chose not to stay and went to the super cuts on el cajon. they were very willing to accept a coupon from a different store.it's amazing to think that a place of business would be willing to lose a customer over $3.00.bad customer service. i won't be going back.

i came in an hour before they closed for a haircut. wait time was average, but they have seats and recent magazines, so all is well there.i do have to give a shout-out to the hairdressers, though. more than one person came in at the last minute asking for a haircut. when told that no more appointments were being accepted (as i wasn't the only one waiting, it was obvious there was a wait), these people became visibly frustrated; one man was verbally frustrated and said the manager had told him he could come in right until closing. when they said it wasn't policy, he slammed out of there saying loudly and angrily: "i'll never come back."at no time was anyone in the business mean or insulting, merely apologetic. not even after the guy slammed out. props to them.

if you go in for a cut, ask for cecily! she's the best stylist we've had here. my brother and husband both go to her. she's sweet, comforting and detail oriented. all good things when looking for a stylist :)

i really enjoyed my visit to supercuts. griselda really took her time and did a wonderful job. my hair grows in all kinds of crazy directions and can be difficult to cut but she did wonderfully. thanks again.

being new to san diego and having no barber, i thought i'd keep it conservative and go with my safe, reliable choice, supercuts. i was very pleased. cecily was wonderful. terrific job on my hair and beard plus a good conversationalist. i'm only here for a few more months, but, for as long as i'm here, getting a great haircut is one thing i don't have to think about.

the people here are often nice, but the girl who cut my hair was just getting lazy with it. i asked for long side bangs and told her exactly what i wanted and she proceeded to quickly part my hair the way i told her not to in the weirdest way, grab a chunk of my hair, and slide her scissors through it literally as scissors would slide when cutting wrapping paper in a matter of 5 seconds. i'm a very timid and non confrontational person so i just didn't say anything because what's done was done, but they are way shorter than i asked and after leaving, parting my hair the right way, and looking in the mirror i realized that they look so terrible. it's been about a month and a half and they haven't grown back at all and they're way too short to do anything with. the girl with the dark pixie/bob cut was the one who cut it and i'm just so over trying to style my impossible hair. it also only took about 1 minute and a half for the whole haircut (minus the shampooing) and i had to pay $25. after, i went up to the counter and she tried to sell me expensive tea tree shampoo and told me that was what she washed my hair with when i clearly saw her wash it with the paul mitchell shampoo. i'm sad because i have gone here a few times and never had any issues with the other ladies.
fantastic haircut and service from mercedes! she took the time to get it right.

watch out for shady business.  griselda sold my 93 year old father, who has dementia, a 2 oz product that he can't use for $21 and then took a $25 tip.  so his $21 hair cut cost him $67.  i called to complain and she was very rude and dismissive.  she had no remorse for taking advantage of him.  shameful!!!

i really have to give a shout out to griselda for her eyebrow waxes. i have some strong caterpillar eyebrows that i like to have a very specific shape, and she has been 100% on the mark every time i've gone to her. with hair cuts, i went to this location and got a sub par cut from another stylist and when i went back, specifically to griselda, she identified it and fixed the cut, and did a great job doing it. people don't often associate supercuts with waxing (i frequently get asked "supercuts does waxing!?") but i am so incredibly satisfied with griselda's work, and with her knowledge of current styles and her skill with my hair.

i came with my girlfriend here today and she came to get a haircut and signed herself in, nothing out the ordinary, this was our second time and our first time being a very pleasant visit . as we sit in the store, this lady comes in and request to get a haircut and the hairstylist told her a 20 to 30 min and the lady literally said she didn't have time cause she has work. i really thought the stylist would tell her sorry or something like that but literally they put her next. what is that ? we were waiting patiently. so i guess now you can just barge in and say you can't wait that long and you'll be next. you guys should really put this people to the side and make them wait how we did. this experience was underwhelming. it's honestly those people's fault for running late. they should plan accordingly on the things they do rather then barging in like that and not taking inconsideration on the people that sign in and wait.

all of the staff members at this super cuts location are super friendly. because the wait can be a while, i recommend checking in online especially if you decide to take advantage of the super tuesday $16 haircuts (regular $21) since is gets busier that day. i highly recommend requesting briana. she does an excellent job and has a very warm personality.

this place has been my go to place for haircut. usually chill folks in there with price expected results.  they have a new front desk gal with fiery red hair and exotic appearance who needs to learn how to smile!! talk about a rbf!

this happened a while ago but i just started reviewing. i went in as a walk-in to get a haircut. they took my name down and i waited in the seated area. other people came in and i noticed they went before me. i thought maybe they had an appointment and i was a walk-in so that was understandable. then i noticed everyone was going before me. i waited about an hour when originally it was stated it would be fifteen minutes. finally, someone came up to me and asked if i had  given my name when i walked in. i said yes and they looked and it wasn't in there. she told me that they lost my name somehow in the system. then even though she just notified me that they lost my name, she took a newer customer and said i'd be next. why would you not just do me next?? what horrible customer service! but she said i'd get a 15% discount. another woman, possibly the manager, came up to me and said i'd get it for free. never went back after.

sarah is fantastic! i promise that you definitely will be supper happy with your haircut. she also has such a great personality and she won't let you mess you hair up even if you insist lol. trust me, i am talking from experience. lol ... on a serious note, if you are going there for the first time and you are not sure who to ask for, ask for sarah and you will be in safe hands.
i've been coming to this place ever since! the stylists are really great and attentive to your needs.

i see michelle! i can count with one hand the people i trust to cut my hair. i wish i could say how long she's been cutting my hair, more than a decade ago since she was in the north park location.i like the no fuss approach to haircuts. i don't want to stay for hours with a wash, cut and then blow dry. (don't get me wrong she will blow dry your hair if you want her to) i personally, just don't have time for that. michelle is super skilled, accurate and always professional and polite. thank you!
i've gone to michelle 3x for a cut and color and she is amazing! best hair cut i've had in sd and love my color. i will definitely go back.
i received a fantastic haircut from marcia at the hillcrest location. she was incredibly detailed and the results were amazing. she was also very nice to talk too. i feel great, thanks marica.

so i found my new stylist.  nicole takes her time and gives great suggestions for my hair style.  i had a color and a cut and love them both.  i have had issues in the past with stylist pulling on my hair which was painful since i do have a sensitive scalp.  nicole is gentle almost to the point where i am so relaxed i could fall asleep. she also gave me the best scalp massage when she was shampooing my hair.  if you want a "spa like" experience ask for nicole.

this store has absolutely horrible customer service, i will never go there again. i got to the store and they had 2 stylists working and 1 person waiting, so i waited. when the stylist were done they took the person who was waiting before me. his cut was quick, maybe 10 minutes. both stylists were done and went in the back and 2 other stylists had also come in. i sat waiting patiently, but they all went in the back like i wasn't there. and one stylist was setting up his station and i asked what was going on, he said he'd ask them in the back...i left, what a waste of time.

i went to nicole for a haircut and coloring for my wedding.  she did a phenomenal job of cutting my hair.  she was very detailed and took her time.  she made sure to check in with me to make sure i liked it and even went back in a couple times for small changes.  the coloring turned out great too.  some bleeding, but i don't think that is her fault.

it didn't suck and i was pleasantly surprised.  came here with my friend bobby that wanted to get a quick haircut, he was thinking about getting it buzzed but changed his mind at the last minute.   i said well damn, i need a trim let me try them out it's just hair anyway and what's an inch off anyway. i got jaime, she wasn't very friendly at first but she warmed up to me after awhile and it was okay.   sprung for the shampoo as well so with a cut at shampoo it was $22 & a $4 tip and she was pretty fast and from what i saw did a good job for a quick trim.   my mom is a hairdresser so i know what to look for and know all the tactics.  i told her my mom is a hairdresser so no need to up sale me anything since i get them for free in my care packages from her. protip:  looks like the hair stylist to request is jack martinez

sad:( you know the feeling , when you walk into a business and feel that the people working there would've preferred you hadn't? that's the feeling at this supercuts! no smiles, no kind "welcome" or "hello", just an awkward feeling of not being wanted! they took my name but no communication on how long it might be. there was one person waiting so i figured it probably wouldn't take too long. then 40 minutes later, person after person walked through the door and went in front of me! at this point i kinda thought they would let me know how long i had left! nope, not a word! so now i sit, already invested 45 minutes, do i stay or do i go and start over at a new place? super, not!!!!!!!

i am the kind of person that does not go to the same stylist or make appointments. i am in a hurry and when i want a haircut i get one right then. that all changed when i started going to lokki. he does such an amazing job on my hair and also eyebrows. this is the second salon i have been to see him and i will  keep following him. he knows exactly how to cut and style my hair to make me look and feel great. besides being an amazing stylist he is so much fun to talk to! he gets five stars!

ok, called general manager and she said they had a new manager since we were at supercuts mission hills and she said they she cut hair good and we wold like her. went back and was totally pleased. i guess at some point they "cleaned house" and the last person we had  problems with was no longer there along with others.the change of management could not of been better..so once again we are fans. yea!

never again......i went in with hair below my shoulders and i came out looking like buster brown.  i have thick wavy hair and the idiot who cut my hair did not know the difference between feathering hair and layering hair.  this person didn't even know how to cut feathered bangs.  i had to go the next day and find a salon that could cut my hair so that i didn't look like buster brown.  went down to avalon and the wonderful lady there cut my hair in 20 minutes and i love it.  supercuts is a joke, if you want your hair butchered, by all means go in there and let them do it.  all they are interested in is selling you hair products and getting their money.perhaps you should vest your employees and see if they really know how to cut all types of hair.  stay away otherwise you will be very disappointed!!!!!!!!!
been coming for years. was sad to hear michelle richardson left to another salon but a mutual friend forwarded her facebook page so i could find her. search under her name and it comes right up.
unprofessional. i'm new to the area. disappointed. the behavior of the stylist made me feel like i'd not be returning to this particular location. oh well. live and learn.

i don't get my hair cut that often, but love that i've discovered this great place, and especially jack! i generally keep my hair long, so he was only seeing me once a year at best and always treated me like a regular!  recently, my hair had grown so long that i decided to chop it off and donate it to beautiful locks, who make free wigs for women and girls dealing with cancer. jack was the only person i'd trust to do this! then, he created such a cute layered bob cut for me that i keep getting compliments on, that i may keep it short all summer! you'll be seeing me again soon jack!

the owner of this supercuts location reached out and apologized for the stylist's comments. she also offered to refund the cost of the services and set up a complimentary haircut with her location's manager. very nice and thoughtful.sadly, i felt no choice but to decline. if the services were great but the customer service was terrible - i might have considered but they weren't. yes, my haircut was good but my eyebrows were awful and the stylist was heinously rude. no going back from there.  +1 more star for the owner, still -3 for the stylist's behavior.

i've received a haircut from a few people at this location. it's a hit or miss-- but i continue to come back because it's affordable and the wait is normally not as long as other places. the overall feel of the place is clean and welcoming. the reason why i am giving them a 4 star is because of my experiences with some of their hair stylist. again-- it's a hit or miss.

have come here a few times for a haircut. one woman does a great job, wish i knew her name but she did a great job.the two other times i've gone here, i've spent a half hour sitting in the chair while the hairdresser tries to upsell me on products.  i ended up buying one that didn't end up working well and was available for half the price online.  my advice, stop constantly upselling your customers and just give them a solid cut.
such a great experience! they were fast, knowledgeable, and affordable. took two appointments last minute. very happy with my stylists as well.

10 times i've made an online appointment only to be told when i arrive that the "system" messed up and i need to wait or reschedule. never an apology, always made to feel like it was my mistake. stupid me for continually going back for a so-so haircut, but never again.

i have had nothing but good experiences here! i highly recommend victoria and yesterday i was cut by a lady with glasses and pink hair and she was super friendly and was able to get me in & out very quickly. thank you so much!
this was a good haircut, but i just had a regular 15 min men's hairs cut and it cost 24 dollars!! so overpriced, should've just gone to a barber shop

been here once most likely not coming back. the haircut was ok, the stylist was nice but it seems like the manager is always in the back so the girl who was doing my hair was also answering the phones and registering customers at the same time.she left me there at least 3 times!plus the shampoo is not included so you need to pay $5 dls extra and if you say no they tell you" well i can't really do the haircut without a shampoo, so you don't have the choice. they need to have a receptionist so stylists can focus on their job and shampoos should be included.

they told me it was a 45 minute wait, ok no problem. i wait over 45 minutes, it happens. i am ok with that. but my turn is up, i know because the gentleman gave the order to us, i have been waiting patiently in the store and they skip me. the employees look at each other as if they don't know what to do. they continue to sit the 2 guests that were just called in place of me. it has been an hour now and still waiting. not happy. been here once before and the haircut was good so i came back. cherry picking clients i guess, i don't know. guess i'm just not coming back.my haircut is now done. nice haircut, they gave me a complimentary shampoo, the other employee that was not one of the original 2 cut my hair and apologized and said there was a mix up after one came back from lunch.
great staff. everyone is super friendly. i've been going to ruben since i first moved down here almost 3 years ago. he always gets the job done perfectly. highly recommend!

this location is amazing. i appreciate the the customer service and the stylists abilities. they are always willing to go the extra mile to make their customers happy.thank you also for displaying the rainbow flag! that means so much.

worst haircut. hadn't been to a supercuts in years. good customer service but haircut sucked. i'll pay extra to go somewhere else. $4 to wash your hair when you butchered most of it off. how she cut the top was so amateur... it literally looks butchered. can't wait for my hair to grow back so i get someone who can actually cut hair. i think i could have done better. she seems nice so i didn't say it to her face how horrible she did. but people should know how horrible she cut my hair.

today this particular location lost my confidence.  needing to secure cuts for both myself and my four-year-old son i loaded us up to arrive shortly after opening.  we arrived about 9:20 am on a thursday.  we parked on the street at a city meter and before unloading him i paid the maximum on the meter, simply to be safe.  he was not thrilled about getting a haircut, but i had worked on this plan all morning, making sure he understood we needed haircuts in preparation for leaving town in the next couple of days.  we walked in and saw one customer in a chair and two or three others in the waiting area.  as i approached the counter the one stylist, while cutting her client's hair, asked me if the cut was for me or for us both.  i acknowledged that we both needed cuts.  she then informed me that the wait would be more than an hour and that she was the only person there.  what the heck?!?  i can understand the occasional odd schedule with only a few stylists, but only one?  so i wasted my time, my parking money and the only opportunity to get my son and i in for cuts before leaving town.  i would appreciate any feedback from this store's ownership and/or management.  is this your current and ongoing business model?  if so, perhaps you need to simply shutter your business.  at least then i would know from the street not to bother parking.edit: in spite of my rant, i received a swift reply from ryan, indicating their 9-10 am policy.  i appreciated their attention to my concerns.

i have been getting my haircut from ruben s at this supercuts for about 3 years. he's the best and the reason i still go here! always use the app to book your haircuts and you will always know how long to wait or when to come in.

called ahead and put my name in they told me they would be ready for me in 45 minutes which worked perfectly with my schedule but when i showed up i still waited another 45minutes didn't even end up getting my hair cut because i had to be somewhere

all i wanted was a simple mens haircut. don't bother scheduling an appointment you will wait any way. customer service was bad and in my experience.  i walked in and wasn't greeted but treated like i was an inconvenience. 1 employee was giving a haircut while 2 others were talking in the back while several people were waiting. i didn't even stick around for a haircut i left and went to fantastic sams on university, second time this place let me down. wouldn't recommend it.

very nice employees but the wait time was rediculous. had my haircut short, for the first time in a long time & the ends weren't thinned out and blended. so went in for a redo and waited an hour after my scheduled time. unfortunately, wouldn't come back or recommend a cut from them.

i was looking for a place close to new apt for regular haircut . i stopped in here on a friday at 230.  i was treated very rudely by young hispanic female before being told it would be 45 to hr wait. both stylists were well into current haircuts and only one guy waiting. i think she just didn't feel like providing me service even though  i had done nothing to earn her nasty attitude. or she didn't feel like working. i've always received excellent service from great clips and sport clips and always tip well. i guess their competitors keep my business .
i get my haircut by ruben and every single time he does a fantastic job. it's worth it to request him to cut your hair even if you have to wait a few extra minutes.

ruben is absolutely the best hairstylist i've ever had, and i've gone to the fanciest places in san diego in the past. he listens to what you want and is very precise! when i first started going here i was nervous that they might cut off too much hair or butcher it- (but i was on a budget at the time). and oh man, after having ruben he's the only person who has cut my hair after that for over a year. sadly my family and i are moving to sacramento now and i wanted to leave a review and say i'm so upset to not have him cutting my hair anymore!!! my hair is the healthiest and longest it's ever been thanks to him! thank you ruben!
ruben brings back my best look every time. always worth going back to him. i've been going to him for years.

upd; the hair was donated!we came to cut and if possible donate my 13 years old daughter's non colored hair. the hairdresser measured confirmed 8 inches and cut to the floor instead of pony tale. then swept it and told - oh , you need 11 inches to donate... i am sorry. she charged us 24 dollars. my daughter cried. and we left. i was extremely sad and disappointed. i will take it further for sure. this unacceptable. poor service. upd - the store manager chrissy was wonderful, she told the store will donate the lock of hair on julia's name. i hope she will. thank you very much.
cristy is great! knew exactly which haircut was best for my hair type/head shape. great conversation, great cut, will definitely come again
cristy is awesome!  really patient with everything i asked of her.  she was 2017 stylist of the year!  ask for her when you go in. she's also very experienced with hair coloring :).

i usually stop by a supercuts every 2 months for a quick trim.this is the location nearest me, but also the one i prefer. staff appear more well organized than other supercuts locations. wait times can be quite long so call ahead for  evenings!
great haircuts, an super friendly staff. very nice place. it also has a great location, next to a pizza, taco, and smoothie place. five stars!

one hairstylist (who may be the manager...i'm not sure) is very unprofessional. in the middle of cutting my hair, she checks on an intern/apprentice to see how she is doing. additionally, she is constantly trying to sell me shampoos and conditioners when cutting my hair. i never came back here again because of this experience. someone should teach this lady that customers come first.

just got the worst haircut of my life. asked for a simple military style medium fade with a hard part. there is no fade whatsoever, just a squiggly line going across the back of my head and the hard part is not even close to being straight. she left cut hair all over the back of my neck. didn't offer to add any product or to style it. oh, and she had some rank bo. insanely terrible experience. avoid the older woman stylist here. she has no clue on how to do a simple men's haircut. biggest waste of $26 ever. now i have to go and get another hair stylist to fix the cob job somewhere else.

i always have a good experience coming here! my hair has never felt, looked, or laid better! all of the staff there are super friendly and just really great people. i would recommend this place to anyone who asks. seriously these guys know what they're doing and do a really great job at it!
ask for andy. he's personable and did an excellent job cutting my hair. these haircut chains can be hit or miss and the stylists usually stay for a bit then move oni recommend andy

flew into san diego to visit my daughter.  did not have time deal with my hair before trip.  wanted to look presentable so it was right out of the airport and into supercuts.  thanks to stylist krista for a nice haircut and a pleasant experience.  she is friendly and personable, listens well and offers good suggestions.  in a short time, i walked out with exactly the cut i wanted (and trimmed eyebrows too).

first off, i just want to say that my stylist was very friendly and i enjoyed her company while getting my haircut. that is the only reason why i am giving an extra star.other than that, i was extremely unimpressed with the quality of the cut itself. not only did this place increase the prices from my previous visit, this was by far the worst haircut i've ever gotten. the stylist's clippers were so bad that after her first run you could still see long hairs that were not uniform to the rest of them! she had to basically go and cut it all over again. in addition, the front of my hair was completely uneven, one side being non existent and the other being almost the same length as before i came in. around my ears were not even trimmed and i didn't even notice that because there were so many other bad things that were occupying my attention! this also took 40+ minutes while it normally takes no more than 20 and caused me to be late to pick someone up. i do not have a particularly hard head to cut and have never had such a bad result from a $22 male haircut.between this ridiculous price increase and lower quality standard there's no way i'll be back. also worth mentioning is that i normally do not post bad reviews, but this is something that really was unacceptable and based off of the other recent reviews i am not the only one who feels this way.

great quick local haircut store and convenient location in utc area! i also get my cuts from amber, janet and cathy.. 3 great stylist ask for one of them that's on! a good little place that will check to make sure you're happy and if not they'll make it right.. the manager maggie is also very nice! been going here for 7 years!
the stylist smelled so bad. like homeless. it was unbearable! never ever again will i visit this place. i can still smell it. unacceptable for a stylist or any other service job employee.

i recently moved from la and i was nervous to get a haircut. danielle was awesome! she was very attentive and very funny! she was awesome! i told her how i want my haircut and she got it to every detail. my hair looks awesome because of her! she washed my hair, did my eyerbows, and lined up my sides. for $19 it was pretty awesome.

this review is long overdue! all the stylists i've encountered at the supercut la jolla village square location are great. but i want to take the time to say thank you to jenny! i went to jenny after getting a really bad, uneven haircut elsewhere and jenny was sweet enough to fix my bad hair disaster. she even went as far as showing me new hair techniques and ways to style it. thank you jenny!

i've been getting my hair cut at this location for about a year and a half almost. i've gone through multiple hair stylists who came and went and overall it was a great experience. most notably right now, though, is maggie. she does my haircut the way i want it every time and she understands my long term goal of how i want my hair to grow out in a certain way. she makes great recommendations for the type of hair that i have in terms of my daily routine and the products i use. and, she does my eyebrows perfectly. better than anybody else who's ever touched them. i recommend this location for its friendly atmosphere and great hair stylists. i go once a month and every time i leave i am even more satisfied than the time before.

$19 for a men's haircut. a little on the pricey side for me. i usually go to happy barber where it's about $10 but i got off work late and they already closed. there weren't that many people in line, however the wait still took long. nothing impressive about my haircut. lady was nice but i wouldn't come again unless i really needed a haircut and had no where to go.

overall great cuts and good experience, but wait times could be long and staff seems stressed at times. prices are also higher than where i used to go for a cut in la, but i don't have any urges to seek elsewhere. parking is easy and the barbers are good at executing what i'm looking for and that also seems to be the case for the other people that have simultaneously had their hair cut when i have gone.
good experience with jenny. she asked all of the right questions so i could get the exact haircut i wanted. very happy.

ashley is an artist! she's been cutting my husband's hair for 3 years (?) now. she's only cut my hair twice. i went to a more expensive salon to get a fancy style but it was a little messy looking and i had ashley fix it up and now it looks perfect!i think i'll let her cut my hair from now on ;)

i have to say the hair stylists here are top notch. every time i come, the hair stylist always caters to what i want and also provides input on how to make the haircut better. they also give input on where your cow licks are and how to style your hair if you don't know how to. furthermore, they give tips on hair products. they are very invested in you. tips:-every tuesday there are haircuts for 16 instead of 21 dollars. - if you put in your number with them, after every 8th haircut, you get the next for free. what a steal!

just got home from an less than pleasant experience at supercuts at costa verde shopping center. i repeatedly said that the clipper was hurting me and that something must be wrong with it but was told that it was just new and sharp.once i got home, my fiancée was shocked on how bad my neck looked as it looked like i had some kind of allergic outbreak, and it keeps on getting worse.not only does it look like i have a skin condition, but it still hurts pretty bad. i can't believe that my stylist did not mention to me that she actually had damaged my skin and played it off like it was all fine.as you can see on the attached pictures, it is not fine. this is not acceptable as i kept on saying that the clipper was really causing me pain during the session.

the worst barbershop i've ever met. their barber isn't professional at all and cut my ear while talking and laughing with others. my ear kept bleeding and no wonder they also gave me a super ugly haircut ever in my life.

been coming to janet for the past 5 years! she is a gem. sad that i will be moving to oregon because she is irreplaceable. i always walk out with the biggest smile on my face. i get my color here and all my friends always tell me that they "need that color too"!

had a wonderful experience with kayle today very professional, quick, totally understood what i wanted the first time. i walked in at a very busy time and she seemed in control of the whole shop. told me that wait will be 10-15 minutes, it was actually like 7 minutes. so glad i made the decision to just stop in today. i will be back !!!

tbh i don't expect to become gorgeous from here. i'm in for the affordable cut and no waiting for people who show up to their appointments late. i call, if there's a less than 30 min wait, i'm there. if not, then i go another time. $15 tuesdays and usually coupons are available online.i feel like the cuts i get on tuesdays are more rushed and careless, they don't always dry your hair or brush it when done. went on a sunday with a $5 coupon = $20 cut and was pretty satisfied.

simply put i had a wonderful experience at this supercuts, corinne did a wonderful job with what i know is a difficult head of hair. i know its been the headache of hair stylists since i was a kid and she handled it masterfully. i know the online check in function sometimes messes up so i swung by after work and saw a pretty open salon(2 people waiting), had an extremely reasonable wait and then had a wonderful haircut. i'm not great with describing wonderful service but i know corinne gave it through a quality haircut and pleasant side chatter. she gave me some tips on my hair and i left with a clean haircut which for me is the ideal haircut experience. will be visiting again.
we got hoodwinked into a $50 haircut. i wouldn't go to supercuts if i was going to pay that. not worth it at all.
