i've had a few decent haircuts at this location, nothing exceptional but basically what you would expect at a supercuts. however, the previous two times that i either called in or booked an appointment online, the actual wait when i showed up was significantly longer, which is frustrating when going on a lunch break with a limited amount of time. specifically, today, a mother came in to get her daughter a haircut. i was next in line which would have corresponded with my expected time from booking online. however, the mother spontaneously decided that she wanted her son to get a haircut as well, and he was somehow immediately placed in front of me in line and i was told the wait would be an additional 15-20 minutes.this seems quite unprofessional and disrespectful of clients' time as i essentially wasted 10 mins each way driving to the location, as i didn't have the time to wait another 20 minutes. plus who knows whether the mother would have decided to get herself a haircut as well and been served before me. i will not be returning here in the future.
janet is a magician. i have never liked my haircuts but she literally makes me feel sexier. love this place. will never go anywhere else except to see janet. thank you so much.

kathy and janet are fantastic!! i'm extremely picky about my layers and in the 5 years i've been coming here i've never been even slightly disappointed! the stylists are all super friendly and well-trained. there can be a longer wait on nights/weekends but i always call ahead to check and put my name on the list so i don't have to sit and wait so long. i've tried other supercuts locations but this is by far my favorite!

by far the worst supercuts experience i've ever had. i should have just returned at a later date when the lady in the first chair to the right was working. arrived at 615, i was told 20 minute wait and 2 people ahead of me. cool, no problem with me. well fast forward a hour and a half, an employee getting their hair dyed and washed, and about 8 people getting their hair cut before me, i get pissed. i asked the lady who informed me of my original quoted wait time and she tells me that the list just goes in order and that i'm next. i'm no rocket scientist but pretty sure i should have been next 6 people ago. super bummer cause the lady in that first chair cut my hair perfect every time. beware of "super tuesday".

to be honest i wasn't expecting much, i mean i figured they wouldn't screw up my head so as long as they didn't do that i would have been satisfied. you see my favorite barber is no longer in the area so i had to go to someone new and i was not looking forward to it. but i was very pleasantly surprised, i did the online check in and showed up 20 minutes later and walked right in and sat down in the chair. ashley was my haircutter, and she really did a good job, i was surprised because it was a very good haircut and i had low expectations going in. also it took maybe all of 10 minutes which was amazing, quick and good, hard to beat that!
if you are the owner, please contact me.  i want a refund.  bad experience here.  i was charged for a service without being told beforehand that there would be a charge.
great haircut and really friendly staff. you get what you pay for and they have clean cuts here. the best i've seen from any super cuts.
corrinne is great!  i'm a hairstylist and new to the area and in need of a trim.  she took me right away and hooked me up with a great trim!  thanks corrinne!
nice location. all the people were great. busy but not too long of a wait. the hot towels are the best.

one of the best supercuts i've ever been too! i've been here on a few different occasions and each time my experience was great! even when it's busy the wait isn't terribly long. all of the stylist there are very courteous and extremely professional. i normally go to janet because she does the best job on my hair. i mean really this woman is a magician with clippers!!!!!! safe to say i won't be going anywhere else for my hair cuts. keep up the good work ladies.

haircut was okay so i'd give it three stars and my barber was really sweet and nice. 2 stars because no one bothered to mention there was a check-in list so as people ahead were sitting down, i heard someone mention this list. needless to say, i asked the front desk lady, who was supposed to inform me, if there was a checkin. she said yes and checked me in...of course not after she let the people who came in after me go ahead.first chair lady definitely served her acquaintances before me. 2 as a matter of fact.

kayla has been cutting my hair for the last year or so.  i found her by chance.  she is always pleasant, and courteous.  more  importantly, she always takes her time and does a great job.  i'm picky about my hair.  i've requested a complex scissor cut and a mixed clipper/scissor cut.  she's done great with both.  she follows directions and always aims to please.  i highly recommend her.

yesenia did an amazing job! i cut serval inches off of my hair because it was damaged from color treatments.yesenia was very kind and kept a great conversation & gave me some tips on how to keep my hair healthy in the future.she paid great attention to detail making sure my hair was cut perfectly straight & making sure i was happy with my final look! thank you! i'll definitely be back!

ok, so have been to several sc and have had wins but lots of losses(in reference to respect to management). this location however just might have redeemed this chain/owner/franchise.frequented the location in college grove(for the love of god, keep driving and do not stop!) and needless to say the service each and every time was less than par. this combined with a rude associate led me to drive far out of the way to el cajon blvd, didn't give them much of a chance but on a whim i tried this spot and now i'm a loyal customer.for the first time in many years had a beautiful stylist give me the haircut i actually wanted without any hesitation or refusal! came out amazing and had absolutely no complaints. this was also not even. on my first or second visit here so i know this spot likes to take care of it's clients.don't be fooled as this location is right where your gps takes you. it's situated in a little side plaza by einstein bros. bagels and the rubio's (took me some driving around the first time to find it) and doesn't have any large enough sign to see from street.such a clean environment even post haircut as these ladies clean up and don't wait till it builds up. polite, talkative and fun. what's not to like?i normally get my haircut way long.in between but here can't wait to come back and get a trim just like today.enjoy the cut and don't forget to ask for your favorite stylist if they're here.

i've had the same hair stylist for almost 2 years and she never disappoints. brissia has been very helpul since the first day up until now and has a lot of patience with me :) i can't see anyone else cutting my hair. i recommend this place and brissia as your hair stylist. p.s.i'm her favorite client

my stylist for the last couple years has been victoria.  victoria recently moved to the murphy canyon location from the more convenient location for me in pb - but i followed her.  and you would too if you let her do your do!  she is the only woman i let touch my lox - not even my ma can touch 'em.  seriously, i grew up with poker straight ugly hair with zero style. but now i get tons of compliments from both men and women.  last nite at nolita hall a woman ask me how i get my hair to look so good.  i tell them to go see vzamora @ supercuts.  and you should go see her too.

just don't go here. went in for a bang trim and this is what i ended up with. i do not want to go back and have her attempt to "fix" it and make it worse. will not be returning, ever again. not happy that i even paid for this when most likely i'm going to be going somewhere else to fix this mess. skip this place!!

i really enjoyed the managers professionalism and cooperation. we had an issue and she not only fixed the problem but exceeded my expectations. roxy is an amazing stylist and has great customer service.

thank you roxy for the fabulous haircut and blow dry. my hair was a mess when i got to you and ever since you touched my hair, it's been so much better. it's been a week and i still even have my hair blow dried from when you did it a week ago. also thank you for the recommendations of products and the next steps. can't wait to see you again in 6 weeks for a trim!

awful experience. i don't know if it was just the employee i had, or an off night for this place, or if they're consistently terrible. i went in about a week and a half ago for a trim. victoria was my "stylist." i had scheduled an appointment online, but still had to wait about 30 minutes past that to be helped. the website did note that there might be a wait, but it felt excessively long and the two employees working didn't seem to be particularly focused on getting things moving. they were kind of just standing around joking with each other after the two customers i was waiting on had paid and left. victoria started trimming my hair, and in the middle of the cut she received a phone call. the other employee who answered the phone gave the handset to her on hold, and she proceeded to try to take it off hold, tucked it between her ear and her shoulder, and repositioned her comb and scissors to continue my cut while on the phone. this of course alarmed me, and i told her she could take her phone call and then come back to my hair later. there was no way i wanted her cutting my hair while focusing on the phone call. she just snapped at me "i'm not going to cut it." and then she proceeded to jab at my head with her comb while messing with the phone. she couldn't figure out how to get the phone off hold, so she kept pressing buttons, tucking the phone with her shoulder, then jabbing at my hair with her comb. this continued over and over again for a few minutes until the other employee came over to help her. once the phone issue was resolved, she hurriedly finished my trim. the worst part of this experience is how uneven the trim is, as you can see in the picture. after all that, she didn't even give me a proper hair cut, and this is after supercuts raised their prices. $21 wasted on a sloppy hair cut, and there's no way i'm going back there and letting here near my hair again.

absolutely horrible, my hair is destroyed! i cannot believe the haircut i received! it looks like a 2 yr old cut my hair! i am livid! the experienced stylist let a very inexperienced stylist do my hair all while she sat back and watched!

i've been going to this location for over a year now, never been disappointed. roxy does a great job and always takes good care of me. i am very picky with my hair, and i love a super clean cut. my hard part looks always awesome and sharp. roxy has been giving me good advice on hair products and other treatments as well. an easy 5-star rating.

roxy is great,  her cut is detailed and precise, she really listened to me , and that i appreciate, she educated me on some new products that i love!i will definitely be back in 2 months for a trim! she is one of the best!thank you , roxy, love the style!

clean, fast and on-point! i've gone to this supercuts for years now and have never walked away with anything but over-satisfied with the quality of service i've received.  i send all my friends to this particular store all the time... it's super clean... the stylists are top notch... very skilled and friendly.  i would recommend anyone check this place out. ps... i'm unintentionally very picky... so five stars from me!!!!

savana gave my a super cute cute super fast! i went frommed-long hair to a super short bob. i showed her a picture of what i wanted and she replicated it!! she asked multiple times if i was comfortable with the amount she took off. loved my cut and how fast and easy it was. only waited ten mins to be seen. would defiantly come back. ask for savanna!!

i witnesses the best customer service, above that, actual care for a customer. i was just walking in for a quick cut and one of the girls was holding and soothing a clients baby so she could finish her cut without her baby being upset. if i could give this a million stars i would! also, my cut was amazing so i will be coming back. roxy is a superstar.

my regular hair stylist for 20 years went on vacation so i stopped in here. first i was told my hair had to be shampooed since i had hair spray in it. (i had shampooed it a few hours earlier) in 20 years at my regular place, concept salon, cutting my hair with hair spray on it was never a problem. so of course after the shampoo she cut my hair then asked how did it look. being wet i had no idea but it looked nothing like it did when i came in. i doubt many people want to look radically different when they get a haircut. as a finale she offered to sell me a gallon of shampoo.  i should have checked yelp- with 3.5 stars i would have gone somewhere else.

my hairstylist kathleen moved to this location a few months ago so it's about time to review the location. this location has plenty of parking, is always clean, and there is a starbucks right next door if it is busy and you have a little wait. this location can get busy at peak times, so i recommend using their app to get on the list. also, i'm confident recommending kathleen to any yelper looking for a simple trim to a complex color job - she is worth the wait and there always seems to be a line of people waiting for her! she never rushes you, has great attention to detail, listens to what the customer wants, and is always bubbly and welcoming.

had an amazing experience here with a very talented hairstylist... roxy. very honest about my hair and took me thru all the steps of repairing it. awesome cut. and beautiful color. highly recommend roxy's chair. at the very least this talented crew. thank you! love my new look!

roxy, is amazing. she is always willing to do whatever crazy idea i come up with. today she transformed into a beautiful unicorn. thank you roxy, the girls are all very welcoming, and it's it always a pleasurable experience.

professionalism, courteous, cleanliness, and patience these are the qualities you should always look for when selecting a salon. well surprise you just found it. they do it all here. cuts, color, massage, and style. i know they offer additional services but i never looked into it. ask for roger, he is the best. periodi get the consistent high quality cut every time i see him. i'm in there every 3 weeks. i get the full package (cut, tea tree wash, and massage). the entire staff is great and a great team. they help each other ensure the customer experience is always great. i personally highly recommend this supercuts, but only if you want to leave extremely happy and have it done right the first time.

i absolutely love barissia! she's truly incredible. after a failed cut from a lady at their location a few months prior, i decided to try again. she came to my rescue!! i have curly hair and she was able to give me an excellent cut which has always seemed impossible for other stylists. the best part is that she actually listens to you. if a style won't work, she's honest...and when it does, she freakin rocks it! that's a quality that is so appreciated. i see her, and only her now! i also bring my kids...she's our go-to gal. friendly, informative and just all around an amazing person. we love her!

sunday morning. time to get a trim. first time here. and i have to say: i had a great experience with cece. just beautiful cut. i've got me some long hair too that can be unruly. she handled my tresses with ease and gentleness. ahh, i luv it when my hair is happy. front desk was nice and pleasant. honestly, i have no complaints. coming back for a 2nd round when its time.

don't let faryal cut your hair. i'm so disappointed. i walk in, and a few minutes later she tells me to sit down. i tell her i just want to trim my hair and fix it up. she just starts cutting. 5-10 minutes passes and she says all done. i've never had someone rush a haircut this fast. usually they're about 15-30 minutes. she rushed so much that i had hair all over my face when i left. she didn't even fix my sideburns.. she did such a poor job. i don't understand who hired her. she really needs to slow down and pay attention to what she's doing. moral of the story: she cuts hair way too fast and doesn't pay attention to detail. she just wants you off her chair and on to the next customer.the quicker the job, the less you get paid! take your time for gods sake.

i've brought my son here five times to get a hair cut. five chances this place had to show that they could actually do a basic hair cut. failed miserably every time. i can overlook the fact that none of the associates there can blend a fade; my son's hair grows quick enough that it masks their ineptitude. what i can not get over, though, is not one single person in that place can cut a straight line. i literally have to go back and ask them to attempt to fix the crooked edging around his hairline. even then, it comes out no better, or worse than before. $19 plus tips for something i'm sure i could do just as good at home with a target clipper set. unbelievable. they've literally robbed me for $95, plus (unearned) tip(s).

i've gotten my hair done at this supercuts for 10+ years now and it's consistently better than the salons that charge $50 or more. and, yes, i have given several salons in that price range a try, but they always seem to mess my hair up. my case isn't even that complicated! that's why for my basic trim, supercuts is the best place for me.over the years a few different stylists have given me haircuts and i would recommend all of them. andrea, cecilia, and shirin are great! today, joanne trimmed my hair and she did a wonderful job too. she was very attentive to what i wanted, we had a great conversation, and she made the whole process so pleasant!i will keep coming back here. the salon is clean and the stylists are so good at what they do. where else can you get a great haircut for around $20? beats me!

their web app lies. the reported a 5 minute wait ended up being a 40 minute wait. this particular location is a mess. they use a 1980's system of writing names on a piece of paper then scratching them off when the customer is serviced, or they walk out in frustration. of course, the names on the paper don't actually reflect the order on who is decided to get called next. that's at the discretion of the floor manager.  when a stylist became available she would look around the room and figure out who gets called next. if you mentioned you used the app there seemed be some preference, or when someone complains and threatens to walk out they get the next stylist. a women that came after me complained and went ahead of me. if she wasn't getting her daughter's hair cut and i would have been very upset and walked out myself. i know kids get restless so i let it go.  there were apologies stating that the app never works and that causes all of their delays.. though it app seems to work fine for the escondido location. there are several negative reviews for this location,  this one is clearly rogue.- one of the lowest rated supercuts in san diego.

don't let anybody tell you otherwise, theresa is the best and she's the only reason i have been coming to this place, 25 minutes drive each way, for over two years... you could say i am quite particular about my hair and how its cut and from the very first time i went to her, she has always done a 10/10 job. simply wonderful.she is great at listening to exactly what you want, but can help you figure it out together if you want to change things up and are not so sure what style/cut you would like done. she is always making absolutely certain that you love it and that it's perfect before you leave, and she will spend as long as it takes until you are 100% satisfied. i have never trusted someone more with my hair than i trust her and, trust me - that says a lot. theresa is the real deal!i'm a guy with medium-short hair but i have had more complex cuts and styles in the past and theresa has always been very patient with me and gotten me exactly the look i wanted. some of my family members have also been seeing her for cuts/color/etc for a long time and she is  masterful at all of it (men's and women's hair).we always leave there with a smile, looking and feeling great.theresa is a pro but she's also one of the sweetest people i know. she's by far the most requested person at this place so i recommend booking ahead for her if you can. i'd gone to fancy hair salons in the past and paid over $40 for a way subpar cut while with theresa i can get an awesome fresh cut that is perfect for a lot less, and i can be certain it will always look if i could, i would bring theresa with me across the country just to cut my hair, when i move. she's that good. make sure you ask for her when you book and you will thank me later.

visiting the area and needed an emergency haircut. arrived at 10:30 am and was told to come back at noon. back at noon and finally given to the new kid on the block who was sweet but very slow and unsure at 12:45 pm. it was a monday holiday and the place was packed which may have had something to do with the loooong wait although other reviewers have said similar things about waiting and waiting and....
i saw anna today for a root touch up. it was my first time there. she was so great!! i will definitely go back to her.

nice place to come in and grab a simple hair cut when you are in a bind and your stylist is out. i showed the gal what i wanted and what i normally get. she quickly interrupted and said what she thought and if she just had let me finished my sentence/consultation she would have heard everything that i wanted with my hair. they did a great job cutting my hair, but sometimes, listening in the key.
no wait time and i had a relaxing time. june gave great recommendations and i'm very happy with my cut! i'll be making my next appointment here with june.

amazing amazing service!! they definitely took their time cutting my hair to make sure it was perfect. the service is extremely friendly and they really listen to their customers to make sure that they leave happy!!

avoid this place if you can =/i came by and looking back i wish i didn't! yikes =x i could have done it better myself, that's how bad it turned out. i came by and was looking for a trim and new layers all around. the stylist was chit chatty with me and seemed like she was taking her sweet time with me cutting my locks, then all of a sudden she busts out the mirror and tells me to take a look while it was drenched wet and thick i can't see anything?! .. umm apparently she was done cutting  and i didn't even know it!??? i gave a shocked look.. i'm bad at keeping a poker face ;pthe next day it was obvious once my hair was dry that she did it super uneven and super choppy. the shortest layer on the back was super high and there were no layers in between the shortest layer and the bottom layer of my hair. and she told me if i notice anything i can come back.. ummm excuse me why would i come back so my hair can get butchered again?? no thanks! =x o.o

actual conversation:me: i didn't wash the bleach out in time. i'm a mess. veronica: i'm sure it's not that bad. (me taking off the headband and removing tons of bobby-pins)veronica: we can fix this.    and then she did!

thank you to cecilia for the beautiful wash and blowdry today. my hair is very long and thick and you must have patience to do my hair. she takes her time and does beautiful work. i will be back and would recommend her to friends and family . don't forget to cal ahead so you don't have to wait !!

i recently had the opportunity to be a hair "model" for a training session.  (apparently stylists stay up to date on trends and changes in the industry with continuing education and they occasionally need "guinea pigs".)   i won't lie, i was a little nervous going in, but could not have been happier with my hair cut and the whole experience. i was extremely impressed with the master stylist melissa, who facilitated the training and with the stylists, all of whom were on site for this early morning training before the salon opened for business.listening to the  stylists' questions and their sharing of collective knowledge during my hair cut really gave me a new appreciation for them and their craft.   i never realized how much goes into cutting hair... stylist's make it look so easy because they carry on relaxed conversations while they are working their magic.  i will never take a haircut for granted again. there are so many decisions to be made and specific techniques and tricks to use at every step of the haircut...and this is different for each head of hair and face. i walked out of super cuts with the one of the best haircuts i have ever gotten.  i was super surprised and super happy.  i have a new-found respect for the super cut stylists at the del mar highlands salon.  bravo!  i will be back.

we had a terrible experience here!!! theresa. do not let her cut your hair. we came in with simple request: #2 on the sides, just clean up the top. she butchered my son's hair. she should not be allowed to cut hair. jagged razor line along side of my son's scalp, did not blend, did not trim or even cut a single hair on the top of his head at all. what a joke.

wish i could give half a star for the rudeness of employees here!stopped by on thursday to make an appointment for friday on my lunch break. the woman told me a regular cut should take no more than 20 minutes. i confirmed this with her before i left to ensure my 2pm appointment would get me out of there in time to make it back to work. came in and checked in 2pm friday for my appointment and sat there for 15 minutes while workers partook in casual conversation with one another. as i began looking back and forth from the clock to the employees lounging around, no one said "be right with you" or even acknowledged my presence. when one employee was finished mindlessly chatting and called my name it was 2:17. when i asked if i would be done by 230, she and another employee sneered at me and said definitely not. when i said "we'll i have to be at work in 13 minutes" they stared blankly at me as if it was my fault they were engaging in conversation with one another when my appointment was supposed to begin 17 minutes prior. never coming to this location again. teenage mcdonald's employees are more professional than then the middle aged women working here!! horrible experience!

i have been seeing andrea in this salon for years. her bubbly personality and charismatic attitude makes the salon visit something i love to do. whether it's a simple trim or a full on blonde make over she has all the skills! make sure to book asap as the girl is busy and this proves her skill in the trade. ask for andrea!
go to sherin for your cut! i always feel great whet i walk out. she does a fantastic job!

the actual hair-cutters and/or stylists are fine. friendly and professional. but they really need to get their check-in system under wraps. it'll say 0 minute wait time, and i end up waiting for 45 minutes. it's happened 3 times in a row now. i can see other people have written about similar experiences. why can't they get this figured out? it was never a problem at the pb location. it really shouldn't be that hard....

can i take off a star because i hate the layout of this mall? it's so awkward!!!! i only mention it because it makes me dread going here. that aside, i came in and was introduced to marisela. what a queen. i am a cornucopia of disabilities and can not wash my own hair regularly. so i need a steady affordable place. crap. i think it's tuesday's they have discount cuts. marisela was sensitive to my needs, which required listening to me, and even hooked me up with a new do that i love!! i can guarantee you they have the cheapest prices i've come across in the city. again, double check the discount days, they're worth it. she was even kind enough to write down how she cut my hair in the event i don't get her next time. if it's up to me, it will always be her. save your money, give yourself a little hair me up and give marisela a shoutout from holly who likes the #3, round. hair cutter talk, shrug. ;-)

very disappointed and way overpriced.  i've come here many time for a quick trim & blow dry.  last time they massaged scalp, did a hot towel on face and asked me repeatedly how i liked the service.  this time, they rush thru, barely washed the shampoo out of my hair and was upset when i asked for a blow dry.  when i went to pay, they charged me $70!  that is full salon prices and certainly did not receive that treatment.don't waste your time or money here.

3.5/5 starsmy husband needed a haircut and saw the supercuts sign. they were not busy so was able to walk right in after signing in on the computer. i really don't want my info on supercuts computers. we used a last initial instead and it was no problem. you can also book an appointment online which would be very handy for people who plan.the haircut was good for a good price. she was actually able to fix some problems from a former haircut. i wish i knew her name to give her credit. next time. i recommend this supercuts for a basic haircut since that's all we experienced. nothing exceptional, though. they were pleasant and had a good variety of products.

just wanna thank tamara murphy for the best hair cut i've ever had as an adult. plus i got an awesome shampoo and head massage. plus i ended upbuying the shampoo and conditioner she used. i don't live very close but next time i need a hair cut there's no place i'll be going but here. thank u again

i was here yesterday. i hate my haircut. everything is uneven. i know i have curly hair and that's harder to cut but this is unacceptable. they get two stars because they are all nice people, i won't be back again though. at least the lady yesterday didn't aggressively try to sell me hair products.

we have been searching for a new salon for the kids and this is it.  outstanding cuts, reasonable prices- especially on tuesdays!  the cuts are consistent, even across 3 different stylists.  we've been pleased with all of them.  it's so hard to find someone that your kids won't complain about- there's always something- she pulled too hard, it hurt, she cut my bangs too short,  etc etc.  and sometimes i have to agree .  but here, all three stylists managed to make at least this mom happy!  we will be back!

anytime you go to one of these "first available stylist" salons it's a total crap shoot with the quality of service and cut. this isn't just an issue with supercuts, but other places like sports clips too. even if you do find a good stylist, you have to go by their schedule and the good ones usually don't stay at any one location long. this location is one of the better ones because their online system is pretty reliable with only a few times i've seen "call salon". they also have more stylists on shift than other locations.out of 7 times i've been here i'd say 6 haircuts were fine, and one was terrible..
i came by today to get a trim, reshaping a prior haircut a bit shorter. aracely listened to what i wanted and delivered exactly what i asked for. very professional!

i explained in a very detailed manner to the hairdresser how i wanted my haircut. the hairdresser thought that a shorter version of what i wanted would look better and proceeded to cut my hair a lot more than previously accorded, without consulting me before. now my hair is extremely short and i had to go somewhere else to have an actual hairdresser fix it. very sad to know i paid for someone to do whatever they wanted with my hair especially when my hair takes so long to grow back. extremely disappointed and upset. avoid this place.

i got a really awful haircut and decided to take matters into my own hands. i ended up chopping my hair off unevenly and not leaving much to work with. i decided to give supercuts a shot. rebecca listened to what i needed and promptly fixed my hair. she was very thoughtful and made sure i was happy every step of the way. i was so happy i left a $10 tip. i'm also a girl who is picky about her hair so maybe that will give this review more substance? idk thanks rebecca

so, i was in the area and my son needed a hair cut. christmas photos coming up(yeah we're a bit behind) anyway decided to stop by and get it out of the way. bad move. my son likes his skin fades and always gets the same cut or a variation of it. we went in and he was taken back almost immediately(yay). told the lady at the desk we wanted a fade.. i gave my son my phone to show the stylist a picture of what we wanted(a skin fade with a hard part). she looked and said okay and walked back with my boy. he followed her with my phone still in hand so i called him back to give it back to me. the stylist looks back and says she needs the picture to cut his hair. that should've been my sign to go ahead and ask for another stylist. i've never had a stylist take my phone with them to stare at a picture while they faded his hair. anyway i had forgotten my glasses in the car and was wearing my prescription sunglasses inside. visibility was no good from where i was sitting. i decided to get my glasses out of the car really quick and as soon as i got back(about a minute later) i had a pretty clear view of what was happening to my sons head. it was looking really off. i hate being rude but good lord the woman does not know how to fade. i was asked if it was good so i took the opportunity to walk back and see the mess up close. it was bad. i asked why it looked so chunky at spots and she replied "that's the fade."woah wait no, nothing about a fade is chunky or bald spotty. it fades. i responded that i knew what a fade was, he's been getting fades since he was 2. and then the hard part.. the line was not a line. it was a weird curve thing. i asked her why it wasn't straight. i grabbed my phone from my son and showed her the picture and asked how that looked at all like the picture. she then said, "i didn't look at the picture when i did the line." say what? she took my phone and had my son hold it just so "she didn't look at it." ?!?!? then said, "that line is easier than what i did." well that's just nice, why wasn't it done then? i wanted a simple straight line. i don't care what level of line you "think" you can do. give what was asked. anyway she then asked what she could do to make it better. man, i didn't know what to say besides actually fade his hair. i didn't have words so i walked away and just waited for her to finish. once she brought him out, all nice and butchered i looked over at his disaster haircut. i wasn't going to let the kid walk around looking like that and asked for someone else to fix it. luckily the manager came out and took him back and started to actually fade his hair. there wasn't much she could do about the horribly done hard part but she at least faded his hair the right way so thank you for that. we weren't charged which was why i gave 3 stars and not 2. word to the wise coming here, ask and make sure the stylist even knows what a fade is before you let them go at it. and to the stylist who cut his hair, next time please don't pretend you can do something you can't and end up butchering someone's hair. it's okay to pass on a client to someone who knows what they're doing. thanks.

came by on my lunch and with a limited time to get my hair cut and luckily they had immediate openings. the store apparently had been pretty slow all morning, but soon after i walked in, it started to pick up. ashlyn trimmed my hair, its very long right now and had a ton of split ends so i told her all i needed was a few inches cut off and layers around my face. between the wash and the cut i was in and out in under 20 min! i am not even totally certain that she cut everything, but she swears she did. she used a few products in my hair and showed me what she used, both seemed nice! for now, i am super happy with my cut, although i have literally never had someone cut it so quickly. i heard the girl next to me say the same thing to the lady cutting her hair, so it seems like that's how they do it. cheaper cuts but they get you in and out quick. i have no complaints about that as long as its a good cut (which so far i think so, but will update this if i am wrong). cant complain about getting my hair done quick and easy and on the cheap (25$ is really nothing!!). thanks to ashlyn!!

i had an issue with a stylist few months back and had to rant my problems here.  since then, the owner reached out to me to personally apologize and offer me a chance to give them another chance.well i had the chance to go back twice so far and i have to say the two other styles were on top of their game.  they were one of the best styles i've had; they made sure the cut was what i wanted, catered to my style, asked questions and made sure i was happy before leaving the establishment.  these ladies know how to take care of their clients and experts in the way they handled all aspects of the business.thank you to the two stylists; ashlyn and tammy.  you both were wonderful!

i live in mission valley and was looking to get a haircut. gave supercuts a shot and can honestly say i haven't gone anywhere else since! super easy to put your name on the list via the app (or call ahead) so you don't need to sit and wait...or you can just walk right in, they have plenty of stylists so the wait is never really that long. i always request tamara, the manager, because she is super friendly and upbeat and simply knows what i want! but all the ladies here are friendly and know their stuff. treat yourself...get the scalp massage. :)

i love this salon. it's always painless and quick! manager is very professional & friendly. i always recommend this particular supercuts to all my friends because it truly is great. every stylist has to go through vigorous training and it shows.

the girl with the colorful hair did my our kids cut and it looks great, very happy with service and price and there was zero wait. $16 haircut and his hair grows fast so this was a great deal for us, we're happy and will be back
i got very disappointing hair cut..the lady i got does not kno even how to cut. she is very unprofessional. i definately not go again this place.

stylist miss ashlyn has done my hair the last several visits and she has an amazing touch and always nails the cut i ask for. miss ashlyn has a very kind demeanor and i'll bet that she makes all of her clients feel as if they are in caring and skilled hands.i brought my girl miss dana in yesterday for a major do-over and gave miss ashlyn carte blanche to do as she wished with miss dana's very long hair. an hour later, we left the salon as pleased as we possibly could. this salon appears to be extremely well-staffed and managed.thank you, supercuts, miss ashlyn and management
went in to get a little off the top, not almost all. told the lady twice just a little bit!! clean haircut, but not what i wanted.

i very rarely leave reviews, for any business. but there are "special" occasions in which i feel they are warranted, good or bad. this is a mixture of both. i'll start off by saying that the lady that cut my hair was very nice. she also did a great job and my hair really looks good. the issue that i have is quite simple. i had a very strong gel in my hair and when the stylist went to run the clippers through it she felt it best to wash my hair. sure, sounds reasonable.... so i get my hair washed, she's explaining the shampoo and conditioner and even offers me a scalp massage. i get it, she's doing as most businesses do and that's to try and upsell me. i have no problem with that. the problem comes when i go to pay. my $20 haircut is now $24! i'm not worried about $4, i even still tipped the lady. the problem i have is that this additional charge was never mentioned. i wasn't asked if it was ok. i wasn't even told that is costs $4 to wash my hair. it was simply not mentioned. i feel this is a little deceitful. i think customers should be informed anytime that additional charges are going to be added to their bill. overall i was happy with the experience. clean place, good conversation, great haircut. i at least know now that if i decide to go back to make sure i ask, and not assume, that my $20 haircut will end up being $20. i appreciate the offer, ryan. i figured this was an oversight by the staff. i also could've asked and not assumed. it's really not that big of a deal and i certainly don't expect any sort of compensation for it. again, the overall experience was good. friendly staff and a good haircut. thanks again for the offer.
very good customer service!!! my son comes here every time he needs haircut. they pay attention what you like to have it done. friendly place and very pleasant.

boyfriend got a haircut and after continuously explaining to the women that he wanted a fade and to not round off his head this is what happened. it was worse, he told her to fade it more and this is what he ended up with. waste of money.

totally hit or miss. today i took my 4 year old son to get his haircut. each time i ask for it to stay longer on top and clean up around the ears.bravo maria for giving thomas the best haircut ever!!!this was a hit day.btw... this location is always super tidy, and everyone is friendly. at the end of haircuts they give the kiddos a lollipop!!!

went in for a cut with my son on sunday 8/19/18. $37 for 2 haircuts. well first off right off the bat they screwed my son's head up. i asked for a short fade one on the side 2 on the top and he has patches all through the sides of his head or they did not know how to fade properly. secondly when we went to leave i went to pay with my credit card $37 for 2 haircuts and i left a $14 tip in cash. the receipt they printed me out said $37 on it. my bank sends me text messages immediately when a transaction goes through so before i walked out of the store i had a text message saying supercuts in charge me $44.40. so i showed them this and asked where the $7.40 went did they add a tip without my permission what is it can you explain they told me no they told me that my information was wrong and they charged me what the receipt shows. well my bank doesn't lie and the receipt shows what it's supposed to but the transaction that went through on the bank is $7 more than the receipt shows so you guys stole my money. i have reported it as fraud and open investigation through the bank. i have my receipts the pictures and video from inside your store the way your employees handle the situation. i sincerely hope that someone from the corporate office sees this and contacts me to rectify the situation. not only should be store manager and employees should have training how to better handle situations like this, they should also have more training and customer service. will never return the supercuts

i got a fabulous "haurcut" at this location. no, i didn't request that one part be about half an inch longer than the rest but that's what i got. stuff happens and i'm a man so in the end i just smash it into place but a simple fade is the first haircut that you learn how to do. would give less stars if possible
shahrzad gave me a really good haircut. she was really patient and cool despite of me being really freaky about my hair. happy with the haircut.thank you shahrzad.
update- got a cut from an asian lady (not dana) and currently am very happy with it. we will see how it turns out :) :) :)

jenny is amazing here! i first went here a few months back and was lucky enough to get jenny. i have been going back to her about once a month ever since. she is so friendly and engaging. she is a 10/10!!!

after 4-5 haircuts here i have to say this place is a disaster.  each time i go home and shower and no matter who cuts my hair i have piece of hair sticking out everywhere.  not to say many other places in santa clara area better.  i think santa clara is the bermuda triangle of haircuts.  only a few good places and you can tell they are good because they are completely booked.  definitely a huge gap to fill if anybody can bring a decent organization to the area.

hit or miss period. they have couple of experienced hair stylist, the rest are just always new. high churnprice is competitive and you do get your appointment in a very timely manner- don't have to wait long

wish there was a negative star option. got a hair cut from here the lady was foreign, not asian i forgot her name. doesn't matter but this lady cut my hair and i have never been so disappointed in a hair cut. my hair is extremely choppy and it doesn't blend together what so ever. do not trust these people. they ruined my hair. first off cut it way too short when i hadn't asked them to cut off so many inches. second they were so inaccurate with copying the hair style i had suggested. and third let me walk out with the most ugliest hair cut i have ever had. so dissatisfied and so upset. never coming here again and i will make sure anyone i know will never come here.

ionica did a lovely and efficient job shaping up my straggly ends into a bob that tapers under nicely. i've also had a cut by niloufar and color by phuong and maria. all did a great job.will definitely return for friendly, reliable service at a great price point.

the most excellent service.  i bring my disabled son, who is in a wheelchair.  my son is not an easy cut .  but all the staff know my son's name and greet him with smiles every time.  i especially want to thank stylist fariba naji.  fariba is not only the best stylist at the shop.  she always goes above and beyond to help my son.   fariba, jimmy says hi and thank you for all that you do for him!  mu family highly recommends this shop.  if i could give 10 stars i would!

i visit this super cuts even though its 5 miles away from home just because of phoung. she is amazing. not sure if she quit that place. if she did then its a bummer. went today and looks like entire staff has changed. ionica was my stylist. 1. she look stressed out. 2. zero customer service. at times sounded rude.3. she screwed up my hair. cut more on on one side then the other. finishing was pathetic. my hair looks like someone chewed it on the side. i will not visit this place again if phoung is not around.

i recommend phuong to everyone. she really can give you the hair you want or even better. :)she is very kind and professional. give her a chance and you will chose her to be your only hair-specialist.

place is ok, nothing extremely awesome in hair cut they do, some of personnel is not really friendly and always in rush, and i noticed that in other locations, not bad place at all if u live close by and don't want make a reservation and wait for better quality and pricy locations

my sons have had a few good and some very bad haircuts (and bad experiences) here. not all of the stylists understand what a "sports haircut" is, and many take nothing off. a waste of time in some cases. they should train their newer people better. the people are all nice. their wait area is small. good location. but their haircut results are mixed (some good, many not so good).

not happy about the haircut or color service here. i asked for 2 inches off, there goes 4 inches instead. when it came to picking a color to even out my hair color and hide the highlights i got at a different salon back in february the girl wasn't confident with any color suggestions. when i was waiting for the color to set (which she left on for way too long) she kept saying "i wonder if it will turn out good" - not what you want to hear when you're getting permanent color... the color turned out much too dark for my complexion and was way over priced for just a supercuts salon. would not come here again for any hair services!
i was charged 18 dollars for a simple haircut. plus tips.& it wasnt perfect. never going back there .
sue was great. had a hair cut and shampoo. she was really such a nice person. love to be here again.

woah, what a convenient location considering what surrounds the area. there were two stylists there and little to no wait on a friday afternoon. i was able to get in and out within a fairly good amount of time. overall for what i paid ($20) and tip, i felt as if it could have turned out a little better. 4 stars for locations.maybe a different stylist next time around.

not sure about other super cuts but this location is great for kids' cuts. great service , inexpensive cuts, and convenient location. i've been bringing my son here for almost a year and he gets a great cut every time. previously, i've taken him to "real" barbershops hoping for quality cuts. after seeing how quickly his hair grows/ how often he needs a cut, i figured i'd give something like this a try. this location is within walking distance from us so it's very convenient.after seeing how great his first cut here was from ana(she's no longer here), i figured we just got lucky with the stylist. after the first visit, he's had a different person cut his hair each time and it came out just as good. i believe the kids cut cost about 18 or so. it's a great place for a quick cut for boys.
i can't recommend this place!!! only if you want ugly haircut and wearing hat next 2 month (minimum)!!! in the pictures my husband with his new haircut!

worst service forever. they cannot even do an easy blow out. they took forever, pulled my hair hundred of times and at the end my hair is still messy and i paid 50 bucks for it. they even asked me for a tip. will never go back again.

i have been here a few times as it is close to work and i can walk over during lunch when it is not very crowded. the people who work here are polite, but the barbers failed to do what i asked for specifically. i have never had this problem at other barber shops. also the place was hot the last time i went here.

worst experience ever. don't come to this place and waste your money. i did hair color and trim. the hair stylist left a lot of stains on my face, and didn't give me a towel after washing my hair. and they charged me extra 20 dollars for just a trim. i picked this place just because it's the closest to my apartment but the experience was so bad. never ever come back.

i want this place to succeed some of the stylist can cut hair here but really you have to train your front office desk not just to be robots and idiots and create big lines and tell people to sit down when there's no place to sit come on, stupid cats get it right you can make a lot more money and make a lot more customers happy if you just get your front desk right. no excuse make it a user-friendly experience and watch your business grow come on supercuts, help me out.

-friendly and attentive staff -clean and bright shopthe stylist, chelsea, knew exactly how to cut my bf's hair (combover). she listened attentively and repeated back how he wanted it cut. styled it really nice too.

talk about nickle and dime-ing you to death!!! yesterday i called and asked how much a women's haircut cost.  they quoted me $18.95. upon entry to the establishment, kathy asked me if i wanted my hair washed. i thought nothing of it and said, "sure, why not". my hair had been in a bob style, and i did not particularly like the way the front was longer than the back, so i asked her to fix it and make it all one length. she kept cutting and cutting and cutting... at the end she proceeded to blow-dry my hair; somehow i thought that this was done for her to see if she had missed any stray hairs in her layering my hair and that it was included in the haircut. i told her that my hair was naturally wavy/ curly and that there was no way for me to style it by blow drying it or using a straight iron. kathy proceeded to blow dry and straighten my hair anyway. the outcome of all this? i was charged $6 for the shampoo, $18.95 for the haircut and $12.95 for the blow dry-- a total of $35+!! what's more, i left there looking like a guy with longish hair, far from anything like a bob. the closest thing that i can describe my hair to look like is a messed-up dorothy hammill. and it is so short that i am going to have to live with it for over a year!!! i want to scream. this is the last time i am going to supercuts. the reason i went there in the first place was because it is a chain and i was depending on being understood by someone who spoke english better than the place i normally go to. i guess that's what you get for letting someone who's native language is not english.

very nice that you can come here every time during the day. no appointment needed. this spot quite busy but they will allow you for hair cut just in 10-15 min. good for those people who don't expect to much from average pricing barberry shop. fast and easy. friendly personnel

they are open at 9 am in the morning. i came in at 9:03 am. i was the 3rd person while the first two just got started. people who came after me would get the service. they call out names of people with appointments which is logical, but when the people are not present, they would still not call who is sitting there. couple of people who cane after me would get the service without the appointment. i got a feeling they are discriminating me by my race. just because they are not indians they would get service without appointments. bunch of racist creatures. and when you ask, the people say, oh did you come? we didnt notice, you are next. if you have appiintments lined up, you could have told me we are fully booked for morning or something. instead you made me wait and insulted me by not treating equal to other customers without appointments. it is 9:50 am now, i missed 1 hour and you have 3 saloonists who served 9 customers so far before me. i could have gone to another center. and if i  am really not the next, then i would rather do it. this is the second time i have a complaint on this center. first time my girlfriend wrote a review on behalf of me. and they call me and give me a coupon with a sorry. and made sure they wouldnt guve such treatment again. this time it is slightly different issue but still the same ridiculous behavior.

this review is for kathelyn who did a tea tree scalp massage and blow dry for me today. she really took her time to massage my scalp with the right pressure and style my hair with care all the while talking to me about what i liked. i'd like to see her again soon. services like scalp massage are usually hit and miss. i came out feeling better than i went in. all for just $22+ tips. i could do it every day!
absolute joke management with zero accountability. dont expect them to honor your reservation. i would avoid at all costs.
have been visiting this salon off lately. staff is very friendly, never impatient or in a hurry which is why i prefer this salon.
this place was superb when rich was here but after he is gone this is down the drain.if anybody knows where rich is working now please let me know.

first time i have them benefit of the doubt, maybe i didn't explain what i want. the second time it was pretty clear, they don't understand english, only know to cut hair as short as possible and then try to sell someproducts. stay away

pretty disappointed. my usual hair stylist was closed, but i had a hankering for a haircut so i stopped by here because it was the only place open. a middle aged woman had helped me.points of displeasure -texted throughout the haircut -rough with my head-haircut was mediocre in general -didn't bother to dry off my hair- didn't even acknowledge me after i paid. just had me sign and walked away. didn't give me a receipt  or that usual thank you or whatever.for $18 + tip, definitely not worth it. i've had better service from a $10 haircut salon. i definitely don't reccomend this place.

i've been going to lynn for a year now and she is the best hairstylist i've ever had. the first time she cut my hair, i got lots of compliments from friends and coworker about the great job she has done, so i kept going to her and she always does amazing.she gives suggestions and listens to mine and she's extremely personable. during the haircut, she pauses for feedback while there is still time for course correction, and tells me exactly what she did to my hair so that next time she will know what worked.lynn is awesome, super friendly and very professional. i can highly recommend her!

this is the last straw. i'm done with this place. even just 2 years ago i was so down to get ma haircut here. things have changed... the staff has clearly changed from the first several times i've been here. the workers are now mid aged asian women who have very limited knowledge of how to get it right. i get ma head shaved completely and ask to be lined up... the women says okay and cuts a straight line down. strike one. i later notice after i leave that she didn't line me up at all and in fact one corner of my forehead is now slightly farther back than the other. so my face looks slightly disfigured now... -______-not coming back!

i'd like to give zero stars! we walked in and immediately the stylist already cutting someone's hair asked in a rude tone if i had called ahead. i said no (as i didnt know you needed to). she says again in a snotty tone that the wait is an hour and a half. i said ok. and she then said we had to wait there. it was as if she wanted to scare us into not getting a haircut there! and to think, we had never been there before so that was our first impression of that place! needless to say, we left.

my friends and i have been coming here for budget-friendly cuts for over a year. for a trim or simple cut, you can't beat the value for your dollar.recently, i've had my hair cut by stephanie twice. she not only gave me great-looking layers, she also has a very pleasant and chill presence. i appreciated her double checking the trim length with me in the mirror and asking how i liked my hair throughout and so on. my hair is tricky because it's damaged and hard to work with. both times she was able to give me the cut i hoped for on top of helping me achieve healthier hair.thanks, stephanie!

one of the better supercuts. i go here from time to time for a cheap trim. i don't know her name but she's a vietnamese lady and did a great job keeping my hair long but chopping off enough to get rid of my split ends. i was happy with her cut. i don't ever feel pressure here to buy anything which is nice. also plenty of parking. wait is never more than 10 min on weekends.

pretty bad service. haircut took almost twice as long as they usually did at the old supercuts palo alto which i miss and the lady helping me never said a full sentence to me which made it very hard to communicate what i wanted. a haircut is a detailed thing and anyone giving one should be able to communicate more clearly than with a "this ok?" and a gesture. the lady cutting my hair had to get this other hair cutter to come finish off my haircut. i didn't ask for anything complicated or unusual! shouldn't they be trained in a school on this not in a retail shop? miss the palo alto location people there were always at least workable and they usually made sure they were clear on what i wanted .
good cut for my son. quick and efficient and the woman was nice and friendly. expensive though.

went in a few months back; had pre-scheduled an appt. on their app, and everything was going ok until the cut was done and i decided after review that i needed more cut off.  the stylist was a bit perturbed and kept saying over and over 'ok, so you're changing what you originally told me'....i tried to ignore her as it was obvious she was trying to guilt me out of changing my mind.  she then said if she was to have to start all over, she'd have to charge me for another haircut, and then pointed to the people waiting and mentioned that they'd all have to wait longer now too (definite guilt trip)!  i said forget it, paid and left.  i have never had a stylist or salon do this to me before - what's the point of having you check your haircut afterwards with two different mirrors and ask you if it's ok if clearly the idea is that they don't want to hear anything but 'yes'?!  i had been going to this supercuts for years until now....i won't be back.

horrible customer service the hours are until 8. i came in at 7:50 with an emergency i son cut a big chunk of his hair off. i walked in and asked if they were closed the two girls said no so i said can i just quick cut for my son since he had school tomorrow and after say no they are getting ready to close and went on with the conversation they were having. horrible customer service!!
oralia did a great job.great cut, very professional ... even did my eye-brows!keep up the good work

after coming here for over 10 years and having decent but inconsistent hair cuts, the last cut broke the camel's back. i asked for a scissor cut and then she bluntly says, "i'll use the trimmer and a comb" and then proceeds to lop off a bunch of hair. i'm not sure why she asked me how i normally get it cut if she couldn't care less. in the end, i'm almost 49 years old and i came home with a frickin mullet. i am resolute that i will never go back to this supercuts and probably never to any supercut again. the bad haircut is one thing, but to be disrespected and to have bad service is enough. go elsewhere.

$53 for a haircut?!  i may as well have gone back to aveda salon on santana row.when my normal hair stylist at aveda moved to texas, i decided to ask some co-workers for recommendations.  inocencia at supercuts was recommended to me.  i haven't been to a supercuts in a while, but i figured i would give it a try, because my co-worker has great hair.  inocencia gave me a great haircut.  if she ever changes salons, i would be happy to go back to her.  but when i went to pay for my haircut, i was in for an unpleasant surprise.  the price of a haircut on the board was $18.95.  i decided to treat myself and get the shampoo ($5) and blowdry ($12).  so my total bill should be $35?  right?  but when i checked out, the cashier and manager told me i had "style and blowdry"  (a what?) not a regular blow dry which was way down on the bottom of the price list not anywhere near the haircut package i thought i was getting.  a "style and blowdry" costs $35.   how this makes any sense, i have no idea.  so they said my bill was $18.95 plus $35 = $53.  why is a blow dry more expensive than a haircut?  how was i supposed to know there is a difference between blow dry types (i just got it done straight, no fancy wedding hair.)   inocencia was in agreement and tried to support my case, but we both lost.  and guess what supercuts?  you lost too because i will never go back to a supercuts ever again.   my aveda cut and blowdry cost $65 but i also got a massage in the package and the experience was much better.  i will be going back to aveda in the future -- inocencia, maybe you should join me there!
firstly, service was friendly. got my hair cut by tina. she did a great job and listened to what i wanted.

got my hair cut by emma on tuesday.  she did a great job.  listened to what i wanted, looked at pictures that i brought of different cuts i liked, suggested cuts that would be good for my hair type and facial features.  she just doesn't cut hair, she's a great stylist.  prices are cheap, the place was clean and the staff friendly.

i've been coming here for a deep conditioning treatment with marcela since oct and she has worked miracles with my hair! it's is so much healthier and she has helped me keep it long and healthy! i never have to wait too long and the staff is always friendly.

i get a no frills hair cut and try to be very specific about what i want and 80% of the time i am pretty happy with my cut. it is the times when i am feeling lazy and don't really care that my head gets askew.for the price and convenience, i am really happy with this location and expect what i pay for when i take the time to explain what i want.i like the call ahead feature and now that i found my favorite stylist, when she is in the country i can get a decent cut.whoo hoo.

this is pretty hit or miss place. first time was good, second time was terrible -- hair cut was uneven and i had to fix it up at home, as i was rushed out when more potential customers started lining up for haircut. it's $17.95 for a full haircut. pretty dissatisfied with this particular place.

thank you crystal! don't leave without having "the tea tree experience". my stylist crystal was kind enough to suggest this amazing addition to the standard shampoo. tingly tea tree shampoo along with a hypnotically relaxing scalp massage, finished off with a steaming towel face wrap and i felt like floating! i wish i could have one every day, like getting a spa treatment at supercuts. of course the haircut was perfect too,  she took care to be sure i had exactly what i wanted done and that i was happy before i left. i will definitely be back!

i went here yesterday and i wanted more than a standard haircut, i wanted a jet-black coloring job.   the stylist who took care of me, sarene, had over 20 years of hair styling experience, said it wouldn't be a problem. turns out, she knew exactly what she was doing.  because i'm just reaching the age when my hairline is starting to recede a bit at the temples, she cut it in exactly the best way to maximize the look of my hair and was careful with applying the right solutions in the right proportions to keep the dye in my hair and off my skin.she was sweet the whole time and did a lot of little things to assure my comfort, saying nice things like how good it was to be pampered, complimenting my looks, and giving me a scalp massage during pre-treatment and another when the color rinsed out, and the "tea tree" treatment which helped lock in the color.  she also recommended an excellent product to keep my colored hair healthy afterward, and i'm very pleased with her work and look forward to going back for a touch-up and future treatments.  the whole process took about 1.5 hours and was reasonably priced at $45 for the color job plus $10 for the tea tree treatment.i made sure to tip her generously for her work, because she totally deserved it!this place does take appointments, so if you're planning on a great cut, style, or color, i would call and ask specifically for sarene's service.and if you're a member of aaa, don't forget to bring in your card to get a 20% discount on everything, services and products alike, something you will need to ask for as they don't tell you about it up front.they also have a "cut card" where you get stamped every time you come in and your 13th cut is free.  but again, you will need to ask for it, or ask them to stamp it if you've already got one.

first off, the service was friendly. the lady welcomed me with a warm welcome and made sure that i was being helped. now to the haircut. for $17, the haircut was a good quality, the cut being pretty even. although, the upper right side of my head has a small patch of hair that the hairdresser did not touch, even after i told her that it needed to be trimmed. lastly, she gave me a warm towel to wipe the excess hair that was on my face during the cut. all in all, the experience was great and the place looked amazing, but since one side of my hair is uneven, i give it three stars. i would recommend this place to anybody who wants a simple, quick, and inexpensive cut!!!!

is $130 for a haircut and highlights too much? i have long hair and have never gotten high lights before and wanted to go somewhere "cheap" this doesn't seem cheap. and it's gonna take 3 hours... oy vey.  and they don't have color samples i just have to trust they know what they're doing...at least it sounds like they do. we'll see, i'm waiting for the girl to get her coffee before she starts :-/

went here for the first time last week to chop all of my hair off (kind of a scary thing!) luckily marcela was awesome and walked me through everything super patiently. i will definitely be coming back just for her... recommended!

i went to this supercuts once and had a terrible haircut. i complained to supercuts and they were great around giving me a voucher for a new haircut. i went again to this same location and again had an awful experience. i normally get a buzz cut. somehow each time i get this simple cut here, they miss 40% of the hairs on my head and make it look terrible. my regular supercuts in campbell does an excellent job. not sure why this particular store is consistently bad.

omg charlene is the best!! moved to south bay last year and have be putting off...and off...and off...the oh so inevitable search for "the one". and i found her! she is really knowledgeable, and she knew exactly what i wanted, and i am so happy to have given this little store a chance. thank you charlene! see you soon =)

honestly one of the worst haircuts ive had so farthe indian lady who cut my hair messed up my hairline on my left forehead and in an attempt to fix it, messed up my right forehead hairline too.nothing but a nightmare, wouldnt reccommend to anyone
grace magic hairdresser - polite and very friendly. very highly recommended.

my boyfriend and i came here the other day and i definitely don't recommend it. they didn't cut my boyfriend's hair the way he wanted to and they cut my hair much shorter than i initially wanted; giving me layers. and we both specially told the women how we wanted our hair done.
grace is my haircut hero, she found a cut that fits me since the first time i visited this location. i don't understand why no one told me before that what my hair needs thinning  scissors only.

grace is the reason why i continue to come! she takes care of my son and recently she shampoo'd and blew-dried my long hair and it was an amazing experience.  my hair made it through the day and wind! thank you grace! loved it!
i had a great experience at super cuts. shahrzad gave me a great haircut and she was so friendly as well. i definitely recommend this place.
grace is amazing and cuts extremely well! was happy with my hair cut. their cool attitude was a big plus! will be seeing you soon!

i went there today with my sister and we both felt that we were cheated big time! grace charged us twice that of the amount promised. very sloppy job of shampoo and quick less than 2 mins massage.one star is for the blow drying job only. this branch needs to teach their staff for better communication and honesty.

jackie's awesome! i checked in before leaving my house and only had to wait for 15-20 minutes. she made sure i like the length before she cut and listened to my requests instead of talking me out of them. she also styled my hair for free just because she's not busy. i would come back again & i highly recommend her if you go. thank you jackie!

today i went in for the hair color and the hair cut. jacky helped me with everything and she did a great job. all the staff are super friendly and nice! it's so funny cause i was at the store when those two ladies came inside and got their hair blow dried! they both had tick hair and took so much time of grace's and she already gave them discounts. it's so sad how some people like to take advantage of others and not show appreciation! anyways my husband and i always go to that supper cut even through it's far from where we live cause of their friendly staff and awesome job they all do. thanks jacky and the entire staff for taking good care of your customers!
i've been going here for a couple years because it's close to work and love the staff. grace, jackie, and everyone i've had has been professional and they all do a great job.

this is the only place i will come to get my haircut. jacky is the best!!! i followed her here from another location because she is so great! jacky remembers things about me even though i am not so good about coming to see her as often as i should. she is always happy to see me and makes me feel like an old friend or even a member of the family.when i first saw her a few years ago i told her that i need to wash and go because i am what i call blowdryer illiterate. i have said this to stylists in the past and before i met jacky thought i liked my haircuts. she gave me the best cut i have ever had in my life!!! she also picked my hair color for me and i love it!!!!! it is the perfect color for me. she has also helped me with selecting hair products that are best for me. jacky is amazing.

been to this supercuts for years and grace has been absolutely amazing. she remembers how i like my hair cut and she always has an awesome attitude. she brightens everyone's day and makes this a great experience.  i highly recommend this place and especially grace!

i have curly hair and hardly satisfied with any of the haircuts i get. actually i'm a bit picky about my hair style. a friend of mine recommended sherri on this branch of super cuts. i thought to myself it worth trying... and i think finally i find my hair stylist! she is really skillful and i finally got the haircut i wished for many years. i think she really deserves a five star review. thank you so much sherri!

as much as i like some of the hair dressers here, it is just ridiculous if you have to wait for an hour, even after an appointment. if you value time this is not the place.update: i did get the haircut after the wait and am very happy with it. they gave me a $2 credit, i understand it is a token, no issues, it's not the money as my tip was more than it.i understand some customers may come in for some service and then decide for more which can take extra time. but then let the customers with reservation know the reality so they can plan. in my case 39 min after the time reserved i even offered to reschedule to a different time or day as i had to take my daughter for soccer. i was told 5 min more which ended up lot longer. there are way better ways to handle customers: both who demand more service than initially asked and ones who booked online thinking they can avoid long wait. recommendation to business - value your customers. you have some good hair dressers but if you cannot provide proper customer service you'll loose customers like me. i was a loyal super cuts on prospect rd customer till they messed up with service on several occasions. please don't stoop to that level and fix the issues.

grace is a world class hair stylist and star of this location. jackie, another stylist at this location initially gave me a bad haircut and i had to go back to get it fixed. grace fixed my haircut for free and transformed the original bad haircut into an extremely good haircut. grace's skills and customer service are both top notch. they should give a promotion and raise to grace for her excellent skills, customer service and for making up for the faults of others on the team.

i visited super cuts for the first time. very happy with the layered haircut and blow dry. my hairstylist was very friendly and she did a very good job. i thought this place is cheaper, but i paid $55 for haircut plus $5 for tip. its the same i used to give in ulta.  but still i am happy with the hair style

couldn't even understand the blonde lady cutting my hair. she had big glasses. waiting for about 45 minutes for a trim. i asked for a trim with shampoo and blow dry and assumed the blow dry would cost about the same as the shampoo. no one told me the price. blow dry was $50 wtf and took over an hour to wash, cut my hair one inch, and blow dry. when she was washing my hair she scrubbed the dye out of my hair and got my face shirt and arms all wet. 10/10 will not go back again

been here twice with my boys.   they just don't care.  our first time, the haircut was sloppy on my older son who wanted his hair crewcut.  they had no idea what that was.   the second time, was for my younger son who has lovely long hair.  he wanted it trimmed for his halloween costume.  i specifically told the lady to please cut an inch off the back and give him a layer.  i turn around and she's butchering his hair with the clippers.  i don't get it, don't all people who cut hair know what layers are?  my son was in tears and i was close to them.   that was the last time i'll go!  i asked her what she was doing and she was so clueless and didn't care either!  seriously go somewhere else.  i know supercuts isn't the most quality but this is beyond bad.

this was my 2nd time going to this supercuts location. customer service wise not too great. there were about 4 ladies just working on stocking up products not even caring who comes in the store. i got seated right away with a asian male stylist. at 1st i was quite skeptical because i couldn't really understand his english, but i showed him a photo of what i wanted and explained to me he couldn't do it like that and instead did his best to cut the way i want it. overall he did an amazing job. for the price is just perfect. instead of going to those salons to have a haircut for $50 and such i got mine for $19.

i have been going to coleman super cutsfor 3 yrsalway had good hair cutsbut this last cut was horriblewent there 2 times but but same old asian lady was there,so i went in there today,7 days later to get someone else to trim it up and wes refusedif there was a negative 2 i would use itthe girl agreed but the manager said no!!!would only take 6 min or soso much for satisfeid customersi will never go there again................
if yvonna was still there it would be 5 stars for sure.  she always did a great job every time, and did a perfect fade.  haven't found anyone there that can do a good a job as her.

the guy that cut my hair was kind of short with me.  i was looking for some advice and he kind of just barked questions at me.  i got my haircut and it's not really what i was looking for and it wasn't even styled, just cut and air dried.  i'm not happy at all honestly, i just wasted $25 and about to spend even more to get it fixed at a place that gives a shit.

vanessa cut my hair and was very professional and accommodating. she knew what i was talking about when i had a request for my hair line. i noticed the way she cleaned her station before she called me too. she thoroughly cleaned every razor head with a brush and tapped it on the counter to ensure all hair was removed. she sprayed sanitizer on both sides of each item she had used: laying everything down and then flipping it over for each spray. she also greeted every customer that walked in and let them know someone would be attending them soon.

i am giving 1 stars for the worst hospitality and also for the dumb asian hairdresser i have ever seen in my life. using asian as i don't know her name. the reason for my bad review is because even saying her to cut only an inch from the existing hair, she went ahead on her own left me with such a short hair. on top of it, it took months to grow the beard and i regret asking for beard trim. i asked her to have it little structured and ended up loosing my beard style. she was not able to even tell the difference on what goof up she did. my left side was way up than right. and when she fixed left, it wasn't a surprise that now right was way upper than left.
