absolutely the worst quality haircut ive ever had... the younger blonde woman that has the station by the register moves way too fast and doesn't communicate on what she's doing. i'm 45 years old and i get my haircut every two weeks, i think i have it down pat on the instructions i give and what i expect when it's done . they were not busy and there was no reason for her to rush so quickly. if you want a different haircut every time you go there this is the place for you.

just called for an appointment at 5:30pm. easy. asked for layers with a "deep v" back but it wasn't "v" enough. whatevers. i came in knowing that where ever i go to get my hair cut, my hair will be chopped off half the length (my hair reached my belly button, now it's at my clavical). i'm pretty sastified since the price for a hair cut was just $19.99. great service, nice workers and in and out in 40 mins.

cynthia is an angel. she salvaged my hair in under an hour. i'd gone to a different chain for colour the day before and my hopeful summer ombré dreams were squished with a bad blend and super bad damage on the ends.cynthia recommended a protein treatment and gave me the cut i wanted. she was so fun to talk to and we swapped salon horror stories. when she was finished i could move my fingers through my hair again. my hair instantly felt better. it still needs to be babied for a while, but i feel like i can go out in public now. thanks, cynthia!

i call in, they tell me to come in and when i do, they tell me they don't have time.i try to make a reservation for the next day they won't let me! they only take same day reservations.i come in, they tell me to wait 30 min, i wait for an hour, no luck, i leave....what is wrong with supercuts? they can't handle a simple reservation system. people plan their day, show some respect.

i know this is petty of me to say, but how does a stylist not know what a pixie cut is?! this is the second time i've had this particular stylist (i want to say his name is nathan) cut my hair and yes it had been like 3 months since the last time he saw me, but you'd think you'd remember the girl who wanted a pixie cut who had to show what it was via picture what that is because he didn't know! also a small disagreement that i wanted something like the picture i showed him and he kept telling me it was a #1  clipper and i told him i've always had a 3 1/2. sorry, i dont care what it looks like... just do a style like the picture but do what i tell you to do..is that really that hard? ugh. if i didn't like the other ladies who work there i wouldnt come back because of him. i'm requesting one of them next time.

go to this place only if you don't value your time. i called them in advance today (sunday, november 19) and they told me that the wait line is ~ 1 hour. so they signed me up to come in an hour. when i actually arrived they told me to wait a little and that they would be "right with me". after waiting for 15 minutes and not seeing any progress i asked the cashier lady when could i expect to get my service. she answered that there are two more people ahead of me, my call in advance didn't matter at all and that they didn't have sign ups and a adjusted the line in accordance with how many people walked in. as a result i had to leave without service (wasted my time) because i had other things scheduled later on that day.
the staff in this location is rude to customers.  natalie, the store manager was yelling at customers right in front of me.  this is not a good environment!!

everything about this place is terrible. rude hairstylist that do not listen a $20 haircut is going to cost me so much to fix! i asked for a trim and i got a choppy uneven mess! all she did was criticize my hair and have nothing but negative comments about everything. i understand having a bad day but at least cut it the way i ask! do not go here!
this salon is really good i like it. they spent a good time on my hair cut :) also the employees are really friendly !

horrible horrible horrible, and i don't recommend any women to come here for hair cuts! normally, i go to asian salons, but i decided to try a new place because my cuts are quite expensive (usually $50), so i came here because i saw pretty decent reviews, and the price was significantly lower ($19) than what i usually pay. i always get my cut the same. "please trim the damaged ends, and keep the v-shape." i never caught her name, but it was an asian lady who cut my hair. her hair was layered, black, and maybe to her mid back or a bit shorter. my hair originally was down to my butt. now, it is at my shoulders!!! i told her to cut my ends, and she literally cut off more than a foot of my hair which took me years to grow out. i have never been more upset after getting a haircut. it's not even shaped in a v like i asked! my hair is just very awkwardly shaped now. worst part is that i wanted to look good for an upcoming banquet, and now i'm going to have to spend a fortune fixing my hair somehow with extensions. very very upset, and now i think i'll just stick to my $50 haircuts once my hair is actually back to it's normal length in a couple of years.

cheyenne did an amazing style with cut and even more amazing with highlights to dark hair. i would recommend to anyone who needs a professional color, cut and style. a return customer always.......phyllis & jenna

i have been to this place many a times and i was pretty okay with this place. but this time i had an encounter with an unwelcoming lady. i am not aware of her name but she had blue colored hair. the cut she gave me is terrible. she was cutting hair as if its her first day at job. no manners. no courtesy. absolute rude and unprofessional person and truly a novice. how could supercuts appoint such people? this place used to be good but now its absolutely a place to be avoided. for my recent experience i want to give 0 stars but luckily there is no such option.

i went in for a trim but decided to live a little and cut my hair. i should've known better. if i could turn back time, i would've turned the car around and peeled it back to my usual places or actually just gotten a trim.the haircut was bad. the type of bad you leave the store with a sinking feeling and a boulder in your lstomach bad. the bad you get when you ate too many chicken nuggets in college at 3 am bad.i got layers on my previously long and shiny hair (rip). well, when i say layers, i meant "layers" as in keep the original length but add some volume but putting in layers. holy s this lady (god bless her soul i didn't remember her damn name) cut across the middle of my hair in what looks like a poor replication of an avant garde art piece. it looked like steps.okay, now i have steps. what's next. she also had no idea how to blend in said steps to look natural. nope. she just put down her tools and told me to look at the mirror. uh no. can you please try that again. she cut literally an inch below where my old ombre hair started and my natural color ended. it was now a step and a bar of color. after another try it still looked terrible and i decided to cut my loss and just leave. my hair went in smooth (after many months of hard work and care), long, and healthy looking. my hair now looks frizzy, damaged, and a s---show. she didn't attempt to talk to me at all until the last 3 minutes when she was trying to be subtle and think of convo to get her tip.no.nonononono good thing hair grows back.

i went and a woman was wearing dirty black latex gloves i thought maybe cuz she was at the register but no she sanitized her gloved hands and started running her hands thru my hair. i half wanted to vomit the cut my hair like dora the explorer yup never again. swiper no swiping

i called at 9:45 on a saturday morning and they scheduled me for 11 that day. i only waited five minutes before my stylist called me over. super efficient. i think my stylist's name was aman (i'm sorry i forgot!) and i adored her. she was incredibly accommodating, friendly, gentle with my brain cavity (much appreciated!), didn't push extras on me but offered them. i was grateful she knew how to hold a conversation but didn't force small talk on me. also importantly, she did a great job with my cut and didn't shame me for the terrible state my bleached mullet was in. considering what she had to work with, she proved her stylist skills.the a-line cut was $24, which included a shampoo. and she dried/ styled it for an additional $15. for someone who pinches pennies, it was a great deal. i'll be back for future hair cuts!

come here for choppy cuts :/i wanted a trim for my hair, cut straight--the exact same style i have now, which is straight--cutting off an inch. the lady that cut my hair, who i never asked for the name of since i forgot to, didn't even seem like she knew what she was doing. when i asked for a soft v-line, she said it would look weird and didn't do it; it was my choice and style for my hair, so why does she get to choose what i can do for my hair? she then said she wanted to cut an a-line, and i rejected because i'm not a doll to experiment with--especially with my hair, but i clearly made that mistake by having her cut my hair to begin with.not often did she grab onto locks of my hair to lift an cut, like most professional stylists do. she cut it straight by asking me to tilt my head and bringing the shears, trying to cut my hair straight as if she was tracing a line with scissors on paper. so her technique was poor. she constantly looked at the mirror as she cut my hair, and told me my hair was even when it wasn't (my left side was longer than my right and she didn't fix it).throughout my cut she kept on recommending me different styles i should do to my hair and commenting about it: "your hair is so dead", "you need to re-color it's so uneven", "color this higher next time", etc. thanks, but i'd rather not listen to someone who is a stylist that can barely cut hair.she gave me so many layers when i asked for subtle layers, and i despise it so much. i tie my hair in a half-do because the cut is so bad and i have to wait until my hair grows out for me to get a better, even cut. oh, and she forgot to cut certain parts of my hair so they were my original length; i had to get scissors at so it myself at home.the price for this trim and horrible outcome is still $20.00 for some reason, and it's $20.00 for both men and women, but i say you save your money for elsewhere.the waiting time is not bad at all for a sunday afternoon. we were treated right away without a line waiting prior to us, and the receptionist was very friendly and kind--and professional.even so, i'm not returning and i recommend you to be careful! if you have a bad feeling about your stylist, listen to it or you'll end up with a cut like mine!
i feel the service there are not worthy the price. men cut in 10 min for 20 while the service is not different.

i wish i could give a negative rating. the staff is horrible and not courteous at all. i have been to salons where the staff can't speak english but they try to understand customer's needs. she just started the haircut without even trying to understand what kind of cut i wanted. when i explained, she said "i know my job". wtf. she also insisted on me getting the hairwash when i didn't want. worst experience. had to walk out without a hair cut.

i've been in other supercuts and this one is much better. it has the same low prices and most importantly the same simple reservation process. people here are very friendly and so far i've been happy with the service.i have to add that i'm probably not a sophisticated customer when it comes to the haircut ;-)

their online check in doesn't work at all unless you do it twice. ended up waiting for 45 minutes at the salon. really horrible site do to online check in. never going here again in my life. they just don't tell you how long the wait is. my recommending this place ever.

i came here to get a haircut as i have done in the past but the experience is always the same. the only reason why i come here is because it's close to my house and i can walk there on a nice day. but i guess i just need to learn. there was no one there except for 1 hairstylist so i couldn't even pick. when she asked what i wanted i told her i wanted to trim the back of my hair to about here i didn't even get explain anything else and she just cut it right there,  whoops it's a little too late then it was all gone, as we continued she asked if i wanted to shampoo i said yes. when it came time to cutting my hair i was very specific with how i wanted it cut she paid no attention to that. asked if i wanted a blow dry and i said no my goal was to just get out of there and leave. when it came time pay , quoting me a price she quoted me the haircut price and then added five dollars for the shampoo. when i explained to her that the shampoo was included in their haircut for the price stated on the pricing board she said no that's for men only. i said no that's not for men only i've been here many times before that's the correct price ok i'll give you a discount she said. i said no you're not giving me a discount your charge me the price you're supposed to charge me. the staff is consistently inconsistent with the pricing even though there is a pricing board displayed above the register they still quote incorrect prices and try to take money from you it's completely bad business,  some of them don't even know how to cut hair i'm not sure how they got their license it's very disappointing. just because it's a discount type hair salon does it mean you should get discounted and inexperience hairstylist

i had a hair cut at supercuts last week. linda was super nice and gave me a great hair cut.i like the way linda cut my hair and she provided very good recommendations to take care of my hair. it was great experience, linda n. was a very nice hair stylist, she took the times to ensure i am happy with  the result. i highly recommend linda for a hair cut at supercuts.

i just brought my adult niece into super cuts to have her hair washed and styled.  being developmentally disabled, she has a hard time explaining how she wants her hair styled, so i explain to the stylist.  she was assigned to amy.  i explained to amy the style she wanted.  amy then stepped away and spoke to two other stylists, then came back and told me that my niece would have to wait for another stylist.    no explanation as to why she was refusing service.  two other customers were taken before my niece was called.  fortunately the stylist who did provide service was very kind and patient.  i found amy's treatment of us rude, unprofessional, and demeaning.

disapointed. i waisted my time waiting i called a head of time asking if i can come in for a color ombré the assured me yes they will do it and when i got there i waited 30 min to be called once called she pretty much told me no she can't do it. didn't give me any other color options and sent me off not to mention she coulden't even show me the color option booklet!. to me it seemed like she did not want to do the coloring at all! let me just say i have been to a supper cuts and they were able to do ombré smh. disappointed and a waste of my time when i could have gone somewhere else!

terrible.  avoid stephanie at all costs.  not only did she have an attitude, she proceeded to hit me repeatedly with her clippers.  she high-sided my head after i showed her a photo of a low fade that i requested.  ever seen full metal jacket?  similar experience.  also, they charge 20 dollars for a supercuts, which includes a hot towel wipe.  she hit me with the blow dryer and said "i think it looks good".20 dollars will get you a legit haircut at a barber.  don't waste your time.

i've been getting my hair cut here for many years. kathy is great and a pleasure to talk to. she has always given me the feeling that i come to a place where i am welcome and appreciated. kathy manages the place so that it does not feel at all like a chain but a neighborhood establishment.

i had mixed experience here. last time i got haircut from azam which was pretty good. yesterday some other person (linda) has done my haircut, that turned out to be terrible. i found linda's work to be super quick but very sloppy - she didn't deliver what i wanted and whetever she delivered is of poor quality i.e. it's uneven in so many places.
unorganized place. does not honor their own priority system. they take in regular customers as walk-in. the place looks unhygenic. licenses of such a place should be revoked.

they should name this location super"bad"cuts. the whole bunch that work here couldnt care less about doing an honest day's work, just pass their time taking breaks all the time and never prioritize online appointments. the place is incredibly dirty and the equipment looks almost unsanitary. they ignore people waiting and i've seen many times people just leave unhappy and angry.

we've been here for an hour, waiting patiently.  the staff has been ridiculously slow and despite the fact that they had about 10 clients waiting, they still choose to waste time on small talk with departing customers.  then a guy walks in, is greeted immediately, and they take him in front of everyone else.  it wasn't until i complained loudly that i was told that we're next.  what a joke.  i no longer recommend this place because of this inexcusable customer service.

jacky is an amazing person and she is fun and focused on her job . i went to their salon couple times and she helped me multiple times with an amazing hair color and hair cut. with having 25+years of experience i recommend you all to go to her . once you go ,you will go for ever to her

this was the worst day of my life. i arrive in to meet a most unfriendly ** woman who was very rude and smelled bad,she was very aggressive and not gentle. awful experience. greatly disappointed. and then the check overcharged me 65$ not sure she was qualified enough to shear sheep. save yourself from this place. yes she is manager in this place.

hair is one of those things you shouldn't be lazy about. but when it comes time for a cut, i can always think of more fun ways to spend $60+.hence the time when i came to supercuts. i just needed a quick trim to get off the split ends as well as my roots touched up. somehow that left me $80 poorer, but given the number of terrible salon experiences i've had, i was okay with the price. my roots didn't come out totally perfect (they ended up being about an 8 1/2 instead of a 9 color) but it's not terribly noticable. as for the trim, the lady took off my split ends without ruining my layers, and i was happy enough with the results.would i come back here? ehh, i shouldn't. but i might.

yolanda gave me a great cut. i asked for trim and taper and she was quick to understand. only negative is they push for the shampoo, massage, the products!! i had a hard time saying no to everything lol. still will come again for the nice quick hair cut.

i was extremely thrilled w/azita's work! after years of growing out my hair and not taking very good care of it, i finally decided to just chop it off. azita did a great job turning a long rat's nest into a shoulder-length, stylish cut. i showed her a picture of what i was looking for and she took it from there (while still keeping me informed of what she was doing to my head)! she will definitely be the one to maintain it from here on out!(only reason i'm not giving this 5 stars is because the price was a little bit much... $44 for a cut, blow dry and style.  i was willing to pay it, given the state of my hair and how drastic the change was, but it's a bracing difference from the $19 trims/cuts i'm used to! azita is worth the price, but i don't know if i'd feel comfortable with it for any other stylist.)

this place sucks, specially on the weekends. they have hired people who have other jobs during the weekdays & really don't know how to give a hair cut. the place had edgy barbers. just weekends is a horrible place . i wish i could give them -5 stars.

this was the worst service that i have received from a supercuts center. the stylist has had no interest in the cut. therefore, the cut has an absolute lack of basic quality. absolutely disappointed about this place.

the service at this location is pretty bad across the board. from the time you enter, to the end of the haircut the service just sucks. no one acknowledges you on entry. app check-in and wait times mean nothing. a 0 minute wait time is more like 20 minutes. people checking in person get in ahead of your app check-ins (done 15 minutes earlier). prices are higher than other supercuts. haircuts are standard. won't be visiting again. really needs franchise management to take a look.

this is the absolute worst place to get a haircut, i mean honestly, the only thing u can do there is purchase one of the resold branded hair-care products. and also, the staff there is deaf, and does not listen, for i just had a haircut where i had asked my barber to give me three on all sides and cut around half of the hair on the top. however, i exited the store with hair that matched a chinese monk, and now, bald with a cleanly shaved head, i beg u to not end up the position i am in, and choose a place whose staff listens to you.

first time i've cut my hair in years at another place other than my aunts salon, didn't really know what to do with my hair, but jenny was very nice and helped me throughout the whole thing, i haven't loved my hair in a long time, i totally recommend you get ur haircut with jenny! great costumer service and haircut! :)

turns out kardelia does not work here anymore. she was just perfect for short hair cuts.today i went in just despite finding out kardelia no longer works there, thinking to myself... how badly can someone screw up a hair cut and then i found out. i should have figured out when she started and stopped her because it did seem like she had no clue. i would have really appreciated if she was honest and just said she has no experience.ladies should skip this place if you have short hair!
not everyone here knows how to cut.. not a place what i was looking for...too bad for people who have curly hair.. they will make you cartoon character..

just because they are cutting kid's hair, they feel they don't really have to pay attention. i took my daughter today for hair cut. lady who gave her hair cut was very sleepy probably. she just plainly ran her scissor in a straight line still from the back,  right side looks shorter than left. hate this place and never coming back. $16+ $2 tip, not worth it at all! i went there just because i went to target for shopping and regret my bad decision ever. my 8 yr old was sad to see her hair when it dried up. please don't go there an don't take your kids either. there are other better salons where stylists are hard working, pay attention to details and not sleepy!!

from what i've noticed from this place, my haircut is always a hit or a miss depending on who is cutting it. they always have different people cutting at different times of the day and some people know how to actually cut the hair and others simply just suck. it's hard to give a good gauge as to how things are. however, the one thing that i absolutely dislike about this place is the increase in prices. i've been coming to this place for years now and i remember when i first came, it was about $15. now, it's $20 for a frickin haircut. $20 is way too excessive. therefore, i'll probably not go there anymore. side note: i'm a guy so idk how the haircuts are for women.

i was unable to wash and dry my own hair due to a surgery.  nancy was very gentle, listened to my concerns and needs and delivered better results than any highend salon i have used in the past.  my husband has been getting his hair cut here for years and honestly, it's a bargain.
don't go to this place . they have their own "friends" jump the line. super rude people . worst place in america.

i have been coming here for many years. i get consistently good work from pretty much anyone i get to cut my hair and i think that they are very reasonably priced.  they make good suggestions for your hair style when asked and they also give you good advise on how to take care of your hair afterwards.  this feels like a very neighborly place to me where the employees carr about people and they all try hard to give good service.  wait times can vary but you can leave your name and go shop nearby for a while and come back later. kardelia runs a good team and if you want some good work done for a very decent price, this is a great place to come.

i am a regular customer at this location in the heart of cupertino, but tonight i've got the worst service ever and the highest price quoted ever to color the roots only ($65.00)!!! from the start i was hinted that i need to go to professional salon and that my color will not turn out right. then i needed to make a decision about the color to blend in. at that point all i had left is just to leave.:((

i went for a haircut and supercolor. i dont know the person who did my coloring. it was the worst coloring i ever had. i came back home and realized this. the color was all over my skin ( under both ears, on the forehead and all over the back on the neck). she has not bothered to apply vaseline before starting. worst job ever.
i just heard kardelia no longer works there. is this true?? does anyone know where she went? who is going to cut my hair from now?

i don't want to write the name of the stylist here, but the work she did on my husband's hair is just horrible. he went for a trim and she trimmed his hair and also thinned them. he is practically bald now.never ever go here..
go ask for azita! !very  good lady  ,,good in cut, ,color  but also fix your color  as well  when  you don't like! !

went there as i needed a haircut and was exploring places where i can get a reasonable haircut.  the initial welcome was good, i entered my details in the computer and was asked to wait for 15 min.when my turn came. ...i explained as how i need my haircut to be done but very soon i found that the actual haircut was totally different as i explained. she made my head looks as a rounded watermilon.  worst haircut i ever had. now i need to wait till my hair grows big and go for a good haircut place.note: if someone going there...please make sure u instruct them every minute so that u get a haircut as u wanted.

daughters hair all broke off from a keratin treatment and then i saw her brush it out and pulled it and brushed it so hard. it was awful. i had to stand up. a few times in the beginning i was just going to walk straight out because of the vibe and the haughtiness the young asian beautician displayed but i thought maybe it will be ok. always go with your instinct. 30% of her hair is now gone and broken off all on top so it looks like it sticks up. so sad. she had luxurious hair and now it's thin. :( the 1st time an older woman did it and did a great job. this time, won't be back.

kudos to brianna. she does such an awesome job. she cuts all the boys hair, and my mans. she is attentive and always very communicative with us on styling. i can say she is really good with ethnic hair, because my boys hair is very coarse and has a tendency to stand straight up, but she has done a great job with styling in the latest fashion trend. we have been going here and will continue to show her our loyalty.

i'm not one to give bad reviews but i think this was the worst place i've ever gone to get a haircut. i came in pretty positive trusting the people there with giving a decent haircut but i really over estimated them. the end result was terrible. i hate my hair now. i told the lady clear instructions on what i wanted and what my usual hairstyle was. she went completely opposite of what i wanted. so terrible. so ugly. i will never go here again. i definitely won't be recommending this place to anyone. $20 for a shitty ass haircut. goodbye.

i love it. last time i went to get my hair cut the lady cut off way to much (i just wanted a trim)here i was a little nervous because the lady didn't speak good english.  but me and my bf got our hair cut and they turned out great. they didn't cut to much off the lines on mine look nice. if you come here just make sure you explain everything and they understand i'm sure you'll leave happy.

first off, they tell me thirty minutes wait until the next haircut, that's fine, an hour and 15 passes. secondly, my hair dresser, hien, was terrible. first off, she was rude and super abrupt. i told her i wanted a disconnected undercut but to fade from a 2 to a 3. say she understands. when she starts cutting, the haircut feels weird, so i ask to look, it looks terrible. she says she's not done. i let her do what she wants. proceeds to use the razor and constantly bumps my head with it while cutting. i just get it over with. once she gets to the fade, she tells me that the hair is weird and that she will have to fade it, that's what i wanted in the first place. in the end, i just want to be out from what terrible service i have received. i check my own hair, it looks terrible. while there is apparent that there was a change in razor sizes from two to three, its not faded at all. the top back of my hair is basically a mushroom cap. since i had asked to not touch the front, the front looks fine. overall, a terrible job and won't be coming back. not worth $20.

ladies steer clear of this salon. it seems as though they specialize in men's haircuts. i should have known better to come here when i noticed there were only male customers. i came here to get a little trim, preparing for professional photos that are being taken at my new job in a few days. i told the stylist i wanted a trim and to keep the style, including my bangs. i showed her a photo of how i wanted my bangs. she cut way too much to where i feel like i hardly have any hair left. she tried to blend my bangs with the hair in front, like taper it. it doesn't blend at all. she just cut way too much. when blending it like that it shouldn't be super noticeable. also, i asked that she only trim my bangs and to have them at eyebrow length. i already had them, they were just a little too long. she started snipping away and then stepped back to look at them, when i saw in the mirror what she had done i wanted to run out right then. i told her they were uneven. she kept trying to fix them and i finally had to stop her. they look terrible and they're too short to pin back.  i feel so embarrassed and self conscious. it took everything in me to hold back the tears. on top of it all i have to have my photos taken at work soon with this hair. i will never visit a supercuts again.

i just found out that my stylist of many years, song, retired. she had consistently given me the best haircut and was someone i looked forward to visiting. i'll miss you song! congratulations on your retirement... you deserve the best!

i had a great first impression.i've never been to a supercuts before and i didn't know what to expect. i decided to go early in the morning to avoid waiting too long, it was a good call. the lady who cut my hair was very friendly and the wash was amazing! i definitely want to come back, just to get my hair washed. and of course she did a great job cutting my hair. i was very satisfied with the place and the service, this will now be my go to place.
i won't complain about the staff as a person, super friendly.  but my goodness, my stylist shouldn't cut hairs..... it was uneven and left a square tail on the end of my hair.

got a quick haircut here and she did a great job. quick and clean, no drama or hatred. somewhat expensive for men's haircut but recommend this place. my hair stylist i think name dung is pretty looking too.

i always get the same lady i don't remember her name but she is asian and has short hair. it's always a nice convo along with a nice hair cut. she's so friendly. i like this location even though i live downtown and there are closer ones. they know what they're doing here. make an app because they get really busy!

i've been going to atelier in santana row, but the stylists there charge $60 + for the cut/styling that are not that great nor complimentary to my look (casual professional).  so i was looking for a new hair salon to get my shoulder length hair trimmed and slightly textured (but not too seared) at the bottom so that it would curl in when i style and not bulk out.  today, i got exactly that when i came to supercuts that was close to where i was shopping things.  my stylist kathy was very pleasant, attentive, and professional about cutting my hair.  she had a pleasant manner in conversing with me while she cut and styled my hair.  she also dried and styled my hair without charging any extra.  for $17 + tip (she really deserved it too), i walked out looking a lot better than i did a few months ago after a cut at atelier, and much happier and more satisfied with the customer service.  i will go back to this supercuts to have kathy do my hair again.

supercuts are hit and miss in general, so it takes a fantastic stylist to get me to go back time after time.  haylee is consistently nailing it with her haircuts!  she takes her time and does it right.  not to mention she is always on a pleasant mood and genuinely wants to you enjoy your haircut.  wait times can be rough at this location, so be sure to call ahead to check in on their app.
went in for cut and colorstylist was super nice meticulous and did an extraordinary job !

went and got a hair cut from then a week ago, got a hair that were not even so went back 5 days later asking them to fix and they but charging me full price of the hair. should they fixing it for free, you would think so right but not. end customer not happy with hair then charge again to fix it.

out of all the salons/barbershops i've been to, this is the worst. it took the staff an hour and 15 minutes to get through 3 customers. so, i'm waiting for awhile now, and one of the employees comes in and clocks on, and she clearly sees people waiting for their turn. however, she just ignores us and chats with the other employees for a good 30 minutes. finally, she decides to work and she's decides to cut my hair. great, i can get my goods done. i ask her for simple number 1 fade comb over. instead she barely touches the top of my hair, and gives me buzz cut on my sides. i was clearly dissatisfied with her work, and when she notices, she gives me attitude and says i should've downloaded the app and made a reservation. like cmon dude, i'm kind enough to not complain about the $20 shit haircut, but you tell me i should've known better? honestly never coming back to this place. overall, this place is overpriced for a haircut, you'd be better off growing out your hair than coming here.

do not get your hair cut by song. you tell her to cut it one way and she cuts it however she feels like cutting it. i look like an idiot. she cut my hair like she hated my whole family. i'd rather shave my head with a dull rock than walk around with this hair cut she gave me. i can't believe how bad my haircut is. i could of give my friends new born baby two samurai swords and she probably could of cut it better than song. if you do plan on going to song for a hair cut, i'd recommend setting your hair on fire and putting it out really fast. it would save you 17 dollars.

asked how long was the wait said 15 min which was not bad, i told the lady i'll back back in 10min she said ok. i came back saw she was about to be done, but she went on break her name is liz. i saw another lady was about to be done with another customer so i waited another five minute found out she was off. as i was waiting all this time only customer left no one said anything. from 15min i had to wait 30min just to fine out after i went up and ask what was going on to wait another 15min. lady she said sorry i'm the only one. 45 min to get a hair cut at supercuts. all they had to do was say from the beginning or anytime that it will be 45 min wait. worst service ever..

nvm there's red in my hair, doesn't look bad. and whenever i wash my hair, my fingernails are filled with black dyed skin flakes... not sure if i've seen it like this before since i dyed hair multiple times and it never came out flakey. butttt it's okay my trim was still nice, will come back for the cuts

wanted to write a quick review. walked in and was seen within 15 minutes, chin did my hair, he was kind and very welcoming! we talked for a while as he cut my hair and i had full trust in him cutting my hair! i've had the same girl cut and color my hair for 5 years now, so the fact that he made me feel comfortable is great.!bottom line he's been with the company for 10 years and did a great job with my hair.! i will return to see him again.!

super arrogant and rude! the person who did the haircut on my wife! i asked if she could blow-dry and in some way show  the haircut style, she answered rudely saying it was not my hair,  & it only mattered if my wife liked it. when i said to remove us from their system she said it didn't matter to her, that for every bad client that leaves she gets three good ones. liz is her name she said, & that she didn't care about the bad reviews, we've been customers since this location opened, sadly this was a very bad experience and won't be back, this person doesn't know how to treat people

good place for quick and clean haircut. my man dj will cut your hair fast and clean, and with not mistakes.i hate taking forever getting a haircut. that's why i always ask for dj. clean, fresh, and always perfect!
the waiting times are ridiculous. i came in at 4:00 waited until 4:42 just to be cut my 3 because other people called

if you're a guy with pretty straightforward hair whether old or young, these people can probably give you a decent cut.  i know a couple of guys that go here all the time and they look like normal humans when they emerge. or if you are a child with perfectly straight hair and you're asking them to cut a straight line across the back, they might do an ok job.however- if you are a female do not do it.  you will regret it.  i gave these people three chances over a two year period with my perfectly normal straight hair.  my hair is absolutely nothing difficult, and all three times they truly butchered it.  this last time was the worst.  i can honestly say it looks like an angry cat gnawed and chewed at my hair!!  no joke.  she even blow dried it for thirty minutes, and kept adding spray and gel over and over so that when i looked in the mirror it looked ok.  as soon as i got in the car and moved my head i saw that she was using the ten pounds of gel and blow dryer to shape my hair, almost like it's play doh, into looking normal.  not only that but she used the shearing scissors and completely, and i mean completely ruined my hair - in fact i cannot even get it fixed because it's so uneven that i have to wait for it to grow for a few months.  she also somehow charged me 60.00 for this cut.  go to his and hers hair bar across the street.  they won't upsell, give you a free drink and do a beautiful job on your hair.

i've been going to supercuts having beatriz cut and/or color my hair for 1 year now (like 1-2x a month haha) :) so wanted to give an updated review. i refuse to go anywhere else!!! it's more affordable than the top notch salons and beatriz does such an amazing job, i feel like i got top notch service!!! i've lived in cali for 8 years and couldn't find anyone i was satisfied with until now! she always listens to what i want and gets it right every time and with a very friendly and professional attitude. i am always in and out quicker than i have ever been anywhere else so it's not that time consuming which is great because setting at a salon 3-4 hours is tiring.
beatriz always cuts my hair, shes amazing, go to beatriz you will not be disappointed!!!!
they always do great cuts for us and are always friendly. we like a special cut for my son and they always do it right. we are happy going there.

i made an appointment to get my haircut at 4pm yesterday. i decided to give them a try since i was in the area. i got there around 3:50pm. they greeted me and asked me to sit and wait. within the next 10 mins, 2 more people came. finally, one of the lady finished the person she was working on and called a white man up. knowing i had made an appointment and he was a walkin. she looked at her coworker and spoke in vietnamese saying can someone take me cause she took the white guy since she didnt want him to wait...it went back and forth between her and the 2 coworkers...it was 4:15 by now..i got annoyed and spoke to them in both english and vietnamese (shocking them that im viet) how unprofessional they are. i felt had i been white, i may have actually got my appointment the time i made it for. i find it very unprofessional of people to speak in their native language while having clients that don't understand what they are saying. all in all, id save my money and time and find anther place.sent from my iphone

i received the most hideous hair cut by a women who obviously couldn't understand english.  i asked for a trim (2 inches)  this woman cut 5 to 6 inches off.  when i told her she didn't understand what it was i wanted she said ih well 18.95.  i was blown away by her attitude and by the haircut i received.  her station is the first one on the right.  don't get your hair cut by her she is totally unprofessional and doesn't know how to cut hair!
call ahead and good luck trying to get your scheduled time. not sure why they tell you a time.

i not to picky about my hair; most times i wear a ball cap and keep my hair pretty short, but the hack job i got today is unbelievable.  when i was 4 years old and gave myself a haircut i probably did a better job.  there are random long patches and short patches along the sides of my head that were obvious once i got home and looked closely in the mirror. i'm not being picky either the differences in hair lenth are greater than half an inch; and up to an inch in some placesi not sure of her name but if a younger spanish lady with tattoos tries cutting your hair, run.

do not go to supercuts to get highlights or foil lightening! i got a melt done back in may at a great salon and went to supercuts to try and get it touched up for a better price. when i told her what i got done and exactly how it was done at my previous salon, she said she could do it and started to apply the bleach. when she rinsed it out i was greeted with the most hideous edges i've ever seen. she took no time to blend my highlighted hair in with my natural hair. i asked if she could dye the roots to fade the highlights better and initially she said no, but then changed her mind when she saw how unhappy i was with my hair. when she was finishing up the dye, she explained to me how supercuts couldn't do what i wanted with my hair at this location. i would have been okay if i couldn't have gotten what i wanted done if i would have been informed of it before she started bleaching my hair. she at least tried to make it right with dying it but i'll be making an appointment with my regular salon to get it fixed anyway because it's still not exactly what i wanted and when the dye washes out my roots will look hideous. in addition, a different lady gave me a trim and asked if i wanted 2 inches off. i said no and i wanted 1/2 inch off only (showed her with my fingers too). she completely disregarded that and cut off 2 inches anyway. overall, mediocre skills and terrible communication. pictures are attached of the highlights before and after the dye was added. i'd be embarrassed to call myself a hair stylist if i was giving that kind of service to others.

i love this branch. been coming here for over a decade. the ladies are kind and do always do a great job. always book appointment via telephone or website as they get very busy. be patient they are worth it.

you really get what you pay for. haircuts here are cheaper & i think are a greater option for men than it is for women. i do not remember the person who cut my hair but my experience here was just alright. i always get lured into getting cheap haircuts & then afterward regret that i did because the experience just feels very unenjoyable. you don't get your hair washed or shampooed, no styling & the technique in their cuts seem to emphasize timeliness rather than quality. i've never had my hair colored here but i'd honestly be scared to.

i've been going here for 7 years, but never again! i've made appts. in the past and had to wait a little bit while they finished up the prior customer, but today was different. i made a phone appt. with helen and got there on time to find that she had just taken a young kid (by the looks of it, a few mins earlier). i was acknowledged by her when i walked in and then made to wait for 25mins(!), while she spent an exorbitant amount of time trimming up his buzz cut and washing his hair. nothing else was ever said by anyone there with regards to my having to wait so long. i finally left without saying a word.to top it off, even though i have been going to helen for much of this time, my haircuts have been inconsistent at best. i go as a matter on convenience, but i really have to pay attention to make sure i get a decent haircut.don't waste your time or money at this location.

great cuts from all the crew at this place.  no rush service and attention to detail. bummed that vi (vee) has moved on. she gave me the best cut i have ever had.  hopefully her departure is temporary.

i had the worst service here. i came in just to get my hair washed because i broke my arm pretty badly. seemed simple enough, but i was very wrong. after waiting 40 minutes, the woman finally took me to the back, i told her i just wanted my hair washed and braided because of my arm and she said she didn't know how to braid. she then went to take my hair out of the pony tail, she couldn't and i told her to just cut the hair tie because it wasn't worth it and she cut my hair instead of the tie. she told me that new management meant that she could only do everything in 5 minutes and that i should get a keratin treatment instead. after washing my hair, she brought me to the chair and started brushing my hair instead of combing it. just the top layer was brushed and she went to put it in a pony tail and i said i wanted it higher and felt my hair and it was still so tangled. after all that, i had to do comb my hair one handed and finished it at home. i left so upset. would not recommend this place to anyone.

i got my hair cut by vee. she did a great job, was very polite, and took her time. was very satisfied by her attention to detail and making sure i was completely happy with my cut. will definately come back to get my hair cut from her.

i received the worst hair cut in my life by a woman who does not understand english and does not know what she was doing i have asked for 4 and she cut too short and they keep laughing with each other when i said that this is not right and worst part is i had to pay $18 for for such ugly hair cut they do. i could have given zero if yelp allowed me. save your money and hair by going to some other place
horrible service. let's others cut in line, even after having booked online. will not be returning again. thankfully another supercuts has just opened up close by.

decided to try supercuts one more time. made an appointment ahead of time. came to the location and i was promptly greeted by staff. my stylist was friendly and very detailed in her work. she made sure i got what i asked for and i appreciate the time she took to ensure my hair was cut properly. i will be coming back to this location again.

the only reason i am leaving a review is because of the new stylist katlyn. katlyn started about 6 weeks ago and i just happen to end up with her one day when i dropped in for a quick haircut. the last 3 haircuts have been outstanding! she listens and asks questions in an effort to get your haircut right. i reccomend the tea tree service as well with her. let's be honest, supercuts in general is a crapshoot for a good haircut. that said, when you find someone good it's a bonus.

be prepared to wait for quite some time almost all days of the week. on weekend the wait time is really high. this supercuts is located in the rivermark plaza near the safeway. i have been a couple of times here. this seems to be quite a busy location and the wait time is typically around 20-30 minutes. also i am quite disappointed with the final result of my haircut. i have tried two different stylists on two different occasions and on both the occasions the haircut length was way shorted than i instructed/asked for. and unlike a bad experience in a restaurant, you can't get your hair back (compare with sending your food back). so maybe from next time i will try a different place. i waited for two visits before posting this so that the review doesn't look like a knee-jerk reaction from a singular visit.

i went to get my hair done here because caitlin started working here.  she's amazing and awesome at what she does.  she has over 25 years experience and is always updated to the current fashion.  i'll follow her wherever she works.  she listens to what type of haircut you want and trust me whatever it is you'll be very happy with it.  thanks again caitlin!! see you soon.  don't forget ask for caitlin!  you will thank me!!

this was a horrible experience. the stylist did a very bad job of trimming my hair. she trimmed more than what i had asked for.  i wasn't even sure she was understanding what i'm saying since she just kept nodding her head. after the trimming, she didn't even bother to blow the strands of hair from my face. i had to ask her to do it later which caused all the strands to fall on my shirt! the old staff was nowhere to be found. looks like all the good staff has moved to better locations. i would be never going to this place anymore.

i will not recommend this store to anyone.i went there today for haircut. i showed them a picture for reference (those employees somehow don't understand english). woman who was cutting my hair was very rude. i asked her why she is talking rudely and she said it's a bad day for her (why talk rudely then).she cut my hair very short than i asked for and when i questioned her about that, she said because she accidently cut some hair short and covered it cutting remaining hair short (ridiculous).also, she was cutting hair so harshly that once or twice her scissor hurt my head.plz don't go to this store. they'll ruin your hair.edit: i went home and checked backside of my head. it was looking messy. i had to trim it by myself to make it look better. i've attached photo of how it looked post haircut.

where is cody? inquiring minds need to know. i liked the other guy's (dane?) work also. unfortunately i put my kids name on the list for him and when my family arrived he was working on another client and took like 40 mins to complete that. we waited and ended up having one kid go to another stylist and the other went to him. i was willing to give him another chance because i witnessed his work on several occasions and it was very good, and he apologized. however, he is no longer there either. i went to the super cuts on holger partially because i was hoping to find them lol. no such luck. without cody this is just a dusty, outdated location with bad parking. i will just go to the other location to get my little kids a decent haircut until i find something else.

there must have been an ownership change at this location.  since they got rid of all the old stylist and brought in new people.  i've been coming here for the past 7 years and getting my hair cut by cody.  however, his no longer there as are the other familiar faces that i used to see.  everybody there is all new.  based on the cut i received, they must have all just graduated from supercuts training program with zero experience.    i would never go back to this supercuts.  for the past 7 years, the days that cody worked (tues to sat), there were always a wait with waiting area full, now, no matter what time you go by, they are empty.  no wait what so ever.  that tells you something, they are loosing business left and right from people like me.  new management at this location deserves to loose all of their old customers when they discharged all of their experienced stylist.

feel compelled to leave a 1 star review because i had the absolute worst experience. i wanted to trim my split ends as my hair is growing long. the lady didn't seem to understand my 'please don't cut it too short, keep the original shape', and forced 'a style' on me. she chopped off so much hair that at one point i literally asked her to stop cutting my hair. her style turned out to be hideous, lucky me that i put my hair up in a bun most of the time. i am never going back to supercuts. this is a great place for guys - a lot of my guy friends go there frequently and their hair come out fine. just not for gals. especially not if your hair is long.

first of all i give one star because i just lost two of my best stylist. i came in today and find out that two of my best stylist are no longer working at this location. i have been going to kathy and cody bui for sometime now. every time i come in to town i always stop by to either see kat or cody they are excellent with there craft. i also wonder why they stay so long at this location and not start something on there own but they always say they care about the people they work with . i just want to thank them for all those wonderful haircuts sorry supercuts i will never come back to this location again.

this place is hard to beat for fast, cheap, and decent haircuts and beard trims. is this going to be the most amazing spa experience of your life? nope? best haircut ever? not likely. but for a decent, affordable cut this place is good. the stylists are competent and friendly.

i went to this place because it is near where i visit my parents.  christine cut my hair and was an expert. i have long hair and needed it cut with a bit of a layer, and she not only did an excellent job but was also very pleasant. i have to give her thumbs up, since she really deserves it.  thank you, christine!

the lady cut me up and didn't want to let me see the back of my neck the two times she had me look back at it , i don't understand why she couldn't just be honest with me and i would understand her but the fact that she gripped on to my shirt twice to cover it is not okay and i understand she messed up but that's more messed up of me to get talked into buying their product and getting cut up.
was referred by a friend to go here and get an appointment with cody. really friendly guy. he knew what i wanted before telling him and i loved the result. will definitely go back.
i have been coming here for years. still great, still affordable. worth the wait. thank you for your superb customer service kathy! love my a-line bob.

another crappy experience- called yesterday and the lady told me that my stylist will be tomorrow and i can call tomorrow to set up an appointment. i called today and i was told that they are not taking appointments anymore because they are booked, but i can still come in and wait in line....
great place for a haircut. cody gave me a much needed wonderful haircut and after care recommendations. thanks cody!

i had my haircut done by cody and in all my years of having my hair done at salons (even high-end), this has been by far my best.  cody didn't make me feel like i was just another customer at supercuts and he was conscious about the concerns i had with my hair to the point that i left with tears of happiness!  my experience was great and i will definitely be coming back to cody. -lucy
being going to this place for few months. cody is the  best at what he does. he takes so much care and everytime i visit here he gives me a new look. i highly recommend this place.

i will definitely be back. everyone who works there has tons of regular customers. i can see why. i popped in for a haircut before the lunch rush, and it's one of the best, most reasonably priced haircuts i've ever had, and i used to work in the hair products business. if you come in knowing what you want, and you communicate that to their stylists, you'll be happy.

been going to kathy for many years...she is awesome...she knows how to cut hair perfectly..ask for her, you won't be disappointed.great customer service, reasonable prices, can be a bit busy sometimes, but i'd rather wait and have my hair done the way i want, then to go somewhere quickly and be disappointed. the stylist that work there are very friendly...everyone seems happy to be there.ask for kathy!
